'Zoombie' Bomb Cadaver.description: These zombie-like constructs have numerous pieces of technological equipment protruding from their dead flesh. The purpose of all this machinery is to turn these creatures into walking bombs. When near a target, they explode to cause maximum damage.

3K Kelvin.description: 3K Kelvin is a heavy hitter for the Hellions in Paragon City. He is often called in to deal with problems of the Hellions, using his fire mastery to burn his enemies to cinders.

5th Column Krieger.description: After the Council took over, this soldier found himself suddenly unemployed. He now works for those he chooses worthy, waiting to recall the true glory of the 5th Column.

7th Generation Paragon Protector.description: Crey denies the rumors that the Paragon Protectors are corporate pawns, but no one outside the company knows the truth for sure. The Claw Pattern hero is a master of melee combat, using both claws and enhanced physical attributes to make mincemeat of his or her opponents.

9CU.description: Prototype War Works shock troopers, members of Siege's personal cadre. These towering androids carry a heavy PGMP Rifle that is capable of delivering a deadly neurotoxin payload.

9th Generation Classified Protector.description: These Paragon Protectors are the newest of Crey's line of 'designer heroes'. They seem to be sturdier and more resilient than ones you've met from your previous encounters. They seem to be deliberately made for a special task, though you're not entirely sure what that is.

9th Generation Hero Corps Clone.description: This generation of Paragon Protector seems... incomplete. They speak in odd, disjointed thoughts and seem to lack complete control of their powers.

???.description: This strange tentacle seems to be one of many belonging to the Kraken, a mythical beast that dwells beneath the sea.

A bomb.description: This is a Rikti bomb that has yet to go off.

ACU.description: The most advanced of the Warworks shock troopers. These towering androids carry a heavy PGMP Rifle that is capable of delivering a deadly neurotoxin payload.

ACU Essence.description: This Warworks Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

AU-Bomber.description:
King Midas and his Goldbrickers have taken advantage of many different applications for the technology reverse-engineered from the D-Rifter, not the least of which is an integrated combat system.

The Asynchronized Universe (AU) System allows its wearer to anchor half of themselves in a dimensional ripple shard, which allows them to avoid damage and teleport with ease. This technology is fairly unstable however, and the exact consequences of its use are still undetermined.

AU-Bricker.description:
King Midas and his Goldbrickers have taken advantage of many different applications for the technology reverse-engineered from the D-Rifter, not the least of which is an integrated combat system.

The Asynchronized Universe (AU) System allows its wearer to anchor half of themselves in a dimensional ripple shard, which allows them to avoid damage and teleport with ease. This technology is fairly unstable however, and the exact consequences of its use are still undetermined.

AU-Rifter.description:
King Midas and his Goldbrickers have taken advantage of many different applications for the technology reverse-engineered from the D-Rifter, not the least of which is an integrated combat system.

The Asynchronized Universe (AU) System allows its wearer to anchor half of themselves in a dimensional ripple shard, which allows them to avoid damage and teleport with ease. This technology is fairly unstable however, and the exact consequences of its use are still undetermined.

Aaron Thiery.description: Aaron Theiry was a former scientist for SERAPH. It has been revealed that he is, in fact, an Arachnos spy, feeding the organization secrets about Atlas Park!

Aberrant.description: Humanity's dark desire for mindless mayhem and destruction have been channeled by the Banner of Mayhem.  The results are these creatures that are fueled by the need to blindly destroy everything around them.

Aberrant Eremite.description: The leaders of the Anathema have fully mutated minds that allow them to project their indomitable will onto others. They can use these powers to immobilize, hypnotize, or even dominate lesser wills. The Eremites are the preachers of the Lost. Their psychic abilities allow them to entrance crowds of possible converts.

Aberrant Rector.description: The leaders of the Anathema have fully mutated minds that allow them to project their indomitable will onto others. They can use these powers to immobilize, hypnotize, or even dominate lesser wills. The Rectors are the masters of one-on-one conversions; their persuasive abilities work best on a single target.

Abomination.description: In reanimation, as in cooking, better ingredients yield better results. Dr. Vahzilok constructs his Abominations out of the very best ingredients he can find: the organs of fallen heroes. The Abominations are stronger, tougher, and faster than their Cadaver kin. Unfortunately, they don't smell any better.

Ace McKnight.description: Ace McKnight is the source of Willy Wheeler's missions. Unfortunately, McKnight has turned out to be an undercover Longbow agent and needs to be taken down!

Acolyte of War.description: The Acolytes of War serve as front line forces for the Carnival of War, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes that immediate action most be taken against the Talons of Vengeance no matter the cost, rather than building up Carnival forces for an overwhelming assault. They can trace their origins back to the Legacy Chain, and retain some of their armor and accoutrements.

Adamant of Steel.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. At the foundation of the Chain is the Legacy of the Sword. They are the strong arm of the group and protect the mystics of the other Legacies with their lives. They never retreat and willingly give their lives for their sacred cause.

Adamastor.description: For centuries, Adamastor caused havoc and destruction to sailors off the coast of Africa. According to legend, he attacked the sea goddess Thetis and was banished from the ocean forever. Miserable and bereft, Adamastor wandered the Dark Continent seeking mortal prey - until the Banished Pantheon found a use for him in Paragon City.

Adding the Sun.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Adept.description: Though their skills are minimal in comparison to those of their leaders, Cabal Adepts have learned to summon hot lightening into their fists. After centuries of training for this feat, many Adepts are shocked to find that it is actually quite painful. Of course, after so many years spent battling the Red Caps, pain is nothing they can't handle.

Advanced Corner Terminal.description: This advanced terminal can be used to monitor all the functions of base security. It increases the control generated by the base computer system.

Advanced Database.description: This database contains detailed knowledge about the known powers of super-powered beings, allowing you to better adjust and control your base security system.

Advanced Drone.description: During the Rikti War these flying Drones swarmed all over the city's skies. Today these machines still sweep through the air with some frequency. Their quick evasive maneuvering, sophisticated scanners and powerful energy cannon make them a constant menace.

Advanced Holodisplay.description: The Edge Holodisplay is a state-of-the-art 3D display for managing base security. It increases the control generated for the base.

Advanced Oscillator.description: The airborne Clockwork Oscillators are a new and deadly threat to Paragon City's skies. Like their grounded counterparts, the Sprockets, these high-flying mechanical men attack using bolts of electricity. They are immune to any psychological attacks.

Advanced Terminal.description: This advanced terminal can be used to monitor all the functions of base security. It increases the control generated by the base computer system.

Aeon Protector Drone.description: Dr. Aeon has built these drones specifically to power his new 'Aeon Invulnerability' device. You'll have to destroy them to weaken Dr. Aeon!

Aeon Scientist.description:
The irony is not lost on you that the only person Dr. Aeon would consider worthy of appointing as head of Aeon Corp's research & development department would be a clone of himself. Though for some bizarre reason, this Dr. Aeon clone is uncomfortably handsome.

He is equipped with a suit of Dr. Aeon's signature power armor, though it seems to be an earlier prototype as it doesn't appear to have the full range of bells and whistles.

Aeon Security Arachnobot.description:
These impressive looking Arachnobots are hybridized with components used in the Toxic Tarantula exo-skeletons. Despite their impressive size and power, all the models that have been assigned to serve as facility security are mostly underperforming prototypes that were created during development. Some have speculated that Black Scorpion sees Dr. Aeon as a potential up-and-coming threat in the various Arachnos technological divisions.

Black Scoprion's assigning these Arachnobots to Aeon Corp was likely a ploy to discredit Dr. Aeon's leadership capabilities and establish his place in the Arachnos hierarchy.

Aereus Colossus Dextro.description:
The bronze-clad Aereus Colossi are the keystone to Romulus' plan to conquer Cimerora. Constructed in secret by the 5th Column, these gargantuan robots are the pinnacle of their engineering efforts.

Despite being forced to activate prematurely and lacking their intended Incarnate-level power sources, these massive goliaths are more than capable of annihilating anything they detect as a threat in this time period or otherwise.

Vandal claims Dextro is the older brother who's fiery passion for battle burns brightly.

Aereus Colossus Laeva.description:
The bronze-clad Aereus Colossi are the keystone to Romulus' plan to conquer Cimerora. Constructed in secret by the 5th Column, these gargantuan robots are the pinnacle of their engineering efforts.

Despite being forced to activate prematurely and lacking their intended Incarnate-level power sources, these massive goliaths are more than capable of annihilating anything they detect as a threat in this time period or otherwise.

Vandal claims that Laeva is the younger sister whose cold indifference hides her true feelings.

Agamemnon.description: Agamemnon is the leader of the Warriors. With his unmatched martial skill and several powerful artifacts, he has made the Warriors a force to be reckoned with, and put down all challengers to his title.

Agent Caspian.description: Agent Caspian is an elite agent for the Freedom Corps organization known as Longbow. He is a master of infiltration and escape techniques.

Agent Crimson.description: Viridian is a very dangerous man who works subtle deals that can change the course of world history. The core of his job is influencing other villain groups through manipulation, sabotage, deal brokering, or collaboration, as it suits the needs of Arachnos. There is some rivalry between his organization of manipulators and Shadow Spiders' spies, but both know that they can only succeed at their job with the help of the other.

Agent Gally.description: Gally Ido was once just an innocent girl who dreamed of escaping the Rogue Isles with her boyfriend, Hugo Figures. Unfortunately, her psychic powers drew the attention of Arachnos, and she was betrayed by Westin Phipps. She somehow escaped from Arachnos and made her way to Paragon City, where she joined Longbow and hoped that one day she'd find a way to save the boy she loves.

Agent Hugo.description: Hugo Figure was once just an innocent boy who dreamed of escaping the Rogue Isles with his girlfriend Gally Ido. Unfortunately, his psychic powers drew the attention of Arachnos, and he was betrayed by Westin Phipps and forced into the Bane Spiders. Recently freed from Bane Spider mind control, now he's fighting to free the other Bane Spiders and return to the girl he loves.

Agent Indigo.description: Rumors abound throughout the villain underground about two incredibly dangerous government operatives, code-named Agent Crimson and Agent Indigo. Indigo is supposed to be the information and retrieval specialist, a deadly opponent who can read thoughts and see into the future.

Agent Tavish Bell.description: Agent Bell is a well-known Crey Liaison in Grandville, whose track record as of late has left much to be desired.

Agent X.description: Agent X is a renowned Longbow super-spy. His technical skills are phenomenal, with a gadget or gizmo available for any occasion.

Agony Mage.description: There is not greater distraction than pain and suffering. The Masters of Agony often help relieve their friends of such distractions in times of peace. But when it comes to battle, they are adept at harming their foes through powerful and disruptive enchantments.

Air Bomb.description: This is a Fuel Air Bomb deployed by the Freedom Corps Cataphract

Air Defense Coordinator.description: The Sky Raiders are known for meticulously planning their raids, and they spend just as much time planning their defenses. Men like this Air Defense Coordinator are one of the reasons they have maintained a presence in the villain community.

Air Thorn Caster.description: Air Casters can harness the winds to give themselves the power of flight. They can also conjure up meteorological menaces from lightning bolts to snow storms.

Ajax.description: Ajax was originally the only known surviving member of the Omega Team. His guilt drove him into years of depression until the Omega Team Time Capsule was opened. It was revealed that the current Ajax was nothing but a thug who killed the original Ajax. Now, Ajax seeks to redeem himself by cleansing the Rogue Isles of all villains within it.

Akarist.description: The ancient Oranbegan sorcerer known as Akarist was once a mortal man, over 14,000 years ago. In his original body, his magical powers were at their peak.

Alec Parson.description: Alec Parson was once a senior forensic scientist working for MICIR, the Ministry of Information Criminal Investigation and Research, in Praetoria. He has a passion for robotics and all things Clockwork related. He helped Longbow mass produce their own version of Praetoria's Clockwork. In addition, Alec Parson has his own, personally built, Clockwork and rifle that he uses to defend himself and others. After seeing all the atrocities that were spread by the Clockwork in the Praetorian War, Parson believes that it's time to show the people the good that technology and Clockwork can do for the world.

Alex.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Alexander Pavlidis.description: Alexander Pavlidis is a former Warrior turned whistleblower, turned politician. A surprisng turn of events for a former gang member, especially one formerly working under David 'Odysseus' Hill.

Alexis Cole-Duncan.description: Alexis Cole-Duncan was once called Miss Liberty. She is the daughter of Statesman and the mother of Ms. Liberty. Alexis spent some time in retirement before picking back up the mantle of heroism, only this time it would be as a diplomat/negotiator. She works together with General Howard Aarons to calm various super-powered threats down, though unfortunately, most threats elevate to a hostile level before she even arrives at the scene.

Alley Cat.description: The lowest rank of those who serve Bobcat is filled with strays. She searches the streets of the city for those who have nowhere else to go. She prefers those who have been injured in some way, mentally or physically and bear a grudge toward the ones that hurt them. Bobcat offers her Alley Cats something to fight for...and against.

Aloore the Watcher.description: Aloore is Rularuu's most trusted Field General. He guards the Palace and uses his Sentries to keep watch over the entire Shadow Shard. Of all Rularuu's fragments, Aloore is most similar to Rularuu himself. This makes him skilled and useful, but also dangerous, because Rularuu is not built for servitude.

Alpha Howler Wolf.description: Alpha Howler Wolves are the most dominant of their species. They support their pack with piercing howls and snarls to strengthen their pack and weaken their victims.

Alpha Werewolf.description: Leadership of a werewolf pack goes not to the wisest wolf, but to the most brutal. Ascendence to the status of Alpha Werewolf usually involves the bloody murder of one's predecessor. Challenging the current Alpha is often a fatal proposition, but many wolves consider it worth the risk, since the Alpha is always allowed the first taste of a fresh kill.

Alpha Wolf.description: These minions stand boldly at the pinnacle of the Pack. They are leaders by right of combat and dominance. They will fight to the last because they know defeat might mean a fall from the top.

Altar.description: This object seems to be regenerating the health of the villains around it.

Alysonde.description: Once a young explorer, Marissa Sorensen was well-known amongst the scientific community for discoveries relating the relationship between the gods of the various pantheons and a strange location from which they drew their power. One day, Marissa herself discovered this location and became the Huntress, Alysonde. She is renowned among the heroes of the world for her selflessness, but her history as an explorer has left her with many enemies.

Amanda.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Amanda Vines.description: Amanda Vines is the star reporter of WSPDR news. Her investigative abilities have been a thorn in Lord Recluse's side for years, but her popularity has made disposing of her problematic. One of these days she's going to finally push an investigation too far, but until then she's going to keep searching for the truth.

Ambassador Alwani.description: Ambassador Alwani hails from the small country of West Libertalia. If you don't get him out of here, the Sky Raiders will assassinate him.

Amy.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Amy Jonsson.description: Katie's aunt, Amy Jonsson, has been her primary caretaker since the Cabal was stranded in the mystical land of Croatoa. Amy has significant powers, which are a boon to any person she hopes to assist.

Anathema.description: The Anathema are members of the Lost who have undergone substantial mutation, becoming huge creatures that are barely recognizable as humans. They engage their foes with an unnatural brutality, using whatever weaponry they can find.

Ancestor Spirit.description: The monstrous Ancestor Spirits are physical manifestations of the long-dead Tsoo progenitors. They're incredibly strong and tough in combat, but they're also wily. They have the ability to become intangible at will, making them slippery opponents to pin down in a fight.

Ancestor Spirit Essence.description: This Tsoo essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Ancestral Guardian.description: This Tsoo master has completed the rituals necessary to accept an Ancestral Spirit into their bodies. This manifests as an otherworldly glow that seems to emerge from their tattoos. An Ancestral Ink master is a formidable combatant, acquiring expertise in arts which lesser members struggle to learn. This warrior has mastered the art of staff fighting.

Ancestral Guardian Essence.description: This Tsoo essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Ancestral Sorcerer.description: This Tsoo sorcerer has completed the rituals necessary to accept an Ancestral Spirit into his body. This manifests as an otherworldly glow that seems to emerge from his tattoos. Becoming imbued with the power of an Ancestor grants a sorcerer unique powers, including the ability to call forth lightning from the sky and even control time itself. Additionally, he has been blessed by his ancestor spirit with greater combat ability, which manifests in the form of kinetic melee fighting.

Ancestral Sorceress.description: This Tsoo sorceress has completed the rituals necessary to accept an Ancestral Spirit into her body. This manifests as an otherworldly glow that seems to emerge from her tattoos. Becoming imbued with the power of an Ancestor grants a sorceress unique powers, including the ability to call forth lightning from the sky and even control time itself. Additionally, she has been blessed by her ancestor spirit with greater combat ability, which manifests in the form of kinetic melee fighting.

Ancestral Warden.description: This Tsoo master has completed the rituals necessary to accept an Ancestral Spirit into their bodies. This manifests as an otherworldly glow that seems to emerge from their tattoos. An Ancestral Ink master is a formidable combatant, acquiring expertise in arts which lesser members struggle to learn. This warrior has mastered the art of kinetic melee fighting.

Anchorite of War.description: The Anchorites of War are well-trained in the mystical arts and serve as commanders in the Carnival of War, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes that immediate action most be taken against the Talons of Vengeance no matter the cost, rather than building up Carnival forces for an overwhelming assault. Many of them can trace their origins back to the Midnight Squad of Praetoria, but others have been derived from the followers of Vanessa DeVore.

Ancient Lockbox.description: This powerful artifact guards the girdle of Aphrodite. Its twisted magic keeps anyone pure of heart from opening it to retrieve the goddess's possession.

Ancient Obelisk.description: This ancient obelisk gives off a dark, disturbing feeling, brimming with an untold amount of power.

Ancient Tablet.description: This mystical tablet pulses with power..

Ancient Thorn Spectre.description: These ghastly daemons are the oldest and most powerful incorporeal spirits the Circle has dredged from Oranbega. Some mystical archives recovered from the cult indicate some of these beings may in fact be the very same spirits that gifted Baron Zoria and his first followers the thorns they plunged into their bodies in the group's inception, however this is unconfirmed.

Ancient Vampire.description: It is an unfortunate fate to encounter one of the ancient vampires who are the progenitors of the vampiric curse. These beings have lived for thousands of years, feeding on humanity's blood from the darkness. They are more capable of destroying any vampire hunters foolish enough to think they can match the elder ancestors on equal footing. Commanding the very shadows themselves, these beings are the definitive masters of the night, and they are always thirsty.

Ancient of Death.description: The Ancients are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who long ago merged their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods, granting both the person and the spirit a far greater share of power than they could ever achieve individually. This Ancient channels the Spirit of Death, delighting in the death and decay of friend and foe alike. Once they focus on a victim, they become single-minded in their attacks and cannot be distracted until they have brought death to their opponent.

Ancient of Desire.description: The Ancients are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who long ago merged their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods, granting both the person and the spirit a far greater share of power than they could ever achieve individually. This Ancient channels the Spirit of Desire, feeding upon the unrelenting pull of those who succumb to any form of overwhelming need. They flood the area around them with telepathic imagery, confusing and even damaging opponents with visions of their greatest desires.

Ancient of Frost.description: The Ancients are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who long ago merged their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods, granting both the person and the spirit a far greater share of power than they could ever achieve individually. This Ancient has harnessed a spirit of frost, magnifying the abilities found in a Frost Shaman to greater levels than the lesser minion could achieve.

Ancient of Pain.description: The Ancients are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who long ago merged their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods, granting both the person and the spirit a far greater share of power than they could ever achieve individually. This Ancient channels the Spirit of Pain and delights in agony and misery. They particularly relish the pain caused by the blasts of pure destruction they use to attack foes.

Ancient of Sorrow.description: The Ancients are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who long ago merged their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods, granting both the person and the spirit a far greater share of power than they could ever achieve individually. This Ancient channels the Spirit of Sorrow and projects blasts of pure sorrow that explode in life-sapping bursts, seeping the will and life force from anyone caught in the explosion.

Ancient of Storms.description: The Ancients are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who long ago merged their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods, granting both the person and the spirit a far greater share of power than they could ever achieve individually. This Ancient has harnessed a spirit of the winds, magnifying the abilities found in a Storm Shaman to greater levels than the lesser minion could achieve.

Andrew.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Andrew Rider.description: Andrew Rider is a ruthless, but highly regarded real estate developer in Paragon City. He's well known for his efforts to renovate urban areas, a practice which his critics have decried as gentrification and displacement of the city's less wealthy citizens.

Andy Smash-Hands.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Angela.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Anger Monument.description: This monument seems to pulse with power.

Angry Bomb.description: Angry Bombs are unstable cybernetically enhanced humans fitted with high yield explosives. They are commanded into close combat with the enemy where their explosive payload is then detonated.

Angry Zombie Firebomb.description: Stuffed with volatile compounds, this mass of flesh has been built to explode when excited.

Animated Staff.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. This magic staff was once wielded by a powerful magic-user - their aptitude has bled into the weapon itself, granting it a life of its own.

Ann.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Anna.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Anna Palatine.description: The appointed sovereign of the Survivor Compound in First Ward, Anna Palatine's title has been ignored by the Hetman, except for when it has suited his aims.

Anomaly.description: These terrible little monsters somehow live inside the Cap au Diable Power Transferrance System. Perhaps there is more to the 'PTS' than meets the eye. There are certainly rumors. Many wonder why the PTS is covered in glowing sigils. Could that have something to do with these supernatural nuisances?

Anthony.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Anti Gravity Well.description: Everything about the Shadow Shard seems to defy to laws of physics. This Anti Gravity well seems to be no exception.

Anti-Matter.description: Trapped within his powered armor, Anti-Matter used to be Tyrants primary scientific consultant. He and Neuron were once the best of friends and created the Clockwork of Praetorian Earth together. Of late his theories have been more and more radical causing Tyrant to lean on Neuron for research and analysis. Unbeknownst to anyone Anti-Matter had cracked the Portal tech. He is waiting to reveal his breakthrough in order to garner favor from Tyrant and his true love, Dominatrix.

Anti-Matter Reactor Core.description:
The Rikti have been known to utilize anti-matter reactors to power their greatest vehicles and constructs, but this is the first time you've seen one up close.

At this range, it would destroy the entire space station if it were to suddenly go critical...

Antimatter Burst.description: Gotterdammerung strikes you with an Antimatter Burst!

Antimatter Pulse Generator.description: This entity generates the Antimatter Pulse found at Keyes Island.

Antonio Nash.description: Since the destruction of Galaxy City, the FBSA has been scrambling to reassign its personnel to more effective positions in Paragon City. Antonio Nash, formerly the New Hero Liaison for GIFT, has been reassigned to a more direct investigative role. His focused research on the effects of Superadine flew to the top of the priority list when a group of Trolls, led by Atta, went on a rampage through Skyway City and defeated two prominent members of the Freedom Phalanx. Now Nash has been caught up in the investigation of Pandora's Box, and what possible ties it could have - if any - with the Trolls and their designer drug of choice.

Anxious Arachnos Scientist.description:
These scientists are at the forefront of the continual push from Arachnos to always have the latest and greatest in every manner of technology. This competitive endeavor puts an enormous amount of stress on all those who are tasked with research and development. Despite this, they are truly diligent workers, and the on-going dominance that Arachnos enjoys in the Rogue Isles is in no small part due to having these unparalleled scientific minds ever toiling towards realizing the next cutting-edge invention.

While not the most formidable combatant in their own right, they often have access to robotic defenders or advanced gadgets at their disposal that make them more than capable of defending themselves from the wide variety of threats that would love to acquire their knowledge or expertise.

Apex.description: Apex has been a covert member of Vanguard for quite some time now. He has proven himself multiple times to be trustworthy and capable of leading initiatives that are given to him. Lady Grey and Dark Watcher have come to rely on him to lead squads on the most important of missions.

Apocalypse.description: In the year 2352, a mad scientist designed a powerful doomsday weapon known as the World-Breaker Engine and crafted four robot guardians to harness and channel the destructive energies it created. Apocalypse was one such guardian. Fueled by the World-Breaker Engine, Apocalypse's powers were near limitless, along with his brethren Armageddon, Gotterdammerung and Gehenna. So great was their might that they could not be destroyed but were instead cast through time and scattered across the ages. Three of the four have reunited and they bide their time in the Coliseum, waiting to be reunited with their lost brother and the Engine that will fuel the end of the world.

Apocalypse Beam Generator.description: This entity generates the Apocalypse Beam at the finale of Sig Arc 1 Episode 7

Apparition.description: These mournful ghosts were, until recently, the shopkeepers, farmers, and students of Salamanca. Their sudden departure from this Earth has thrown them into great turmoil, and most feel compelled to take out their rage on their former home.

Arachnobot.description: These attack drones are used to soften up super-powered targets. Arachnos considers them very expendable, and as such uses them to record and monitor a threat's abilities before more expensive troops-such as Tarantulas or Fortunatas are deployed.

Arachnobot Advanced Spiderling.description: Arachnobot Blasters were created by Arachnos Orb Weavers to take down particularly powerful super-powered threats.

Arachnobot Blaster.description: Arachnobot Blasters were created by Arachnos Orb Weavers to take down particularly powerful super-powered threats.

Arachnobot Disruptor.description: Orb Weavers created the Disruptor Arachnobots to capture their prey alive.

Arachnoid.description: Lord Recluse guards the secrets of the Arachnoids closely, but what is known is that they were created in Project Fury. Some speculate this experimental program was designed to create soldiers in Lord Recluse's image, but if this is true, the results so far are hideously flawed.

Arachnoid Spitter.description: Lord Recluse guards the secrets of the Arachnoids closely, but what is known is that they were created in Project Fury. Some speculate this experimental program was designed to create soldiers in Lord Recluse's image, but if this is true, the results so far are hideously flawed.

Arachnos Arbiter.description: This Arbiter has been dispatched by Arachnos to provide training services for your supergroup.

Arachnos BCU.description: Arachnos scientists were able to engineer their own BCU's after having enough exposure to them during the war with Praetoria. Now, Arachnos uses these BCU's to continue their fight for world domination.

Arachnos Container.description: Arachnos stores all manner of things in containers like this.

Arachnos Cruise Missile.description: Arachnos no doubt stole the technology for these drones from the Rikti. Or perhaps they bargained for it. Lord Recluse will deal with anyone who gives him what he wants.

Arachnos Drone.description: Arachnos no doubt stole the technology for these drones from the Rikti. Or perhaps they bargained for it. Lord Recluse will deal with anyone who gives him what he wants.

Arachnos Drone Coordinator.description: Arachnos no doubt stole the technology for these drones from the Rikti. Or perhaps they bargained for it. Lord Recluse will deal with anyone who gives him what he wants.

Arachnos Flier.description: Arachnos no doubt stole the technology for these drones from the Rikti. Or perhaps they bargained for it. Lord Recluse will deal with anyone who gives him what he wants.

Arachnos Flyer.description: The Arachnos Flyers are used primarily for troop deployment. If you see one, run.

Arachnos Heavy Blaster.description: Lord Recluse discovered that Black Scorpion had built these enormous walking tanks to attack Mako in another of their inter-patron squabbles. Lord Recluse seized these monstrous war machines for his own use in Recluse's Victory. Loyalists like you will now be able to wield their destructive capabilities in battle! Their lack of speed is more than compensated for with its impressive firepower, and heavy armor. The Arachnos Heavy Blaster is an awesome asset to any villain who's looking for an edge in battle!

Arachnos Kraken.description: Scientists in Arachnos have been able to temporarily control the powerful Hydra!

Arachnos Mini Blaster.description: The Arachnos Mini-Blaster is a miniaturized and mass-produced version of the Arachnos Heavy Blaster found in Recluse' Victory.

Arachnos Mini-Sub.description: Arachnos uses small submarines like this to sneak operatives into and out of Paragon City undetected.

Arachnos Pylon.description: A multi-purpose platform used by the Rikti. These pylon casings can house a wide variety of equipment, ranging from construction gear, to force field generators. Arachnos has somehow obtained this technology and is using it for their own ends.

Arachnos Quartermaster.description: This Quartermaster has been dispatched by Arachnos to provide Enhancements to your supergroup.

Arachnos Reinforcement.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Arachnos Repairman.description: Cybernetic implants in their brains have given these Arachnos technicians an incredible affinity for technology. Under the guidance of Weaver-1, they work tirelessly to build and repair the machines of Arachnos.

Arachnos Scientist.description:
These scientists are at the forefront of the continual push from Arachnos to always have the latest and greatest in every manner of technology. This competitive endeavor puts an enormous amount of stress on all those who are tasked with research and development. Despite this, they are truly diligent workers, and the on-going dominance that Arachnos enjoys in the Rogue Isles is in no small part due to having these unparalleled scientific minds ever toiling towards realizing the next cutting-edge invention.

While not the most formidable combatant in their own right, they often have access to robotic defenders or advanced gadgets at their disposal that make them more than capable of defending themselves from the wide variety of threats that would love to acquire their knowledge or expertise.

Arachnos Transport Transponder.description: Arachnos no doubt stole the technology for these drones from the Rikti. Or perhaps they bargained for it. Lord Recluse will deal with anyone who gives him what he wants.

Arakhn.description: Very little is known about the mysterious figure known as Arakhn. She is a deadly assassin and is the last thing seen by many enemies of the Council. What most of the Council is unaware of is that Arakhn's powers resulted from the fusion of her human body with a Nictus life form. She is on the front lines of a war with the Kheldians, ancient enemies of the Nictus.

Arbiter.description: The Arbiters are the living will of Lord Recluse. In the Rogue Isles, an attack on an Arbiter is an attack on Recluse himself. It is one of the few things that Recluse does not tolerate.

Arbiter Daos.description: Arbiter Daos is perhaps the most humorless man to ever walk the Rogue Isles. A devout servant of Arachnos, Daos is not loathe to take advantage of the impunity his position provides him. He often investigates groups and activities that, strictly speaking, lie outside his purview, but he does so in the knowledge that, whatever his reasons, Arachnos will stand beside him.

Arbiter Drone.description: An unethical scientific genius, Dr. Aeon is not a man to be trifled with. Some think he may soon become a major player within Arachnos, assuming he survives the plans of his enemies.

Arbiter Sands.description: Arbiter Sands is considered a somewhat unconventional member of the Arachnos Arbiter Corps. Though still completely dedicated to the will of Lord Recluse, Sands is known for using unusual and effective tactics. His status as an Arbiter makes him untouchable within Arachnos, for to harm an Arbiter is to attack the will of Lord Recluse himself..

Arc Flash.description: Thanks to her magical bracers Arc Flash is able to harness the chaotic energies of lightning to blast her foes.

Arch-Mage of Agony.description: There is not greater distraction than pain and suffering. The Masters of Agony often help relieve their friends of such distractions in times of peace. But when it comes to battle, they are adept at harming their foes through powerful and disruptive enchantments.

Arch-Mage of Death.description: The most powerful of all the Circle's mages, the Masters of Death are lords of the afterlife. They help to wrangle and control the Behemoths and other beasts the Circle summons, but their most fearsome power is the ability to create a pervasive zone of death that sucks the life out of any foes in the vicinity.

Arch-Mage of Madness.description: The Masters of Madness can control every aspect of the psyche. For their friends, they provide a constant aura of mental fortitude that helps them in all endeavors. In battle, their enemies suffer complete mental domination that leaves them incapable of any action at all.

Arch-Mage of Ruin.description: In ancient times, the Masters of Ruin could level whole cities with their powerful earthquake magic. Today these masters of mayhem are still deadly foes, capable of summoning localized tremors that cause great devastation in a short time.

Archer.description: Many who have lost hope go looking in dark places for the answers to life's questions. The Followers are those whose search has taken them to the Circle of Thorns. Now they must prove their true devotion by serving the Circle's evil will.

Archon Burkholder.description: Archon Burkholder has made a name for himself in the 5th Column. His obsession with robotics led him to carve off his own arm and replace it with one of steel; it also led him to create a terrifying robot factory. There is nearly nothing Burkholder won't do to achieve his own ends.

Archon Kruger.description: An elite Council Archon, Kruger is not to be taken lightly.

Aria.description: As dangerous as she is beautiful, Aria is the alluring siren of the Powers Division's Top Dogs. Her mastery over illusion has allowed her to defeat rivals without lifting a finger, and her musical laughter can quickly turn deadly if you cross her.

Arisen Mummy.description: In particular, one type of zombie stands above the rest in sheer resilience and strength, and that is the mummy. These embalmed cadavars have arisen from their eternal slumber to hunt down and destroy those who have desecrated their tombs during their slumber. Mummies possess unexpected strength for a rotting husk, and their attacks are tainted by foul poisons that accumlated in their rotting flesh.

Armageddon.description: This object will use a power that sets all of its enemies healths to 10% of their current values.

Armiger.description: The Black Knights are an ancient Order of the dead that is charged with overseeing the Eternal Prison; a place where only the wickedest of souls are jailed. Armigers are shield bearers that march at the forefront of the Black Knights when battle calls. Sworn to protect their sword brothers, they wade into battle without fear, relying on sturdy shield and heavy blade to carry the day. Every Armiger has sworn an oath to death before dishonor.

Armiger Surgeon.description: The Battle Surgeons are charged with the vital duty of getting wounded soldiers back into the fight as quickly as possible. Most Nemesis officers frown upon those who refuse to fight again; courage in the face of danger is highly valued in the Nemesis army ranks.

Armor of War.description: Brought to life by magical incantations retained by the former Midnight Squad and nearly lost to history, these animated golems serve as powerful guardians and sentries for the Carnival of War, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes that immediate action most be taken against the Talons of Vengeance no matter the cost, rather than building up Carnival forces for an overwhelming assault. Constructed from scattered pieces of armor found around First Ward, the technologically advanced war machines make use of powerful tech swords which can fire bursts of energy at a target from range or rapidly cut them down in melee.

Arnold Decker.description: Arnold Decker grew up idolizing his older brother Benjamin, and even after his brother's apparent death in the Rikti War, he sought to live up to his memory. Arnold has recently returned home to Paragon City after graduating from college to help his sickly mother. He is currently employed as a lab technician.

Arrest Mode.description: The dreadnaughts tend to lead invasion forces due to their incredible resilience and destructive prowess. Wherever the Goliath War Walker goes, a trail of destruction is left in its wake.

Arsonist.description: The Arsonist probably suffers from some form of pyromania. He likely hides some deep-seated trauma or has some background of family dysfunction. None of that matters now. The Arsonist's only pleasure is to burn things, and people, to the ground.

Arthur.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Ascendant.description: The personal guard of the Center, these crack soldiers are highly trained for protection and defense. Their equipment is geared toward healing and shielding their charge.

Ascendant Adjutant.description: The personal guard of the Center, these crack soldiers are highly trained for protection and defense. Their equipment is geared toward healing and shielding their charge.

Ascendant Archon.description: The personal guard of the Center, these crack soldiers are highly trained for protection and defense. Their equipment is geared toward healing and shielding their charge.

Ashling Corlett.description: Ashling Corlett is a retired (but still on active reserves) member of Hero Corps. Following the destruction of Galaxy City she was invalided out of the service and pensioned off.

Aspect of Ruladak.description: The leader of the Brutes is a most fearsome tyrant. Ruladak's robe is decorated with gems torn from the Brutes that have displeased him. The removal of the gem result's in the Brute's immediate death and eternal dishonor, a fact that troubles Ruladak not in the slightest.

Aspect of Rularuu.description: The demented consciousness of Lanaru the Mad is so twisted by rage that it has wrenched itself free of Rularuu. His psychic instability has manifested as a permanent storm that surrounds his castle and himself.

Aspect of the Well.description: This luminous watery entity is a humanoid homage to the original Well of the Furies from which the Statesman and Lord Recluse acquired their great powers.

Aspirant.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in her strength and toughness due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance. Clad in the latest high-tech body suit and still using standard Knives battle gear, she has abandoned her broadsword in favor of the more confrontational and visceral attacks of a brawler.

Assassin.description: This mercenary sister has been completely converted into a member of the Talons. Her skin is now replaced with the more protective scales of her brethren and large wings have sprouted from her back. The only remnants present from her previous life are her utility belts and her combat headset. She wields dual pistols using toxic ammunition in place of her wrist mounted crossbow.

Assassin Essence.description: This Knives of Vengeance essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Assault Bot.description: Positron has dabbled in Robotics on occasion, though he has not had much success.

Assault Drone Essence.description: This Drone essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Assault Jump Bot.description: The Jump Bots are a recent addition to the mercenary Sky Raiders' arsenal. Their effectiveness in combat has allowed the Raiders to greatly expand operations. Well armed and armored, the Jump Bots earned their name from their leaping ability, which allows them tremendous maneuverability.

Assault Porter Bot.description: In the name of dynamically changing tactics in a changing world, the Sky Raiders have equipped some surplus Jump Bots with surplus Porter packs. While the combination is unorthodox, it has achieved enough success to be put into the field.

Assault Raider.description: The basic Sky Raider infantrymen, Assault Raiders are usually found inside buildings where flight packs wouldn't be an asset. They are typically armed with submachine guns, flamethrowers, or other weapons suitable for fighting in confined spaces.

Assault Trooper.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Assault Troopers are equipped with an upgraded Plasma Glove and Power Armor with jump boosters, making them resistant to all types of damage.

Assembler Duke.description: Like any monarch, the Clockwork King has his own court, although in his case it's composed of mechanical nobles called Dukes. The Assembler Dukes can summon more Clockwork minions to their side during battle.

Assembler Lord.description:
The Clockwork Lords are the commanders of the vast armies of self-constructing automatons at the Clockwork King's disposal.

The Lords are manufacturing powerhouses, quickly assembling Assembler Dukes, who themselves quickly assemble minions of their own after.

If not taken down quickly, these flying menaces can quickly populate a battle with many Clockwork reinforcements.

Assembler Prince.description: The heirs apparent to the Clockwork King's throne, the Princes represent the pinnacle of the mad genius' creations. Assembler Princes' powerful electric attacks can blanket an area with painful lightning blasts. But it's their ability to rapidly produce more Clockwork soldiers that makes them truly insidious.

Astral Projection.description: This seems to be a projection of a powerful member of the Awakened. You are unable to see the fully tangible Awakened, but you are certain it is nearby.

Atta.description: Leadership within the Trolls is determined largely based on a never-ending game of King of the Hill. The fearsome Atta won his position by defeating seven of the Trolls' former leaders in combat, mortally wounding three of them. Since that day, many Trolls have tried to dethrone him, but none have yet succeeded.

Attendant.description: The lowest echelon of the Carnival of Shadows is filled with these servants. Although they are at the bottom of the ladder, they should not be underestimated. They wear the distinctive mask of the Carnival and draw resistance to mental attacks from it like the rest of their comrades.

Attendant Quantum.description: The lowest echelon of the Carnival of Shadows is filled with these servants. Although they are at the bottom of the ladder, they should not be underestimated. They wear the distinctive mask of the Carnival and draw resistance to mental attacks from it like the rest of their comrades.

Attendant of War.description: The Attendants of War serve as front line forces for the Carnival of War, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes that immediate action most be taken against the Talons of Vengeance no matter the cost, rather than building up Carnival forces for an overwhelming assault. They were once followers of Vanessa DeVore.

Attercop.description:
This formerly-a-scientist injected himself with some sort of virulent concoction and transformed himself into a horrific abomination. Probably not the smartest thing to do...

There is an amusing trend of supposedly brilliant scientists making really stupid decisions. You would think these geniuses would have better sensibilities, but maybe that's what makes them worthwhile scientists?

Augur.description: Augurs are the elite amongst the Seers and are masters of mind control. They are capable of crippling their enemies with powerful mental assaults then moving in for the kill.

Augur Essence.description: This Seers Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Augury Table.description: From here orders can be sent and plans can be made. This table increases the amount of control available for your base.

Aurora Borealis.description: Before the Rikti War, Aurora Scott was just a fledgling hero doing her best for the city she loved. Afterward, she was something else entirely. Aurora played host to Sister Psyche's mind after the Freedom Phalanx heroine was injured in the war. After gladly sacrificing her autonomy so that Sister Psyche could continue to serve, Aurora's just now returning to her own life. And she's got a few bones to pick with the villains who flourished in her absence.

Aurora Pena.description: Aurora Pena was once known as Mother Mayhem in Praetoria. She was the body that Praetoria's Shalice Tilman used for many years to spread her thought control amongst the populace. Aurora was freed from her prison and now seeks to make up for the horrors that Mother Mayhem committed with her own body.

Aurora Portal Watcher.description: This entity watches for the death of a portal in the script and then revokes phasing if a portal is closed.

Aurora's Mind.description: This entity plays an effect for players who are within Aurora's phase.

Australis Essence.description: This Polar Light essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Auto Turret.description: The Engineers of the Tac Ops team has constructed this Turret. Its defenses are surely formidable.

Autonomous Expert System.description: This computer uses the latest experimental technology and software programming to create a true synthetic intelligence.  While its function is limited to security systems, the processing ability of this AI is such that it can handle all but the most demanding base needs.

Avalanche Shaman.description: To become an Avalanche Shaman, one must climb the highest mountains in the world to commune with the Pantheon's dread gods. Once these labors are completed, Avalanche Shamans can command the Earth itself. Their favorite trick is to trap their foes in deadly prisons of stone. They delight in hearing the cries of their victims as the stones grind together mercilessly.

Avatar of Hamidon.description: The Avatar of Hamidon has lived in the depths of the Underground for years, though why no action has been taken against its presence or the clear infestation of the Devouring Earth is a mystery.

Avatar of Zeus.description: These violent creatures appear to be manifestations of the power released from Pandora's Box. Why they have taken form themselves, rather than inhabiting a host, you cannot say.

Awakened Armor.description: Brought to life by magical incantations retained by the former Midnight Squad and nearly lost to history, these animated golems serve as powerful guardians and sentries for the Carnival of Light. Constructed from scattered pieces of armor found around First Ward, the technologically advanced war machines make use of powerful tech swords which can fire bursts of energy at a target from range or rapidly cut them down in melee.

Axis America Fire.description: The front-line troops of Axis America have fought long and hard to cement Axis control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Axis America Force.description: The front-line troops of Axis America have fought long and hard to cement Axis control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Axis America Grenade.description: The front-line troops of Axis America have fought long and hard to cement Axis control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Axis America Oberst.description: The Obersts are at the very head of the Axis American army. These men have served the Axis army with distinction, sacrificing their safety and that of their men all in the name of the cause.

Axis America Rifle.description: The front-line troops of Axis America have fought long and hard to cement Axis control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Axis America Rocket.description: The front-line troops of Axis America have fought long and hard to cement Axis control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Axis America Unteroffizier.description: Those elite few who achieve distinction within the armies of Axis America are promoted to the coveted rank of Unteroffizier. They execute their orders with an almost religious zealotry, and do not hesitate to send their subordinates into certain death in service of the Axis cause.

Ayame Higarashi.description: Born into a major crime family in Japan, Ayame has trained hard to become the ultimate assassin, with the hopes of surpassing even Silent Blade and Silver Mantis.

Ayrych.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Azuria.description: Azuria is a seer who works with MAGI, the Modern Arcane Guild of Investigation. This section of the Federal Bureau of Super-powered Affairs assists young magic heroes in finding the right path. Some call Azuria a charlatan, but those in the mystical know believe she has great insight and wisdom.

B'Nadek.description: B'Nadek was once a human by the name of Benjamin Decker. He was captured by the Rikti and put through their genetic manipulation and mind altering program, transforming him into a Rikti. He's just recently broken the brainwashing and wants to return home to become a human again.

B.O.T.L.E.R..description: Positron's pride and joy when it comes to robotic creations, the B.O.T.L.E.R. series is equipped with an advanced service package and can offer tea in every known human dialect.

BAF Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

BCU.description: The most basic unit in the Warworks arsenal. These models are equipped with a heavy assault PGMP Rifle and both nano-repair technology and force fields.

Babbage.description: For reasons unknown, the Clockwork King created this giant automaton and loosed it upon Boomtown. Babbage seems chiefly interested in collecting metal scrap for its King, though it also fervently defends its territory from any hero incursions.

Baby New Year.description:
While Baby New Year's exact nature is up for debate, one thing is certain: Their previous displays of helplessness were clearly a misinterpretation of what was only unyielding self-restraint.

They, without a doubt, can and will use their great power when deemed a necessity.

Back Alley Brawler.description: One of the most veteran heroes in Paragon City, the Brawler is in semi-retirement, training the next generation of heroes. Though he rarely goes into the field these days, his power and fighting skills are still as potent as ever.

Backdraft.description: This building is going to explode!

Bad Penny.description: When a Circle of Thorns ritual in Perez Park accidentally enchanted a long forgotten coin, Bad Penny was born. His mean disposition came from many years trapped in coin jars, change trays, and the fact that he could no longer be used to even purchase a gumball.

Ball of Light.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Balls of Light are made of pure optimism and hope, conjured together by an earnest effort to heal another being.

Bane Sidhe.description: The Bane Sidhes are the most unhappy of all the Cabal's sorceresses. Their fury at the Red Caps has manifested itself in the form of their mournful screams, which can cause even the most powerful heroes to cringe.

Bane Sidhe Wailer.description: The Bane Sidhes are the most unhappy of all the Cabal's sorceresses. Their fury at the Red Caps has manifested itself in the form of their mournful screams, which can cause even the most powerful heroes to cringe.

Bane Spider Commando.description: Taken from the ranks of the Wolf Spiders, Bane Spider Commandos are given specialized assault training. They are vicious masters of combat that relish engaging the enemies of Arachnos.

Bane Spider Essence.description: This Arachnos Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Bane Spider Executioner.description: Only the most trusted Arachnos agents are allowed to lead the Bane Spiders. An agent must be ruthless and efficient to become one of Lord Recluse's personal guardsmen. It is a great honor to be promoted to the position of a Bane Spider Executioner.

Bane Spider Scout.description: Taken from the ranks of the Wolf Spiders, Bane Spider Scouts are given specialized covert operations training. They are elite spies used by Lord Recluse to monitor activities both on the Rogue Isles and beyond.

Banespawn.description: Born out of the spreading corruption sown by an awakening god of the Pantheon, the Banespawn is a vicious, deadly creature which strikes at its foes with the very essence of death. Though its appearance is that of a grotesque spider like creature, there is some indication that it is driven by an unexpected intelligence.

Banespawn Essence.description: This Banished Pantheon essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Banjo.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Banner of Fiends.description: Horrible fiends gather at this banner with the intent to commit blind acts of violence and cruelty. As long as this banner stands these Dark Fiends will continue to conjure forth these manifestations of the ugliness within humanity.

Banner of Mayhem.description: This banner feeds upon humanity's need for destruction conjuring up manifestations representative of this urge. The horrible creatures that guard this banner represent an unimaginable threat to the material world.

Banner of Scorn.description: Manifestations of baleful scorned women gather at this banner. The Banner of Scorn channels the vengeful side of human nature to conjure these entities, and will continue to do so as long as the Banner still stands.

Banner of Terror.description: The Banner of Terror feeds off of humanity's fears and causes it to manifest into the Transparent Terrors that guard this banner. These horrific phantasmal entities seek to shatter the fragile psyches of humanity with terrible fear.

Banshee.description: The Banshee was once a woman with a melodic voice who died in the many battles waged in and around First Ward. Her gift in life has become a curse in death, twisted by the Talons of Vengeance into a terrifying harbinger of bad tidings. Through her otherworldly cries and shouts, the Banshee serves as a messenger of the torment the Talons bring to all those who have incurred their wrath.

Baphomet.description: The Baphomet is the oldest and most feared of the Behemoth Lords. The ground beneath its cloven feet burns with its own infernal fire.

Barbara.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Baron Vordo.description: Baron Zukor remains a mystery to the Rogue Isles. His name does not carry weight with Arachnos, nor with the people on the streets. As far as anyone knows, he is a newcomer... but for all that, he has gained influence among the Destined Ones at an astonishing rate. His true motives remain unclear, for now.

Baron Zoria.description: The ancient Oranbegan sorcerer known as Akarist was once a mortal man, over 14,000 years ago. In his original body, his magical powers were at their peak.

Barracuda.description: A former treasure hunter, Kelli Forston was infected by mysterious creatures known as the Coralax. What she found in the briny deep remains a mystery, but it turned her heart as dark and cold as the depths. In combat, she is almost as quick and savage as her bloodthirsty mentor, Captain Mako.

Barrel.description: The contents of this barrel must be destroyed!

Barrel - Sewer.description: The contents of this barrel must be destroyed!

Barrel - Warehouse.description: The contents of this barrel must be destroyed!

Barrels (Group).description: These barrels are used to carry volatile liquids.

Baryon.description: The Baryon are the most powerful of Anti-Matter's constructs. They generate an intense amount of radiation and must be carefully contained when fighting in area with a civilian presence.

Base Portal.description: This portal will transport you to the Ouroboros Headquarters.

Basic Generator.description: The Haddon 1185 is a proven answer to base power needs. Economical to run, load-bank tested, and government-approved for Super Group use, its German engineered motor is smooth running and compact.

Basic Reclaimator.description: The reclamator works like those at the hospitals, teleporting defeated members to the base and automatically healing them. Its healing is less efficient than a hospital's, but can be improved with auxiliary items.

Basilisk.description: As Chimera's servants advance through the ranks they continue their mastery of weapons and poisons. The Basilisks coat their weapons with a poison that will dull their enemies' reflexes and make them easier to finish off.

Basilisk Quantum.description: As Chimera's servants advance through the ranks they continue their mastery of weapons and poisons. The Basilisks coat their weapons with a poison that will dull their enemies' reflexes and make them easier to finish off.

Bat'Zul.description: A demon-lord of the lowest planes of existence, Bat'Zul's immense power has been shackled beneath Cap Au Diable for hundreds of years. Should he escape, he could turn all of the Rogue Isles into an inferno of destruction.

Battle Drone.description: Positron has dabbled in Robotics on occasion, though he has not had much success.

Battle Maiden.description: Battle Maiden receives her powers from her halberd, a nanite-infested weapon from Warrior Earth. She has amassed a small army of warriors from that dimension as her personal guard.

Battle Orb Essence.description: This IDF Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Battle Orb Mk I.description: Battle Orbs are equipped with a wide variety of equipment loads. Some units serve a defensive and support oriented role, while others are more about bringing additional suppressive fire and offense.

Battle Orb Mk II.description: Battle Orbs are equipped with a wide variety of equipment loads. Some units serve a defensive and support oriented role, while others are more about bringing additional suppressive fire and offense.

Battle Orb Mk III.description: Battle Orbs are equipped with a wide variety of equipment loads. Some units serve a defensive and support oriented role, while others are more about bringing additional suppressive fire and offense.

Beacon Cap au Diable.description: Teleport Beacon to Cap au Diable.

Beacon Echo: Dark Astoria.description: Teleport Beacon to Echo: Dark Astoria.

Beacon Nerva.description: Teleport Beacon to the Nerva Archipelago.

Beacon Rikti War Zone.description: Teleport Beacon to the Rikti War Zone.

Beacon The Storm Palace.description: Teleport Beacon to The Storm Palace

Beastly Keetsoth.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Becky, the Tarantula Battle-Mistress.description: Becky the Tarantula Mistress is like, totally out of bubblegum.

Becky, the Tarantula Mistress.description: Becky the Tarantula Mistress is like, totally always giving life her all! Despite her earnest endeavors and generally upbeat demeanor, Arachnos management has had considerable difficulty finding an assignment that is a good fit for her 'unique personality'.

Bedraggled Citizen.description: This citizen has managed to find a way to survive in First Ward despite the numerous threats to survival one may encounter in this lost part of Praetoria.

Bedrock.description: Made from assemblages of rocks that are somehow given form and consciousness, the Rock Troops are tough, resilient creatures who can either pound their opponents in close combat or hurl rocks from a distance.

Behemoth.description: Summoned from the hellish pits of some other dimension, the Behemoths are fiery demons that inspire nightmares in all who see them. They can summon flaming swords to strike down their enemies, or breath fire from their mouths to incinerate all who stand before them.

Behemoth Essence.description: This demonic essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Behemoth Lord.description: Summoned from the hellish pits of some other dimension, the Behemoths are fiery demons that inspire nightmares in all who see them. They can summon flaming swords to strike down their enemies, or breath fire from their mouths to incinerate all who stand before them.

Behemoth Master.description: Summoned from the hellish pits of some other dimension, the Behemoths are fiery demons that inspire nightmares in all who see them. They can summon flaming swords to strike down their enemies, or breath fire from their mouths to incinerate all who stand before them.

Behemoth Overlord.description: The Behemoth Overlords are - fortunately - very rare. Likewise they are very deadly. Their mastery of fire allows them to immolate multiple foes simultaneously, and they can quickly heal their own wounds by basking in the heat of their infernal fire.

Beholder.description: Beholder is a rare sight; a former seer who has broken completely from Praetor Tilman's network. She is infamous for the amount of chaos and destruction she has caused within Imperial City.

Belladonna Vetrano.description: One of the deadliest covert agents in the world, Belladonna has proven herself a most capable spy and killer for the Resistance. Though her past is a well kept secret, Belladonna makes it clear that she has no love for Tyrant or his lackeys. Rumors abound that she was trained by Chimera; Tyrant's Praetor of Intelligence and widely considered the deadliest assassin in the world. Belladonna will one day put that title to the test.

Ben the Burninator.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Berserker Bomb.description: Berserker Bombs are massive cybernetically enhanced humans fitted with high yield explosives. They are commanded into close combat with the enemy where their explosive payload is then detonated.

Beta Wolf.description: When the Pack has approved of an Omega, they are immediately protected and treated well. It is an instant transition with no going back. Once someone is Pack, death is the only thing that will break that.

Betty.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Biff.description: Biff is an intelligent Arachnoid, much different than the savage variety typically found in the Gutter of Grandville. He is attempting to find a cure for the Arachnoid condition.

Big Al.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Big Dog.description: Every year The Destroyers hold a contest of champions. Anyone can enter the contest, but only the strongest dare, for death is not an uncommon outcome for the losers. The winner earns the title of Big Dog and joins the ranks of The Destroyers leaders; the Top Dogs.

Big McLargeHuge.description: Big McLargehuge was a popular star in the late 1960s through the 1970s. While he never landed a starring role in a major motion picture, he did play the leading man in a large number of B-movies, cementing his status as a cult movie star. His career took a downturn in the 1980s when his outspoken political views effectively saw him blacklisted for much of the decade, and his declining health made it difficult to do long shoots. His career has recently rebounded on television, where he's re-invented himself as a capable character actor with roles in several popular shows.

Big Mel.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Bile.description: Ralph Francesco was an early members of the nihilistic group that would later become the Freakshow. his experience as an army veteran made it inevitable that he'd become one the organization's top men. Because of this lofty position, Ralph was one of the first to undergo cybernetic augmentation. Henceforth, he became known only as Bile.

Billy.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Bioelectric Pustule.description: These Devouring Earth pustules are charged to the brim with bio-electrical energy. What exactly the monsters use them for is a question you're not sure anybody could answer, but this will be very useful for charging Dr. Aeon's Dimensional Originator!

Biopulse.description: Biopulse is one of the rare Infected who drank from the toxic cesspools on Mercy Island and actually manifested super powers! He now hopes to champion the cause of the Infected on Mercy Island as a hero.

Black Chevalier.description: The Black Knights are an ancient Order of the dead that is charged with overseeing the Eternal Prison; a place where only the wickedest of souls are jailed. Armed with great swords easily the height of most men, a Black Chevalier is an unstoppable force, bringing death and destruction in its wake. Where he walks, the foes of the Eternal Order fall in droves.

Black Feather.description: The Black Knights are an ancient Order of the dead that is charged with overseeing the Eternal Prison; a place where only the wickedest of souls are jailed. Black Feathers are said to shoot death on raven wings with their great bows, and indeed, their arrows are fletched with their namesake. With keen eyes, they watch for danger, ensuring that the walls of the Eternal Prison are never breached and that evil cannot escape.

Black Hole Bomb.description: How are you reading this? Well, now that you're here, this is a Black Hole Bomb, it'll explode; Oh yes.

Black Queen.description: The Black Queen rules at the side of Lord Lorn and is normally in charge of the running of the Eternal Prison while Lorn is on campaign. She has come with her husband to Night Ward in search of the Black Swan, whose villainy has earned her a very special cage in the Black Queen's collection within the Eternal Prison. She is no stranger to warfare and weilds potent magic against any who dare raise a weapon against her.

Black Scorpion.description: Ernesto Rodriguez embodies the concept of raw power through technology. Whatever it takes, whatever piece of his body or soul needs to be spliced, altered, or removed to grant him more power, Ernesto seems willing to do it. His unbridled hunger, absolute loyalty, and low intelligence makes him the perfect servant for Lord Recluse.

Black Scorpion's Attendant.description: Working for Black Scorpion comes with a certain level of verbal (and sometimes physical) abuse, but it pays well.

Black Swan.description: Black Swan was born with a connection to the Netherworld. Somehow she was able to manufacture an entire dimension, giving her a huge source of power, a place called Shadow Earth.

Black Warden.description: The Black Knights are an ancient Order of the dead that is charged with overseeing the Eternal Prison; a place where only the wickedest of souls are jailed. Black Wardens are the masters of the Eternal Prison, and form the inner circle of the Eternal Order. It is to them that the many and powerful oaths of the Black Knights are made, and it is solely upon them that the task of finding and punishing the souls of the wicked rests. Through powerful black spells the Black Wardens ensure that no soul can escape their grasp, and that the reward for a life of wickedness is bestowed upon those souls in the form of an eternity of agony from which there is no escape.

Black Wolf.description: This faithful and fearsome Black Wolf has taken a liking to you and will keep you company. However, it won't engage in combat and cannot be attacked.

Blackrose.description: These horrid perversions of normal flora have become one of the most identifiable monsters in the Devouring Earth's maniacal menagerie. In addition to their astonishing mobility, they can fire swarms of thorns at their enemies, tearing flesh to shreds in an instant.

Blade Initiate.description: The Syndicate has survived by recruiting only those with at least some psychic potential. The initiates are the bottom rung of Syndicate ladder, they have yet to prove themselves and ascend to the ranks of Adept.

Blade Prince.description: These cruel demons command a host of dancing swords to flay the flesh of their foes.

Blade of Artemis.description: The intensive training that the Knives of Artemis go through does not completely explain their deadliness. Promotion in their ranks is through rites of combat known only to their inner circles. It is said, however, that if you challenge you either move up... or you perish.

Blade of Artemis Quantum.description: The intensive training that the Knives of Artemis go through does not completely explain their deadliness. Promotion in their ranks is through rites of combat known only to their inner circles. It is said, however, that if you challenge you either move up... or you perish.

Bladegrass.description: These horrid perversions of normal flora have become one of the most identifiable monsters in the Devouring Earth's maniacal menagerie. In addition to their astonishing mobility, they can fire swarms of thorns at their enemies, tearing flesh to shreds in an instant.

Bladestorm.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in her agility and strength due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance and has abandoned her broadsword in favor of the more graceful and visceral attacks of dual blades. The signs of her conversion into a member of the Talons are beginning to show. Though she has removed some of her body suit as her skin begins to provide more natural protection and replaced other pieces with true Talons armor, she still uses most of the standard Knives battle gear.

Blahpunk.description: The Blahpunks' sonic implants have made them a new kind of threat. You have to wonder where they obtained the technology.

Blast Furnace.description: Blast Furnace is a mutant who can cause his body to burst into flame. Somewhat uncontrollable, he has taken to wearing armor to contain his awesome energies.

Blast Master.description: Sometimes the Destroyers come up against something that just needs to get blown up... and then burned down. Blast Masters are the answer. Carrying arsenals of various incendiary bombs and high explosives, Blast Masters destroy things with a lot more style and flair than their more brutal siblings.

Blaze of Flame.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Flame has learned to harness their magic into fiery blasts.

Blight.description: A Blight is a Frostling that has served the Winter Lord long and successfully enough to be granted additional power.
