Blighted.description: Blighted have been subsisting on cesspool water for many weeks now, and the changes they have undergone are far greater than skin deep. They no longer desire any nourishment other than that they take from the cesspool. Their old friends and dreams are entirely forgotten as they slip deeper into their irradiated daze.

Blind Makwa.description: Blind Makwa was born without sight like normal men. He was gifted with the rare and beautiful ability to see spirits as others see one another every day. It was this reason that he became a well respected medicine man. His ability to converse with those who had taken the heaven's road and joined with the great spirit was sought by many in the wake of the Hamidon Wars. But dead men are supposed to tell no tales, and so when Blind Makwa began hearing terrible truths, he snuck away to the First Ward where he would be safe, and no one would look for him.

Blitzkrieg.description: Marshal Blitz's personal Flier has been miniaturized and equipped with stolen ordinance.

Blizzard Thorn Caster.description: At the highest levels of elemental mastery, certain Casters are able to harness multiple techniques and combine them into more devastating powers. Blizzard Casters have mastered the arts of Air and Ice casting, and can manipulate gusts of chill wind and atmospheric energies.

Block.description: Outcast Initiates who show potential are valuable commodities amongst the Outcasts, and are quickly elevated up the ranks. Blocks are just learning how to harden their bodies into stone, and control the primal forces of earth and rock.

Blood Brother Brawler.description: The Hellions have found their special edge by using the power of mystical artifacts to increase their strength and skill. Only the highest ranked gang members know where these artifacts really come from. The gang values secrecy and solidarity; only those who have undergone the initiation ritual and ceremonially cut themselves can be called Blood Brothers.

Blood Brother Chopper.description: No one likes a nice, cheery blaze better than a Hellion. They like it so much, they've managed to set this entire section of the city on fire. It's up to Paragon City's heroes to rain on their parade.

Blood Brother Quantum.description: The Hellions have found their special edge by using the power of mystical artifacts to increase their strength and skill. Only the highest ranked gang members know where these artifacts really come from. The gang values secrecy and solidarity; only those who have undergone the initiation ritual and ceremonially cut themselves can be called Blood Brothers.

Blood Brother Slammer.description: No one likes a nice, cheery blaze better than a Hellion. They like it so much, they've managed to set this entire section of the city on fire. It's up to Paragon City's heroes to rain on their parade.

Blood Brother Slicer.description: No one likes a nice, cheery blaze better than a Hellion. They like it so much, they've managed to set this entire section of the city on fire. It's up to Paragon City's heroes to rain on their parade.

Blood Brother Slugger.description: No one likes a nice, cheery blaze better than a Hellion. They like it so much, they've managed to set this entire section of the city on fire. It's up to Paragon City's heroes to rain on their parade.

Blood Thorn.description: Born in the Brazilian rainforest where the greed from ranchers had taken her home and family at a young age. She decided that the human race needed to be destroyed before they destroy the earth completely.

Blood Widow.description: Blood Widows are Arachnos' beautiful but deadly assassins. Pray you do not feel their kiss.

Bloody Vicious.description: Bloody Vicious is an elite enforcer for the Verandi Family on Port Oakes. While adopting an effete manner, he is quite a deadly combatant with his razor-sharp katana. He has often crossed paths with the Marcone Family.

Blue Phazer.description: Blue Phazer is a hero working with Longbow in the Rogue Isles. She is known to possess a robotic super-suit which allows her to manipulate high-energy fields.

Blue Steel.description: Blue Steel was originally a promising beat cop with the Paragon Police Department before he grew into the role of hero. He was affiliated with Back Alley Brawler and the Regulators, and led initiatives to curb gang activity in Paragon City. He led one of the early crackdowns against the Clockwork, though has rarely spoken of the encounter. The PPD works very closely with Blue Steel, though he finds time between assisting the force and training newer heroes to lend a hand in otherwise impossible situations.

Blue Wisp Pet.description: This is a Faerie who has come from the Lost Lands to aid you.

Blunt_Trauma.description: Blunt Trauma is a mutant who has worked as heavy muscle for various villains in the past. He ended up in the Zig by Longbow for ripping apart a bank vault, but not before he took out an entire assault team.

Bobby.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Bobcat.description:
Created during the tail end of the Hamidon Wars, genetic hybrids were made by a variety of military and privately owned laboratories in an attempt to create super powered soldiers to fight the Devouring Earth. Bobcat is one such experiment that merged human and feline DNA. Left abandoned and forgotten after the war she eventually escaped from the lab and roamed the streets of Praetoria City until Neuron found her.

Initially feral and incredibly bad tempered, she quickly grew accustomed to civilized life. She has taken up a near permanent residence in Studio 55, using her influence as a Praetor's girlfriend to remodel the club as she sees fit.

Bold Bryan.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Bomb.description: This case holds an unusual item.

Bomb Power Entity.description: This entity creates the bomb power

Bombardier.description: The Goldbrickers are high-tech thieves who operate in and around Cap au Diable. They're led by a notorious crime lord known only as King Midas.

Bone Breaker.description: The Skulls' leaders, the Bone Daddies, have become living embodiments of the power of death. They can literally suck the life out of a foe to feed their own spirits. They can also focus the pure darkness of the netherworld into physical attacks that cause massive damage.

Bone Daddy.description: The Skulls' leaders, the Bone Daddies, have become living embodiments of the power of death. They can literally suck the life out of a foe to feed their own spirits. They can also focus the pure darkness of the netherworld into physical attacks that cause massive damage.

Bone Daddy Quantum.description: The Skulls' leaders, the Bone Daddies, have become living embodiments of the power of death. They can literally suck the life out of a foe to feed their own spirits. They can also focus the pure darkness of the netherworld into physical attacks that cause massive damage.

Bookcase.description: These books need to be destroyed.

Bookshelf.description: Information is key to defeating your enemies. This bookshelf generates additional control for your defenses.

Boomer.description: The Goldbrickers are high-tech thieves who operate in and around Cap au Diable. They're led by a notorious crime lord known only as King Midas.

Booster Rocket.description: The Giant Zenith Warcry is taking off. Get out of there!

Borea.description:
Borea and her twin sister Levantera together lead the Shield, the division of Vanguard tasked with protecting the city and it's people from the Rikti.

The two sisters are both extremely capable fighters, and are the chosen Champions of the Order of the Four Winds. However, the sisters rarely see eye-to-eye with each other, and often argue over the best methods to accomplish their goals.

Borea tends to believe in a protective strategy, concentrating on defending the city and it's citizens over aggressive preemptive attacks. After all, if your enemy has destroyed what you were protecting, then any victory is meaningless.

Borealis Essence.description: This Polar Light essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Boulder.description: Made from assemblages of rocks that are somehow given form and consciousness, the Rock Troops are tough, resilient creatures who can either pound their opponents in close combat or hurl rocks from a distance.

Brawler Adept.description: Only those that have achieved enlightenment through brutal combat, have proved themselves worthy members of the Syndicate and unlocked their true potential may call themselves Adepts.

Brawler Initiate.description: The Syndicate has survived by recruiting only those with at least some psychic potential. The initiates are the bottom rung of Syndicate ladder, they have yet to prove themselves and ascend to the ranks of Adept.

Breaker.description: The Gold Brickers generally deal with their enemies from the relative comfort of the sky using their high-tech jetpacks, but the Breakers have found it more thrilling to out-maneuver their enemies in melee wielding heavy galvanized golden wrenches. While not inherently the most threatening member of the Langston Corp crew, one powerful strike from a Breaker after the resulting vulnerability from repeated Gold Bricker sonic cannon blasts is enough to easily end many super-powered threats.

Brenda.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Bres.description: The original Bres was a hero of the Tuatha de Dannan. Here in Croatoa, many of the creatures have earned the right to carry his name. They lead their felHigh creatures in the effort to wipe out the Fir Bolg

Brian.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Brick.description: The Bricks are one with the Earth, although not in a hippie kind of way. Instead they use stone and rock to smash their rivals, hurling boulders or conjuring up mallets with which to maul anyone who gets in their way.

Brigadier Defender.description: The members of the Port Noble Citizen's Brigade are armed citizens standing up for their right and freedoms after the collapse of the Council in Striga Isle. The Defenders have a wider array of 'reclaimed' goods from Striga storehouses to protect themselves and others.

Bright Nova.description: Every Kheldian energy being retains the patterns of its past hosts, and can use these patterns to transform itself and its current host into an energy-based duplicate of that creature, gaining new abilities in the process. The Bright Nova form is patterned off of a race called the Mefnanim that lived in the energy-charged upper atmosphere of a gas giant planet. The Bright Nova form retains the ability fly and to shape and project energy bolts of incredible power.

Brikhaus.description: Brickhouse grew up in East Germany, but when the wall fell moved to the United States. He recently was hired by Freedom Corps to help with some overseas operations due to his dual citizenship.

Bronze Bird.description: A hero of limited field exposure, Bronze Bird is newer than most in the Hero Corps ranks. What they lack in experience, they make up for in an abundance of enthusiasm and flight speed. Their control over the forces of gravity and energy are not to be underestimated, either.

Bronze Leopard.description: Bronze Leopard Masters use claw-like weapons to deadly effect. They disdain the more spectacular uses of Tsoo power, preferring to concentrate on physical techniques.

Bronze Strongman.description: The strongmen of the Carnival of Shadows are capable of amazing feats of strength. The Bronze Strongmen are recruited for their potential and are mentally dominated by the Ring Mistresses. They are then put through a rigorous training regimen to achieve their Herculean physique and are sealed in their helmets.

Bronze Talon.description: One of the upper echelon of the Tsoo, Bronze Talon has never been seen without his bodyguard. Many organizations have claimed to have killed Bronze Talon, but he keeps showing back up, almost as if by magic.

Bruce.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Bruiser.description: This Thug is a massive Brute. The Bruiser has worked his way through the ranks and has nothing left to prove. He is strong, tough and has a mean temper.

Brute.description: This is a generic Dark/Dark Brute.

Bugged Out Freak Psycho.description: The 'Bugged Out' soldiers in Pierce's army are the Found Freaks that made the cut for the program, but didn't take to the mental conditioning regimen as hoped. As a result, the partially lobotomized and inhibitor-chipped lunatics bring a fair bit of chaos to the table for everyone to enjoy!

Builder.description: Should another Clockwork Android fall due to unforeseen circumstances or job hazards the Builders are there to rebuild the fallen Android on the job.

Builder Essence.description: This Clockwork Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Bull Natterling.description: What are Natterlings made of? No one can truly say. Their twisted bodies seem to be composed of all manner of matter, from the flesh of Brutes to the strange jewel-like Kora fruit. In battle, the Natterlings will shoot gouts of this amalgamated material at their enemies, causing great damage and a very unpleasant smell.

Bull Natterling Essence.description: This Rularuu Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Bullet.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Bullet Streak.description: Aiming to take down criminals where ever they may be found, Bullet Streak is a protector of freedom and liberty.

Bulwark Seedling.description: Bulwark Seedlings are the Seed's primary source of defense against Cole's forces and wayward superpowered beings. Every Bulwark Seedling alive increases the Seed of Hamidon's defenses against all types of attack.

Bunker Door.description: These reinforced doors seal off Antimatter's bunkers and must be breached if there is any hope of getting at the reserve Power Cells located within.

Burn Protector.description: Crey Industries is always looking for ways to improve the artificial metahumans cynically called Paragon Protectors. These Protectors seem to be made using all fire-based powers.

Burnin' Bill.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Burning Daemon.description: There is nothing human about this creature. Summoned from the darkest pits, Burning Daemon seeks nothing but to cause havoc and create chaos. Many villain groups have attempted to recruit him to control his power, however he has expressed no interest in any of their petty mortal dealings.

Burnout.description: Burnouts are Seers whose psychic powers never came under their control. This makes them quite dangerous, as their instability would have the potential to spread to otherwise functional Seers. This caused the Burnouts to be cast out of the Seer program.

Bus Stop.description: This bus stop is covered so passengers can get in out of the weather.

Business - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Business - Male.description: This hapless citizen is in over his head.

Businessman.description: This citizen is obviously an influential businessman.

Businesswoman.description: This citizen is obviously an influential businesswoman.

Butch.description: One of Frank McCain's dogs, Butch is a savage yet loyal companion to his gun-toting master.

Button Man Beamer.description: Organized crime has always had plenty of competition in Paragon City, but that doesn't stop young street toughs from wanting to swear allegiance to their Don and live like a wiseguy. The Button Man 'Beamers' carry around stolen beam rifle technology, most likely from Crey, or even Malta. The Family is willing to go to great lengths to ensure their empire is kept safe.

Button Man Brawler.description: Organized crime has always had plenty of competition in Paragon City, but that doesn't stop young street toughs from wanting to swear allegiance to their Don and live like a wiseguy. The Button Man Brawlers are amongst the toughest of the lower ranking Family thugs. They use stolen technology to make each of their punches hit like a ton of bricks. Their brass knuckles are also poisoned with a rare toxin. The Family only calls on these thugs when it's necessary, as they are normally away on important business.

Button Man Buckshot.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Button Man Gunner.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Button Man Hitter.description: Organized crime has always had plenty of competition in Paragon City, but that doesn't stop young street toughs from wanting to swear allegiance to their Don and live like a wiseguy. The Button Man Hitters are pinpoint shots with their heavily modified guns.

Button Man Muscle.description: Organized crime has always had plenty of competition in Paragon City, but that doesn't stop young street toughs from wanting to swear allegiance to their Don and live like a wiseguy. It helps to be a stone cold killer with a gun, like these guys.

Button Man Quantum Gunner.description: Organized crime has always had plenty of competition in Paragon City, but that doesn't stop young street toughs from wanting to swear allegiance to their Don and live like a wiseguy. It helps to be a stone cold killer with a gun, like these guys.

Bystander.description: This Praetorian Citizen has come to witness the current attack on the TPN Campus. They are confused and frightened, making them highly susceptible to influence by the Telepathists deployed by the IDF.

C'Kelkah.description: This Rikti dignitary seems more open-minded than most of the strange, militant aliens. She may be the best hope for peace between humans and Rikti.

C.C..description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Cacophony.description: Cacophony was a singer whose mutants powers manifested during an opera performance, causing untold mayhem and destruction. Since then she has managed to harness her powers for good.

Cadaver.description: These reanimated corpses give off a powerful stench that's a mixture of chemicals and rotting flesh. The odor becomes a hundred times worse when they use their favorite attack - vomiting a stream of corrosive acid on their nearby opponents.

Cage Consortium Captain.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Cage Consortium Guard.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Cage Consortium Officer.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Cairn.description: These tiny Cairns channel the Earth's energies, making nearby Devouring Earth creatures more resistant to damage.

Calamity.description: Mu Guardians pulse with the blood of their slaughtered ancestors in their veins. They have read unholy tomes, visited other planes of existence, and performed dark sacrifices too terrible to mention to become masters of the mystic arts.

Calanthe.description: Calanthe (Real name: Sharon Devaney) was rescued from a burning building by members of Hero Corps. After the investigation concluded it was discovered that she had caused the fire when her powers manifested unexpectedly. Two people died in that building, and the courts ruled her innocent despite the tumultuous drama of the proceedings that left many raw. Unable to shake a sense of guilt and a driving need to ease her conscience, she joined Hero Corps to understand and control the power within her.

Caleb.description: The legendary Caleb. You'd thought he was just a rumor-a tale told to frighten children by cruel parents. Yet here he is, brimming with infernal power and reeking of brimstone from the darkest depths of Hell.

Caliban.description: The leaders of the Trolls have developed truly superhuman abilities. Not only do they heal fast and resist a variety of damage types, they're also capable of feats of tremendous strength. As a result, they have no need for weapons of any kind.

Caliban Quantum.description: The leaders of the Trolls have developed truly superhuman abilities. Not only do they heal fast and resist a variety of damage types, they're also capable of feats of tremendous strength. As a result, they have no need for weapons of any kind.

Calvin Scott.description: Calvin Scott is a high ranking member of the Resistance, a small force determined to remove Emperor Cole from power no matter the cost.

Calystix the Shaper.description: Calystix the Shaper is the high priest of an ancient cult dedicated to the sea-goddess Merulena. He has formed a 'Cult of the Shaper' on Sharkhead in order to free an ancient terror which is trapped beneath the island.

Camera Drone.description: This is a hard light hologram of a Camera Drone.

Camilla.description: A deadly bow priestess of Artemis, Camilla honors the gods with every foe she defeats. She truly believes that Cornutus is divinely blessed and will follow him anywhere as a result. As a testament to their skill with the bow and the staggering amount of enemies they have bested, the gods have rewards the sisters with wings so that they might better commune with the divine.

Candlestick.description: Candlestick is a talented psychic of the Carnival of Light, given to brashness and ill-conceived plans.

Cannon Duke.description: Like any monarch, the Clockwork King has his own court, although in his case it's composed of mechanical nobles called Dukes. These oversized robots are dangerous foes, possessing powerful long range electrical attacks.

Cannon Knight.description: The Knights make up the bulk of the leadership class within the twisted court of the Clockwork King. Cannon Knights possess powerful, long range electrical attacks.

Cannon Prince.description: The heirs apparent to the Clockwork King's throne, the Princes represent the pinnacle of the mad genius' creations. Although Cannon Princes sometimes seem almost human because of their advanced robotic brains, they're still immune to mental attacks and can deal out massive electrical blasts.

Cannon Rook.description:
The Clockwork Rooks take advantage of the Clockwork's vast numbers to utilize a Sprocket as a pawn, companion, as well as their weapon of choice.

When engaged, the Champion will grab their Sprocket pawn, and channel an energy current through its body to create a super-charged mace for dealing with any opponents who interrupt their work.

The ability to psionically insert themselves into their target's focus combined with the clock-face shield they defend themselves with, these champions are one of the Clockwork King's favored approaches to dealing with super-powered threats that get in his way.

Cannoneer.description: The members of the Resistance in the Unified People's Army make up those who were loyal to Calvin Scott's vision. They were unphased when it was revealed that he had a mental disorder causing him to believe that Aurora Pena was his wife; what mattered was the goal of fighting for the freedom of a new tomorrow. They fight now in the Unified People's Army with the belief that they stand for the freedom of mankind, even if mankind doesn't realize it.

Capo Gunner.description: Each Capo controls his own crew of Button Men. It's a kind of authority you don't earn unless you've proven yourself both ruthless and lucky. Capos save the best weapons and women for themselves and are inevitably smart, tough fighters.

Capo Heavy.description: Each Capo controls his own crew of Button Men. It's a kind of authority you don't earn unless you've proven yourself both ruthless and lucky. Capos save the best weapons and women for themselves and are inevitably smart, tough fighters. These Capos have been given the honor of using stolen Praetorian technology, specifically the Resistance Heavy Barrels. The Family had a choice in the matter; they could take the Resistance rifles, or the Resistance Heavy Barrels. Once the capos saw the Heavy Barrel in action, their decision was a no brainer.

Capo Muscle.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Capo Quantum Gunner.description: Each Capo controls his own crew of Button Men. It's a kind of authority you don't earn unless you've proven yourself both ruthless and lucky. Capos save the best weapons and women for themselves and are inevitably smart, tough fighters.

Capo Strongarm.description: Each Capo controls his own crew of Button Men. It's a kind of authority you don't earn unless you've proven yourself both ruthless and lucky. Capos save the best weapons and women for themselves and are inevitably smart, tough fighters. The Capo Strongarm is among the strongest of the Capos. They've been seen throwing rival mafia's cars to deal with 'problems' that arise. One thing is clear: you don't mess with a Capo Strongarm.

Captain.description: Nemesis' officers are some of the best trained soldiers in the world, and they show amazing discipline and devotion to their master. They're armed with the Nemesis lance, a long rifle that can also operate effectively as a spear. Their skill with this weapon makes them deadly at any distance.

Captain Castillo.description: The dashing Captain Ernest Castillo has made quite a name for himself, both for his photogenic panache and for his bold criminal exploits. While he cultivates the image of the daring air-pirate and heart-throb, any who've been on the wrong end of his temper know not to underestimate him.

Captain Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Captain Mako.description: Gideon Ray is a savage mutant who has evolved into what can only be described as a humanoid shark. His acts are even more terrible than his appearance, and few foes are even identifiable once Mako is through with them. Mako is responsible for the death of Sharkhead Isle's most famous hero, Scrapyard.

Captain Sherman.description: The disgraced grandson of a general on an Earth where the South had won the American Civil War, Captain Sherman joined the Nemesis Army out of pure desperation after Nemesis conquered his world. He was a loyal soldier for many years, but has recently begun to question the Prussian Prince of Automatons' grand plans after learning some disturbing secrets.

Captain Stone.description: Captain Stone is a loyal servant of the Sky Raiders who enjoys nothing more than a fueled flight pack, a well-oiled machine gun, and clear orders.

Captain Tirailleur.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. This seemingly simple weapon is actually quite versatile. The Tirailleurs have modified their weapons to fire poison gas grenades.

Captain Wilhelmina M. Dietrich.description: Captain Wilhelmina Marlena Dietrich has proven herself as one of Longbow's top-notch field leaders in several major actions during her career. She has recently been placed in control of Longbow's Anti-Rikti Operations. She has long been a critic of the Vanguard and it's open-door policies.

Caption Manager.description: This entity can be used in conjunction with a HealthObjective script to allow up to 7 captions to be played in a zone event.

Car.description: This car looks like it's of sturdy construction.

Carabineir.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. It fires compact shells that carry a tremendous punch, exploding with the force of a heavy grenade or rocket shell.

Carl.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Caro.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Carol.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Carolyn.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Carrion Creeper Vine.description: The Carrion Creeper vines thrive on the flesh of the dead. It has burst from the body of some poor soul and is now looking for more victims to nourish itself.

Carryall Companion.description: Lifters, as their name indicates, do a lot of the heavy lifting and construction. They are able to easily lift machinery and building materials that previously could only be lifted by powerful cranes. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units.

Casual - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Casual - Male.description: This hapless citizen is in over his head.

Cataphract Essence.description: This Longbow Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Catherine.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Cauldron.description:
Cauldron hails from the green hills of Ireland and was a respected historian of Irish, Scottish, and Welsh folklore. She delved too deeply into the lore behind Bog Bodies and the Cauldronborn, and was cursed by the Sidhe for treading too close to some of the sacred sites and learning their secrets.

Cauldron is now joined with Hero Corps to help remove her curse and in the meantime trades her research skills and develops control over her curse to fight crime as payment.

Cauldron Champion.description:
Few can claim to have been champions of the Gold Bricker's infamous 'Smelting Cauldron' arena. Though the arena venue itself changes from time to time, one thing remains constant: the fighters duke it out in a pool of molten slag.

Only those who have been crowned 'Cauldron Champion' are permitted to wear the burning helmet and the champ's belt. It is the duty and honor of each new champion to run each tournament that follows their victory until they are ultimately defeated themselves by the next champion.

The current champ has reigned for quite some time, he won't go down without a fight!

Cauldron Igniter.description:
These heavy flamethrower turrets are traditionally used in the Smelting Cauldron arenas to pressure challengers who aren't being aggressive enough by enclosing the arena in deadly flames and reducing the area where you can stand.

Their construction is a bit crude and the liquid fuel tanks they use tend to combust easily, causing explosions...

Centurion.description: If the Legionarii were a spear, the Centurions would be the point. Sharpened to a deadly point, these men will do whatever it takes to cut down their enemies.

Centurion Essence.description: This Cimeroran Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Cerebral Chris.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Cerulean.description: Cerulean is a wizard with no compunctions about openly displaying his signature shade of blue to all. He is a man who held great stature in the Midnight Squad of old, but after its fall he was but one of the few survivors seeking solace, and finding it with Vanessa DeVore and her Carnival of Light. Cerulean has made it no secret that he wants to lead the Carnival to war against their adversaries, and as such he has gathered numerous like minded individuals, many of them former Midnighters as well, to his side. So far the Carnival of War stays leashed to Vanessa DeVore's blessing, but with the changes in First Ward coming, it is only a matter of time before war finds them. Cerulean stands ready for that day.

Chain Gun.description: This is a military-issue automated light sentry turret. It can automatically detect and fire short bursts at infiltrators, making it ideal for installation defense.

Chain Gun Turret.description: The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'Our basic model of chain-gun turret provides constant volumes of fire, capable of dissuading most intruders.'

Chain-Gun Turret.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a Chain-Gun turret. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'Our basic model of chain-gun turret provides constant volumes of fire, capable of dissuading most intruders.'

Chains.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Champion.description: The Champions of the Tuatha de Dannan are big, bulky brutes, capable of tearing most people in half. They have distinguished themselves by acts of great strength and courage, and many of the Tuatha look to them as leaders.

Champion Smasher.description: These are the heroes of the Freakshow, devoted utterly to smashing the state and having a great time while they're doing it. They're totally without care or mercy; point them in the right direction (or even the wrong one) and mayhem ensues.

Champion Swiper.description: These are the heroes of the Freakshow, devoted utterly to smashing the state and having a great time while they're doing it. They're totally without care or mercy; point them in the right direction (or even the wrong one) and mayhem ensues.

Champion of Battle.description: To defeat the enemy in front of you and take the battle is the second lesson of the Champions of War Earth. They believe that if you cannot hold your place in the line then not only will you fall, but so will your comrades around you.

Champion of Mourning.description: The first thing that is taught to the Champions of War Earth is that you must always respect those who fall in battle. It does not matter if they are your comrades or your enemy, all those who give their lives to combat must be remembered.

Champion of War.description: The final lesson of the Champions of War Earth is that you must consider each action in terms of the larger picture. If you sacrifice too much to win one battle then you may lose the war. The highest rank of the Champions is always filled with master strategists.

Chance McKnight.description: Chance McKnight is one of the most dedicated officers in the Ministry of Intelligence. He's taken on the responsibility of going undercover into the Syndicate, doing questionable acts that go against everything he believes in in order to get a chance to accomplishing something greater; the arrest of the Syndicate's shadowy leaders. For the past six months McKnight has worked his way up the ladder of leadership and is very close to accomplishing his goal.

Channeler.description: The Channelers are psychics whose powers successfully manifested in a safe manner, allowing them to effectively perform feats of telekinesis and vision induction. However, a minor flaw in their brain chemistry gave an outlet for psionic mutation to spread, starting in the brain and spreading through the right side of the body. They exhibit moderate signs of the greater corruption seen in Subjugators, particularly in their right arm. This corruption allows them to create lashes of psionic energy for use in combat, along with their other abilities.

Charge Cone.group_name: You charge from your current location to your foe.

Charge Impact.group_name: You charge from your current location to your foe.

Charles.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Charles Monroe.description: Suits are there to keep the Syndicate Initiates and Adepts in line and to make sure they don't fall prey to Mother Mayhem's Seers. They act as a sort of psychic shield for their men. The Suits are cold and calculating, one part business man, one part heartless killer.

Charlie Biggs.description: Charlie Biggs is the new exterminator on the block and a rival to Terrence Dobbs. This town ain't big enough for the both of them!

Chaser.description: This Longbow Chaser air-skiff is down for repair, rearming, and refueling. If someone were to attack it now, it could explode.

Chasseur.description: Although Nemesis likes to dress his soldiers in 19th century style, their weaponry is decidedly modern. Most infantrymen attach their bayonets to special assault rifles that outperform all modern equivalents.

Chasseur Surgeon.description: The Battle Surgeons are charged with the vital duty of getting wounded soldiers back into the fight as quickly as possible. Most Nemesis officers frown upon those who refuse to fight again; courage in the face of danger is highly valued in the Nemesis army ranks.

Chemical Burn.description: The most advanced of the Warworks shock troopers. These towering androids carry a heavy PGMP Rifle that is capable of delivering a deadly neurotoxin payload.

Chemical Set.description: The dangerous chemicals in this lab are highly volatile.

Chemical set.description: In the prescence of this lab, you can't help inhaling a whiff or two of Superadine. The substance will buff your Endurance until the lab is destroyed.

Chernobog.description: Bolek Petrovic is the youngest of the Petrovic brothers. As one of the Lords of Death he is a leader of the Skulls street gang in Paragon City. Like his brother he took the name of an ancient Slavic deity when he learned the black arts. Chernobog was known as 'The Black God' to the ancient Slavic tribes, and little is truly known of him. What is known of Bolek Petrovic, however, is that he is a merciless killer who possesses terrible strength.

Cherub Pet.description: This is a solidified, animated hologram of a classic Cherub.

Chi Master.description: Chi Masters are strong, capable combatants who use an attackers strength against them.

Chief Cryo Scientist.description: The leaders of every Crey research team receive special training in leadership, tactics, and combat techniques. They also have access to the latest advanced weaponry, making them especially dangerous.

Chief Interrogator Washington.description: Washington is a man that only those who seek to harm the safety of Praetoria should fear. Those who do fear him make sure to avoid him at all cost, due to Washington's animal-like instincts and ruthless fighting style.

Chief Magus.description: These radical members of the Rikti's Restructurist faction have mastered magical arts stolen from the Circle of Thorns.

Chief Mentalist.description: It's not clear whether these Reflections copy the Rikti of Paragon City, or those of the Rikti homeworld. Some of the forces at Firebase Zulu have theorized the former, since these Reflections are well-armed and trained for combat.

Chief Mentalist Essence.description: This Rikti essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Chief Mesmerist.description: The Rikti battle armor is more advanced than any armor found on Earth. It offers the alien invaders protection from most normal kinds of physical attack. Armed with powerful energy weapons, these armored soldiers continue to pose a deadly threat to humans everywhere.

Chief Plasma Scientist.description: The leaders of every Crey research team receive special training in leadership, tactics, and combat techniques. They also have access to the latest advanced weaponry, making them especially dangerous.

Chief Quantum Gunman.description: The Rikti battle armor is more advanced than any armor found on Earth. It offers the alien invaders protection from most normal kinds of physical attack. Armed with powerful energy weapons, these armored soldiers continue to pose a deadly threat to humans everywhere.

Chief Smasher.description: A combination of revolutionary fervor and massive doses of Excelsior allows the leaders of the Enforcers to completely ignore the effects of pain. This trait lets them keep on fighting when by all rights they should have dropped dead.

Chief Soldier.description: It's not clear whether these Reflections copy the Rikti of Paragon City, or those of the Rikti homeworld. Some of the forces at Firebase Zulu have theorized the former, since these Reflections are well-armed and trained for combat.

Chief Swiper.description: A combination of revolutionary fervor and massive doses of Excelsior allows the leaders of the Enforcers to completely ignore the effects of pain. This trait lets them keep on fighting when by all rights they should have dropped dead.

Child of Anger.description: Mother Mayhem places promising patients in her special facilities and then stimulates their rage centers until they are primed killers. She then overlays clear commands directly into their minds and turns them loose. They can't be bargained with, they can't be reasoned with and they absolutely will not stop...ever.

Child of Anger Quantum.description: Mother Mayhem places promising patients in her special facilities and then stimulates their rage centers until they are primed killers. She then overlays clear commands directly into their minds and turns them loose. They can't be bargained with, they can't be reasoned with and they absolutely will not stop...ever.

Child of Hatred.description: At this point Mother Mayhem has pushed her 'children' to the point that they can feel nothing but hatred for everything around them. They simply want everything around them to die.

Child of Hatred Quantum.description: At this point Mother Mayhem has pushed her 'children' to the point that they can feel nothing but hatred for everything around them. They simply want everything around them to die.

Child of Rage.description: Mother Mayhem continues to prod her minions, pushing them farther and farther down a very particular path of madness. Once they are to this level they no longer feel pity, or remorse, or fear...only rage.

Child of Rage Quantum.description: Mother Mayhem continues to prod her minions, pushing them farther and farther down a very particular path of madness. Once they are to this level they no longer feel pity, or remorse, or fear...only rage.

Chiller.description: Outcast Initiates who show potential are valuable commodities amongst the Outcasts, and are quickly elevated up the ranks. Chillers have grown beyond the ability to keep a drink cool.

Chimera.description: Known in Praetoria as Praetor Sinclair, he is Emperor Cole's ultimate assassin. When his parents were killed by Doppelganger, Justin Sinclair was given the opportunity of a lifetime. Doppelganger took the boy under his wing and trained him to be the world's premier silent killer.

Chris Jenkins, Esq..description: You've seen Jenkins' face on countless billboards over the years. Given the presentation of this office, he must be very successful at his job.

Chris the Fist.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Christine.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Christopher.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Chularn the Slave Lord.description: Chularn is an extremely cruel and twisted soul. The slaves that run his Factory Cubes look upon him with great awe and terror, and his barbarism has become legendary throughout the Shadow Shard. The Wisps he commands fare little better than these human slaves, and they have learned to obey Chularn without question. They watch over the Natterling scavengers and select the choicest items to improve the operation of the Factory Cubes.

Cinderburn.description: The hellfire burns bright inside the leaders of the Hellions. So bright, in fact, that they can call it forth to incinerate their enemies. This inner fire keeps them safe from fire damage, but leaves them quite susceptible to cold.

Circle Mage Archus.description: Despite your efforts, Archus has nearly completed his psychic network using the shards of Seraphina's crystal. Stop him, or you could wind up as his pawn forever!

Circle of Thorns Ritualist.description: Weaving magical effects from fire can be dangerous for the novice mage, but Fire Casters have perfected the art. They can conjure up fires to immolate or distract their enemies, and some can even draw on their foes' body heat to restore their own power.

Circuit.description: A more powerful version of the Electrode unit, this minion can sometimes cause trouble for a single opponent. A group should be able to easily defeat it however due to its limited power supply. It has excellent offensive capabilities and should be dealt with carefully if more than one is present.

Circuit Breaker.description: By providing improved failsafes, the Rook Industries Circuit Breaker increases power output from all generator models.

Citadel.description: Citadel was the very first android hero. In the initial Rikti onslaught, he took heavy damage, and was almost completely destroyed. With Positrons help, scientists at DATA created a second version of Citadel using the old model's original memory core and the remnants of a power suit, once worn by the hero Horatio. Citadel does not fully understand human ways, but he is a valiant defender of Paragon City. He has recently undergone a major upgrade to his systems.

Citizen.description: This citizen is simply doing their job.

Citizen - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Citizen - Male.description: This hapless citizen is in over his head.

City Companion.description: Sweepers are often seen patrolling the street cleaning up litter and debris to make Praetoria a more beautiful place to live. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves.

Civilian Patient.description: This civilian is a powerful mentalist, ripe with potential for joining the ranks of the Seers.

Clamor.description: Eve van Dorn's had a hard time finding friends as dedicated to violence as she is. For a while she found a home in the Council's previous regime, but she could only advance so far in such an organization. So she turned to the Freakshow. Under the name Clamor, Eve's had no trouble rallying other Freaks to her banner.

Classified Crey Defender.description: This backup Paragon Protector is a specialized unit to assist the Command Unit in containing a scene.

Classified Crey Demolitionist.description: This backup Paragon Protector is a specialized unit to assist the Command Unit in containing a scene.

Claudia.description: A deadly bow priestess of Artemis, Claudia honors the gods through combat but she has gone restless with the constant demands of the Coliseum. She doesn't really think that Cornutus is blessed by the gods, but doesn't want to say anything for fear that it might upset her more pious sister Camilla. Claudia longs for the day when the gods will grow weary of the constant bloodshed and demand different homage from them but she doesn't expect it any time soon.

Cleaner.description: Cleaners are designed for simple labor intensive tasks like cleaning, welding, and repairing other Clockwork. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves.

Clear Pets Marker.description: This entity stays around until told to die.

Cleopatra.description: Cleopatra is a woman who has fought every moment to get where she is today. Despite having everything she could have when she was growing up, she wanted to live the life of a fighter. She received nothing but the best training and has proved herself to not only be a high ranking member of the Loyalist, but also Praetor White's girlfriend.

Clerk Desk.description: From here orders can be sent and plans can be made. This desk increases the amount of control available for your base.

Clockwork Construction.description: What on earth are the Clockwork up to now. This monstrosity must be destroyed!

Clockwork King.description: The mad Clockwork King imagines himself the center of a mechanical court. His powerful mind continually creates more subjects to his insane rule. The true horror is that his massive steel chassis holds a human brain.

Clockwork Lord.description: These elite soldiers are the personal guard and right hand of the Clockwork King. You can be sure that they will stop at nothing to ensure his safety.

Clockwork Parts.description: This box is full of Clockwork parts.

Clockwork Pet.description: This is a solidified, animated hologram of a clockwork Sprocket.

Clone of Colonel Duray.description:
The field commander of the late General Aarons' Threat Response Battalion, Colonel Virgil Duray is one of the most highly decorated officers from the Hamidon Wars. The TRB, nicknamed Tribe, was the only conventionally armed military force to achieve consistent victories over the Devouring Earth.

Duray has since been put in command of the latest and greatest of Praetoria's Special Forces; The Imperial Defense Force's 2nd Battalion. Composed entirely of soldiers from the TRB, the 2nd Battalion is arguably just a rename of Duray's former command with one exceptional difference. Every soldier in the battalion has been genetically reengineered by Praetor Berry.

Cloud of Ice.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Frigid temperatures permeate the air surrounding this living spell, slowing the movement of nearby aggressors.

Coalesced Spirit.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. A Coalesced Spirit is a more powerful spirit that arises when two Scattered Spirits have combined. The more powerful hatred they embody gives them some resistance to status effects, in addition to their other powers.

Cobalt Arachne.description:
On several occasions, the United Nation's General Assembly have questioned Lord Recluse and Arachnos over various war crime allegations pertaining to a specific Night Widow agent that the collective espionage intelligence world have dubbed 'Cobalt Arachne'.

Despite the rumors, numerous on-record testimonies and strong evidence provided by Arachnos top-ranking officials and the Arbiters states that officially there exists no record of such an agent amongst their operative's ranks. Debates are on-going whether this individual is truly an Arachnos agent, just an insane worshipper of Lord Recluse who operates independently, or if they even exist at all.

Cobra.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Cobra Hatchling.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Cockatrice.description: These low rank servants of Chimera have only the most rudimentary skills with poison. They can create a toxin that will slowly damage their target but is almost never fatal unless combined with other attacks.

Cockatrice Quantum.description: These low rank servants of Chimera have only the most rudimentary skills with poison. They can create a toxin that will slowly damage their target but is almost never fatal unless combined with other attacks.

Code Gremlin.description: Gremlins, much like bugs, are just as annoying but harder to catch, and sometimes compromise other things unexpectedly. A true mischief maker!

Cog.description: These pint-sized junkyard contraptions have become a real plague on the streets of certain neighborhoods. Their exact workings are mysterious, but there's no mystery about the deadly bolts of electricity they hurl at anyone who gets in their way.

Cold Demonling.description: These infernal single-minded creatures born of the Abyss seek only to cause mayhem, destruction and suffering on the material plane.

Cole's Clone.description: Neuron's genetic engineering experiments at recreating Marcus Cole have reached a viable state, though its power pales in comparison to the Emperor.

Collared Hunter.description: This Ghouls's collar has an explosion trigger attached. Watch out!

Collared Manslayer.description: This Ghouls's collar has an explosion trigger attached. Watch out!

Collared Painted One.description: This Ghouls's collar has an explosion trigger attached. Watch out!

Colleague.description: An Arachnos lab assistant who found herself immolated in an accident that granted her control over fire and flame, Colleague worked tirelessly for Arachnos for years until she was approached by Positron, who sought to convince her to become an agent working for the Freedom Phalanx. After evaluating her options, she chose to pursue his offer and has been working for the Freedom Phalanx ever since, diligently feeding secrets to the heroes of Paragon City. A recent crackdown within Arachnos has Colleague thinking of officially going straight, but before she makes that leap, she is working with the Hammers of Justice and using her Arachnos connections to help its agents infiltrate top secret labs.

Colonel.description: Nemesis' officers are some of the best trained soldiers in the world, and they show amazing discipline and devotion to their master. They're armed with the Nemesis lance, a long rifle that can also operate effectively as a spear. Their skill with this weapon makes them deadly at any distance.

Colonel Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Colonel Duray.description:
The field commander of the late General Aarons' Threat Response Battalion, Colonel Virgil Duray is one of the most highly decorated officers from the Hamidon Wars. The TRB, nicknamed Tribe, was the only conventionally armed military force to achieve consistent victories over the Devouring Earth.

Duray has since been put in command of the latest and greatest of Praetoria's Special Forces; The Imperial Defense Force's 2nd Battalion. Composed entirely of soldiers from the TRB, the 2nd Battalion is arguably just a rename of Duray's former command with one exceptional difference. Every soldier in the battalion has been genetically reengineered by Praetor Berry.

Colonel Essence.description: This Nemesis Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Colonel Tirailleur.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. This seemingly simple weapon is actually quite versatile. The Tirailleurs have modified their weapons to fire poison gas grenades.

Comatorium.description: A shut in for most of his life, Comatorium went crazy when his apartment burnt down with his mother in it. He made the decision after the fire that everyone around him had to pay for his loss.

Commander.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. IDF Commanders lead the IDF Forces to war offering a frightening array of plasma weaponry. They have little need of bulky powered armor, their innate superior genetic structure proving to be more than a match for conventional weapons.

Commander Essence.description: This IDF Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Commando.description: The best of the best. The Commando is a seasoned veteran of combat, and specializes in heavy weapons. There is nothing subtle about the Commando.

Communications Officer.description: This is an Arachnos communications officer, trained in gathering and disseminating intelligence on hero activities in Paragon City and the Rogue Isles.

Computer.description: This computer controls the base's security system, and must be destroyed.

Comrade.description: A relic of the Cold War, the Soviet soldier who goes by the name of Comrade is a Killer-For-Hire. If you need someone to disappear forever, Comrade will do the deed, for the right price.

Concrete Bill.description: Concrete' Bill is an enforcer for the Family. He got his nickname for the sheer amount of people he gave concrete shoes to before dropping them into the harbors of St. Martial. He's entrusted with delivering the protection money collected from the businesses of St. Martial.

Conduit.description: Conduits were once psychics or Seers who, unlike the Burnouts, managed to gain control of their power, but whose bodies couldn't completely handle the energy resulting from such control. This results in psionic energy continuously coursing over their body. Conduits retain enough control over their power to use it to provide beneficial effects to others like them and to confront any who challenge them.

Conqueror.description: This mercenary sister has been completely converted into a member of the Talons. Her skin is now replaced with the more protective scales of her brethren and large wings have sprouted from her back. The only remnants present from her previous life are her utility belts and her combat headset. She wields a titanic sword in place of her broadsword.

Conscript.description: It's not clear whether these Reflections copy the Rikti of Paragon City, or those of the Rikti homeworld. Some of the forces at Firebase Zulu have theorized the former, since these Reflections are well-armed and trained for combat.

Consigliere.description: In Paragon City, you don't become one of the Don's trusted advisors without a little super-powered expertise. Consiglieres have far more subtle powers than their Underboss counterparts, which match their more subtle responsibilities within the Family.

Construction Companion.description: Should another Clockwork Android fall due to unforeseen circumstances or job hazards the Builders are there to rebuild the fallen Android on the job.

Consuming Burst.description: Diabolique strikes you with a Consuming Burst!

Containment Chamber.description: These high-tech Containment Chambers provide a high-tech experimental platform for growing the IDF super soldiers.

Containment System Terminal.description: These terminals are the main control system for the magnetic field which contains the antimatter reaction within the Keyes Island reactors. In order to maintain the magnetic field, these terminals need to have their field generation cells refreshed periodically.

Contaminated Brawler.description: These thugs have gotten their hands on a mysterious drug that drives them mad. The source of this drug remains a mystery, but without help these Contaminated brutes will tear the city apart.

Contaminated Hunter.description: Genetically altered to have a hyper developed medulla oblongata, Ghouls produce adrenaline at a prodigious rate, enhancing their strength, speed, and aggressiveness. Packs of hunters prowl the tunnels beneath Praetoria, eating anything and everything they can get their hands on, sometimes even each other.

Contaminated Manslayer.description: Genetically altered to have a hyper developed medulla oblongata, Ghouls produce adrenaline at a prodigious rate, enhancing their strength, speed, and aggressiveness. Manslayers possess amazing strength and their presence causes other ghouls to fly into an uncontrollable murderous frenzy.

Contaminated Painted One.description: Genetically altered to have a hyper developed medulla oblongata, Ghouls produce adrenaline at a prodigious rate, enhancing their strength, speed, and aggressiveness. Painted ones lead packs of hunters, directing their rage by showering their victims in disgusting bile which attracts nearby Ghouls.

Contaminated Scavenger.description: These thugs have gotten their hands on a mysterious drug that drives them mad. The source of this drug remains a mystery, but without help these Contaminated brutes will tear the city apart.

Contaminated Slicer.description: These thugs have gotten their hands on a mysterious drug that drives them mad. The source of this drug remains a mystery, but without help these Contaminated brutes will tear the city apart.

Contaminated Thug.description: These thugs have gotten their hands on a mysterious drug that drives them mad. The source of this drug remains a mystery, but without help these Contaminated brutes will tear the city apart.

Contaminating Seedling.description: Contaminating Seedlings infect the brains of nearby enemies with rapidly evolving strains of the Tellurian Plague, seriously impairing the victims' mental faculties. For each Contaminating Seedling it spawns, the Seed of Hamidon lowers the recharge and endurance of anyone within its spore cloud.

Contemplation Charts.description: These contemplation charts will help prepare you for the worst kinds of combat situations. Here you can get Break Free Inspirations.  Rent: 100 Prestige

Contemptress.description: There is no fury more intense than that of a woman scorned, and The Banner of Scorn has conjured manifestations of wronged women with a bone to pick. They seek eternal revenge for the horrible things that society, and life in general, has inflicted upon them.

Contractor.description: This civilian is in the wrong place at the wrong time, supporting or working with a cause that clashes with your values.

Controller Hero.description: Dr. Advance uses his suit of space/time manipulating powered armor to help Longbow explore dangerous extremes of science!

Copper Crane.description: The Copper Crane style utilizes the Tsoo's internal energy to paralyze their foes using chakra points. Copper Crane masters can leave their foes helpless before taking them down.

Copper Serpent.description: Members of the Copper Serpent Order suffuse their bodies with toxins to utilize their deadly poison-based martial art.

Coral Sentinel.description: These creatures are composed of living coral made from the sea-goddess Merulina. They have been summoned as guardians.

Coral Warder.description: These creatures are composed of living coral made from the sea-goddess Merulina. They have been summoned as guardians.

Coralax Blue Hybrid.description: The Coralax are humans who have been infected with living coral. Stories persist that there is an entire society of coral-creatures in the seas around the Rogue Isles, but how these unfortunates became their servants is unknown.

Coralax Green Hybrid.description: The Coralax are humans who have been infected with living coral. Stories persist that there is an entire society of coral-creatures in the seas around the Rogue Isles, but how these unfortunates became their servants is unknown.

Coralax Red Hybrid.description: The Coralax are humans who have been infected with living coral. Stories persist that there is an entire society of coral-creatures in the seas around the Rogue Isles, but how these unfortunates became their servants is unknown.

Cordless Cord.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Corner Terminal.description: This terminal monitors many of the functions of base security and increases the control generated by the base computer system.

Cornutus the Minotaur.description: Thanks to the intervention of some unscrupulous time travelers, Cornutus the Minotaur managed to kill Theseus and escape his labyrinthine prison on Crete. Constantly on the run from Attican assassins, Cornutus flaunted the laws of both man and the Gods for many years. In his travels, he encountered two beautiful sisters, disciples of Artemis, who mistook him for the avatar of the gods, who often like to take the forms of animals. Cornutus likes the money and the thrill of fighting in the Coliseum and he wields his massive axe with freakish strength and brutality, making him a crowd favorite.

Corporeal Shard.description: Light reflects off the surface of these mysterious ice crystals in an unnatural way, it is almost as if they are sucking the heat out of the air itself. Lord Winter draws his tremendous power from these Ice Shards making him nearly indestructible. This particular crystal appear susceptible to lethal and smashing attacks.

Correctional Officer.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Corruptor.description: This is a generic Assault Rifle/Traps Corruptor.

Cortex.description: Dr. Vahzilok has sent one of his most powerful disciples to ensure that his plan to poison the dam goes off without a hitch. It is rumored that Cortex was a hero once. It's hard to believe that now.

Costumed Employee.description: Even the best costumes can't take the boredom out of lumbering around and pretending to be a scary zombie all day.

Council Defector.description: Nothing is worse than a traitor, especially one who claims to have reformed. It just sets a bad example all around.

Council Empire Adjutant.description: Those elite few who achieve distinction within the armies of the Council Empire are promoted to the coveted rank of Adjutant. They execute their orders without thought or compunction, and do not hesitate to send their subordinates into certain death in service of the Council.

Council Empire Adjutant Quantum.description: Those elite few who achieve distinction within the armies of the Council Empire are promoted to the coveted rank of Adjutant. They execute their orders without thought or compunction, and do not hesitate to send their subordinates into certain death in service of the Council.

Council Empire Archon.description: The Archons are at the very head of the Council Empire army. These men have served the Council with distinction, sacrificing their safety and that of their men all in the name of the Council's supremacy.

Council Empire Archon Quantum.description: The Archons are at the very head of the Council Empire army. These men have served the Council with distinction, sacrificing their safety and that of their men all in the name of the Council's supremacy.

Council Empire Fire.description: The front-line troops of the Council Empire have fought long and hard to cement Council control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Council Empire Force.description: The front-line troops of the Council Empire have fought long and hard to cement Council control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Council Empire Grenade.description: The front-line troops of the Council Empire have fought long and hard to cement Council control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Council Empire Quantum.description: The front-line troops of the Council Empire have fought long and hard to cement Council control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Council Empire Rifle.description: The front-line troops of the Council Empire have fought long and hard to cement Council control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Council Empire Rocket.description: The front-line troops of the Council Empire have fought long and hard to cement Council control over the former United States. They're not afraid of wading into the thick of battle at a moment's notice.

Council Goliath War Walker.description: Vandal and his engineers from the Council spent months during the Praetorian war engineering their own War Walkers. Now, their plans have finally come to light, and the Council intends to show the world their new, overwhelming force, with their new mass-produced War Walkers.

Council Prisoner.description: The Zigursky Prison, or 'Zig' as it's known on the street, houses the most dangerous criminals in Paragon City. Despite the Zig's advanced security systems, a few hardened criminals occasionally escape. With nothing but time on their hands, these cons stop at nothing to win their freedom.

Council Super-Soldier.description: The Council Super-Soldier, sometimes affectionately called 'The Rager' by their peers, are first-generation experimental soldiers borne from a marriage of Council determination and Praetorian science. A distant cousin to the serum from Marauder and the amphetamine drip from Neuron runs through this soldier's veins.

Council Technician.description: A Council Archon is normally a force to be reckoned with, but this man is barely standing due to his injuries. He should be easy to capture and control.

Council War Walker.description: Vandal and his engineers from the Council spent months during the Praetorian war engineering their own War Walkers. Now, their plans have finally come to light, and the Council intends to show the world their new, overwhelming force, with their new mass-produced War Walkers.

Counter.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Counter Spell.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Few wizards dare to call a Gate into existence, and even fewer correctly estimate their ability to control it. The unfortunate soul of this Gate's summoner is forever bound to it, calling forth demons until this foul magic is dispelled.

Countess Crey.description: Countess Crey runs her corporation with an iron fist. Though others hold the lofty title of president and CEO, everyone understands that this is just a legal fiction. The countess is the one holding the strings behind the vast corporation - and woe to anyone who gets in her way.

Coyote.description: This sneaky Coyote has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Crab Spider Longfang.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Crab Spider Slicer.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Crab Spider Webmaster.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Craig.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Crane Enforcer.description: The Pha, or Enforcers, are the foot soldiers of the Tsoo. They have yet to receive magical tattoos, and so must rely on their own strength and their weaponry. They train constantly and are especially deadly in close combat situations.

Crash to Desktop.description: Sometimes, code conflicts will crash you straight into a desktop. Not recommended to fight in an office location.

Crate.description: The contents of this crate must be destroyed!

Crate - Metal.description: The contents of this crate must be destroyed!

Crate - Tech.description: The contents of this crate must be destroyed!

Crate - Wood.description: This is a large cargo crate you used to sneak onto the Sky Raider ship. Blast your way out of here!

Crazed Bruiser.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Buckshot.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Chopper.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Demolitionist.description: These poor chumps think they've got a chance against the Cage Consortium. Sure their working conditions are atrocious. If most of them weren't former criminals and other troublemakers maybe they could have found better jobs in St. Martial or Grandville instead of this dump.

Crazed Gunner.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Quantum.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Slammer.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Slicer.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazed Slugger.description: These people seem to have been driven mad by the temporal disturbance affecting their dimension. Perhaps if you put an end to the disturbance, they will return to normal.

Crazy Chopper.description: Malaise has the mutant ability to project his insanity into the minds of others. He has slowly adapted to his altered version of reality but the instantaneous placement of his skewed view upon others drives them mad.

Crazy Quantum.description: Malaise has the mutant ability to project his insanity into the minds of others. He has slowly adapted to his altered version of reality but the instantaneous placement of his skewed view upon others drives them mad.

Crazy Slicer.description: Malaise has the mutant ability to project his insanity into the minds of others. He has slowly adapted to his altered version of reality but the instantaneous placement of his skewed view upon others drives them mad.

Crescent.description: Masters of the Crescent style have learned to tap into the very power of the universe itself and focus it through their own bodies. This power enhances their strength and allows them to alter reality around their foes.

Crey Crisis Unit.description: Crey sends these specialized units to handle big problems. Their grenade launchers can fire a variety of munitions, making them well-equipped to handle any situation. These armor clad leaders carry enough firepower to stop a tank. They're also almost as hard to hurt, though they are vulnerable to mental assaults.

Crey Cryo Tank.description: Crey's perfected Cryo Armor can turn any soldier into the proverbial irresistible force. Cooled with liquid nitrogen, the Cryo Tanks can absorb almost limitless heat and hurl great chunks of ice at their foes.

Crey Eliminator.description: With their heavy chain guns and advanced training, these armor clad leaders carry enough firepower to stop a tank. They're also almost as hard to hurt, though they are vulnerable to mental assaults.

Crey Elite Gamma Tank.description: Crey's perfected Gamma Armor can turn any soldier into the proverbial irresistible force. Gamma Tanks can direct deadly radiation towards their foes, which leaves them weakened against follow-up hits.

Crey Gamma Tank.description: Crey's perfected Gamma Armor can turn any soldier into the proverbial irresistible force. Gamma Tanks can direct deadly radiation towards their foes, which leaves them weakened against follow-up hits.

Crey Juggernaut.description: With their powerful personal force fields, missile launchers, and advanced training, these armor clad leaders carry enough firepower to stop a tank. They're also almost as hard to hurt, though they are vulnerable to mental assaults.

Crey Power Tank.description: Crey's perfected Power Armor can turn any soldier into the proverbial irresistible force. Power Tanks can generate almost limitless power, which they can hurl at great distances.

Crey Protector.description: With their powerful force fields, heavy weapons, and advanced training, these armor clad leaders carry enough firepower to stop a tank. They're also almost as hard to hurt, though they are vulnerable to mental assaults.

Crey Quantum Tank.description: Crey's perfected Power Armor can turn any soldier into the proverbial irresistible force. Power Tanks can generate almost limitless power, which they can hurl at great distances.

Crey Voltaic Tank.description: Crey's perfected Voltaic Armor can turn any soldier into the proverbial irresistible force. Voltaic Tanks can generate almost limitless electrical current, which they can hurl at great distances.

Crimson.description: The Sky Raiders have been secretly working on a giant Jump Bot based on stolen military technology.

Crimson Prototype.description: The Sky Raiders have been secretly working on a giant Jump Bot based on stolen military technology.

Crimson Revenant.description: Crimson Revenant is a professional hero hunter. He's made a pretty penny for taking on jobs from Arachnos, and so he is content to outsource some of his tasks to other villains for a cut of the action. For someone who's spent a better part of his adult life cutting down heroes in their prime, Crimson Revenant has a sunny outlook on life. Just don't cross him. The clouds can roll in fast.
