Critical Mass.description: A giant of a man, Critical Mass likes to take on his opponents in close combat. He dons a heavy suit of armor and unleashes a torrent of energy with every strike.

Crone.description: The Crones of the  Coven have learned to make darkness their puppet. But in mastering the dark, they have become somewhat dependant upon it. A Crone deprived of her magic texts quickly shrivels to a lifeless husk. This punishment is inflicted on any Crone suspected of betraying the coven's secrets.

Crone Matriarch.description: Those who stand at the head of the Coven are the most ancient of the witches, don't be deceived by their youthful appearances, molded by the dark magic they command. These matriarchs have vast knowledge of magic of all kinds, and are always eager to test the results of their centuries of arcane mastery on the unsuspecting.

Crosscut.description: Where he came from, no one knows. Who he is, not even he remembers. What he has planned, only the soon-to-be dead learn. Not much of a conversationalist, Crosscut likes to talk with his blades. And usually, that's the last thing one hears.

Crow.description: Crow is the only surviving member of an elite military unit that was subjected to one of Neuron's experiments. Though he does not excuse Neuron of his carelessness, it is his commander, Colonel Duray, that is the focus of his vengeace.

Crowd Dispersal.description: The dreadnaughts tend to lead invasion forces due to their incredible resilience and destructive prowess. Wherever the Goliath War Walker goes, a trail of destruction is left in its wake.

Crusher.description: The majority of The Destroyers are made up of extraordinarily tough individuals who have survived The Gauntlet, an initiation ritual designed to weed out the weak. Once initiated they are expected to fight for the cause. Crushers are high on Fixodine and carry baseball bats which they use to smash anything and everything around them.

Cryogenicist.description:
Crey Industries has recently enjoyed impressive leaps in their cryo technology division's advancements, primarily owing to having had the unmentioned fortune of coming into possession of 'certain technologies' from 'certain other dimensions'.

Having abandoned the somewhat limited applications of liquid nitrogen-based weaponry, Crey's infamous cryo rifles are now powered by absolute-zero energy cells. Firing blasts of concentrated cold that hit minus two-hundred-seventy-three Celsius; these shots are deadly and can easily put a stop to just about anything that moves.

Crystal.description: The Devouring Earth grows these crystalline warriors in special caves deep beneath the Earth. Their blasts of shards can cut deeply into a target's flesh and bone, and energy attacks have a diminished effect against their crystalline forms. Luckily, they're susceptible to smashing attacks.

Crystal Ball.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Years of channelling power through the mists of time has granted these Crystal Balls the power to alter time's effects on objects in close proximity.

Crystal Chamber.description: You can see that someone is trapped within this Crystal Chamber. You must set him free!

Crystal Focus.description: The binding spells of this Crystal Focus increase the power output of energy devices.

Crystal Shard.description: Even Shards from a fallen crystalline creature can prove deadly.

Crystal Titan.description: This giant crystal monster may be the most beautiful of Hamidon's strange creations. It is also one of the deadliest. Crystal Titan will happily slaughter any human being who sets foot within Hamidon's bizarre paradise.

Crystal Ward.description: The circle of protection is a standard part of any mystic's repertoire. This one is meant to contain and protect the power within.

Crystal of Health.description: These Green Crystals seem to resonate with a strange power.

Crystal of Pain.description: These Red Crystals seem to resonate with a strange power.

Crystal of Vitality.description: These Blue Crystals seem to resonate with a strange power.

Cuirasseur.description: The elite troops of Nemesis' army have tremendous discipline and skill that allows them to stand fast in the face of danger. They carry a deadly weapon that melds a scorching flamethrower with a powerful Gatling gun, giving them all the firepower they need for any foe.

Cult Worshipper.description: Often driven to the Shepherds to enact vigilante justice upon the slavers and derelicts of First Ward, these formerly harmless citizens are now fanatically loyal cult members.

Cyclone Elemental.description: From a distance, the Storm Elementals are a beautiful sight. At close range, however, they're a serious threat. Their Endurance-draining attacks can cripple their foes. The most powerful Storm Elementals are able to hold their victims in an ionic embrace, rendering them defenseless.

Cyclops.description: Captured in the hills of Cimerora and brought to the gladiatorial pits, the Cyclops fights for no other purpose but to kill and maim. There are rumors that it has the blood of an Incarnate flowing through its veins, but none has claimed it as their own.

Cynthia.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Cyrus Thompson.description: Cyrus Thompson is a retired superhero who once went by the name Breakneck. His wife gave him this name, not because of his super speed, but because "If you don't give up this nonsense, you're going to break your fool neck."

D.U.S.T. Leader.description: The Direct Urban Strike Team, or D.U.S.T., are an elite unit of the T.E.S.T. forces equipped to deal with counterinsurgency and urban combat. They are trained to deal with the Devouring Earth and other unusual threats, making them the premier force for deployment in times of dire need. They are equipped with a unique variant of standard T.E.S.T. armor and with a specialized plasma cannon that has a variety of firing modes. The Leaders have experience improvising with the weapon, and are infamous for poisoning their enemies with weaponized flamer fuel.

D.U.S.T. Provost.description: The Direct Urban Strike Team, or D.U.S.T., are an elite unit of the T.E.S.T. forces equipped to deal with counterinsurgency and urban combat. They are trained to deal with the Devouring Earth and other unusual threats, making them the premier force for deployment in times of dire need. They are equipped with a unique variant of standard T.E.S.T. armor and with a specialized plasma cannon that has a variety of firing modes. The Provosts are very well trained in the use of their weapon and are feared by all who work against Cole's will.

D.U.S.T. Ranger.description: The Direct Urban Strike Team, or D.U.S.T., are an elite unit of the T.E.S.T. forces equipped to deal with counterinsurgency and urban combat. They are trained to deal with the Devouring Earth and other unusual threats, making them the premier force for deployment in times of dire need. They are equipped with a unique variant of standard T.E.S.T. armor and with a specialized plasma cannon that has a variety of firing modes. The Rangers are among the most elite soldiers in the PPD, able to survive deployments in harsh conditions for months at a time.

DD Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

DPS Dummy.description: Uppon defeat of this unit, you will see a combat log message stating time to kill and estimated DPS. This dummy can not regenerate.

DPS Dummy (regen).description: Uppon defeat of this unit, you will see a combat log message stating time to kill and estimated DPS. This dummy has regeneration and AV resistances.

Daedalus.description: Daedalus is the finest crafter these ancient times have ever seen. His gift borders on Celestial, but is in fact simply his own genius at work.

Damned.description: The leaders of the Hellions are here to stoke the flames of the inferno. If left to their own devices, they'd be happy to see the entire city up in flames.

Damned Quantum.description: The hellfire burns bright inside the leaders of the Hellions. So bright, in fact, that they can call it forth to incinerate their enemies. This inner fire keeps them safe from fire damage, but leaves them quite susceptible to cold.

Dampening Field.description: This reinforced door stands between you and freedom!  The door seems to be vibrate and hum, as though it is coursing with energy.

Dampening Ray.description: The beam from this crystal weakens enemies, reducing the damage they can cause for a short duration.

Dana Habashy.description: Dana Habashy is the wife of Matthew Habashy. She was thought to be dead during the Galaxy City incident, but was instead captured by Arachnos.

Daniel.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Danny-24.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Dario Stanzini.description:
Dario Stanzini was once a famous magician whose life was changed by a participant in his audience. He called the stranger up to be sawed in half. The man, not knowing it was staged, freaked out and placed a curse on Stanzini, dooming his family and loved ones to die within a year.

Three years have passed since then. Stanzini's loved one and family have all died off, leaving the man left with nothing but vengeance, hoping to one day find the man who did this and kill him. Stanzini has gone to great lengths to acquire the power to find this man, enough that he has been labelled as a villain in Paragon and has fled to the Isles to increase his power; he has gone so far as to even ally himself with Arachnos to get what he needs.

Dark Cantata.description: A choral work that uses solo voices with an instrumental (usually orchestral) accompaniment. A cantata is generally a choral work of some length that also uses solo voices, usually with instrumental accompaniment. In this case, it's a haunting melody that's also tearing you apart.

Dark Dwarf.description: Every Kheldian energy being retains the patterns of its past hosts, and can use these patterns to transform itself and its current host into an energy-based duplicate of that creature, gaining new abilities in the process. The Dark Dwarf form is patterned off of a race called the Ruktur that lived on the surface of a pulsar. The Dark Dwarf form retains the incredible physical resilience of the Ruktur, as well as the ability to channel energy into powerful melee attacks.

Dark Dwarf Alpha.description: Every Kheldian energy being retains the patterns of its past hosts, and can use these patterns to transform itself and its current host into an energy-based duplicate of that creature, gaining new abilities in the process. The Dark Dwarf form is patterned off of a race called the Ruktur that lived on the surface of a pulsar. The Dark Dwarf form retains the incredible physical resilience of the Ruktur, as well as the ability to channel energy into powerful melee attacks.

Dark Equinox Archon.description: The Dark Vampyri are the assistants to Nosferatu, the man responsible for the Council's super soldier program. They are scientists as well as super soldiers, and have a hand in the creation of other Vampyri. They often personalize their own transformation process, giving themselves special abilities and powers that lesser beings can only dream of.

Dark Fairy Pet.description: This is a Faerie who has come from the Lost Lands to aid you.

Dark Fiend.description: The depraved ugliness festering in the underbelly of humanity is called forth at The Banner of Fiends. These Dark Fiends are a physical manifestation of pure malice, seeking calculated cruelty and malevolence, just because they can.

Dark Fog.description: This strange fog seems to roam Croatoa with little purpose or predictability. Heroes who find themselves trapped within it have reported a variety of harmful effects.

Dark Nova.description: Every Kheldian energy being retains the patterns of its past hosts, and can use these patterns to transform itself and its current host into an energy-based duplicate of that creature, gaining new abilities in the process. The Dark Nova form is patterned off of a race called the Hulnanim that lived in the lightless depths of a gas giant planet. The Dark Nova form retains the ability to fly and to shape and project dark energy bolts of incredible power.

Dark Nova Alpha.description: Every Kheldian energy being retains the patterns of its past hosts, and can use these patterns to transform itself and its current host into an energy-based duplicate of that creature, gaining new abilities in the process. The Dark Nova form is patterned off of a race called the Hulnanim that lived in the lightless depths of a gas giant planet. The Dark Nova form retains the ability to fly and to shape and project dark energy bolts of incredible power.

Dark Ring Mistress.description: When a Ring Mistress has accomplished a number of successful tasks for the Carnival of Shadows, her mask is enhanced with dark and terrible powers. In addition to psychic attacks the Dark Ring Mistresses assault their enemies with power from the dark recesses of their minds.

Dark Ring Mistress Essence.description: This Carnival essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Dark Sabaoth.description: A former angel who was stripped not only of his divinity, but his entire name as well. He now roams the Earth as Dark Sabaoth, building a new name for himself, and carving out his own place in history.

Dark Spectre.description: These phantasms are actually manifestations of humanity's fears come to life. At the Banner of Transparent Terrors, they seek to inflict unimaginable terror upon their victims and as long as the Banner of Terror persists, these parasites will feed off of the fear of others.

Dark Vampyr.description: The Dark Vampyri are the assistants to Nosferatu, the man responsible for the 5th Column's super soldier program. Commandants are scientists as well as super soldiers, and have a hand in the creation of other Vampyri. They often personalize their own transformation process, giving themselves special abilities and powers that lesser beings can only dream of.

Dark Warwolf.description: Some Nightwolves have mastered the ability to temporarily transform back into their human body. This allows these soldiers to infiltrate targeted facilities before revealing their monstrous nature. The authorities have little time to react once they realize what they're dealing with.

Dark Watcher.description:
Many rumors swirl around the Dark Watcher.
Some claim that he's a federal agent who learned too much and went renegade.
Others say that he's an immortal being who walks the treacherous path between worlds under his own power.
Still others say that he is not a human being at all.

Whatever the truth, he has appeared time and again to help the heroes of Earth fend off enemies ranging from the Rikti to the Rularuu.

Normally, he disappears after his job is done, but for reasons unknown he has stayed with Vanguard since the group's inception, acting as Lady Grey's loyal advisor.

Darkwolf.description: The nature of the Nightwolves remains a terrifying mystery. These monstrous, werewolf like creatures were once human beings, but they have since been warped beyond all recognition. Unlike the Vampyri, these beasts are not the result of any known super serum treatment. Many suspect that some kind of magic is involved in their transformation.

Darrin Wade.description: Darrin Wade was once a loyal member of the Midnight Squad, a secret organization dedicated to learning everything there is to know about the unknown. However, there was a falling out and he left their organization. He did not leave empty-handed, though, taking some of their more priceless relics and tomes. He's managed to establish himself in the Rogue Isles as a broker of lost information and ancient artifacts.

Database.description: This database contains detailed knowledge about the known powers of super-powered beings, allowing you to better adjust and control your base security system.

David.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Davie.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Deactivated Rikti Drone.description: This deactivated Rikti Drone is not very powerful. It would take three such Drones to challenge a single hero.

Deadlock.description: Deadlock is an elite sellsword with a reputation for taking on impossible jobs, only to come out on top.

Deadly Ninja Assassin.description: These deadly ninja assassins have been trained by unseen masters from another era to provide a quick, powerful challenge to any who choose to fight in the Coliseum.

Deadly Ripper.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Death.description: No Rikti warriors are more feared than those known as the 4 Riders. Said to have suffered some strange transformation during the crossing between worlds even their fellow Rikti are terrified of them. The Rider known as Death uses fear and sudden overwhelming attacks to kill his unfortunate foes.

Death Doll.description: The Death Dolls, like their Death Walker brothers, are an elite force among the Skulls who have learned how to twist the power of death into fearsome attacks that disable their foes while draining away their life essence. Even among the Skulls, who have dedicated themselves to death itself, they are a frightening force to be reckoned with.

Death Field.description: This reinforced door stands between you and freedom!  The door seems to be vibrate and hum, as though it is coursing with energy.

Death Head Buckshot.description: The Death Heads are proven leaders in the Skulls - utter nihilists who worship death in the hopes of eventually defying it. These bloodthirsty, cold-blooded killers are armed to the teeth and resistant to any kind of negative energy attacks.

Death Head Gunner.description: The Death Heads are proven leaders in the Skulls - utter nihilists who worship death in the hopes of eventually defying it. These bloodthirsty, cold-blooded killers are armed to the teeth and resistant to any kind of negative energy attacks.

Death Head Quantum Gunner.description: The Death Heads are proven leaders in the Skulls - utter nihilists who worship death in the hopes of eventually defying it. These bloodthirsty, cold-blooded killers are armed to the teeth and resistant to any kind of negative energy attacks.

Death Head Soldier.description: The Death Heads are proven leaders in the Skulls - utter nihilists who worship death in the hopes of eventually defying it. These bloodthirsty, cold-blooded killers are armed to the teeth and resistant to any kind of negative energy attacks.

Death Mage.description: The most powerful of all the Circle's mages, the Masters of Death are lords of the afterlife. They help to wrangle and control the Behemoths and other beasts the Circle summons, but their most fearsome power is the ability to create a pervasive zone of death that sucks the life out of any foes in the vicinity.

Death Moon.description: Masters of the Death Moon school have learned to tap into the powers of life and death. They can draw out an enemy's life, or concentrate the negative energies of the spirit to grant themselves power.

Death Shaman.description: The Death Shaman has descended into the realm of death and returned. They walk between the worlds, granting some measure of power over life and death. They can drain the life from their victims, casting a pall of suffering across the battlefield.

Death Shamaness.description: The Death Shamaness has descended into the realm of death and returned. They walk between the worlds, granting some measure of power over life and death. They can drain the life from their victims, casting a pall of suffering across the battlefield.

Death Walker.description: The Death Walkers, like their Death Doll sisters, are an elite force among the Skulls who have learned how to twist the power of death into fearsome attacks that disable their foes while draining away their life essence. Even among the Skulls, who have dedicated themselves to death itself, they are a frightening force to be reckoned with.

Death's Head.description: The Death's Head Order has mastered and fused techniques from both the Midnight and Death Moon schools. The order's disciples are masters of a devastating martial art based around control of darkness and shadow. It is said they can kill without even striking.

Deathblossom.description: These horrid perversions of normal flora have become one of the most identifiable monsters in the Devouring Earth's maniacal menagerie. In addition to their astonishing mobility, they can fire swarms of thorns at their enemies, tearing flesh to shreds in an instant.

Deathcap.description: Fungus run amok' is probably the best way to describe these loathsome creatures. Like their inanimate ancestors, mushroom men prefer dark, dank places. In combat they can release clouds of deadly spores that choke and disable nearby enemies.

Deathspore.description: Fungus run amok' is probably the best way to describe these loathsome creatures. Like their inanimate ancestors, mushroom men prefer dark, dank places. In combat they can release clouds of deadly spores that choke and disable nearby enemies.

Deathsurge.description: This electrical horror has sprung forth from Dr. Aeon's Power Transferrance System! Could this be a side-effect of tapping into Mount Diable?

Deborah.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Debra.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Decaying Luminous Eidolon.description: The Luminous Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's ruined corpse army have become akin to minor walking meltdowns. Approach these with caution, as they can infect and leech from an unsuspecting hero.

Decaying Mire Eidolon.description: The Luminous Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's ruined corpse army have become akin to minor walking meltdowns. Approach these with caution, as they can infect and leech from an unsuspecting hero.

Decaying Murk Eidolon.description: The Murk Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's festering former army have taken a more aggressive approach to their impending deaths. They have weaponized their Decaying blood into a toxic snare to catch unprepared heroes.

Decibelle.description: Marybell Eddison had been singing since she was little, and loved to make people happy with her song. Then her mutation kicked in, and her beautiful voice became a weapon capable of demolishing buildings. Some might have lapsed into despair, but the kindly words of her family pastor helped Marybell see her power for the gift it was. While she may not be able to make people happy with her song, now she can protect them with the power of her voice as Decibelle!

Decomposing Luminous Eidolon.description: The Luminous Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's ruined corpse army have become akin to minor walking meltdowns. Approach these with caution, as they can infect and leech from an unsuspecting hero.

Decomposing Mire Eidolon.description: The Mire Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's rapidly decaying army have begun to leak miasma from every orifice, and this has not gone unnoticed. They are more dangerous and desperate than ever, capable of overwhelming a hero's senses.

Decomposing Murk Eidolon.description: The Murk Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's festering former army have taken a more aggressive approach to their impending deaths. They have weaponized their Decomposing blood into a toxic snare to catch unprepared heroes.

Dee Nutz.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Defected Assault Commander.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Commander.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Elite Ranger.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Field Leader.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Heavy Trooper.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Ranger.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Shock Trooper.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Soldier.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defected Trooper.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Defender.description: Many who have lost hope go looking in dark places for the answers to life's questions. The Followers are those whose search has taken them to the Circle of Thorns. Now they must prove their true devotion by serving the Circle's evil will.

Defender Hero.description: Dr. Advance uses his suit of space/time manipulating powered armor to help Longbow explore dangerous extremes of science!

Defense Turret.description: Armed with plasma weaponry capable of piercing through the toughest of armor, these turrets are an incredibly effective deterrent for keeping trespassers out of the Lambda sector and other vital Praetorian military outposts.

Defiler.description: Though little is known about how a Defiler comes to be, it is known that they result from the complete transformation of an Elder into a servant of a god within the Pantheon. This particular creature has sworn itself to the service of Mot, and is capable of manipulating the energy of pure death to destroy its foes.

Defiler Essence.description: This Banished Pantheon essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Deiter Kilo-meter.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Demetrios Vasilokos.description: Dr. Vahzilok, removed from his Coalescent Combat Suit, isn't much to look at.

Demetrios_Vasilikos.description: Demetrios Vasilikos has dedicated himself to undoing the terrible work that his research has done in the hands of Praetor Berry. After realizing that Calvin Scott and the Resistance saw the rehabilitated Ghouls to be little more than shock troops in their crusade against Cole, Demetrios fled with his people, now known as the Forlorn, to First Ward. It is here that Demetrios hopes to continue his research and help the people whose lives his genetic experimentation has ruined.

Demolition Charge.description: This demolition charge packs a whallop. It has a self-arming mechanism which can be disabled if destroyed before it complete the arming cycle.

Demolition Companion.description: Dismantlers are occasionally called in when their plasma torches can be put to use to tear apart crumbling or collapsed buildings. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units.

Demolitionist.description: These poor chumps think they've got a chance against the Cage Consortium. Sure their working conditions are atrocious. If most of them weren't former criminals and other troublemakers maybe they could have found better jobs in St. Martial or Grandville instead of this dump.

Demon.description: A hellish visiage of violence and pain. It came to ruin someone's day.

Demon Lord.description: These vicious creatures serve Infernal only because he forces them to. By subverting their will through the use of ancient mystic rituals he creates permanent servants. If his control begins to wane over a particular demon, he performs another ceremony and binds it permanently into his weapons or armor to increase their strength.

Demon Overlord.description: Occasionally Infernal is able to find a more powerful demon to subjugate. It takes a much greater effort to control them so he cannot use them as frequently but he still has a significant number under his sway. One of the greatest dangers Infernal faces is losing control of one of his Demon Lords.

Demon Pet.description: This is a solidified, animated hologram of a miniature Demon.

Demon Prince.description: Demon Princes are the infernal ruling class within the cold depths of the abyss. They are bound by only the most powerful conjurors, as they are tremendously dangerous to bring to the material plane.

Dennis.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Dervish.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in her agility and strength due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance. Clad in the latest high-tech body suit and still using standard Knives battle gear, she has abandoned her broadsword in favor of the more graceful and visceral attacks of dual blades.

Desdemona.description: The daughter of the original Desdemona, Eve Salvatore was destined to take up her mother's persona and pursue a life of crime. However, hers is a life of choices, and even the Arachnos Fortunatas can't predict her destiny accurately. As a demon summoning Mastermind she has the power to bend the wills of infernal entities to that of her own, a power that she has used to great effect in ridding the world of anyone who dared stand in her way.

Desdemona's Blessing.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Desiccated Chamber.description: Their hatred for humanity and utter disdain for life have left the Banished Pantheon with few allies. Thus they must make their own, by raising the dead to create armies of zombie-like servants totally devoted to their devilish agenda.

Desiccated Husk.description: The Banished Pantheon's powers reach from the spirit world to raise the bodies of long dead soldiers armed with the weapons of our forefathers. These dried out Husks of men provide the backbone of the Pantheon's armies - a never ending supply of undead warriors.

Desideratus.description: Desideratus was once a well-regarded historian and classicist, but he never felt that he had garnered the recognition he truly deserved. Indeed, his intellect was matched only by his jealousy, leading him to covet all the things he felt should have been his. When the link to the power of the gods was uncovered, he was enraged when that power chose Rhiannon over him and this rage informed his every action since. He has spent years accumulating money and power, learning ancient secrets and developing new technologies, all in an effort to make the world pay for something over a perceived slight over which no one had any control.

Desk.description: The contents of this desk are valuable.

Destroyer.description: If a Wrecker shows a high success rate, Marauder gives them one final test: pick a Destroyer and defeat him in single combat. The fight is to the death. If the Wrecker wins, he has a new title and greater responsibilities. This test is typical of the Darwinian approach that Marauder is committed to.

Destroyer Quantum.description: If a Wrecker shows a high success rate, Marauder gives them one final test: pick a Destroyer and defeat him in single combat. The fight is to the death. If the Wrecker wins, he has a new title and greater responsibilities. This test is typical of the Darwinian approach that Marauder is committed to.

Destruction Monument.description: This monument seems to pulse with power.

Detective Hopp.description: Detective Hopp is an investigator for the PPD. He recently was reported missing after looking into a suicide case that happened in Peregrine Island.

Detective Miller.description: A long-term veteran of the force, Detective Miller has seen it all, and watched it happen with a wry smile and the sense of perspective that only a lifetime in Paragon City can give you.

Detonating Seedling.description: The continual barrage by IDF explosive devices within the tunnels has led to a rapid adaptation by the Devouring Earth, resulting in these little "bomblings". They will detonate very quickly after they are generated from the biomass within the Avatar's chamber.

Devastation Beam Attractor.description: This entity activates the Devastation Beam's hold of players in the field of effect.

Devastation Beam Generator.description: This entity generates the Devastation Beam found at Keyes Island.

Devastation Beam Graphic.description: This entity creates the Devastation Beam's visual effect.

Devastation Beam Mass Driver.description: This entity activates the Devastation Beam's damage to players in the field of effect.

Devastation Beam Watcher.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Developing Clone.description: Neuron's genetic engineering experiments at recreating Marcus Cole have reached a viable state, though its power pales in comparison to the Emperor.

Devolved.description: Most people on Mercy agree: the Devolved no longer qualify as human. After months of consuming nothing but cesspool water, they have become tireless, witless, and wickedly strong. It would be fair to call them more zombie than man.

Devotee.description: The Devotees are extremely loyal members of the Talons whose bodies have been deformed in a more avian fashion than others of the group, with feathered wings sprouting from their backs. They are elite hunters, with tremendous talent as archers. Like the Huntresses, they can ensnare their targets. However, their greater skill and attunement to the mystical arts has given them the ability to shoot arrows of fire and ice.

Devoured Crystal Energy Trap.description: This crystal channels a powerful energy that is tuned to the psychic link between Desdemona and Vanessa DeVore. As long as the crystals remain active, Desdemona is in peril.

Devoured Pyriss.description: Pyriss was once an impressionable young would-be heroine, until Peter Themari and a truly depraved villain tricked her into turning against her allies and becoming a villain herself. It seems that her villainous life left her at the mercy of the devouring Earth, who consumed her and transformed her into what she is now.

Devouring Earth Hive Spire.description: These strange living spires are somehow connected with Hamidon's ability to control the creatures of the Devouring Earth.

Devouring Earth Spore Cloud.description: This entity affects players with the spore clouds that infest the circular tunnel sections of the Underground

Devouring Earth Trapper.description: This entity serves to pulse the "trap" which Desdemona becomes ensnared in during the Underground event.

Devouring Swarm.description: These nettlesome Swarms are encountered either in groups or are summoned forth by members of the Devouring Earth. They are highly resistant to smashing and lethal attacks but theses flying hordes do not fare well when confronted with fire or energy based assaults. You have seen these before, but this Swarm seems different somehow.

Diabolique.description: Tammy Arcanus was born with great Magical powers on Praetorian Earth, just like she was on Primal Earth. Unfortunately they manifested very differently. As she reached adolescence she began exploring her powers before she was trained. She used astral projection to cast her spirit forth. So intoxicated was she by the new wonders that she was discovering she returned to her body too late to link with it. She watched helplessly as it withered and died without a spirit. As a living ghost, she found herself bound by Emperor Cole himself, forced to do his bidding for the foreseeable future.

Diane.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Digiwench.description: Digiwench is a high-ranking operative working with Arachnos under the supervision of Black Scorpion's team. She is an engineer, first and foremost; her speciality lies within nanometer-sized machine assembly algorithms for automated tasks. Her list of accomplishments is impressive and intimidating, so it seems amazing she's taken all that promise and signed on to work with Black Scorpion under such a self-deprecating name.

Dillo.description: One of the Maaxigada'arzildilo, aliens from a distant solar system , "Dillo" has traveled to Earth to warn the Humans of the impending threat of the Shivans. Dillo's homeworld was destroyed centuries by a devastating assault by the Shivans leaving him and his people as space-faring nomads. Upon finding radio waves  sent from Earth, Dillo's people have sent him as a scout to warn the Humans of dangers of Shivans or to return with sad news of another race of lifeforms annihilated by these unstoppable devastators. Having arrived just as the invasion began, Dillo chose to stay and help the Earthlings fight off the menace instead of potentially luring them back to his own people.

Dimensional Portal.description: One of DJ Zero's Dimensional Portals, who knows what fun and happening place it leads to? You will need to protect this Dimensional Portal from Snaptooth.

Dimensional Vortex.description: Impressive bases require immense power. The dimensional vortex opens a gateway to a realm of pure energy which can be carefully tapped to accommodate your base needs.

Diminuendo of the Soul.description: A dynamic instruction meaning to gradually play quieter. In this instance, Diminuendo is gradually quieting your soul through a nonstop barrage of musical torment.

Dire Wolf.description: Dire Wolves are among the most deadly natural predators of our world. This rare and elusive creature is capable of deadly bite attacks as well as freezing breath attacks.

Director 11.description: Director 11, as he is called, would have a dossier of operations and plots several cubic feet large... That is, if he ever left a paper trail. One fact that has managed to get out is his penchant for using excessive amounts of self-propelling proximity mines to control the field of battle.

Disciple.description: The Disciples are extremely loyal members of the Talons whose bodies have been deformed in a more avian fashion than others of the group, with feathered wings sprouting from their backs. They are elite hunters, with tremendous talent as archers. Like their bow-wielding sisters, they can ensnare their targets. However, their greater skill and attunement to the mystical arts has given them the ability to shoot arrows of fire and ice.

Discordant Spores Generator.description: This entity generates the Discordant Spores found in the Avatar's chamber.

Diseased Abomination.description: In reanimation, as in cooking, better ingredients yield better results. Dr. Vahzilok constructs his Abominations out of the very best ingredients he can find: the organs of fallen heroes. The Abominations are stronger, tougher, and faster than their Cadaver kin. Unfortunately, they don't smell any better.

Dismantler.description: Dismantlers are occasionally called in when their plasma torches can be put to use to tear apart crumbling or collapsed buildings. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units.

Dismantler Essence.description: This Clockwork Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Dispel Magic.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Few wizards dare to call a Gate into existence, and even fewer correctly estimate their ability to control it. The unfortunate soul of this Gate's summoner is forever bound to it, calling forth demons until this foul magic is dispelled.

Dispersed Impression.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. The Dispersed Impression is a stronger form than the Spirits. Unlike a Fractured Impression, this type can merge with other entities.

Display Case.description: This case holds an unusual item.

Display case.description: This case holds an unusual item.

Disruptor Pylon.description: These devices create an instability in the interdimensional field. When several are operating at once you can redirect an Item of Power to your base.

Dissident.description: This Praetorian Citizen has developed a reputation amongst the rabble for spouting anti-Cole propaganda. They've become an outward symbol of the Resistance's futile struggle, but are still limited to improvised weapons and their own charisma.

Distorted Arrogance.description: This is a curious Rikti construct, it seems to house some kind of mind, but it's a distorted and unsettling madness contained within; The kind that shouldn't be tampered with.

Distortion.description: These terrible little monsters somehow live inside the Cap au Diable Power Transferrance System. Perhaps there is more to the 'PTS' than meets the eye. There are certainly rumors. Many wonder why the PTS is covered in glowing sigils. Could that have something to do with these supernatural nuisances?

Diviner.description: Diviners are among the elite of Mother Mayhem's Seers. They are mid-rank combatants among the elite. They specialize in crushing their foes in close range combat.

Diviner Essence.description: This Seers Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Diviner Maros.description: Diviner Maros is a figure of awe and terror, even among his fellow cultists within the Circle of Thorns. Though not the most powerful of their mystics, Maros has the ability or curse to see the past and future. Rumors say that his spirit was split across time after an accident during some arduous mystic research, but no one really knows the truth. Many within the Circle fear him, because his predictions come true all too often. When rumors arose that he was seeking freelancers to perform a tasks there was a great outcry within the Circle, but no one dared try to stop him.

Doc Buzzsaw.description: Doc Buzzsaw makes no secret that she was once a disciple of Dr. Vahzilok, but had a falling out with her mentor some time ago. Afterwards she journeyed to the Rogue Isles to continue her research, and rumor has it, escape the retribution of the Vahzilok. The Freakshow came to her looking for someone who understood both cybernetic machinery and human anatomy well enough to repair them, and she quickly formed an association with them. The Freaks love the improvements 'Doc' makes for them, and Buzzsaw sees her energetic new allies as the perfect mix of protectors and test subjects. The fact that both sides are completely deranged only makes the partnership work better.

Doc Delilah.description: Doctor Delilah Stein was born with her Herculean strength and incredible physical resistance. She fought evil as a heroine for a time, but eventually found her real calling: History and Archeology. Now she combines her past life and her education into a new career as an historian of meta-human history, and an archeologist of the unusual. Dr. Stein recently began investigating the hero bases lost in the destruction of Overbrook, looking for clues to fill in the history of pre-Rikti War heroes and villains.

Doc Kryten.description: Dr. Kryten is one of the numerous PortalCorp. scientists who have been working with the heroes of Paragon City to explore nearby dimensions. He might be regretting that career choice right now.

Doc Quantum.description: Doctor Quantum has used his scientific genius to develop a means of wielding quantum energies to defeat super-powered menaces.

Dockworker.description: These dockworkers are upset about the working conditions the Family are putting them through and have decided to take up arms against it.

Dockworker Foreman.description: These dockworkers are upset about the working conditions the Family are putting them through and have decided to take up arms against it.

Dockworker Heavy.description: These dockworkers are upset about the working conditions the Family are putting them through and have decided to take up arms against it.

Doctor Bein.description: Dr. Rudolph Bein is a legendary name in the science community, and hasn't been heard from since the mid 1980's. Rumor has it he was entrapped by the United States government and forced to work for them. Others say that Crey set him up to take a fall and has been rotting in the Zig for decades. Regardless of the truth, Dr. Bein's influence on Crey science is obvious in all aspects of Crey's biological advancements to this day, even if he's become a phantom in the corporate machine.

Doctor Geist.description: Doctor Geist is a mad scientist working for Arachnos on a project involving mutant spiders! He is also a long time rival of his former colleague, Doctor Creed.

Doctor Generic.description: ERROR: IDENTITY UNCONFIRMED. LOADING GENERIC PROFILE.

Dog of War.description: This Ghoul has been rehabilitated by Dr. Helix. Each one was a former member of an elite military unit subjected to Neuron's horrible experimentation.

Dollface.description: The least dangerous appearing of all the candidates, Dollface manages to use her looks to her advantage. Everyone involved knows that when the time comes, she'll be the easiest to 'do away with'.

Dollface's Soul.description: From a distance, the Storm Elementals are a beautiful sight. At close range, however, they're a serious threat. Their Endurance-draining attacks can cripple their foes. The most powerful Storm Elementals are able to hold their victims in an ionic embrace, rendering them defenseless.

Dominator.description: This is a generic Fire/Fire Dominator.

Dominatrix.description: Being the powered grand-daughter of Emperor Cole has its perks. Praetor Duncan trains new Powers Division recruits while at the same time stringing Anti-Matter along, as if he ever had a chance to be with a woman of her stature.

Don the Brain.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Donald.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Donated Food.description: This crate is full of food that the concerned citizens of Paragon City have donated to the poor of the Rogue Isles.

Donated School Books.description: These school books were donated to the poor of the Rogue Isles by the concerned citizens of Paragon City.

Donna.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Doomsayer.description: The Doomsayers believe the utter destruction of their home heralds the beginning of the end of Praetoria, but they lead their fellow Shepherds in their quest to improve the lot of the First Ward Citizens.

Dorjan, Counsel to Romulus.description: Dorjan is one of the first Cimerorans under Imperious' watch to be conjoined with a Nictus. In time, the honorable man he was became more and more jaded, disillusioned, and treacherous. After serving under and failing Romulus, Dorjan eventually became the contact person between the remnants of the Shadow Seeds that Requiem brought to Cimerora from the future, and the established Nictus homeland in the proper timeline. He is emboldened by his power and authority and should not be engaged alone.

Dorothy.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Double Tap.description: A man obsessed with weaponry and guns whose sole purpose in life was to be a vigilante. A victim of mistaken identity he was banished to the dark side of the law and stayed there.

Doug.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Doug, Warrior Spirit.description: New Council recruits are placed in the ranks of the Nebula, the lowest of the organization's Outer Bands. There they will either prove themselves worthy to learn the secrets of the Council, or else they will die in combat. Either way, they serve the Council's purposes.

Douglas.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Downed Police Drone.description: The convicts have disabled this police drone, but they haven't yet torn it apart. Time for you to take a crack at it!

Dr..description: Dr. Roberta Todd is Paragon City's preeminent scientist in the field of Kinetics. She's learned a trick or two in the lab that may come in handy here.

Dr. Advance.description: Dr. Advance uses his suit of space/time manipulating powered armor to help Longbow explore dangerous extremes of science!

Dr. Aeon.description: An unethical scientific genius, Dr. Aeon is not a man to be trifled with. Some think he may soon become a major player within Arachnos, assuming he survives the plans of his enemies.

Dr. Arvin.description: A renowned scientist in Praetoria, Dr. Arvin is known for curing several diseases and helping the people of Praetoria in any way that he can.

Dr. Coolbreeze.description:
Dr. Rufus Mustafa Jenkins was a brilliant cryogenic scientist in the 60's. He was making great strides in the area of cryogenic restabilization - so great, his work colleagues were jealous and framed him for an accident which resulted in the death of the teaching assistant assigned to help in the college lab where he worked.

Dr. Jenkins spent 30 years in prison for a crime he didn't commit - he now seeks to prove that he was framed and restore his name in the halls of academia. Before he went to prison he stashed all of his data on the new prototype 'cryo-gloves' he had been working on. Once released he retrieved his gear and now fights crime in order to restore his pride and finance his research.

All this would be much easier if he wasn't also the appointed guardian of his unruly triplet nephews per his good-for-nothing brother's last wish.

Dr. Crowe.description: Dr. Crowe is a reknown researcher in exotic areas of physics that deal with breaching inter-dimensional barriers.

Dr. Eva Lone.description: Dr. Lone never did well in academics. She cheated her way through medical school, and when she found the public sector actually expected results, turned her attentions to mad science. Dr. Lone has never invented anything though, she only steals inventions from others who are far more creative than she is.

Dr. Francois.description: Dr. Francois is a famous roboticist.

Dr. Franks.description: Dr. Franks is considered one of the top men in the field of temporal mechanics.

Dr. Gilmartin.description: Dr. Gilmartin is a mutant scientist working for Arachnos on the project known only as Deep Six.

Dr. Graves.description: Todd Graves has lived a life of irony that some might find impossible to bear. A prominent surgeon who had a talent for successful organ transplants, Dr. Graves would contract a flesh-eating virus that attacked his largest organ: his skin. Introducing an DNA-altered strain of the virus to another skin 'organ', he managed to successfully complete the first ever full body skin transplant upon his own person. Additionally, the two viruses wound up counteracting each other, creating another that benignly caused all cells within his body to stop deteriorating. Thus, Dr. Graves managed to discover immortality, albeit at a high cost. Although his cells no longer age and 'die', once damaged, they can no longer be healed, but new parts CAN be transplanted onto his body to 'repair' the cell damage. Shunned by the medical community as a modern-day Frankenstein and Monster, Dr. Graves has fled to the Rogue Isles to continue his research and draw from a supply of never-to-be-missed body parts.

Dr. Hetzfeld.description: Dr. Hetzfeld is a brilliant, albeit mad scientist. Such is his disdain of Neuron's position as Praetor of the Sciences the Hetzfeld has taken to modifying his own mind and body to put him on a more even footing when it comes to physical capability. He still believes himself to be the superior scientist, and will stop at nothing to prove that to the world.

Dr. James Harvan.description: James Harvan is known as the leading expert in research on artifacts from the Archaic period of Ancient Greece. While his peers acknowledge that much of his work is groundbreaking, he is still seen as a fairly unorthodox figure in the field of archaeology. This is primarily due to his insistence that much of Greek mythology, including references to supernatural events, are accurate depictions of history.

Dr. Kane.description: Dr. Kane began his career as a dermatologist working for the hazardous waste division of Monoclasty Chemical Company when a fluke accident rendered the doctor mad. Retreating to his mansion, the doctor began working with subjects exhumed from the graveyard behind his home. The results have thus far been chilling.

Dr. Katelyn Pierce.description: Dr. Pierce is a brilliant, conniving, manipulative cybernetic genius, and a wizard at physiological problem-solving.

Dr. Meinst.description: Dr. Meinst is overseeing Pathogen's ordinance cache. It must be penance for escaping imprisonment after her failure in the sewers.

Dr. Murphy.description: Dr. Murphy has published several groundbreaking papers on parallel dimensions and time travel.

Dr. Nelson.description: Dr. Nelson got his degree in advanced physics at an early age, and has been studying interdimensional mechanics ever since.

Dr. Psychotron.description: Buster Melville was a promising medical student with a great future ahead of him. That is, until he was kidnapped by the Clockwork king and became the subject of the mad machine master's experiments to create loyal human subjects. Things looked hopeless until a battle with the mental heroine Aurora Borealis caused a feed-back loop that not only destroyed his control circuits, but opened the psionic potential latent in his mind. After finishing medical school, Buster decided to take up the heroic mantle himself, and now fights any would-be tyrannt as Dr. Psychotron!

Dr. Quatrexin.description: The original inventor of the Black Scorpion armor has made some improvements in his latest re-design. He may not be as skilled in the suit as Black Scorpion himself, but he's still an extremely lethal combatant.

Dr. Roberta Todd.description: Dr. Roberta Todd is Paragon City's preeminent scientist in the field of Kinetics. She's learned a trick or two in the lab that may come in handy here.

Dr. Steffard.description: Dr. Steffard is secretly the Seer murdering villain known to Praetoria as "Cutter Cain". His true motive is to rehabilitate the Seers and give them back their lives, but the process doesn't always result in success.

Dr. Vahzilok.description: The insane leader of the Vahzilok comes across more like a religious zealot than an arch-fiend. Dr. Vahzilok continually proclaims his intention of overcoming death itself. In his twisted mind, the horrid reanimated corpses he creates are only stepping stones toward greater medical miracles.

Dr. Zeon.description:
Dr. Zeon appears to be an evil(?) alternate dimensional version of Dr. Aeon who is responsible for the Phase Transmogrification System that powers Zeon City in this ripple version of Cap Au Diable.

Dr. Zeon's goatee has a sinister aura and his power suit is just as deadly as the version you're more familiar with.

Dragon Blue Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The   blue ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Blue Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Dragon Enforcer.description: The Pha, or Enforcers, are the foot soldiers of the Tsoo. They have yet to receive magical tattoos, and so must rely on their own strength and their weaponry. They train constantly and are especially deadly in close combat situations.

Dragon Fly.description: The Dragonfly Order concentrates on the power of a few key hand to hand techniques, and on extending their inner power to control the forces of wind and rain.

Dragon Red Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The red ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Red Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Dragon Yellow Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The yellow ink enhances a Tsoo's mental powers, giving him the ability to dominate and entrance his opponents. Yellow Ink Men can easily render their victims vulnerable to attack.

Dragoon.description: The elite troops of Nemesis' army have tremendous discipline and skill that allows them to stand fast in the face of danger. They carry a deadly weapon that melds a scorching flamethrower with a powerful Gatling gun, giving them all the firepower they need for any foe.

Drawdown Terminal.description: These terminals are used to control Antimatter's drawdown of the reactor's energy. Destroying them will shutdown the connection and render him vulnerable again.

Dread Templar.description: The Black Knights are an ancient Order of the dead that is charged with overseeing the Eternal Prison; a place where only the wickedest of souls are jailed. Captains of the Eternal Order, the Dread Templars are amongst the oldest and most renowned of the knightly order. Few possess the dedication to become a Templar, but those that do are blessed with immense strength and resilience. Driven by their mighty oaths to the order, a Dread Templar will stop at nothing to vanquish their enemies.

Dream Doctor.description: The man known only as Dream Doctor is the founder of the Midnight Squad. He is a master of sorcery and combat and was a member of the Freedom Phalanx during the 1940's. Dream Doctor is also responsible for sealing Rularuu in the Shadow Shard, an act that saved all of existence. He vanished one day, leaving a note that he went off into dreamspace to look for a way to help save the world from some threat. Dream Doctor's physical presence now can only mean that the threat is near, and that he is ready to help defend the world from it.

Dream Portal.description: Stepping near this portal will take you to the battle for the Magisterium.

Dreamlike Malaise.description: On Praetorian Earth the villain Malaise was never counseled by Sister Psyche, instead he was one of the 'patients' at one of Mother Mayhem's facilities. With the ability to control his madness and inflict it on others, he quickly rose to a position as her favorite.

Dreck.description: Born Daniel Watson, Dreck is the glue that holds the militantly independent Freakshow together. The Freaks may chafe at his orders, they may laugh at his haircut, but they all have to respect Dreck's absolute lust for violence.

Drone.description: During the Rikti War these flying Drones swarmed all over the city's skies. Today these machines still sweep through the air with some frequency. Their quick evasive maneuvering, sophisticated scanners and powerful energy cannon make them a constant menace.

Drop Ship.description: A Rikti Transport ship. It also serves effectively as a Bomber.

Dry Chamber.description: Their hatred for humanity and utter disdain for life have left the Banished Pantheon with few allies. Thus they must make their own, by raising the dead to create armies of zombie-like servants totally devoted to their devilish agenda.

Dry Husk.description: The Banished Pantheon's powers reach from the spirit world to raise the bodies of long dead soldiers armed with the weapons of our forefathers. These dried out Husks of men provide the backbone of the Pantheon's armies - a never ending supply of undead warriors.

Dual Artillery Gun.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a Dual Artillery Gun. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'Our Dual Artillery Gun provides an excellent balance between the need for concentrated firepower and the desire to keep under budget. Ask about our options close-quarter flamethrower!'

Dubstitch.description: Dubstitch is a 'Meat Doctor', a Vahzilok surgeon who has decided to ply their trade with the Freakshow instead. They take on the responsibility of being a 'Wrench' as their new title, and are tasked with maintaining Freak bodies and cybernetics - and keeping those two systems working together.

Duke Lancer.description: Like any monarch, the Clockwork King has his own court, although in his case it's composed of mechanical nobles called Dukes. The Dukes Lancers are dangerous foes, possessing the ability to dominate foes with their mental powers.

Duke Mordorgar.description: The Hellions are at the bottom of the heap, even in Paragon City. But every so often, one of them displays some real power. The self-styled 'Duke Mordrogar' is one of the few Hellions who display some level of real power even without making an unfavorable contract with a demon. This has given him an inflated ego, and an ambitious drive.

Dumpster.description: This is a typical garbage dumpster.

EJ.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Eagle Blue Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The   blue ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Blue Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Eagle Enforcer.description: The Pha, or Enforcers, are the foot soldiers of the Tsoo. They have yet to receive magical tattoos, and so must rely on their own strength and their weaponry. They train constantly and are especially deadly in close combat situations.

Eagle Red Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The red ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Red Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Eagle Yellow Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The yellow ink enhances a Tsoo's mental powers, giving him the ability to dominate and entrance his opponents. Yellow Ink Men can easily render their victims vulnerable to attack.

Earth Thorn Caster.description: The Earth Casters' mastery over stone and sand makes them quite valuable in the underground city that the Circle of Thorns inhabits. But they can use their magic for more than digging tunnels and repairing walls. Under their control, the very ground beneath a hero's feet can become a deadly weapon.

Earthshatter.description: Diabolique causes an Earthshatter at your location!

Echidna.description: Echidna has been cursed with a monstrous visage all her life. With few options open to her she took up the persona of the horrific Greek goddess and unleashed her fury on the unsuspecting world.

Echo of Back Alley Brawler.description: One of the most veteran heroes in Paragon City, the Brawler is in semi-retirement, training the next generation of heroes. Though he rarely goes into the field these days, his power and fighting skills are still as potent as ever.

Echo of Bane Spider Commando.description: Taken from the ranks of the Wolf Spiders, Bane Spider Commandos are given specialized assault training. They are vicious masters of combat that relish engaging the enemies of Arachnos.

Echo of Black Scorpion.description: Ernesto Rodriguez embodies the concept of raw power through technology. Whatever it takes, whatever piece of his body or soul needs to be spliced, altered, or removed to grant him more power, Ernesto seems willing to do it. His unbridled hunger, absolute loyalty, and low intelligence makes him the perfect servant for Lord Recluse.

Echo of Crab Spider Longfang.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Echo of Ghost Widow.description: Beautiful, mysterious, and deadly. Ghost Widow appears to be an actual spirit from beyond the grave rather than a super with some sort of incorporeal power. Some have said she was once a rising star in the Night Widows when she was slain. Her thirst for vengeance must have been great, for she returned from the void and now serves at Recluse's side. There are rumors that her service isn't entirely voluntary, however.

Echo of Glacia.description: This Time Echo is of Glacia, Omega Team survivor. Whatever is drawing these foes from your memories does not seem to care whether it is friend or foe it picks.

Echo of Headman.description: The Rikti battle armor is more advanced than any armor found on Earth. It offers the alien invaders protection from most normal kinds of physical attack. Armed with powerful energy weapons, these armored soldiers continue to pose a deadly threat to humans everywhere.

Echo of Hro'Dtohz.description: This Time Echo is of the Supreme Commander of the Rikti Lineage of War, Hro'Dtohz. The Rikti... how many twists their story took since then...

Echo of Imperious.description: Imperious, Incarnate of Cimerora, is another of the Time Echoes facing you. But your connection to the Well is much stronger than his in this memory.

Echo of Infantry.description: The Rikti have come to stand for everything humans hate and fear in the universe. Their unprovoked invasion of Earth has left much of the planet traumatized and angry. Even out of their battle armor, their high-tech weaponry makes Rikti dangerous opponents.

Echo of Longbow Eagle.description: Some of the most respected soldiers in Longbow's arsenal are the Eagles. They use advanced jetpacks and strike from on high where many of their foes can't even reach them. Their long reach makes many villains cry 'foul.'

Echo of Longbow Nullifier.description: Nullifiers are notorious for temporarily taking away a villain's greatest asset--his powers.

Echo of Longbow Warden.description: Few volunteer for the dangerous role as a 'spines scrapper.' Those who do are almost always the most reckless and dangerous of the bunch. Villains are warned to fight them with extreme caution.

Echo of Lord Recluse.description: The Master of Evil, the Count of Cruel, the Archvillain of Anarchy. Lord Recluse has been called many things. But the people of the Rogue Isles know him as their lord and ruler. Lord Recluse has a mysterious tie with Paragon City's own Statesman - some even claim they were once close companions. Their hatred for one another certainly belies a secret perhaps best left buried.

Echo of Manticore.description: Justin Sinclair was raised in a huge mansion in the outskirts of Paragon City by his English nanny, Virginia Bowman. The sole beneficiary of a huge trust fund, Manticore received training in all manner of mental and physical pursuits, but excelled in archery. When he turned 18, Miss Bowman revealed to him his true heritage. Manticore's father had once been a costumed vigilante in England, until he and his wife died at the hands of a German villain called Protean. Deeply affected by the story, Manticore took up his father's mantle and vowed to bring the 5th Column down.

Echo of Mesmerist.description: The Rikti battle armor is more advanced than any armor found on Earth. It offers the alien invaders protection from most normal kinds of physical attack. Armed with powerful energy weapons, these armored soldiers continue to pose a deadly threat to humans everywhere.

Echo of Minotaur.description: The Minotaur is a beast of ancient times; born from the blood of a human and the passion of an Incarnate. Any man who dares challenge this beast will face a wrath of celestial force.

Echo of Mu Striker.description: Strikers are descendents of the long-lost Mu, drafted into Arachnos service to fight both mystic heroes and the troublesome Circle of Thorns.

Echo of Positron.description: Dr. Raymond Keyes developed a high-tech battle suit that allowed him to channel bolts of anti-matter into fierce attacks. He used his powers to help defeat the Rikti, but at a terrible cost. Due to injuries he sustained at that time, he lost full control of his powers. Now, to protect others from himself, he remains imprisoned within his battle suit. He is constantly searching for a cure for his condition, but that does not stop him from contributing to the defense of Paragon City and contributing many other technological breakthroughs for the good of all.

Echo of Raserei Ubermenschen Force.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Echo of Raserei Ubermenschen Unteroffizi.description: Raserei Ubermenschen Unteroffiziere have the responsibility of leading large numbers of troops. They are concerned with training their men into peak fighting form - and recruiting new members to the cause. Until recently, none have ever been taken alive by the authorities.

Echo of Reichsman.description: Reichsman, living proof the Well responds to power, not virtue, confronts you as a Time Echo from your own memories. You will enjoy defeating him once more, even if it shall not be a true challenge.

Echo of Requiem.description: Requiem's Time Echo is in over its head. If you could defeat him before you became an Incarnate, what is he to you now?

Echo of Romulus Augustus.description: Even the Nictus ties to the Well cannot help this Time Echo of Romulus Augustus defeat you.

Echo of Ruladak the Strong.description: Ruladak the Strong, one of the guardians of the Cathedrals of Pain, has been summoned forth from your mind as a Time Echo. It shall be banished back to the nothing from whence it came.

Echo of Scirocco.description: Imad Malak was not always an evil man. Evil came to him from without. He was traveling in the deep desert near the Baka Valley deep in the Middle East. There he discovered an ancient tomb and stumbled inside. The tomb was that of a long-dead desert hero, and contained several objects of power including the bottle of the djinn Serafina. Also within was the hero's scimitar that granted the wielder incredible powers. Malak took the sword and donned the mantle of Scirocco. Unfortunately he fell under a curse and was driven to commit acts of great evil. He sold the other objects off to the highest bidder, the bottle ending up with the Circle of Thorns. Once a hero of the people, he is now a dark stain on their proud heritage. Imad wishes nothing more than to find some way to rid himself of the curse and find redemption.

Echo of Sister Psyche.description: The Time Echo of Sister Psyche is clearly outmatched by your power.

Echo of Statesman.description: Marcus Cole, who would eventually become Statesman, was a rogue and a mercenary throughout the early part of the 20th century. During WWI, he became ill after being exposed to mustard gas. While traveling with his childhood friend Stefan Richter, Marcus discovered the Well of the Furies. Both men drank from the well and were granted incredible powers. Marcus went on to become Statesman and Stefan, Lord Recluse.

Echo of Toxic Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Echo of Vampyr Commandant.description: The Vampyri Commandants are the assistants to Nosferatu, the man responsible for the 5th Column's super soldier program. Commandants are scientists as well as super soldiers, and have a hand in the creation of other Vampyri. They often personalize their own transformation process, giving themselves special abilities and powers that lesser beings can only dream of.

Echo of Vanguard Colonel.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Echo of Vanguard Ranger.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Echo of Vanguard Sergeant.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Echo of the Crystal Titan.description: This Time Echo is of a giant crystal monster of Hamidon's creation. What, they couldn't bring an image of Hamidon itself to face you?

Echo of the Honoree.description: This Time Echo is of the Honoree, the body of Hero 1 subjected to Rikti mutations. Before... Before... (The memory is fuzzy on this point.)

Eclipse Galaxy Archon.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others.

Eclipse Nightwolf.description: The nature of the Nightwolves remains a terrifying mystery. These monstrous, werewolf like creatures were once human beings, but they have since been warped beyond all recognition. Unlike the Vampyri, these beasts are not the result of any known super serum treatment. Many suspect that a dark energy force is involved in their transformation.

Eclipse Nightwolf Champion.description: The Nightwolf champion has lost all of his humanity to whatever force transformed him into a monstrous killing machine. Unlike the more sedate Nightwolf warriors, the champions are in a wild state and can barely be controlled. They are berserkers, unwilling to obey any orders when their enemy is in sight. They are, however, nearly impossible to kill, which makes up for their disobedient nature.

Eclipse Nyctwolf.description: Some Nightwolves have mastered the ability to temporarily transform back into their human body. This allows these soldiers to infiltrate targeted facilities before revealing their monstrous nature. The authorities have little time to react once they realize what they're dealing with.

Eclipse Warwolf.description: The Warwolf has lost all of his humanity to whatever force transformed him into a monstrous killing machine. Unlike the more sedate Nightwolf warriors, the Warwolves are in a wild state and can barely be controlled. They are berserkers, unwilling to obey any orders when their enemy is in sight. They are, however, nearly impossible to kill, which makes up for their disobedient nature.

Edward.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Eerie Eric.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Efreitor.description: The Spetsnaz are Russian special forces soldiers. They are experts in close-combat and conventional weapons, and have a reputation for ruthlessness.

Eihwaz Rune.description: These strange runes glow ominously with unstable mystic energy.

Elder Cobra.description: These Elder Snakes are vastly more powerful versions of the regular Snakes who inhabit Mercy Island. They are spawned from the mighty Snake goddess Stheno herself!

Elder Magmite.description: The heat of the Earth flows through the bodies of these minions of Igneous. Beneath a thin rock shell, their bodies are composed entirely of liquid magma. Their fiery breath can roast an unwary hero in no time flat, and if necessary they can expel gouts of magma to finish the job.

Elder Mamba.description: These Elder Snakes are vastly more powerful versions of the regular Snakes who inhabit Mercy Island. They are spawned from the mighty Snake goddess Stheno herself!
