Elder Pumicite.description: The Pumicites may look ponderous and stupid, but get too close and you'll see why the police prefer to take on the Trolls. The creatures' porous stone bodies make them surprisingly quick and agile fighters, and their skin is hard and abrasive, like that of a shark. More than one hero has come to regret closing ranks with a Pumicite, and their ability to rip boulders from the ground and hurl them at enemies makes them deadly even at a distance.

Elder Viper.description: These Elder Snakes are vastly more powerful versions of the regular Snakes who inhabit Mercy Island. They are spawned from the mighty Snake goddess Stheno herself!

Elder Viper Assassin.description: These Elder Snakes are vastly more powerful versions of the regular Snakes who inhabit Mercy Island. They are spawned from the mighty Snake goddess Stheno herself!

Elder of Death.description: The Elders are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who have begun training to merge their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods. This Elder can call upon a Spirit of Death as an ally and delights in the death and decay of friend and foe alike. Once they focus on a victim, they become single-minded in their attacks and cannot be distracted until they have brought death to their opponent.

Elder of Desire.description: The Elders are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who have begun training to merge their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods. This Elder can call upon a Spirit of Desire as an ally and feeds upon the unrelenting pull of those who succumb to any form of overwhelming need. They flood the area around them with telepathic imagery, confusing and even damaging opponents with visions of their greatest desires.

Elder of Pain.description: The Elders are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who have begun training to merge their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods. This Elder can call upon a Spirit of Pain as an ally and delights in agony and misery. They particularly relish the pain caused by the blasts of pure destruction they use to attack foes.

Elder of Sorrow.description: The Elders are priests and priestesses within the Banished Pantheon who have begun training to merge their essence with one of the many spirits who serve the gods. This Elder can call upon a Spirit of Sorrow as an ally, and projects blasts of pure sorrow that explode in life-sapping bursts, seeping the will and life force from anyone caught in the explosion.

Electrixie.description: Trixie Watts had gone sailing around the world to try and forget all those she'd lost in the Rikti war. But when she was caught in a radioactive thunderstorm following an illegal Nemesis Army underwater atomic test, she found her life transformed. Trixie had gained the power to control electricity itself, and more importantly, the courage to make a difference.

Electro-Ryan.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

ElectroShock.description: Electroshock is a hero created by the super-science of Dr. Dmitri Krylov. Electroshock was originally a villain who came to Krylov seeking super-powers, but in the end decided to become a hero in Paragon City.

Electrode.description: The basic model of minion designed by Neuron was originally blueprinted to be a laboratory assistant. It is excellent at following simple commands and would have been well suited for tasks a scientist did not have the time or muscle for. Neuron quickly realized that the metallic minions could be used as attack drones and adapted his plans on the fly.

Elemental Shard.description: Light reflects off the surface of these mysterious ice crystals in an unnatural way, it is almost as if they are sucking the heat out of the air itself. Lord Winter draws his tremendous power from these Ice Shards making him nearly indestructible. This particular crystal appear susceptible to fire and cold attacks.

Elementalist.description: Having long ago sworn fealty to the Talons of Vengeance, the Elementalist has been twisted into a half-human, half-serpent monstrosities. In the process of transformation, however, they gain significant aptitude with the mystical elements, allowing them to call forth a variety of elementally attuned powers. In addition, they become more resistant to the element with which they have an affinity.

Elite Automaton.description: Perhaps it's the careful precision of every movement, or the way they perform the same tasks over and over, but something about this seemingly normal citizen doesn't look quite right. In fact, they seem almost mechanical.

Elite Chill Cannon.description: The Elite Cryo Cannon fires a blast of supercoolant capable of affecting even the most fiery super. In addition to causing damage, the cannon can freeze the target in place for a short period of time.

Elite Quantum Agent.description: The leaders of Crey's security teams are experts at identifying threats and picking them off from a distance. With the latest in advanced assault weaponry at their disposal, these agents are a force to be reckoned with.

Elite Quantum Gunner.description: These Warriors have been around long enough that they can not only dish out pain, they can take it as well. On the streets of Paragon City, one doesn't survive long as a mace wielder without building up a resistance to smashing attacks.

Elite Ranger.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Elite Rangers are terrifying foes to engage. Their weaponry is far more advanced than the PPD Shock Glove, and they are decked out in nearly impenetrable power armor.

Elite Ranger Essence.description: This IDF Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Elite Resistance Commando.description: Resistance Commandos are surviving soldiers from the last wars before Cole's world order took over. They are well trained, disciplined, elite fighters armed with some of the best modified weapons the resistance can slap together.

Elite Resistance Fighter.description: Resistance Fighters are experienced resistance recruits who have learned by doing rather than training. They are equipped with outdated military firearms that have been hastily upgraded with power packs and other accessories to give them a heavy enough punch to threaten the PPD.

Elite Resistance Officer.description: Officers are veteran soldiers who have years of command experience. They use their leadership skills to hone the resistance fighters under their command into a deadly fighting force whether they are raw recruits, or elite commandos. They also pack the best weapons they can get their hands on.

Elite Resistance Runesoldier.description: Runesoldiers are high ranking members of the Resistance who have served under the tutelage of a master within the Carnival of Light. Through this training, they have adapted their high-tech weaponry to serve as a focus for mystic energies. However, their mastery of the knowledge they have received is less than ideal, causing their magical energy attacks to have a small element of randomness in the type of energy they produce.

Elite Sapper.description: The Eye of Despair saps the will of enemies, sucking ambition and drive from their very souls. Each hit drains Endurance from the target.

Elite Security Agent.description: The leaders of Crey's security teams are experts at identifying threats and picking them off from a distance. With the latest in advanced assault weaponry at their disposal, these agents are a force to be reckoned with.

Elizabeth.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Ellis.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Emancipated Inky Aspect.description: There are few things more terrifying than watching a parasitic alien tear itself from its host, in a desperate attempt to intimidate and overwhelm an opponent. A Nictus doing so in your presence is a terrible omen - they have calculated their chances of survival, and determined that their best course of action is to disembody themselves and fight you in a pure dark energy form that mimics their late host. Should one get you in a paralytic hold, scream for help, or it may take you for its next host!

Embalmed Abomination.description: When an experiment doesn't work out the way he expected, Dr. Vahzilok doesn't complain. Instead, he makes the best of a bad situation, by converting the subject to a lethal weapon. The Embalmed Abominations are faster and tougher than their Cadaver counterparts, and they explode just as violently.

Embalmed Cadaver.description: These zombie-like constructs have numerous pieces of technological equipment protruding from their dead flesh. The purpose of all this machinery is to turn these creatures into walking bombs. When near a target, they explode to cause maximum damage.

Ember Demon.description: Born in the depths of the abyss, wreathed in unholy flames, these demons allow themselves to be bound by their masters only to cause destruction on the material plane.

Ember of Flame.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Flame has learned to harness their magic into fiery blasts.

Emerald Barrier Nova.description:
This Dark Nova Nictus is channeling a dark energy shield onto Romulus making him invulnerable to damage in exchange for him fueling it with his life force!

You'll have to destroy all the nearby Barrier Novas to get to Romulus! This viridian-hue Nictus appears to be vulnerable to control attacks.

If you were to control this Nictus without defeating it, you could take advantage of it draining Romulus' regenerative capabilities without protecting him.

Emergency Level Pacification Device.description: These high energy projection devices were designed by Anti-Matter to aid in the defense of Praetoria. They have been repurposed here to help keep order in the Behavioral Adjustment Facility.

Emil Marcone.description: Emil Marcone is the son of Manuel Marcone, the former Governor of Port Oakes. When Manuel was arrested by Interpol, Guido 'The Mooch' Verandi stepped up to take control, much to the chagrin of Emil. Emil is now doing whatever he can to seize control from Guido.

Emma.description: This woman was a former Seer. Her cybernetic implants have been removed and she is no longer a part of the Seer Network. The safety parameters provided by the network to reinforce self control are no longer in place, and she is in great danger to not only herself, but anyone around her.

Emperor Marcus Cole.description: Marcus Cole came from the streets of Shroud City with nothing to his name, and ascended to the ultimate throne of power. He pulled the planet back from nuclear annihilation, ended the Hamidon Wars with his own indomitable will, and created a perfect utopian society for all those who follow him. Cole has had many titles in his long life, Soldier, Hero, President, Consul, and for the last 25 years, Emperor of Earth.

Empowered Portal.description: Battle Maiden has summoned this portal to empower her own followers! The portal drains the powers of those from Primal Earth to empower anyone of Battle Maiden's choosing. You'll need to destroy it to level the playing field!

Energeist.description: Born on a battlefield of the Rikti War, the strange being known only as Energeist is the living energy of dozens of meta human powers given physical form and sentient will. For a full year he travelled the ruins left behind by the war, absorbing spent power, gaining strength, and battling those who would take advantage of the desperate people displaced by the war. After meeting the Civic Squad, he joined their team to find a place for himself in the world.

Energy Font.description: This energy font is a physical manifestation of the Controller's power. It will shock any foe that stands near it.

Energy Mage.description: Within their fabled lost city, the High Mages of Energy provide light, heat, and energy for their brethren. In battle they unleash their power in blasts of utter destruction, capable of ripping apart flesh, stone, and steel.

Energy Probe.description: This strange machine looks highly advanced.

Energy Vortex.description: This swirling energy vortex is tapping energy from otherworldly sources. It must be destroyed!

Enforcer.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in her agility and sight due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance and has abandoned her wrist mounted crossbow in favor of more graceful and deadly dual pistols, chambered with ammunition containing toxins created by the Talons. The signs of her conversion into a member of the Talons are beginning to show. Though she has removed some of her body suit as her skin begins to provide more natural protection and replaced other pieces with true Talons armor, she still uses most of the standard Knives battle gear.

Enforcer Smasher.description: The Enforcers are what everyone thinks of when they hear the word Freakshow: dangerous punks with over-sized mechanical arms ending in nasty looking weapons. They are the true heart of the Freakshow, deadly in combat but not yet totally insane.

Enforcer Swiper.description: The Enforcers are what everyone thinks of when they hear the word Freakshow: dangerous punks with over-sized mechanical arms ending in nasty looking weapons. They are the true heart of the Freakshow, deadly in combat but not yet totally insane.

Enforcers.description: A natural leader. In another life, he could have amounted to something. Never-the-less, younger Thugs can learn a lot from him, and are more effective fighters when he is around. The Thug Enforcer has seen his share of gang wars, and his experience with street weapons is invaluable.

Ennerl.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Enraged Miner.description: These poor chumps think they've got a chance against the Cage Consortium. Sure their working conditions are atrocious. If most of them weren't former criminals and other troublemakers maybe they could have found better jobs in St. Martial or Grandville instead of this dump.

Enraged Spectre.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. An Enraged Spectre is among the most powerful of Apparitions. It is created when a Ripped Spectre combines with Scattered Spirits, Formed Impressions or other Enraged Spectres. The more powerful hatred they embody gives them some resistance to status effects, in addition to their other powers.

Enraged Zombie Firebomb.description: Stuffed with volatile compounds, this mass of flesh has been built to explode when excited.

Enthralled Citizen.description: This citizen has fallen prey to one of the Awakened and is no longer an individual with any survival instinct. It serves its Awakened controllers without question.

Enthralled D.U.S.T. Ranger.description: This member of the Praetorian D.U.S.T. has fallen prey to one of the Awakened and is no longer an individual with any survival instinct. It serves its Awakened controllers without question.

Enthralled Fighter.description: This Resistance Fighter has fallen prey to one of the Awakened and is no longer an individual with any survival instinct. It serves its Awakened controllers without question.

Entranced Citizen.description: This citizen has fallen prey to one of the Awakened and is no longer an individual with any survival instinct. It serves its Awakened controllers without question.

Entropic Entangler Chaser.description:
These extremely advanced defensive chasers utilize technology foreign to Primal Earth, using Rikti dimension-native 'time-eater' microbes as a source of entropic nullification and then channeling that into an energy beam that can leave the target suspended in slower time dilation.

For anything that moves, this will leave them slower and less quickly able to respond while the chaser is focusing it's beam on them.

Entropic Entangler Turret.description:
These extremely advanced defensive turrets utilize technology foreign to Primal Earth, using Rikti dimension-native 'time-eater' microbes as a source of entropic nullification and then channeling that into an energy beam that can leave the target suspended in slower time dilation.

For anything that moves, this will leave them slower and less quickly able to respond while the turret is focusing it's beam on them.

These turrets are made of reproducing microbial-nanites and it will regenerate infinitely if being fed additional power from an external source.

Envoy of Shadow.description: Unbound and unnamed, it has crossed the gulf of worlds on a bridge of greed and pain. The Envoy of Shadow is the ambassador of the Prince of Demons, here to offer the Circle of Thorns great power and dark alliances. Its consuming flames and cloak of darkness are manifestations of its endless evil.

Envoy of Vengeance.description: Sibyls are women whose mastery of a single element has given them great capacity for bending the world around them to their will. So concentrated is their power that rare natural events become their playthings. Very few members of the Talons have the inner strength to endure the training needed for such mastery, which makes those who survive the ordeal capable of defending strongly against attacks of their own element. These women have sprouted powerful wings, enabling them to sow destruction over a far greater territory than their lesser sisters. The Sibyl is also wreathed in a continuous aura of energy formed of their element, as though their bodies are forever moments away from becoming pure elemental energy.

Eochai.description: The Tuatha De Danann and the Fir Bolg were tribes who fought for control of legendary Ireland, the Fir Bolg were the original inhabitants and refused to share the land with the Tuatha De Danann. Eochai was their king and Streng their Champion.

Eoh Rune.description: These strange runes glow ominously with unstable mystic energy.

Epoch.description: This wise old man has taught you more about life and responsibility than anyone else. He is a kind soul until you push him, then his gifted powers come to the surface.

Equinox Adjutant.description: The Vampyri Adjutants are soldiers who have been promoted from the Cor Leonis ranks and given the singular honor of becoming a Vampyr. This honor is one the masters of the Council are loathe to give, since it means a year of inactive duty for the Cor Leonis. The result, however, is a Vampyr who has both the power and the experience to lead his monstrous soldiers into battle.

Equinox Archon.description: The Vampyri Archons are the assistants to Nosferatu, the man responsible for the Council's super soldier program. Vampyri Archons are scientists as well as super soldiers, and have a hand in the creation of other Vampyri. They often personalize their own transformation process, giving themselves special abilities and powers that lesser beings can only dream of.

Equinox Mesmerist.description: The Vampyri are not true vampires at all. They are instead the ultimate result of the Council's super soldier program. It takes a full year of chemical treatments and surgical enhancements to create a single Vampyr, but the result is one of the most deadly killing machines in the world. All Vampyri have incredible strength, speed, and resilience. The Vampyr Mesmerist has potent hypnotic abilities that entrance enemies and render them helpless.

Equinox Parasite.description: The Vampyri are not true vampires at all. They are instead the ultimate result of the Council's super soldier program. It takes a full year of chemical treatments and surgical enhancements to create a single Vampyr, but the result is one of the most deadly killing machines in the world. All Vampyri have incredible strength, speed, and resilience. The Vampyr Parasite has the ability to drain life from its targets, while strengthening itself.

Eremite of War.description: The Eremites of War are well-trained in the mystical arts and serve as commanders in the Carnival of War, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes that immediate action most be taken against the Talons of Vengeance no matter the cost, rather than building up Carnival forces for an overwhelming assault. They can trace their origins back to the Legacy Chain, and retain some of their armor and accoutrements.

Eric.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Eternal Guard.description: The Black Knights are an ancient Order of the dead that is charged with overseeing the Eternal Prison; a place where only the wickedest of souls are jailed. The Eternal Guards have sworn an oath to oversee the prison and to stand vigil over its twisted and varied denizens. Ranks of spear wielding Eternal Guards ensure that the walls never go unmanned and that evil is kept at bay.

Ether.description: If you can take out this fledgeling heroine, you'll prove yourself to Operative Rutger.

Ethereal Shard.description: Light reflects off the surface of these mysterious ice crystals in an unnatural way, it is almost as if they are sucking the heat out of the air itself. Lord Winter draws his tremendous power from these Ice Shards making him nearly indestructible. This particular crystal appear susceptible to energy, negative energy and psionic attacks.

Ewige Mitternacht Kommandant.description:
Despite the 5th Column managing to re-establish their independence and escape The Center's control, the majority of the Nictus on Earth honored their allegiance to Arakhn and remained with the Council, leaving only a small number who retained loyalty to Requiem.

Only the men who have proven their loyalty a dozen times over to stand above their peers as the best of the best are given the opportunity to become a host for the last of the 5th Column Nictus. To be chosen grants the coveted rank of 'Eternal Midnight' and is reserved for only Requiem's most trusted commanders.

Unlike the Council's mass-produced Nictus shards used in the Galaxy soldier program, the Ewige Mitternacht are full Nictus hosts and have the complete range of devastating power that entails.

Excalibur.description: This object drops sword bombs of doom.

Executioner.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in raw strength and power due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance and has abandoned her broadsword in favor of a titanic sword with which to devastate her foes. The signs of her conversion into a member of the Talons are beginning to show. Though she has removed some of her body suit as her skin begins to provide more natural protection and replaced other pieces with true Talons armor, she still uses most of the standard Knives battle gear.

Exorcist.description: While the Midnight Squad does not heavily practice the dark arts, there are a handful that see it as a useful way to defend themselves against those who would try and do their group harm.

Experiment 236.description: Experiment 236 is a creation of Dr. Dmitri Krylov, a Russian scientist who came to the Rogue Isles to make money by creating super-powered villains. Experiment 236 did not survive the transformation process with his sanity intact, and has since gone on a fiery rampage!

Experiment Number Nine.description: One of Dr. Kane's most foul experiments, this beast is a mass of vile flesh taken from many sources.

Extinction War Walker.description: The dreadnaughts tend to lead invasion forces due to their incredible resilience and destructive prowess. Wherever the Goliath War Walker goes, a trail of destruction is left in its wake.

Extracted Essence.description: These free-floating Nictus have been drawn to Earth from somewhere else on planet, bridging the distance through a Shadow Crystal. They have not yet joined with or possessed a host, and normally could not survive on a planet's surface for long. However, the dark energies of the Shadow Crystal sustain them, allowing them to hunt for hosts on their own.

Eye In the Sky.description: Skye Davis is a support-class Hero Corps lieutenant, whose primary function is to protect and enhance those around her. While her offensive power may be limited, her effect on those in her protection are considerable.

Eye of the Leviathan.description: This massive eye dominates the Temple of the Waters. Some say the eye is part of a gargantuan beast who slumbers under Sharkhead Isle, while others believe it is a creation of the mad priest known as Calystix the Shaper. In any case, the Eye is ancient and powerful.

Eye of the Storm.description: The Eye of the Storm suppresses the effects of the psionic typhoon raging in Penelope's lair. It also creates a calm area from which Metronome can speak to Penelope and calm her, allowing her defenses to fall.

Faathim the Kind.description: Faathim the Kind's sole purpose in life is to protect the innocents of the Shadow Shard. He has worked hard to maintain his independence from Rularuu, despite his imprisonment in the Chantry. He has limited means of rebellion, but he uses his mighty healing powers to assist champions of good when he can.

Faathim's Prison.description: The Circle of Thorns have achieved their evil end and imprisoned Faathim the Kind, in an effort to tap into his power. Smashing the crystal may free him.

Fabricator Bot.description: Should another Clockwork Android fall due to unforeseen circumstances or job hazards the Builders are there to rebuild the fallen Android on the job.

Face Harvester.description: Some people will do anything for beauty. And then there are the Faces. Star patients of the Facemaker, they've learned the secrets of the Vahzilok and now will do anything they can to make themselves beautiful.

Face Reaper.description: Some people will do anything for beauty. And then there are the Faces. Star patients of the Facemaker, they've learned the secrets of the Vahzilok and now will do anything they can to make themselves beautiful.

Facemaker.description: The Facemaker will provide tailor services for your Supergroup.

Fail Safe.description: The Fail Safe device will destroy any follower of the Reichsman. This is a last resort device.

Fake Nemesis.description: No one alive has ever seen Nemesis' true face. He hides within his finely wrought armor, safe behind personal force fields and a variety of armaments. He has many such suits of armor, each of which is a robot in its own right, capable of acting - and killing - independently.

Fallen Buckshot.description: In the satanic worldview of the Hellions, falling is a good thing. The Fallen have proven their willingness to take on any power the gang's mystic artifacts can give them, no matter how twisted or base. The hellfire that burns within them protects them from fire but leaves them susceptible to cold.

Fallen From Grace.description: Darius was once considered akin to the angels, however that all was brought to a halt when he was abducted by Arachnos, and transformed into the psychotic creature he is today. Arachnos scientists removed his eyes, but later imbued him with the power of fire, and unleashed upon the world to cause destruction.

Fallen Gunner.description: No one likes a nice, cheery blaze better than a Hellion. They like it so much, they've managed to set this entire section of the city on fire. It's up to Paragon City's heroes to rain on their parade.

Fallen Quantum.description: In the satanic worldview of the Hellions, falling is a good thing. The Fallen have proven their willingness to take on any power the gang's mystic artifacts can give them, no matter how twisted or base. The hellfire that burns within them protects them from fire but leaves them susceptible to cold.

Family Triggerman.description: The Triggerman has a wide variety of tactical options. Don't be in front of any of those options!

Famine.description: No Rikti warriors are more feared than those known as the 4 Riders. Said to have suffered some strange transformation during the crossing between worlds even their fellow Rikti are terrified of them. The Rider known as Famine can starve his foes of life and energy, destroying them form within.

Fanatic.description: The Fanatics have taken the intense devotion of the Zealots to another level. While still retaining the swift and deadly claw attacks of their lesser sisters, the Fanatics acquire new abilities, including the ability to call forth a poisonous energy that saps their targets of strength. They are dangerous opponents who can make quick work of a foe if they are allowed to approach too close.

Fang Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Fang agents have achieved some trust in the organization. They are given access to Wyvern's special Fang Poison that slows the reflexes of anyone injected with it.

Far Fire.description: The Far Fire style utilizes the Tsoo's internal energy to burn the very air. Far Fire masters can hurl flame at enemies to burn, blind, or entrap them.

Faultline.description: After he rediscovered his heroic roots, young Jim Temblor has been doing all he can to redeem the name of his father: Faultline. Following several intense battles with the Rikti, Faultline and his girlfriend Fusionette have joined the Vanguard to help fight the alien invaders.

Fearsome Reflection.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. This purple coalescence of energy is known as a Fearsome Reflection.

Feral Kraken.description:
The Rikti have managed to pull this horrifying monstrosity through their portal but the incomplete dimensional gate has left it's mind broken and the beast only has one impulse: The annihilation of all Earthlings in the immediate vicinity!

It is singular-minded and extremely driven, it will not cease chasing its targets until it is put down.

Feralina.description: Feralina was recruited to Hero Corps after the 'Dance Party Disaster' of 2006, which saw the premature shutdown of the Paragon Dance Party and caused DJ Zero's relocation to Pocket D. Details from that event continue to be shrouded in mystery, but Feralina was heralded as a hero afterwards for her actions. Feralina was thought to be K.I.A. in recent years, but revelations of late have revealed she was deep undercover in West Libertalia.

Field Agent.description: The stone-faced, suit clad Field Agents are Crey's main investigative branch. They can be found carrying out a variety of missions, from espionage to assassination ops. They carry the latest weapons and receive intense close combat training.

Field Agent Keith Nance.description: Field Agent Keith Nance, agent for the Department of Superpowered Activities Monitoring, has been kidnapped by your evil double!

Field Officer.description: Officers are veteran soldiers who have years of command experience. They use their leadership skills to hone the resistance fighters under their command into a deadly fighting force whether they are raw recruits, or elite commandos. They also pack the best weapons they can get their hands on.

Fiend.description: The biggest and most dangerous of the Red Caps, the Fiends are no one to be trifled with. Fiends are known for sharpening their teeth on the bones of their victims, and that is by no means their most repugnant quality.

Fiend Lord.description: The depraved ugliness festering in the underbelly of humanity is called forth at The Banner of Fiends. These Dark Fiends are a physical manifestation of pure malice, seeking calculated cruelty and malevolence, just because they can.

Fiery Demonling.description: These infernal single-minded creatures born of the Abyss seek only to cause mayhem, destruction and suffering on the material plane.

Fiery Orb.description: This Fiery Orb is a physical manifestation of the Dominator's power. It will burn any foe that stands near it.

Fiery Robby.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

File Cabinet.description: This file cabinet must be destroyed

Fingers.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Fire.description: The Hellions have started this fire and lives are at stake. Put it out immediately!

Fire Dagger.description: Masters of the art of the Fire Dagger have suffused their internal energies with the power of flame. Fire comes to their fingertips at a whim, allowing them to devastate their foes.

Fire Hydrant.description: This is a hydrant used in case of a fire emergency.

Fire Rune.description: In the satanic worldview of the Hellions, falling is a good thing. The Fallen have proven their willingness to take on any power the gang's mystic artifacts can give them, no matter how twisted or base. The hellfire that burns within them protects them from fire but leaves them susceptible to cold.

Fire Tanker Clone.description: Crey has created synthetic super-humans like this one using DNA harvested from fallen heroes and villains. This clone is able to surround itself in a protective nimbus of fire.

Fire Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Fire Thorn Caster.description: Weaving magical effects from fire can be dangerous for the novice mage, but Fire Casters have perfected the art. They can conjure up fires to immolate or distract their enemies, and some can even draw on their foes' body heat to restore their own power.

Fire Wire.description: Fire Wire is one of the many villains who inhabit Mercy Island. Fire Wire tends to boast and brag about most of his accomplishments, earning him the ire of any competing villains. However, he seems to have some semblance of bite behind his bark, or else he wouldn't still be alive today.

Fireball.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. This potent offensive magic repeatedly tries to "make friends" with those it encounters, causing more fire to come into being.

First Officer Harriman.description: The Sky Raiders officer corps consists of combat veterans who fought both before and during the Rikti War. They've become disenchanted with the government and its current reliance on super-powered heroes, but they haven't lost any of their military ability or discipline.

Flambeaux.description: Flambeaux is a fiery-haired hero who developed a process to turn her body energies into biochemical fire she can project at her enemies.

Flashfreeze.description:
Years ago, Flashfreeze was an ice-wielding Paragon City hero who specialized in demon hunting. The media used to love shipping her with the Vindicator's own Infernal, as the fire-and-ice demon hunter combo made for cute tabloid reading, but he eventually went on record commenting that her methods were 'dangerous and unbecoming'.

Now she's a member of Ultimatum, amongst the government's most powerful operatives and their star black-ops assassin. Utilizing her signature Brain Freeze attack, a sudden drop in temperature is the calling card to her targets for their untimely demise.

Flat Nemesis.description:
No one alive has ever seen Nemesis' true face. He hides within his finely wrought armor, safe behind personal force fields and a variety of armaments. He has many such suits of armor, each of which is a robot in its own right, capable of acting - and killing - independently.

This one has somehow used a molecular depth-compression field to become very flat.

Flesh Carver.description: Reapers and Mortificators from the Vahzilok often find themselves without work in this post-Doctor world they live in. Many of them, hearing whispers of a new initiative being run through Cortex, Pierce, and Buzzsaw, have gladly offered their services in exchange for asylum from Paragon City. Flesh Carvers are wielders of electricity and bonesaws to mend allies and maim foes.

Flesh Wrench.description: Second only to Dr. Pierce and Doc Buzzsaw, the Flesh Wrenches dedicate an almost religious devotion to their work. They cloak themselves in scrubs and new tech and regularly take field testing on as their own responsibility, much to the dismay of the less successful experiments that Pierce has left behind as 'motivation bait'.

Flower Knight.description: Kil-ja 'Kit' Sung is a young Korean-American who ignored her past for most of her life. She immersed herself in the modern age and all types of gadgets and technology. That all changed when she was visited by one of her ancestor spirits. Her ancestor Jun-tak, was a great warrior in his time and a master archer. Jun-tak explained that a time of great trouble must be met by all righteous warriors. He presented Kil-ja with a mystic bow of great power and sent her to Paragon City to carry on the grand tradition of her family. Kit has not fully accepted her role as Flower Knight, but between the advice of her ancestor, the power of his mystic bow, and her expertise with gadgets she is destined to be a mighty heroine in the City of Heroes.

Flowing Dragon.description: Flowing Dragon is the greatest and most talented of Sun Xiong's disciples. He has attuned himself to the currents of the world around him, and his every movement seems to pulse with energy.

Flux.description: These terrible little monsters somehow live inside the Cap au Diable Power Transferrance System. Perhaps there is more to the 'PTS' than meets the eye. There are certainly rumors. Many wonder why the PTS is covered in glowing sigils. Could that have something to do with these supernatural nuisances?

Foot Stephens.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Forbidden Knowledge.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Infused with years of complex ritual magic, this ancient tome contains secrets never meant to be known.

Force Field Door.description: This reinforced door is made of heavy-duty material with a complex locking mechanism. It'll be tough to destroy!

Force Field Generator.description: The Drone generates a Dispersion Bubble that gives the Mastermind's nearby allies increased Defense.

Force Field Generator Pod.description: This generator seems to serve two purposes. It not only keeps the Hydra safe from all attacks, but also appears to keep the fearsome creature under Rikti control.

Force Mage.description: The High Mages of Force deal with the primal forces that move the universe. In their sunken city, they are responsible for preventing cave ins by siphoning off the Earth's seismic energy into useful pursuits. In battle, they can sap the very strength from a foe's limbs and add it to their own.

Foreman.description: These poor chumps think they've got a chance against the Cage Consortium. Sure their working conditions are atrocious. If most of them weren't former criminals and other troublemakers maybe they could have found better jobs in St. Martial or Grandville instead of this dump.

Foreman Carl.description: Carl is the beleagured, if unpleasant, foreman of the PTS.

Foreshadow.description: Some say Yu-sik Jin is a powerful spirit who was placed upon the earth to help the good and punish the wicked. Even when he is defeated, Foreshadow has reincarnated to once again take up his destiny. He possesses an amazing constitution and superior martial arts abilities.

Forklift.description: This is a small heavy-duty forklift used to move supplies around construction, storage and dock sites.

Forlorn Commando.description: Back when they were Ghouls, the Forlorn Commandos were subject to Praetor Berry's most reckless and dubious genetic experiments. Now cured of their insatiable hunger, they serve as the elite shocktroops of the various Forlorn cadres strewn throughout the tunnels of First Ward.

Formed Impression.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. A Formed Impression is a more powerful Apparition that arises when a Dispersed Impression combines with Scattered Spirits or other Formed Impressions. The more powerful hatred they embody gives them some resistance to status effects, in addition to their other powers.

Former Seeker.description: These powerful psychics were former Seers, but have since been removed from the Seer Network. Katie Douglas has taken them under her wing in First Ward, training them to harness their now-unrestrained psychic powers, and protecting them from those who would once again use them as weapons.

Former Seer.description: These psychics were former Seers, but have since been removed from the Seer Network. Though no longer drawing strength from the network their minds are also no longer restrained and possess great psychic power.

Fort Knoxxer.description: The mighty Fort Knoxxer is infamous among the Gold Brickers for having survived so many near-death experiences that his comrades believe him more impervious than Fort Knox itself, hence the nickname. The Knoxxer's logic was that he has already survived explosions, gunfire, and superpowered villains... what's there to fear from a little firepower at his finger tips?

Fortunata.description: Fortunatas are Arachnos agents gifted with psychic powers. Those with aggressive abilities are tasked with taking down super-types-who often have little resistance to their deadly abilities.

Fortunata 'Amelee'.description: Disguised as Rebel Arachnos leader Fortunata Amelee, Fortunata Millia is counting on you to help her escape her supposed comrades.

Fortunata Essence.description: This Arachnos Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Fortunata Fateweaver.description: This Fateweaver has foreseen that your supergroup requires her services.

Fortunata Mistress.description: The most powerful of the Fortunats are the Mistresses. These rare few have mastered numerous psychic abilities and risen to the top of Lord Recluse's beautiful Black Widows.

Fortunata Seer.description: Fortunata Seers can glimpse moments into the future. They use this ability to increase the defenses of the more mundane troops they slavishly lead into combat.

Found Freak.description: Found Freaks are members of the Lost that were, to wit, 'found' by Dr. Pierce's scavenging groups and brought back to be 'volunteered' into the Freaklok army. They've been mentally conditioned to be loyal and offer their abilities for both research and defense.

Foundation of Form.description: The leaders of the Rock Troops are tougher, smarter, and better equipped to take on whatever foes the Devouring Earth sets them against. In addition to the rock wielding skills of their subordinates, they have the ability to summon forth deadly Swarms of insects.

Fractured Impression.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. The Fractured Impression is the weakest type of Impression, with no ability to merge with others. They emerge from Spectres, either on their defeat or by splitting off the Spectre to lend it assistance.

Fractured Spectre.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. The Fractured Spectre is a very much like the Ripped Spectres, except it lacks the ability to merge with other entities.

Fractured Spirit.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. The Fractured Spirit is the weakest type of Apparition, with no ability to merge with others. They emerge from Spectres, either on their defeat or by splitting off the Spectre to lend it assistance.

Frances.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Frank.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Frank \"Hunnerd Yard\" McCain.description: A famed card shark and gunslinger from the Wild West, Frank "Hunnerd Yard" McCain was known especially for his tremendous accuracy at great range. Frank McCain's life changed that hot dusty night when he won a strange device from an odd foreign sounding fellow in a game of cards. Figuring it was some kind of new-fangled, steam-powered still, McCain took it back to his shack and fiddled with it. To his amazement, it lit up as bright as the noon-day sun. Next thing he knew, he was lost in the ancient world with nothing but his guns, his dogs and a broken time travel machine. He now lives like an emperor off the prizes he wins in the Coliseum.

Frankie.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Freak Buckshot.description: The dregs of Freakshow society, the Freaks are newbies who haven't earned their metal yet. They have to prove themselves by using axes, bats, guns, and anything else they can get their hands on to cause as much damage as possible.

Freak Chopper.description: The dregs of Freakshow society, the Freaks are newbies who haven't earned their metal yet. They have to prove themselves by using axes, bats, guns, and anything else they can get their hands on to cause as much damage as possible.

Freak Gunner.description: The dregs of Freakshow society, the Freaks are newbies who haven't earned their metal yet. They have to prove themselves by using axes, bats, guns, and anything else they can get their hands on to cause as much damage as possible.

Freak Quantum_Gunner.description: The dregs of Freakshow society, the Freaks are newbies who haven't earned their metal yet. They have to prove themselves by using axes, bats, guns, and anything else they can get their hands on to cause as much damage as possible.

Freak Slammer.description: The dregs of Freakshow society, the Freaks are newbies who haven't earned their metal yet. They have to prove themselves by using axes, bats, guns, and anything else they can get their hands on to cause as much damage as possible.

Freakbomination.description: The wordy 'Freakbominations', or simply 'Big Freaks' as their friends call them, are reanimated vessels pulled from the Freakshow and from local morgues. The larger frames are chosen on purpose for perfecting some more of the vicious technologies for future size reductions in more inconspicuous ventures.

Freaklok Beam Jerk.description: The Freaklok Beam Jerk gets his name from a long career of earning it. The reactions to the tactical readout on his abilities starts with 'Oh.' and typically ends with 'Oh come on.' His turbocharged nervous system is interfaced directly to a myriad of experimental devices both under and over the skin, and all of it earns him the title he wears.

Freaklok Boomer.description: This liquid cooled zombie crammed with ordinance is clearly not OSHA certified. Dr. Pierce outfits the least promising specimens with minimal or highly theoretical CMRj techniques for testing, and cares little for their survival. Only the perfomance data matters!

Freaklok Disc Jockey.description: The Disc Jockeys are the result of wildly irreverent 'what if' experimentation in the lab. After many failed attempts in modifying the substandard sinew of Abominations for faster reflexes, Dr. Pierce's team found themselves with an overabundance of top halves and piles of burnt-out legs. A few loot runs later on Colonel Duray's stash-houses and the Abomination inventory has been salvaged.

Freaklok Eidolon.description: In a rather mundane turn for the Freaklok, the Freaklok Eidolons are not a macabre techno-horror, but the first step towards realizing the true potential of CMRj for humanity, and an inch closer to Doctor Vahzilok's original goal to defeat death. They are self-repairing and wield the power of all their Eidolon predecessors.

Freaklok Feral Cadaver.description: This trial run of Dr. Pierce's interpretations of CMRj, applied to existing Vahzilok cadaver methodology, has resulted in a feral Freak zombie, which experts are calling 'terrifying'.

Freaklok Juiced Cadaver.description: This trial run of Dr. Pierce's interpretations of CMRj, applied to existing Vahzilok cadaver methodology, has resulted in a promising first batch of electrified grunts with internal and external tesla coils.

Freaklok Pin-Cushion.description: This trial run of Dr. Pierce's interpretations of CMRj, applied to existing Vahzilok cadaver methodology, has resulted in a promising first batch of frontline disposable minions that are outfitted with shrapnel barbs for anti-personnel applications.

Freaklok Riktografter.description: Doc Buzzsaw was no stranger to Rikti technological appropriation and happily handed her notes to Pierce once the lab was cleared and the tech was inventoried. The Freaklok Riktografter has gone a step further and begun to utilize some of the teleportation technology as well, making them an unpredictable lot.

Freaklok Swipey Cadaver.description: This trial run of Dr. Pierce's interpretations of CMRj, applied to existing Vahzilok cadaver methodology, has resulted in a new kind of Freak swiper, one that is more vicious and easier to command.

Freaklok Terminal Ripper.description: Terminal Rippers are cast from the same psychological and physiological mold as the Freakshow Tanks; hopelessly addicted to Excelsior, they have endured multiple organ failures and limb replacements to the point that their humanity and physical body are lost, replaced with slipshod technology. They now need Excelsior on a constant drip to stay alive, for whatever time they have left.

Freaklok Zenigrafter.description: Dr. Pierce's quest to apply CMRj's potential quickly turned to a variety of unorthodox acquisitions. One such suggestion from Punkadelic was to raid a few Council storehouses he knew about from his time with Clamor. The result is a newly repurposed Eidolon that wields the offensive capabilities of a Zenith Warcry.

Freedom Corps Cataphract.description: Utilizing the engineering designs from the Paragon Police Department's Support Automatons, the Freedom Corps has built this armored powerhouse. The Cataphract class, or the "Heavy" as the troops call them, are slow movers but more than make up for it in awesome fire power and enough armor to withstand multiple attacks from villains. With one of these babies, you will own the streets.

Freezer.description: Not just an appliance anymore, the Freezers have mastery over cold and ice. As their name suggests, they're cool as ice and calm under pressure, even as they cast bolts of jagged ice that pierce flesh and bone alike.

Frost Shaman.description: The Frost Shaman finds its origin in the frigid mountains at the roof of the world. There, the Shaman communes with the gods of the Pantheon to command the power of ice. They are quite adept at slowing the movement of their foes, making them less of a threat and easier to bring down.

Frost Shamaness.description: The Frost Shamaness finds its origin in the frigid mountains at the roof of the world. There, the Shamaness communes with the gods of the Pantheon to command the power of ice. They are quite adept at slowing the movement of their foes, making them less of a threat and easier to bring down.

FrostFire.description: Leonard Calhoun used to imagine life as a hero. His strong elemental powers seemed to be just what the job required. Leonard made himself a costume and took up the name Frostfire, but he soon found that saving people wasn't nearly as appealing as picking their pockets. Frostfire descended into a life of crime and began to gather together other misguided mutants such as himself. Thus, the Outcasts were born.

Frostfire.description: Leonard Calhoun used to imagine life as a hero. His strong elemental powers seemed to be just what the job required. Leonard made himself a costume and took up the name Frostfire, but he soon found that saving people wasn't nearly as appealing as picking their pockets. Frostfire descended into a life of crime and began to gather together other misguided mutants such as himself. Thus, the RoguesGallery were born.

Frostling.description: This small creature is made up of snow and malice. Frostlings are the weakest servants of the Winter Lord.

Fungi.description: The Fungi emit spores that strengthen the immunity of Devouring Earth creatures. As a result, nearby creatures become resistant to many effects, including knockdown, sleep, disorient, and stun.

Fungoid.description: These horrid parodies of men lead the fungi armies of the Devouring Earth. Their pummeling attack can shatter bones while their spore clouds disable their victims. Meanwhile, their summoned Swarms hold other foes at bay.

Furious Bomb.description: Furious Bombs are cybernetically enhanced humans fitted with high yield explosives. They are commanded into close combat with the enemy where their explosive payload is then detonated.

Furious Zombie Firebomb.description: Stuffed with volatile compounds, this mass of flesh has been built to explode when excited.

Fury Monument.description: This monument seems to pulse with power.

Fusilier.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. It fires compact shells that carry a tremendous punch, exploding with the force of a heavy grenade or rocket shell.

Fusion.description: Fusion is powered by an internal nuclear reactor which grants him the ability to focus massive waves of force outward. It is a hotly debated question as to why Fusion's Primal Earth double, Fusionette, is not the same gender as he.

Fusion Burst.description: Apocalypse strikes you with a Fusion Burst!

Fusion Generator.description: Developed from prototypes found in Dr. Anguish's secret lab, the X3 Fusion is the best power solution money can by. Only the most noteworthy groups have one of these in their base!

Fusionette.description: Fusionette is one of the Nuclear 90; 90 children from around the world all born in one year with an unusual mutation that gives them natural magnetic nuclear fusion reactors for hearts, and the ability to channel energy from their internal reactor for a variety of super powers. Like many of the Nuclear 90, Fusionette has decided to use her powers for the betterment of mankind as a hero. She's focused on her energy blasts and has recently developed the power of flight.

GL0_5T1CC.description: GLO_ST1CC is a one-man walking dance party that doubles as a night-time beacon for wayward Freaks to stumble their way home towards.

Galaxy.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others.

Galaxy Adjutant.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others.

Galaxy Adjutant Quantum.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others. That weapon he carries is obviously Nictus technology, and probably deadly against Kheldian energy signatures.

Galaxy Archon.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others.

Galaxy Archon Quantum.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others. That weapon he carries is obviously Nictus technology, and probably deadly against Kheldian energy signatures.

Galaxy Quantum.description: The Galaxy Band of the Council has been trained by Arakhn in stealth and infiltration. They have also been conditioned by Kheldian mind control techniques to be loyal to her above all others. That weapon he carries is obviously Nictus technology, and probably deadly against Kheldian energy signatures.

Gale.description: Gale possesses all the power of the storm. Wind, Rain and Lightning are at her command.

Gardvord.description: Veteran Trolls have been around long enough to feel some positive effects from their body-changing drugs. Like the trolls of legend, they have become exceptionally fast healers, making them very difficult to kill.

Gardvord Quantum.description: Veteran Trolls have been around long enough to feel some positive effects from their body-changing drugs. Like the trolls of legend, they have become exceptionally fast healers, making them very difficult to kill.

Garth.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Gary.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Gas Centrifuge.description: This extremely advanced device is built into the room and collects Rikti Monkey gas and then spins it down to an extremely potent and very lethal condensed extract that the Rikti use for weapons development.

Gas Tank.description: This gas must not be released into the air!

Gas Trap.description: This trap emits poisonous smoke from an arcane incense. The fumes from this incense blur the victim's senses, reducing his accuracy for a time.

Gate.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Few wizards dare to call a Gate into existence, and even fewer correctly estimate their ability to control it. The unfortunate soul of this Gate's summoner is forever bound to it, calling forth demons until this foul magic is dispelled.

Gaussian.description:
Gaussian is the Vanguard's main tactician, coordinating intelligence efforts across divisions to form a united front against the Rikti.

Many believe that his ability to keep the Vanguard organized is the only thing that's prevented the Rikti from overwhelming the Vanguard's forces, but Gaussian prefers to downplay his role and instead credit the steadfast determination and fighting skill of the volunteer troops.

Gear.description: Gears emerge from the remnants of destroyed Clockwork Princes. Though tiny, they can still pack quite a punch.

Geiser Graphic Entity.description: This entity creates the Geiser Effect

General Aarons.description: The mysterious General Z has been revealed as General Aarons. His assistance has been invaluable to you, but if the Sky raiders have their way, it may well cost him his life.

General Alito.description: General Alito was once one of the leaders of a rogue faction of Vanguard. His plans were stopped by a super-powered individual, and he was put in a Vanguard prison afterwards. His escape went unnoticed due to Vanguard's focus on repelling the Praetorian invasion. Now, Alito wishes to build up his power once more, believing that he was in the right the entire time, and that one day Vanguard will pay for crushing him.

General Z.description: You're not exactly certain what General Z is doing at this meeting. The only thing you know is that the Sky Raiders seem to want him dead.

Generator.description: These strange devices thrum with power, harvesting the meta-human energies gathered by the Web and channeling them into Lord Recluse.

Generator Energy Curtain.description: The Rook Power Shielding provides extra protection for base generator components. When activated it cloaks the unit in a protective force field.

Geneticist.description: Crey Industries believes firmly in hands on, frontline research, and they demand more from their scientists than most companies. Indeed, Crey Scientists often venture into the field, armed with Cryo weapons to help them collect samples - and do serious damage to anyone who get in their way.

Genin.description: Genin may be the lowest ranking Ninja and only possess basic Ninjitsu skills, but they are nothing to be trifled with. Genin are highly trained warriors and deeply devoted to their Master.

Geode.description: The Devouring Earth grows these crystalline warriors in special caves deep beneath the Earth. Their blasts of shards can cut deeply into a target's flesh and bone, and energy attacks have a diminished effect against their crystalline forms. Luckily, they're susceptible to smashing attacks.

Geode Shard.description: Even Shards from a fallen crystalline creature can prove deadly.

George.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Gerald T. Marchand.description: Provost Marchand was the former leader of the military for Praetoria. He was against a war with Primal Earth and had the majority of his say in all military matters taken away from him by Emperor Cole. Provost Marchand was brought to Primal Earth by Vanguard and helped organize the forces against the final attack on the Magisterium. He has proven himself to be a trustworthy and honorable man. The authorities of Paragon honored his request to form a new supergroup called the New Praetorians, but warned Marchand that they would be keeping a very close eye on his organization.

German Shepherd.description: This faithful German Shepherd has taken a liking to you and will keep you company. However, it won't engage in combat and cannot be attacked.

Gewehr Jaeger.description: Jaegers take their name from the German word for 'hunter'. They're some of the strangest and most advanced combat robots to ever stalk the streets of Paragon City. Nemesis seems to have a limitless supply of these steam-powered killers, each armed with powerful ranged or melee weaponry.

Ghost Ship.description: This fishing trawler, the Moraine, set sail from Striga Isle in 1932. No one knows what terrible tragedy befell its crew, though it is obvious that they are still trying to get home.

Ghost Son.description: This recently-dead phantom claims to be on Arachnos' side, but there are serious questions about his loyalty.

Ghost Widow.description: Beautiful, mysterious, and deadly. Ghost Widow appears to be an actual spirit from beyond the grave rather than a super with some sort of incorporeal power. Some have said she was once a rising star in the Night Widows when she was slain. Her thirst for vengeance must have been great, for she returned from the void and now serves at Recluse's side. There are rumors that her service isn't entirely voluntary, however.

Ghost of Scrapyard.description: Now this is disturbing. Captain Mako tore this guy to pieces years ago, yet here he stands, smashing everything in his way with his spectral hammer. You really hope every cape who has felt your wrath doesn't pull this poltergeist routine. It'll be a busy decade if they do.

Ghoul King.description: This Ghoul appears different than the others. For starters, he isn't shackled and he seems to have a commanding presence over the others.

Ghoulish Mystic.description: More powerful than most of Master Midnight's horde, this aberration retains a number of magical abilities from its life.

Giant Fly Trap.description: This carnivorous plant is straight of out some prehistoric nightmare. It obviously has a taste for fresh meat.

Giant Shivan.description: These horrible things are an amalgamation of human corpses and some sort of weird sentient goo from the meteors crashing into Galaxy City. Some claim a mysterious interplanetary intelligence thought destroyed in the 1980s is the source of the Shivans, but if such a creature existed, 'Shiva', the Hindu name for the 'Destroyer of Worlds', was kept secret by the governments of earth.

Giga Knight.description: The Clockwork King's improved psychic abilities apparently had a profound effect on his creations. These Clockwork are significantly stronger and more durable than their predecessors.

Giga Watts.description: Giga Watts is a cyborg, developed by a resident scientist in Cap au Diable. After many months of testing, Giga learned that he is capable of self-control, and has since abandoned his maker. Giga seeks to join Arachnos, by any means necessary.

Giovanna Scaldi.description: Though records say Giovanna Scaldi died in 17th century Venice, it appears she is alive and well - in Vanessa DeVore's mind. Her soul has survived the centuries locked away in a porcelain mask, and it is her great psychic power that truly drives the Carnival of Shadows.

Girlfriend From Hell.description: The Hellions make jokes and call her the Girlfriend from Hell. They think she's there to please them; to help them. She enjoys letting them think this, as she slowly but surely takes their lives.

Giver of Life.description: The older, more mature plant creatures serve as leaders for their deadly cousins. They're stronger, tougher, and more deadly than the lesser plant creatures. They also have the ability to summon forth Swarms to further trouble their enemies.

Glacia.description: Glacia and her twin sister Infernia spent years battling each other before the Rikti attacked. United for the first time, they fought side-by-side and volunteered for the Omega team together. Like all members of the Omega team, their fate had been a mystery until now. Now they've returned to Earth, and they have some important news to tell.

Glitched Builder.description: Should another Clockwork Android fall due to unforeseen circumstances or job hazards the Builders are there to rebuild the fallen Android on the job. These Clockwork appear to be malfunctioning.

Glitched Cleaner.description: Cleaners are designed for simple labor intensive tasks like cleaning, welding, and repairing other Clockwork. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves. These Clockwork appear to be malfunctioning.

Glitched Dismantler.description: Dismantlers are occasionally called in when their plasma torches can be put to use to tear apart crumbling or collapsed buildings. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units. These Clockwork appear to be malfunctioning.

Glitched Lifter.description: Lifters, as their name indicates, do a lot of the heavy lifting and construction. They are able to easily lift machinery and building materials that previously could only be lifted by powerful cranes. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units. These Clockwork appear to be malfunctioning.

Glitched Mender.description: Menders are often seen repairing broken structures and machines, including other Androids. Their top priority is to keep the other Androids in tip-top working condition. These Clockwork appear to be malfunctioning.

Glitched Sweeper.description: Sweepers are often seen patrolling the street cleaning up litter and debris to make Praetoria a more beautiful place to live. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves. These Clockwork appear to be malfunctioning.

Gloryhound.description: Gloryhound came from an animal shelter in Kings Row. After being bitten by a radioactive human, she learned how to talk, walk on her hind legs, and wear the flag as a cape. Gloryhound obsessively patrols the farmlands and forest that surround the rural community of Croatoa, either looking for sheep to herd or hypervigilant against evil plots.

Godwin Blaire.description: The Reapers seem to be the only normal humans among the ranks of Dr. Vahzilok's reanimated legions. They are trained surgeons who collect body parts with the help of poison darts and industrial strength hacksaws.

Gold Brickster.description: The Brickster is a Gold Bricker who's always quick with a joke or to light up your smoke. Despite his silly demeanor, he's one of the more veteran Smelters within Langston Corp's ranks and there's nothing funny about having flesh seared from bone.

Golden Brickernaut.description:
The Golden Brickernauts are the culmination of all the stolen technology the Gold Brickers have accumulated from years of criminal activity.

Langston Corp's walking tanks were created using the schematics of Dr. Aeon's own power suit, Crey's energy weapons systems, and tied together with the Gold Bricker's own AU-System.

Despite such impressive foundations, the Gold Brickers lack of access to the same exotic materials as Dr. Aeon resulting in an inferior derivative. In order to boost its various capabilities, the Brickernaut armor overclocked its energy system, which if damaged could cause the power core to go critical...

Golden Palm.description: Golden Palm is a hero known for his invulnerability and his super strength abilities. He is often seen slamming his palm into the face and chests of his enemies, sending them into the ground.

Golden Roller.description: No one knows who the Golden Roller really is, only that he gets his name from the sleek gold luxury car he drives around Cap Au Diable. The word on the street is he's a troubleshooter for the Gold Brickers, the high-tech thieves that plague the island.

Golden Sphinx.description: Golden Sphinx is a hero working with Longbow in the Rogue Isles. He is known to possess an ancient Egyptian amulet which grants him supernatural powers.

Goliath War Walker.description: The dreadnaughts tend to lead invasion forces due to their incredible resilience and destructive prowess. Wherever the Goliath War Walker goes, a trail of destruction is left in its wake.

Gorgon.description: These combatants are among the most feared that the Praetorians can field. Their weapons are coated with a poison that will paralyze their opponents. This allows them to easily capture or defeat them at their leisure.

Gorgon Quantum.description: These combatants are among the most feared that the Praetorians can field. Their weapons are coated with a poison that will paralyze their opponents. This allows them to easily capture or defeat them at their leisure.

Gotterdammerung.description: In the year 2352, a mad scientist designed a powerful doomsday weapon known as the World-Breaker Engine and crafted four robot guardians to harness and channel the destructive energies it created. Gotterdammerung was one such guardian. Fueled by the World-Breaker Engine, Gotterdammerung's powers were near limitless, along with his brethren Apocalypse, Armageddon and Gehenna. So great was their might that they could not be destroyed but were instead cast through time and scattered across the ages. Three of the four have reunited and they bide their time in the Coliseum, waiting to be reunited with their lost brother and the Engine that will fuel the end of the world.

Graham Easton.description: Graham Easton is the curator of the Paragon International Art Museum in Steel Canyon. He takes his work seriously, but is plagued with constant fear of the local criminal element. As it turns out, his fears are often justified.

Granite.description: The leaders of the Rock Troops are tougher, smarter, and better equipped to take on whatever foes the Devouring Earth sets them against. In addition to the rock wielding skills of their subordinates, they have the ability to summon forth deadly Swarms of insects.

Grant Creston.description: Grant Creston was once a commander within the Imperial Defense Force, until he defected to help the citizens of First Ward. Creston had discovered that instead of helping the citizens, the IDF were using the area as a training ground. With the destruction of Praetoria, Grant Creston has met with his former mentor, Provost Marchand, who explained that his own rule over the armies was overriden by Emperor Cole. Now, Grant Creston is out to show the people of Primal Earth that there were, and still are, honorable soldiers within the Imperial Defense Force, and that they can be a force for good in their world.

Grate.description: This grate covers important ship parts.

Grave Knight.description: Only the most battle-hardened warriors filled with a lust for revenge will return as a Grave Knight. This undead warrior may be sentient, but it has no understanding of a living world now alien to him. It can only see its own bloodlust and thirst for vengeance. Only the most powerful Masterminds can control them.

Gravedigger Assailant.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Brawler.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Chopper.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Quantum Gunner.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Slammer.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Slicer.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Slugger.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravedigger Striker.description: The Skulls worship death in a very personal, creepy way. The Gravediggers are the gang's foot soldiers - wannabes who must prove their skill with knives and guns before they (literally) earn their bones.

Gravidian.description: Discovering you're the son of an alien is a difficult thing in the years following the Rikti war. For young Tensor Fields, it was the first thing in his life that made sense. He trained his native gravity-altering abilities under his father's tutelage, and took up the traditional heroic garb of his homeworld as his own. Now he upholds the high ideals of an advanced civilization as Gravidian!

Greater Devoured.description: Vernon von Grun has begun experimentations on controlling the Devouring Earth. This Greater Devoured is an example of his work!

Greater Fiend.description: The depraved ugliness festering in the underbelly of humanity is called forth at The Banner of Fiends. These Dark Fiends are a physical manifestation of pure malice, seeking calculated cruelty and malevolence, just because they can.

Greater Mystic Aspect.description: The malevolent mystic banners have released their energies to form the Greater Mystic Aspect. This colossal entity represents all of the negative aspects of humanity coalesced into physical form.

Greater Unbound Nictus.description: These free-floating Nictus have been drawn to Earth from somewhere else on planet, bridging the distance through a Shadow Crystal. They have not yet joined with or possessed a host, and normally could not survive on a planet's surface for long. However, the dark energies of the Shadow Crystal sustain them, allowing them to hunt for hosts on their own.

Green Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The green ink enhances a Tsoo's strength, giving him powerful hand to hand attacks that can easily render a victim unconscious.

Gregori Romanov.description: Gregori Romanov is one of a group of four mystics who were investigating Croatoa's strange transformation of Salamanca. They may be the only thing standing between Salamanca and the spirit world.

Gregory.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Gregory Vega.description: Gregory Vega is the man behind the Syndicate plot to aid Metronome. Putting him down will scatter the Syndicate and slow down Metronome's plans!

Gremlin.description: These terrible little monsters somehow live inside the Cap au Diable Power Transferrance System. Perhaps there is more to the 'PTS' than meets the eye. There are certainly rumors. Many wonder why the PTS is covered in glowing sigils. Could that have something to do with these supernatural nuisances?

Grenadier.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. It fires compact shells that carry a tremendous punch, exploding with the force of a heavy grenade or rocket shell.

Grey Matter.description: Grey Matter is a wily and tenacious Eidolon from, and made of, parts unknown.

Group of Barrels.description: These barrels are used to carry volatile liquids.

Grym.description: Grym endured the Trials of Confluence for all 7 years, emerging as the Lord Guardian until the Trials begin once again.
