Taking his right of first choosing, he selected Paragon City as his protectorate and crossed the veil into the World of Shape to install himself as the City's Grim.

Guard.description: Many who have lost hope go looking in dark places for the answers to life's questions. The Followers are those whose search has taken them to the Circle of Thorns. Now they must prove their true devotion by serving the Circle's evil will.

Guardian.description: Many who have lost hope go looking in dark places for the answers to life's questions. The Followers are those whose search has taken them to the Circle of Thorns. Now they must prove their true devotion by serving the Circle's evil will.

Guardian Essence.description: This Knives of Vengeance essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Guardian Shard.description: Even Shards from a fallen crystalline creature can prove deadly.

Guardian Turret.description: Guardian Turrets are immobile turrets that ensure the security of sensitive areas. They never leave their post and their plasma cannon can reach out and touch anyone even remotely threatening their position.

Guide.description: Many who have lost hope go looking in dark places for the answers to life's questions. The Followers are those whose search has taken them to the Circle of Thorns. Now they must prove their true devotion by serving the Circle's evil will.

Guido 'The Mooch' Verandi.description: Guido 'The Mooch' Verandi is the head of the Verandi Family on Port Oakes. Typical of the Family, he is ruthless, efficient and deadly. He has often crossed paths with the Marcone Family.

Gunslinger.description: Some of the most deadly operatives in the Malta Group have been given the nickname Gunslingers. This name came into common usage not only because the agents use firearms, but because they also tend to have the same kind of cocky attitude and cowboy mentality that one associates with gunslingers in the old west.

Gyrfalcon.description: Gyrfalcon is the Malta Group's top general and the only known member of the organization's mysterious Council of Leaders. Though Gyrfalcon has an almost legendary disdain for his operatives, when they get killed or captured, he does something about it. That, after all, is what you do.

Gyro.description: If you are reading this something is very wrong.

Hacked Builder.description: Should another Clockwork Android fall due to unforeseen circumstances or job hazards the Builders are there to rebuild the fallen Android on the job. This Clockwork has been reprogrammed by the Resistance.

Hacked Cleaner.description: Cleaners are designed for simple labor intensive tasks like cleaning, welding, and repairing other Clockwork. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves. This Clockwork has been reprogrammed by the Resistance.

Hacked Dismantler.description: Dismantlers are occasionally called in when their plasma torches can be put to use to tear apart crumbling or collapsed buildings. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units. This Clockwork has been reprogrammed by the Resistance.

Hacked Lifter.description: Lifters, as their name indicates, do a lot of the heavy lifting and construction. They are able to easily lift machinery and building materials that previously could only be lifted by powerful cranes. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units. This Clockwork has been reprogrammed by the Resistance.

Hacked Medical Orb.description: Battle Orbs are equipped with a wide variety of equipment loads. Some units serve a defensive and support oriented role, while others are more about bringing additional suppressive fire and offense.

Hacked Mender.description: Menders are often seen repairing broken structures and machines, including other Androids. Their top priority is to keep the other Androids in tip-top working condition. This Clockwork has been reprogrammed by the Resistance.

Hacked Morale Orb.description: Battle Orbs are equipped with a wide variety of equipment loads. Some units serve a defensive and support oriented role, while others are more about bringing additional suppressive fire and offense.

Hacked Shield Orb.description: Battle Orbs are equipped with a wide variety of equipment loads. Some units serve a defensive and support oriented role, while others are more about bringing additional suppressive fire and offense.

Hacked Sweeper.description: Sweepers are often seen patrolling the street cleaning up litter and debris to make Praetoria a more beautiful place to live. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves. This Clockwork has been reprogrammed by the Resistance.

Halox von Horn.description: Son of a wealthy antiques dealer, von Horn developed his powers after unleashing a spirit from its confines in an old fortune teller's crystal ball.

Hamidon.description: Hamidon is the nucleus of a giant single celled organism, spawned from some twisted primordial soup. It has but one instinct, to devour the Earth and all that infests it.

Hamidon Bud.description: Although defeated, it seems the pieces of the Hamidon are still a threat. Left uncheck, it is likely that each piece could one day grow to become as big a menace as the original. It must be stopped.

Hand of Artemis.description: The highest ranks in the Knives of Artemis are small in number. In addition to being deadly combatants, they must be able to adhere to and foster a strict code of honor. Some consider honor among mercenaries hypocrisy of the highest order, they just don't say so in front of any Knives.

Hand of Artemis Quantum.description: The highest ranks in the Knives of Artemis are small in number. In addition to being deadly combatants, they must be able to adhere to and foster a strict code of honor. Some consider honor among mercenaries hypocrisy of the highest order, they just don't say so in front of any Knives.

Harbinger.description: Harbinger is an elite member of the Seers who holds the rank of Augur. She has been sent to provide command and control of the Failed Experiments; disposable troops for the war against Primal Earth.

Harbinger of Bat'zul.description: These demons are the servitors of Bat'Zul, a powerful demon prince rumored to be trapped somewhere.

HardMode Objective Trigger.description: Oh no, you found the trampoline! Naughty naughty.

Hardcase.description: Hardcase is a professional demon hunter. Demon hunters as a general rule don't live very long, so the fact that he is a veteran is a testament to his skills or luck. Hardcase has come to St. Martial to deal with the demons who plague the area, and is looking for freelancers who aren't afraid to tuss with the monsters.

Hardened Citizen.description: This citizen has managed to find a way to survive in First Ward despite the numerous threats to survival one may encounter in this lost part of Praetoria.

Hardened Resistance Commando.description: Resistance Commandos are surviving soldiers from the last wars before Cole's world order took over. They are well trained, disciplined, elite fighters armed with some of the best modified weapons the resistance can slap together.

Harlequin Fencer.description: These capering minions look bright and cheerful in their motley but they are a grave threat. They are masters of the blade, prodding their enemy with pinpoint knife throwing and then using vicious sword attacks when in melee. Their place in the Carnival hierarchy is low.

Harlequin Juggler.description: These deadly troubadours use their dexterity to turn juggling rings into attacks. Their lightning reflexes combine with electricity charged rings to provide quite a show. They wear the masks that are equipped to all the Carnival. These masks increase the healing rate of all these tricksters, among other things.

Harold.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Harpy.description: One of the more dramatic transformations caused by an allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, the Harpy has lost almost all resemblance to her former human self. This woman has now become a humanoid bird with exceptional vision and the ability to fly. Because of her extremely keen senses and superior mobility, the Harpy makes an excellent scout and archer.

Harpy Essence.description: This Talons of Vengeance essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Harridan.description: The Harridans are among the most monstrous members of the Talons of Vengeance. They are fully transformed hybrids between woman and serpent, with almost no trace of the person they once were emerging from their hideous faces. They are extremely powerful swordswomen, capable of cutting through their enemies with speed and precision. Worse still, they make full use of their terrifying appearance to control their enemies, even to the point of turning them to stone.

Hatched Kraken.description: The recently Hatched Kraken appears to be a mutation of the strange Hydra Spawn that live in the sewers. The Hatched Kraken is quite powerful and can destroy full teams of heroes without effort.

Hatchet.description: Hatchet is known in the Resistance for his 'pet' ghoul, a monster that he trained on his own. Many fear ever having to fight Hatchet, knowing that he is not one to show any mercy.

Hatred Monument.description: This monument seems to pulse with power.

Hauler Bot.description: Lifters, as their name indicates, do a lot of the heavy lifting and construction. They are able to easily lift machinery and building materials that previously could only be lifted by powerful cranes. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units.

Headman.description: The Rikti have come to stand for everything humans hate and fear in the universe. Their unprovoked invasion of Earth has left much of the planet traumatized and angry. Even out of their battle armor, their high-tech weaponry makes Rikti dangerous opponents.

Headman Blaster.description: Mutates are fearsome, dedicated fighters, and their leaders, the Headmen, prefer to be in the thick of the fighting. Headmen have more advanced mutations than their followers, and they're not afraid to charge into combat with anyone who stands in their path.

Headman Essence.description: This Rikti essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Headman Gunman.description: It's not clear whether these Reflections copy the Rikti of Paragon City, or those of the Rikti homeworld. Some of the forces at Firebase Zulu have theorized the former, since these Reflections are well-armed and trained for combat.

Headman Quantum Gunner.description: Mutates are fearsome, dedicated fighters, and their leaders, the Headmen, prefer to by in the thick of the fighting. Headmen have more advanced mutations than their followers, and they're not afraid to charge into combat with anyone who stands in their path.

Headman Quantum Soldier.description: The Rikti battle armor is more advanced than any armor found on Earth. It offers the alien invaders protection from most normal kinds of physical attack. Armed with powerful energy weapons, these armored soldiers continue to pose a deadly threat to humans everywhere.

Headman Rifleman.description: Mutates are fearsome, dedicated fighters, and their leaders, the Headmen, prefer to be in the thick of the fighting. Headmen have more advanced mutations than their followers, and they're not afraid to charge into combat with anyone who stands in their path.

Headman Swordsman.description: Mutates are fearsome, dedicated fighters, and their leaders, the Headmen, prefer to be in the thick of the fighting. Headmen have more advanced mutations than their followers, and they're not afraid to charge into combat with anyone who stands in their path.

Health Kit.description: Use this health kit to buy and sell inspirations.

Heavy Assault Suit.description: These assault suits have been developed by the Rikti specifically to deal with super powered enemies. They provide excellent protection and firepower and provide excellent flight capabilities.

Heavy Brawler.description: The members of the Resistance in the Unified People's Army make up those who were loyal to Calvin Scott's vision. They were unphased when it was revealed that he had a mental disorder causing him to believe that Aurora Pena was his wife; what mattered was the goal of fighting for the freedom of a new tomorrow. They fight now in the Unified People's Army with the belief that they stand for the freedom of mankind, even if mankind doesn't realize it.

Heavy Commander.description: IDF Heavy Commanders can lead the Heavy Troopers into combat or occasionally supply heavy support on their own to a unit. They overcome the short range flaws of the Heavy Trooper with the addition of plasma machine guns to handle close range foes.

Heavy Trooper.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Heavy Troopers wear heavy Power Armor with jump boosters as well as shoulder mounted rocket launchers that are capable of delivering a powerful nerve gas that can cripple enemies.

Helen.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Helix.description: Dr. Helix is a brilliant geneticist who is working with the Resistance. A one time associate of Dr. Hetzfeld's, she left the mad doctor's employ when he abandoned her in the tunnels during one of her observation forays. A chance meeting with Crow saved her from certain death at the hands of the Ghouls, and lead to her joining up with the Resistance. Her special environmental suit allows her to turn completely undetectable, making her a valuable asset for reconnaissance and covert operations.

Hell Rider.description: It's unclear how long these eerie ghosts have floated along the desolate streets of Paragon City, or what force has held them to this world. One thing alone is clear: they seem to be angry with you.

Hellfire Demonling.description: These infernal single-minded creatures born of the Abyss seek only to cause mayhem, destruction and suffering on the material plane.

Hellfire Gargoyle.description: Born in the depths of the abyss, wreathed in unholy flames, these demons allow themselves to be bound by their masters only to cause destruction on the material plane.

Hellfrost.description: The deepest bowels of the Pit births these monstrosities. Beware their Infernal Blades, for it is said they tear far more than just flesh. Some claim bits of their victims souls are shorn away as well.

Hellfrost Lord.description: The Lords of the Hellfrosts come from the deepest frozen layers of Hell, and use techniques as ancient as their realm. These demons eschew swords for sprouting toxic icicles across their bodies to flay unfortunate souls.

Hellion Informant.description: In the satanic worldview of the Hellions, falling is a good thing. The Fallen have proven their willingness to take on any power the gang's mystic artifacts can give them, no matter how twisted or base. The hellfire that burns within them protects them from fire but leaves them susceptible to cold.

Hellion Prisoner.description: The Zigursky Prison, or 'Zig' as it's known on the street, houses the most dangerous criminals in Paragon City. Despite the Zig's advanced security systems, a few hardened criminals occasionally escape. With nothing but time on their hands, these cons stop at nothing to win their freedom.

Helot of Darkness.description: These warriors of the Ravenna Conclave are unassuming, but fierce. Few report back to tell the stories of engaging one of them in combat, but those who do give wild and unbelieveable accounts of their prowess being mixed with magic.

Hematic Seedling.description: Hematic Seedlings are the Seed's cardiovascular entities. Every Hematic Seedling alive allows the Seed to drain the vitality from the bodies of anyone who would oppose it, lowering their Resistance and Defense as well as weakening the effects of all healing on them.

Henry.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Heracles.description: This Warrior tough has stolen Stephanie Peebles' wedding band. It would mean a lot to her if you could get it back.

Herald.description: The masters called Heralds have sharpened their mental focus to a deadly weapon. They can use the power of their will to render their enemies helpless before their weapons.

Herald of Bat'zul.description: These demons are the servitors of Bat'Zul, a powerful demon prince rumored to be trapped somewhere.

Herculean.description: These violent creatures appear to be manifestations of the power released from Pandora's Box. Why they have taken form themselves, rather than inhabiting a host, you cannot say.

Hercules Class Titan.description: The Hercules class is the smallest Titan unit employed by Malta. It is believed that the technology used to create them came to this covert villain group sometime during or after the fall of the Soviet Union. It has not yet been determined if the Titans are simply robots, or something more. Their offensive capabilities are many and varied.

Herder.description: The older, more mature plant creatures serve as leaders for their deadly cousins. They're stronger, tougher, and more deadly than the lesser plant creatures. They also have the ability to summon forth Swarms to further trouble their enemies.

Hero 1.description:
After his father, Hero One died, the rough and tumble bloke from London who would become Hero 1 was hesitant at taking up the mantle and legacy of his predecessor. The key to the mantle was blood, of which all who bore the legacy was descended from the same bloodline, of which their ancestry could be traced back to the ancient fae of England. The fae were charged long ago to keep Excalibur safe, and so the responsibilities fell to the son.

Initially, he did not want the responsibility that came with being a super-powered hero, and was angry and upset at the course his father had laid out for him. But when he found the cave where the Lady of the Lake, his future patron was, she calmed him down, seeing who he would become in the future and so his destiny was changed forever. The power from the Lady along with the sword Excalibur empowered him greatly, although he was unaware he was what would later be known as an Incarnate.

Hero Corps Field Analyst.description: Hero Corps has dispatched this Field Analyst to provide services for your supergroup.

Hero Statue.description: This is a memorial statue dedicated to one of the great heroes of Paragon City.

Hetman.description: A Crusader of the Resistance, the Hetman serves as the Survivor Compound's de facto leader in First Ward. He opposes Anna's claim to its Throne as Palatine, and has performed a ruthless military coup to end it.

Hewer.description: The age-old axe has always been a popular weapon, especially for those looking to quickly cause great amounts of gruesome damage with both speed and finesse. That descriptions sums up the Hewers perfectly.

Hewer Elite.description: Those Warriors most experienced with the axe can work themselves into a wild frenzy as they heedlessly chop through the opposition. The more damage they do, the more confident and resilient they become, shaking off damage in their berserker blood lust.

High Roller.description: High Roller may not have been the most powerful villain in the world back in his heyday, but now's he's fallen on some pretty hard times. There may be little honor among theives, but sometimes it's okay to give another guy a break. Hey, one day you might be in the same kind of spot.

High-Explosive Missile Turret.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a High-Explosive Missile Turret. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'When you need maximum defense and cost is no concern, the Hi-Explosive Missile Turret is the premier choice. It's high-powered explosive rockets can ruin the day for nearly any attacker.'

Hired Scientist.description: This civilian is in the wrong place at the wrong time, supporting or working with a cause that clashes with your values.

Hive of Anger.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. A Hive of Anger is a singularity of smaller apparitions, forming a mass of negative emotion so strong that it can draw lesser beings under its sway, increasing its own power.

Hollow Point.description: Forgotten by his unit and left for dead behind enemy lines, for Hollow Point escaping from that hell was only the beginning of the war. One by one he is making those who abandoned him realize the scope of their mistake.

Hollow Reaper.description:
Within the spirit realm, there are none who do not fear the Hollow Reapers, the highest rank amongst the Unseelie Court.

When our two worlds are at their closest, before the eve of Halloween, these fallen fae wield their spectral scythes to tear open rifts through which the malevolent beings of the spirit realm attempt invade our world.

Holo Man.description: Holo Man is an ingenious inventor who developed a portable holograph and force field projector technology in hopes of becoming wealthy off the entertainment industry. When the Rikti War came, he instead used it to fight off the alien invaders, and has turned to the life of a hero since then.

Holodisplay.description: The Holodisplay provides improved monitoring for base security, increasing the control generated for the base.

Hombre.description: When a Crusher has shown his true dedication to the group he is put through another Gauntlet. Those who pass the test are elevated to Hombres and are given the symbolic tattoos fitting of their station. Hombres have no need of weapons as the immense strength afforded by their increased Fixodine use is more than enough to make them deadly adversaries.

Home Companion.description: Cleaners are designed for simple labor intensive tasks like cleaning, welding, and repairing other Clockwork. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves.

Honored Brute.description: The most powerful Brutes know that it's best to weaken the enemy before charging into the fray. These creatures love to drain their enemies' Endurance before entering battle. Another favorite tactic is to use the power of their crystals to slow their foes' movement and attack speed.

Honoree.description: The Honoree was formerly Hero 1, the hero who was sent to the Rikti homeworld and successfully destroyed the bridge between their world and ours. Hero 1 was captured on the Ritki homeworld and subjected to mutations similar to what the Lost undergo. Having spent many months reconditioning with the help of several powerful psychics, he now aids Vanguard where he can.

Hooded Lantern.description: The Drudges' Hooded Lanterns are powered by the wax of souls which they collect and use as currency. This torch flickers and floats before you, moving at the whim of the Taskmasters who control the Drudges' hierarchy.

Hooligan.description: The Hooligans have distinguished themselves among their brethren their acts of shocking cruelty. It's not uncommon to see a helpless villager or beast being tormented by a happy Hooligan; in fact, they like no sound better than the sound of tears.

Hopkins.description: Hopkins is the devoted servant and bodyguard of the mysterious Countess Crey. Since the day he was hired, he's been at her side constantly, rarely venturing outside the range of her voice. Hopkins is clearly the second in command in the Crey hierarchy.

Hoplite of Umbra.description: Hoplites in the Ravenna Conclave are ones who have given their lives to the pursuit of advancing the overall security of the society. They have earned the respect of the elders and the ruling class, and been inducted into the Path of the Dark fully.

Horde.description: It's unclear how long these eerie ghosts have floated along the desolate streets of Paragon City, or what force has held them to this world. One thing alone is clear: they seem to be angry with you.

Hordeling Berserker.description: From the nightmares of Hell's sinners come these disgusting creatures, nightmares born of fire, brimstone, and hate.

Hordeling Hurler.description: From the nightmares of Hell's sinners come these disgusting creatures, nightmares born of fire, brimstone, and hate.

Hordeling Lasher.description: From the nightmares of Hell's sinners come these disgusting creatures, nightmares born of fire, brimstone, and hate.

Horror.description: Humanity's dark desire for mindless mayhem and destruction have been channeled by the Banner of Mayhem.  The results are these creatures that are fueled by the need to blindly destroy everything around them.

Howler Wolf.description: Howler Wolves are fierce predators of the wild and have been called to aid you. They primarily attack with biting jaws in an attempt to cripple their victims.

Hro'Dtohz.description: The Supreme Commander of the Rikti Lineage of War, Hro'Dtohz is the one responsible for commanding the vast power of the Rikti Military in the war against Earth. A ruthless tactical genius with his own twisted code of honor, he is set on humanity's extermination or subsumption.

Huge Cable.description: These strange living spires are somehow connected with Hamidon's ability to control the creatures of the Devouring Earth.

Hunter.description: Genetically altered to have a hyper developed medulla oblongata, Ghouls produce adrenaline at a prodigious rate, enhancing their strength, speed, and aggressiveness. Packs of hunters prowl the tunnels beneath Praetoria, eating anything and everything they can get their hands on, sometimes even each other.

Huntmaster.description: The Spirit Stalkers are the souls of predators bound to the twisted will of Shadow Hunter, the embodiment of Nature's primal need for life to feed on life. While other creatures are ruled by the laws of Nature, mankind has ever sought to dominate it instead. Shadow Hunter has harnessed this instinct and molded the ruthless will of man into his deadly Huntmasters. No creature is beyond their cruel ambition to hunt down and make into a trophy to display their dominance.

Huntress.description: This young woman has sworn her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, a powerful force of fanatical warriors who seek to punish those who have committed particulary egregious offenses of oathbreaking, betrayal and deceit. The Huntress remains mostly human, and is a skilled archer with the means to ensnare her targets and then to quickly dispatch them with a barrage of arrows.

Hussar.description: The elite troops of Nemesis' army have tremendous discipline and skill that allows them to stand fast in the face of danger. They carry a deadly weapon that melds a scorching flamethrower with a powerful Gatling gun, giving them all the firepower they need for any foe.

Hydra.description: The alien Rikti created the Hydra to guard their secret bases beneath the city. It seems programmed to attack anything that isn't Rikti. Heroes must stop this creature from growing any larger and threatening the city as a whole.

Hydra Growth Control Pylon.description: This pylon appears to be retrofitted with some bio-electric gel packs. Presumably, this is what is keeping the Kraken under their control and so large.

IDX Blinker.description: Members of the Freakshow's IDX faction were some of the first to assist in the Freaklok's start-up, knowing the path forward to Bile was inevitable and his patronage was all but assured. They are efficient and thorough collectors, and erasers, of information under Bile's leadership. The 'Blinker' is proficient in the skillset of data collection.

IDX Virus.description: Members of the Freakshow's IDX faction were some of the first to assist in the Freaklok's start-up, knowing the path forward to Bile was inevitable and his patronage was all but assured. They are efficient and thorough collectors, and erasers, of information under Bile's leadership. The 'Virus' is proficient in the skillset of data erasure.

IVy.description: Mk-VI "Victoria" androids are a deadly assassin android model. Unlike the ACU, BCU and Warwalkers these cunning automatons prefer to employ stealth to engage in melee and deliver killing blows to their enemies.

Ice Mistral.description: Irena Rudenko was chosen by one of the Monks of the Four Winds to become the Ice Mistral. Receiving the power changed her; she retained the icy-cold aloofness and desire for mastery of the wind, but none of the control. Her own rage overrode the honor normally imbued to the Knights of the Wind and she went on a mad killing spree. Scirocco took her under his wing to protect her from the Monks - many of which have fallen trying to reclaim their lost power.

Ice Thorn Caster.description: The frigid magics of the Ice Casters take careful study to master. In the hands of these mages, ice becomes a deadly weapon, either shredding enemies with jagged blasts or freezing them in place and chilling them to their bones.

Ice Wind.description: Through special alchemies and meditations, masters of the Ice Wind technique have taken on the powers of winter's fiercest storms. Their chilling techniques can leave a foe frozen and helpless beneath an onslaught of ice.

Icecap.description: Orphaned in the bitter-cold mountains of Nepal this young man made a pact with the harsh spirits of frost and ice to bring their pain wherever he walked.

Icedrone.description:
Icedrone was a brilliant mechanic who had a project on the side - the creation of super-powered gloves that could control ice.

He was forced to use a prototype version of his gloves when the Hellions attacked his shop one day. The shop burned to the ground, but Icedrone was able to defeat the Hellions. Icedrone abandoned his career as a mechanic that day to take up fighting crime in Paragon, though he has been known to let his own political views get in the way of his crime-fighting.

Icepick.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Icon Employee.description: This Icon Employee will provide tailor services for your Supergroup.

Igniter.description: This crystal taps into the fires of other realms to cause minor damage over time to targets in range.

Illusion of Cortex.description: Cortex is messing with your reality!

Illusionist.description: The Carnival Illusionists are as deadly as they are elegant. Their masks enhance their natural psychic abilities and allow them to create deadly mental illusions. These powers attack their opponents' minds directly and can convince them that they are being wounded, among other things. The Illusionists are also trained to use the power of their minds to fly.

Immanence.description: The Immanence was once a psychic who embraced her power and made little effort to contain it. Unlike the Mindstorms, who maintain their corporeal form through sheer force of will, the Immanence allowed her power to expand and become so overwhelming that her body simply dematerialized, leaving nothing but a manifestation of living psionic energy. The Immanence is a being who represents the raw power of a mind unfettered by the body. They can twist their own energy to manipulate the world around them, creating voids and fields of deadly psionic force. Their power has evolved to the point where they are even capable of creating living fragments of their own essence to assist them in combat.

Immature Protector Clone.description: This Paragon Protector looks to have made it into the field a little too early.

Immense Image of Aurora Borealis.description: Before the Rikti War, Aurora Scott was just a fledgling hero doing her best for the city she loved. Afterward, she was something else entirely. Aurora played host to Sister Psyche's mind after the Freedom Phalanx heroine was injured in the war. After gladly sacrificing her autonomy so that Sister Psyche could continue to serve, Aurora's just now returning to her own life. And she's got a few bones to pick with the villains who flourished in her absence. However, part of Aurora went with Sister Psyche and became trapped in the woman's mind. Now, this 'Aurora Psyche' is doing everything she can to escape - with help from Malaise!

Immense Image of Malaise.description: Jean-Pierre Lourdin was not always a hero. He began his career as a villain in Europe, using the twisted images in his mind to commit robberies. With INTERPOL hot on his trail he landed in Paragon City, where his broken thoughts were detected by Sister Psyche. She confronted him and after an intense battle was able to subdue him. She spent months healing the damage to his mind and has taught him more productive uses of his abilities. Sister Psyche vouched for him with the authorities and he has been allowed to help with the current crisis in Paragon City. Many are keeping a watchful eye on Malaise, however, for signs of his madness returning.

Immunes Engineer.description: The tactics of the Engineer have been honed through countless battles. They function as a secondary team amongst the Centurions and Legionarii, performing quick strikes to the weakest points in their enemies armor.

Immunes Surgeon.description: The Surgeons have long been the healers among the Cimeroran. They have trained at their craft for most of their live seeking to aid those surrounding them.

Immunes Surgeon Essence.description: This Cimeroran Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Impending Death.description: The inside of Mot is a place of unrelenting despair, with the chill of death encroaching with every moment.

Imperious.description: Born from both God and Man, Imperious commands the forces of Justice against the armies of darkness. His Pantheon of heroes fight at his side without question. He is truly the leader of these people and the visionary of the future.

Implacable Anchorite.description: The Implacable Anchorites are well-trained in the mystical arts and serve as commanders in the Carnival of Vengeance, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes it would be better to join the Talons of Vengeance, rather than resist them. Many of them can trace their origins back to the Midnight Squad of Praetoria, but others have been derived from the followers of Vanessa DeVore.

Improved Drone.description: During the Rikti War these flying Drones swarmed all over the city's skies. Today these machines still sweep through the air with some frequency. Their quick evasive maneuvering, sophisticated scanners and powerful energy cannon make them a constant menace.

Improved Igniter.description: This crystal taps into the fires of other realms to cause moderate damage over time to targets in range.

Improved Type 22.description: These genetically altered humans are given the cold numeric moniker Type 22, suggesting that they were part of an earlier batch of experiments. Genetic meddling has given them immense strength and speed, at the cost of extremely rapid cellular decay.

Improved Type 53.description: More advanced genetic creations than their Type 22 counterparts, the Type 53 was created as a command and control unit, as well as a test bed for advanced genetic manipulation. The Type 53 has a targeting computer surgically installed in its head, enabling it to designate a target to its comrades. Genetic meddling has given them immense strength and speed, but once again at the cost of extremely rapid cellular decay.

Improved Type 90.description: Advanced genetic abominations; the Type 90 appears to be intended as a mass-produced replacement for Power's Division members. They are stronger, faster, and tougher than their compatriots, leading them from the front and inspiring them to fight harder and longer than humanly possible. Genetic meddling has given them immense strength and speed, but once again at the cost of extremely rapid cellular decay.

Incandescent.description:
Incandescent is the head of the Herald division of Vanguard and is ultimately responsible for public relations as well as liaising with the United Nations.

Kelly Dupuis was an environmental lobbyist charged with protecting the bayou of Louisiana. On a fact finding mission in the swamps she was separated from her group and had a life-changing encounter with a mystically charged Will-oâ€™-the-wisp. It imbued her with the power of a living energy sourceâ€¦ and a clean one at that.

Incarnate Warhulk.description: Whatever process Nemesis used to empower his Jaegers, it's now clear that it also applies to his Warhulks. The power of Pandora's Box has made these creations far stronger than they ever were before.

Incendiary Missile Turret.description: The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'When the Crey labs came up with a powerful new incendiary formula, it didn't take us a minute to think of modifying our already popular Missile Turrets to take advantage of it. We think you'll like the results.'

Inciter.description: This young woman has sworn her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, a powerful force of fanatical warriors who seek to punish those who have committed particulary egregious offenses of oathbreaking, betrayal and deceit. The Inciter remains mostly human, and is a swift, vicious opponent who favors moving in for deadly strikes with her imbued claws.

Infantry.description: The Rikti have come to stand for everything humans hate and fear in the universe. Their unprovoked invasion of Earth has left much of the planet traumatized and angry. Even out of their battle armor, their high-tech weaponry makes Rikti dangerous opponents.

Infected RIP.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Infernal.description: A master of demon binding and summoning from another dimension, Infernal's boundless willpower allows him to control the many fiends he has forced into his service. As a member of the Vindicators, he often assists Numina of the Freedom Phalanx.

Infernia.description: Infernia and her twin sister Glacia spent years battling each other before the Rikti attacked. United for the first time, they fought side-by-side and volunteered for the Omega team together. Like all members of the Omega team, their fate had been a mystery until now. Now they've returned to Earth, and they have some important news to tell.

Inferno Raider.description: The basic Sky Raider infantrymen, Assault Raiders are usually found inside buildings where flight packs wouldn't be an asset. They are typically armed with submachine guns, flamethrowers, or other weapons suitable for fighting in confined spaces.

Inferno of Flame.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Flame has learned to harness their magic into fiery blasts.

Infested ACU.description: The most advanced of the Warworks shock troopers. These towering androids carry a heavy PGMP Rifle that is capable of delivering a deadly neurotoxin payload.

Infested Assault Trooper.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Assault Troopers are equipped with an upgraded Plasma Glove and Power Armor with jump boosters, making them resistant to all types of damage.

Infested Augur.description: Augurs are the elite amongst the Seers and are masters of mind control. They are capable of crippling their enemies with powerful mental assaults then moving in for the kill.

Infested BCU.description: The most basic unit in the Warworks arsenal. These models are equipped with a heavy assault PGMP Rifle and both nano-repair technology and force fields.

Infested Diviner.description: Diviners are among the elite of Mother Mayhem's Seers. They are mid-rank combatants among the elite. They specialize in crushing their foes in close range combat.

Infested Elite Ranger.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Elite Rangers are terrifying foes to engage. Their weaponry is far more advanced than the PPD Shock Glove, and they are decked out in nearly impenetrable power armor.

Infested Heavy Trooper.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Heavy Troopers wear heavy Power Armor with jump boosters as well as shoulder mounted rocket launchers that are capable of delivering a powerful nerve gas that can cripple enemies.

Infested Ranger.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Rangers are equipped with an upgraded Plasma Glove and Power Armor, making them resistant to all types of damage.

Infested Scryer.description: Scyers are among the elite of Mother Mayhem's Seers. They make up the rank and file combatants among the elite. They specialize in tearing their foes minds apart with their mental assault while peering into the mind of their foes to find their weakness.

Infested Seeker.description: Seekers are among the elite of Mother Mayhem's Seers. They make up the rank and file combatants among the elite. Seekers have the ability to mend others wounds with their minds as well as augment their allies with mental wards.

Infested Shock Trooper.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force Troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Shock Troopers are terrifying foes to engage. Their weaponry is far more advanced than the PPD Shock Glove, and they are decked out in nearly impenetrable power armor.

Infested T.E.S.T. Leader.description: Tactical Engagement Strike Team Leaders are always selected from within the ranks. They are trained to take down lawbreakers hard and fast with no concern for secondary objectives like avoiding collateral damage.

Infested T.E.S.T. Provost.description: Anything that pulls a PPD Provost out of their Monitor Sphere information nexus has to be considered a severe threat. In order to insure their safety, Provosts don the state of the art in PPD protective gear to restore order in the most extreme cases of lawbreaking.

Infested T.E.S.T. Ranger.description: The final physical challenge that a member of the PPD goes through in order to be admitted into the Tactical Engagement Strike Team is speculated about in hushed whispers all over Praetoria. Those who succeed won't speak of it and those who fail don't survive the experience.

Infiltrator.description: The stone-faced, suit clad Field Agents are Crey's main investigative branch. They can be found carrying out a variety of missions, from espionage to assassination ops. They carry the latest weapons and receive intense close combat training.

Infinity.description: Infinity commands the robots, all creations of his own hands. He seems to have a vendetta against the valley, one that you are caught in the middle of.

Infurno.description: The girl who would become Infurno was a college student working on a degree in "Undecided" until a friend got involved in an experiment that granted her a fur coat and super-powers. With the help of an aspiring mage, she managed to acquire a sample of the feline genetic serum involved to put her own unique twist on it. After a ritual involving a small amount of the sample, a few carefully selected magical components and a candle flame, the college student was transformed into a fiery force for justice.

Inhibitor.description: The Inhibitors are sometimes said to be the most difficult of Neurons creations to deal with. They are built to make it difficult for any opponent to do what they are good at. This ability to negate the strengths of their foe make the Inhibitors a frustrating, and potentially deadly opponent.

Inimical Eremite.description: The Inimical Eremites are well-trained in the mystical arts and serve as commanders in the Carnival of Vengeance, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes it would be better to join the Talons of Vengeance, rather than resist them. They can trace their origins back to the Legacy Chain, and retain some of their armor and accoutrements.

Initiate.description: For some, magic comes naturally, while others may take centuries to master it. Cabal initiates are still learning the ways of the winds. Their powers are meager, and so they arm themselves with daggers. Over the years, they have become quite skilled in their use.

Insect Pod.description: This is a webbed cocoon used to hold human-sized subject.

Instigator.description: This Praetorian Citizen is not only angry, but their preaching has driven others into anger against Cole and the government. They've even brought improvised weapons with the pretense of taking the fight to Cole. Who do these people think they are fooling?

Interrogator Kang.description: Interrogator Kang is one of the veteran agents of the Ministry of Intelligence. He is known to be one of the best case workers in the city because he was working the job before Seers came along.

Invention Worktable.description: The Invention Worktable is an required to make Enhancements in your base. Selecting it allows you to create Enhancements and other items from salvage you have collected.

Iron Crane.description: Iron Crane is the eldest of Sun Xiong's favored disciples. He has trained rigorously for decades, hardening his body and learning to strike with deadly speed.

Iron Ellis.description: Iron Ellis is a decorated Hero Corps hero, having served in the first and second Rikti Wars and only being moved from his office in Galaxy City because it was literally bombarded with meteors. Ellis has been working quietly behind the scenes since the attack, issuing orders to other members and assigning contracts with ruthless efficiency. Many of his friends and co-workers worry that his carefree attitude was lost in Galaxy City, but the truth is he's never been more effective than he is today, in the wake of the disaster.

Iron Hands.description: Masters of the Iron Hand technique have trained their fists to break metal. They have detailed knowledge of human pressure points, which they use to drain the life from a foe and replace their own energies.

Iron Strongman.description: After serving the Carnival loyally for a year and a day, the Bronze Strongmen are presented with a mallet made of cold iron that is a symbolic representation of their loyalty as well as a fearsome weapon. The Iron Strongmen are the backbone of the Carnival's physical threat level.

Iron Widow.description: Iron Widow is the secretive leader of the Scrapyarders ever since the murder of Scrapyard at the hands of the deadly Captain Mako. She handles most of the Scrapyarder operations out of Paragon City to avoid death at the hands of Cage Consortium and Arachnos assassins who find her agenda to disruptive to operations on the Rogue Isles.

Isa Rune.description: These strange runes glow ominously with unstable mystic energy.

J.P. Mason.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Jack.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Jack Hammer.description: Jack Hammer is a veteran of the Resistance, willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done. This includes injecting himself with just the right amount of Fixodyne to keep himself sane during the job, but powerful enough to stand toe to toe with members of the Powers Division.

Jack in Irons.description: Believe it or not, this burly giant is proud of his appearance. He adorns himself with the severed heads of his victims, and he takes great pleasure in the panic these accessories evoke. Jack wandered the spirit plane for centuries until the Red Caps found him and brought him to Croatoa. All in all, he's pleased with his new digs. There are plenty of people to frighten, and that suits him fine.

Jackie.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Jade Spider.description: It was a trick!  Defeat the Giant Spider before it destroys all of Paragon City!

Jaeger.description: Jaegers take their name from the German word for 'hunter'. They're some of the strangest and most advanced combat robots to ever stalk the streets of Paragon City. Nemesis seems to have a limitless supply of these steam-powered killers, each armed with powerful ranged or melee weaponry.

James.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jane Temblor.description: Jane Temblor, aka Faultline, is the Praetorian double of hero Jim Temblor. Jane's history is similar to Jim's, despite the obvious, though there are rumors her Earth control has something to do with a possible Devouring Earth influence on her parents.

Janet.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Janey Taylor.description: Janet Taylor is one of a group of four mystics who were investigating Croatoa's strange transformation of Salamanca. They may be the only thing standing between Salamanca and the spirit world.

Jason.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jason the Toaster.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Jayce Kakaris.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Jean Louard.description: The agenda of this mysterious man is anyone's guess.

Jean-Pierre Lourdin.description: Jean-Pierre Lourdin has the incredible ability to trap the minds of others in a prison of their own worst nightmares. His special gift has made him impossible to track by the Seers, as every time their mind touches his own they go irrevocably mad.

Jeffrey.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jeffy.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Jenkins.description: Arachnos soldiers are well-paid paramilitary commandos who follow orders to the letter.

Jennifer.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jeremy.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Jerry.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jessica.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jessica Flores.description: Jessica Flores is an independent investigative reporter whose agenda is uncovering the media's lies about the Resistance movement and showing people the truth of things. This is a dangerous job, however, and she has adopted several pen names under which she writes her articles in order to hide her identity. She hopes to one day crack the wall of censorship that TPN imposses over any and all stories involving the Resistance movement and its believers.

Jim 'Thunderhead' Bartlett.description: Jim 'Thunderhead' Bartlett was one of the greatest American heroes of World War II. He's not as young as he used to be, but he still knows a thing or two about busting bad guys.

Jim Donner.description: Jim Donner is known for being the former partner of James Noble. The two together were one of the best officers in all of Praetoria. After James died serving overseas, Jim looked after his wife and child. Jim eventually married Jennifer and has since sworn to serve the people of Praetoria in the name of James Noble.

Jimbo.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Jimmy.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Jimmy Crescendo.description: Gambler and crooner, Jimmy Crescendo knows Ted Dubois from their days as military special forces. Jimmy's experiences overseas changed him and he's had problems returning to civilian life. Ted Dubois keeps him around the casino for those times when things get a bit dicey, though he's grown increasingly concerned with Jimmy's obsession with demonology and occult. Ironically, Jimmy has the voice of an angel and keeps the ladies coming around on a nightly basis, but his dark temper and complete lack of humanity make him an ideal strong-arm for the casino.

John.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

John Houston.description: John Houston is TPN's most recognized investigative reporter. He is also regarded as the most annoying television personality of the last decade.

Johnny.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Johnny B Bad.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Johnny Power.description: One of the Nuclear 90, Johnny Power was a rising star that was corrupted by his fame, and betrayed by his ego. When his 500 million dollar movie 'The Power', starring Johnny Power, as himself, completely tanked, he turned to crime to pay the bills. When he realized it was more profitable to keep the money, however, Johnny fled to the Rogue Isles where he enjoyed no shortage of opportunities to use his extraordinary abilities for personal gain.

Johnny Sonata.description: He's the top of the heap, the big cheese, the man himself: Johnny Sonata. Everyone knows who Johnny Sonata is. He sung his way up in the world with his golden voice and charming smile. While he still releases platinum-selling albums every year, he spends much of his time running his casino, the Golden Giza. Johnny is an extremely powerful man, and there are many rumors that say he's tied both to the Family and to Arachnos.

Johnny Sonata's Soul.description: Sold to a demon on a lonely winter night in exchange for fame, wealth, and power, Johnny Sonata's soul may be the last remnant of a different, better, person who might have been. Johnny might want his soul back, but Johnny's Soul might not want to return.

Jose.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Joseph.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Joshua.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Jounin.description: The Jounin Ninja is a master assassins and expert swordsman. A master of stealth and shadow, few ever see them coming.

Joyce.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Juan Hernandez.description: Juan Hernandez is a Crey Vice President in charge of Special Projects. These special projects are clandestine operations that have led to the deaths of dozens of civilians.

Juicer Chief.description: It takes some skill to control death dealing levels of electricity as they course through your nervous system, and Juicer leaders have that control. They can use their implants to generate massive balls of lightning. They're no fun in close combat either, as their punch packs a heck of an electrical wallop.

Juicer Freak.description: Juicers undergo a very specific and unusual cybernetic enhancement, one that sets them apart from all other Freaks and does strange things to their brains. A network of electrical wiring and emitters allows the Juicers to shoot forth great gouts of electrical energy that can devastate their foes.

Juicer Sniper.description: It takes some skill to control death dealing levels of electricity as they course through your nervous system, and Juicer leaders have that control. They can use their implants to generate massive balls of lightning. They're no fun in close combat either, as their punch packs a heck of an electrical wallop.

Jump Bot Incinerator.description: The Jump Bots are a recent addition to the mercenary Sky Raiders' arsenal. Their effectiveness in combat has allowed the Raiders to greatly expand operations. Well armed and armored, the Jump Bots earned their name from their leaping ability, which allows them tremendous maneuverability.

Jurassik.description: The giant monster was dubbed Jurassik by a hero some time ago, and the name has stuck (though the hero has regrettably disappeared). It appears that Jurassik has been mutated by the many pollutants and chemicals in Crey's Folly. Now, it is a creature of pure violence.

Jurassik Rubble.description: Jurassik has fallen, but from the rubble a smaller creature has arisen to vex heroes!

Jutal.description: After enough abuse of the dangerous drug called Superadine, A Troll will start to show some body-changing effects. These Brutes are starting to develop superior strength and power, although nothing like their more veteran kin.

Kadabra Kill.description: In all his travels around the world and to realms unknown, Kadabra Kill seeks a single prize, the salvation of his wife, Sigil. Long ago, when they were both young and foolish, she gave up her soul to save his own. Soon she must pay the ultimate price.

Kalinda.description: As an Arachnos Fortunata, it is Kalinda's task to keep an eye on all new arrivals to Mercy Island. That doesn't mean she's on their side. She is evaluating each new resident for signs of greatness, and for signs of weakness. Kalinda can set you on the path to greatness, or she can make sure you're never heard from again. There are only two things she believes in: the glory of Arachnos, and the survival of the fittest.

Kaolin of Earth.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Earth commands the forces of nature.

Karen.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Kathleen.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Katie.description: Katie's spirit has been trapped here by the spiteful Red Caps. As the youngest of their number, Katie represents the Cabal's hope for the future. If her spirit remains trapped here, they are likely to turn away from all goodness and light in the world.

Katie Douglas.description: Katie Douglas is an ex-seer who escaped from the Seer Network and the authorities and made her way to First Ward. She has worked tirelessly toward freeing other Seers and has enjoyed limited success in the First Ward. To accomplish that feat, however, she has had to lie low and choose her allies very carefully. The Resistance sees her as nothing more than a weapon; politically or literally, and the Loyalists would just as soon place her back into the Network for another 15 years.

Ken Kellerman.description: Ken Kellerman has been kidnapped by Crey. He'll need your help if he's going to escape with his memory intact.

Kenneth.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Keres.description: The Keres is among the oldest and most loyal of all the members of the Talons of Vengeance, having ascended to her current state through the blessing of the Furies themselves. She has been tasked with being a walking engine of death and destruction. She channels the bitter energy of death through all of her attacks, making her already ferocious skill with her titanic axe even more deadly. These vicious combatants are walking embodiments of the inevitability of death to those who cross the Furies.

Kevin.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Keyes Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

Keyes Island Escape Watch.description: This entity is spawned by an escaping WarWalker during the Keyes Island event and will immediately kill itself. This will spur a recount of all active Patrol teams.

Keyes Island Escape Watcher.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Keyes Island Surrogate.description: This entity serves as a Surrogate Antimatter during the span of time in the Keyes event during which he is not present.

Keyes Island Systemic Watcher.description: This entity serves as to suppress Systemic Decay when Antimatter is hidden but present on the map.

Keyes Island Watcher.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Kid Cryonix.description: Alex 'Kid Cryonix' Creed is the 3rd in a set of geneticaly engineered triplets. His brothers Cedric and Dmitri are also heroes in Paragon City. Alex is quick with a joke and takes 'the whole super human thing' very lightly.

Kid Electronix.description: Cedric Creed has always had an 'electric' personality. He was voted 'most likely to have a cereal named after themselves' at his high school. Shortly after graduation his powers manifested. Cedric craves the spotlight and has even hired an agent in his bid to be Paragon City's most famous hero. Cedric is a bit too arrogant and cocky for his own good, but his heart is in the right place.

Kid Hydronix.description: Dmitri Creed is the quiet one. When he does decide to speak, he always seems to make it count. Whether it's a dynamite insult or a well-placed compliment, his timing is always on point. Of the three of his triplet siblings, Dmitri would be considered the most dangerous, because you can't ever seem to know what he's thinking. Not even his guardian, Dr. Coolbreeze, has been able to crack that riddle... just that if Dmitri gets angry with you, you better hope you have gills.

Killer.description: The alpha wolf of Frank McCain's pack of dogs, Killer has a will of his own and doesn't always join McCain in the Coliseum. When there's a genuine threat to the pack Killer is always there.

Kimberly.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Kimberly Kellerman.description: Kimberly Kellerman has been kidnapped by Crey. She'll need your help if she is going to stay alive.

King Midas.description:
Lawrence Langston boasts having one of the most distinguished criminal careers in the Rogue Isles as well as control over a global corporate dynasty.

His reign as 'King Midas' was not without assistance however, and he struck many deals in order to obtain his both literal and figurative power. In a bid to accrue even greater strength, he became Dr. Aeon's science experiment and gained indestructible diamond-like skin in exchange for helping the doctor manipulate affairs within Cap Au Diable.

At a certain point however (likely after the birth of his daughter), King Midas decided to prioritize the future of his loyal Gold Brickers over his dealings with Dr. Aeon, ending what was a colorful 30 year partnership in the shadows.

King Midas?.description:
Lawrence Langston boasts having one of the most distinguished criminal careers in the Rogue Isles as well as control over a global corporate dynasty.

His reign as 'King Midas' was not without assistance however, and he struck many deals in order to obtain his both literal and figurative power. In a bid to accrue even greater strength, he became Dr. Aeon's science experiment and gained indestructible diamond-like skin in exchange for helping the doctor manipulate affairs within Cap Au Diable.

At a certain point however (likely after the birth of his daughter), King Midas decided to prioritize the future of his loyal Gold Brickers over his dealings with Dr. Aeon, ending what was a colorful 30 year partnership in the shadows.

Knight Lance.description: The Knights make up the bulk of the leadership class within the twisted court of the Clockwork King. Cannon Knights possess powerful, long range psychic attacks.

Knight-Errant.description: The Clockwork King's powerful Knights Errant are locking down the Shining Stars!  Defeat the Knights to free them and gain their assistance!

Knockback Object.description: This entity is used to perform knockback effects on NPCs during cutscenes.

Koago.description: This massive Pumicite guards the way to Sam Wincott.

Kraken.description: The Kraken appears to be a mutation of the strange Hydra Spawn that live in the sewers. For unknown reasons, it stalks the streets of Perez Park. The Kraken is quite powerful and can destroy full teams of heroes without effort.

Kronos Class Titan.description: Malaise has created a Nightmare, drawing from the experiences of those whom he battles. This Nightmare has the appearance of the Kronos Class Titan.

Kuularth the Scavenger.description: Kuularth makes his nest in the Repository that feeds parts to the Factory Cubes. His Natterlings roam the Shadow Shard collecting anything and everything that could be useful. They are always accompanied by a Wisp, who Kuularth refers to as 'consultants.' The Wisps' master, Chularn, prefers to call them 'supervisors.'

Lab Equipment.description: This Lab Equipment looks like something from a B-rated sci-fi movie. You can only imagine its diabolical purpose.

Laboratory Control Panel.description: This panel contains critical information regarding Nemesis's Antikythera Amplifier.

Lady.description: The Lady is the mistress of all she surveys. She is responsible for a number of Trainers and Servants. There is a strong bond of fealty that goes both ways in these relationships. With power comes responsibility.

Lady Grey.description:
Ever composed, ever mysterious, the powerful and otherworldly Lady Grey is rumored to be older than Lord Recluse, and one of the most powerful meta-humans on the planet.

She was instrumental in the founding of Vanguard, and runs the organization expertly.

She takes a great interest in Vanguard's day-to-day operations, and knows all of her troops by name.

Lady Jane.description: Lady Jane is the new leader of the Dawn Patrol, ever since Hero 1 stepped through the Rikti portal in an attempt to save Earth from the alien invasion. She's recently been spotted in Paragon City and rumors say she's investigating the whereabouts of surviving Omega team members.

Lady Winter.description: Lady Winter has descended upon Earth with her Winter Hordes in order to cover the entire planet in ice, starting with Agincourt and the Rogue Isles!

Lamashtu.description: Lamashtu is the daughter of Anu, the Sky God. Rather than follow the will of the gods, Lamashtu's malevolence knows no bounds. Left unchecked she threatens to consume and destroy all life. It is for these reasons that Lamashtu was sealed within the Eternal Prison by the gods and the Furies centuries ago. She bears seven names and when called upon in incantations she manifests as seven witches. She is responsible for many of the woes of ancient times. Nightmares, death, plague, sickness, and the wholesale slaughter of men, women, children along with feasting on their blood and bones are all grisly examples of her work. Lamashtu has an enduring hatred for all of creation. It is not surprising then, that she is the mother of all monsters, including those first corrupt creatures which would one day be claimed as servants of the Furies.

Lambda Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

Lambda Sector Turret.description: Armed with plasma weaponry capable of piercing through the toughest of armor, these turrets are an incredibly effective deterrent for keeping trespassers out of the Lambda sector and other vital Praetorian military outposts.

Lambda Sector Watcher.description: This entity kills itself when detecting Marauder in a volume it is spawned in. This triggers failure of his encounter and the event.

Lambent of Light.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Light are the order's lowest-ranking sorcerers.

Lamia.description: The Lamia was once a swift warrior who excelled in hand to hand combat with claw weapons. Through her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, she has been morphed into a fast-moving half-serpent, able to close rapidly with her foes to deliver vicious attacks without mercy.

Lamplighter.description: Lamplighters are tasked with keeping Night Ward's lamps lit and push back the dark forces that hunger for the souls of the dead. However, their spiritual flame is more than just for lighting lamps, it can also ignite one's soul.

Lanaru the Crazed.description: Malaise has created a Nightmare, drawing from the experiences of those whom he battles. This Nightmare has the appearance of Lanaru.

Lance.description: These Syndicate diehards were once initiates who rose through the ranks of their organization through dedication, skill and no small amount of craziness. Sword Masters can cut the very air causing blades of wind to slice at their foes from range.

Lance Corporal.description: Nemesis' officers are some of the best trained soldiers in the world, and they show amazing discipline and devotion to their master. They're armed with the Nemesis lance, a long rifle that can also operate effectively as a spear. Their skill with this weapon makes them deadly at any distance.

Lance Corporal Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Lance Prince.description: The heirs apparent to the Clockwork King's throne, the Princes represent the pinnacle of the mad genius' creations. Although Lance Princes sometimes seem almost human because of their advanced robotic brains, they possess the decidedly inhuman ability to dominate their foes with their will..

Lance Sergeant.description: Nemesis' officers are some of the best trained soldiers in the world, and they show amazing discipline and devotion to their master. They're armed with the Nemesis lance, a long rifle that can also operate effectively as a spear. Their skill with this weapon makes them deadly at any distance.

Lance Sgt Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Lance Sgt Tirailleur.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. This seemingly simple weapon is actually quite versatile. The Tirailleurs have modified their weapons to fire poison gas grenades.

Lancer.description: Although Nemesis likes to dress his soldiers in 19th century style, their weaponry is decidedly modern. Most infantrymen attach their bayonets to special assault rifles that outperform all modern equivalents.

Lancer Surgeon.description: The Battle Surgeons are charged with the vital duty of getting wounded soldiers back into the fight as quickly as possible. Most Nemesis officers frown upon those who refuse to fight again; courage in the face of danger is highly valued in the Nemesis army ranks.

Lancer Surgeon Essence.description: This Nemesis Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Langston Bruiser.description:
After the death of King Midas and the loss of their primary base of operations, the surviving remnants of the Goldbrickers have fled to Kallisti Wharf.

Turning over a new leaf under the leadership of Marigold Langston, the group now seeks to go clean and establish themselves in Paragon City. However, this has drawn the ire of many factions who see the newcomers as a threat.

Burners are part of the security force that protects Langston Corp's facilities. Armed with rocket packs and their patented Smelting Arms, they leverage their Rogue Isles ruggedness to demonstrate why their group is not to be trifled with.

Langston Burner.description:
After the death of King Midas and the loss of their primary base of operations, the surviving remnants of the Goldbrickers have fled to Kallisti Wharf.

Turning over a new leaf under the leadership of Marigold Langston, the group now seeks to go clean and establish themselves in Paragon City. However, this has drawn the ire of many factions who see the newcomers as a threat.

Burners are part of the security force that protects Langston Corp's facilities. Armed with rocket packs and their patented Smelting Arms, they leverage their Rogue Isles ruggedness to demonstrate why their group is not to be trifled with.

Large Cable.description: These strange living spires are somehow connected with Hamidon's ability to control the creatures of the Devouring Earth.

Large Cargo Crate.description: This is a large cargo crate you used to sneak onto the Sky Raider ship. Blast your way out of here!

Large Metal Crate.description: This large crate is used to transport various types of goods.

Larry.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Lars Hansen.description: Lars Hansen has been the light keeper on Striga Isle for longer than most of his neighbors have been alive. He remembers what the island used to be like before the Council moved in: a little seedy, perhaps, but lively and full of hope. Nowadays, no one ventures near the lighthouse that is Lars' home, and he gets a little lonely from time to time. To stave away his sorrows, Lars bides his time by keeping a watch on Council activities. His attention has shifted to Port Noble in recent days, but he is still vigilant as ever.

Laser Drone Essence.description: This Drone essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Laser Trap.description: Trespassers will be ensnared if the laser beams of this trap are tripped.

Last Man on Earth.description: Obviously insane, he is likely the last man on his entire earth. He has nothing more he can lose.

Lastri Kayumanis.description: While Lastri Kayumanis remains a new player in the Rogue Isles, her organization appears to have significant financial resources at its disposal. Less than a week after arriving in Sharkhead, she managed to establish a stable, wide-ranging smuggling operation, complete with a trained and loyal workforce. She has used this network to smuggle military-grade weaponry into the Rogue Isles under the nose of Arachnos, but it is unclear what purpose her employer has in mind for them.

Lattice.description: This giant crystal monster may be the most beautiful of Hamidon's strange creations. It is also one of the deadliest. Lattice will happily slaughter any human being who sets foot within Hamidon's bizarre paradise.

Laura.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Laura Lockhart.description: Laura Lockhart is a military deprogrammer that specializes in countering 5th Column propaganda. She is currently working alongside the Paragon City Police Department, trying to stifle the recent surge in 5th Column activity in the Steel Canyon district.

Lawrence Harken.description: Lawrence Harken is the leader of the citizens who are trying to get Medi-Port Tech to give medi-porters to all the people of Paragon City.

Lead Brick.description: The biggest, baddest, Bricks on the block have complete control over the earth beneath their feet. They can turn soil into quicksand, cause stalagmites to erupt at the snap of a finger and generally make life miserable for anyone they don't like who happens to be standing on the ground.

Lead Freezer.description: The top-dog Freezers are constantly surrounded by an area of cold, even on the hottest summer's day. They can create a host of different cold-based effects, from frost armor for themselves to freezing prisons for their foes.

Lead Quantum Brick.description: The biggest, baddest, Bricks on the block have complete control over the earth beneath their feet. They can turn soil into quicksand, cause stalagmites to erupt at the snap of a finger and generally make life miserable for anyone they don't like who happens to be standing on the ground.

Lead Quantum Scorcher.description: These are the pinnacle pyros of the Outcasts, masters of the element of fire. They can perform a myriad of fiery marvels, one of the flashiest of which is the creation of Fire Imps: malevolent humanoids of pure fire who pounce upon the Scorchers' foes.

Lead Scorcher.description: These are the pinnacle pyros of the Outcasts, masters of the element of fire. They can perform a myriad of fiery marvels, one of the flashiest of which is the creation of Fire Imps: malevolent humanoids of pure fire who pounce upon the Scorchers' foes.

Lead Shocker.description: Experienced Shockers are masters of their chosen element. They soar with the expertise of veteran flyers and can make electricity dance at their commands. They're especially fond of entrapping their rivals in fields of lightning.

Lee.description: One of Frank McCain's dogs, Lee is the youngest and most gentle of the pack. That doesn't keep him from being able to take down a full-grown man

Lefty.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Legacy Chain Rune.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. They've begun placing these protective runes in the area of Fort Darwin to ward off any person who bears the taint of evil. Unfortunately for them, it doesn't seem to be doing the trick.

Legatus Legionis.description: Throughout the battlefield, you can hear the shouts and commands of the Praefectus. They alone can keep the bloodlust and battle frenzy that flows through the veins of every Cimeroran in check.

Legionarii.description: The Legionarii is the backbone to Imperious' army. Ever true to their emperor, despite the odds they face, these men fight harder and longer than any other forces on the battlefield.

LeoKnight.description: This massive Tanker is the older brother of Longbow Agent Caspian. The same Caspian you captured for Vargas. He's angry, he's tough, and beating the villain who caught his little brother is his top priority.

Leon.description: Leon is a moderately experienced hero of Paragon City and has spent most of his time fighting against the Council. He has become hardened by what he has seen, and fights with a cold brutality not often seen in licensed heroes.

Leonard.description: Leonard was once the bodyguard for a man named Thomas Mane. After Thomas Mane's death, Leonard has decided to stay in the Isles and offer his services to those individuals who have his trust.
