Leprechaun.description: This Leprechaun seems to bring you good luck whenever he's near. Leprechauns provide a 10% influence bonus to their owners.

Lesser Devoured.description: The Devoured were once normal human beings, but they have since been transformed into horrifying creatures. Their bodies have been mutated grotesquely, and even their brains have been perverted into believing the radical environmental precepts of the Devouring Earth. In combat they show their hatred for the world of men by spitting poison at their foes.

Lesser Fiend.description: The depraved ugliness festering in the underbelly of humanity is called forth at The Banner of Fiends. These Dark Fiends are a physical manifestation of pure malice, seeking calculated cruelty and malevolence, just because they can.

Lesser Mystic Aspect.description: These horrible creatures are a mere fragment of the wicked Greater Mystic Aspect. Small as they might be they still pose a terrible threat.

Lesser Scorned.description: There is no fury more intense than that of a woman scorned, and The Banner of Scorn has conjured manifestations of wronged women with a bone to pick. They seek eternal revenge for the horrible things that society, and life in general, has inflicted upon them.

Lesser Unbound Nictus.description: These free-floating Nictus have been drawn to Earth from somewhere else on planet, bridging the distance through a Shadow Crystal. They have not yet joined with or possessed a host, and normally could not survive on a planet's surface for long. However, the dark energies of the Shadow Crystal sustain them, allowing them to hunt for hosts on their own.

Lethal Force Authorized.description: The dreadnaughts tend to lead invasion forces due to their incredible resilience and destructive prowess. Wherever the Goliath War Walker goes, a trail of destruction is left in its wake.

Levantera.description:
Levantera and her twin sister Borea lead the Shield, the division of Vanguard tasked with protecting the city and its people from the Rikti.

The two sisters are both extremely capable fighters, and are the chosen Champions of the Order of the Four Winds. However, the sisters rarely see eye-to-eye with each other, and often argue over the best methods to accomplish their goals.

While Levantera likes to cultivate a more cultured appearance than her sister, she's also the more offensively-minded of the two. She believes that the best kind of counter-attack is a pre-emptive one. After all, if your enemies are all dead, then they can't hurt your friends.

Ley Tap.description: Through spells and constructs, mystic power is drawn directly from the earth to provide for base needs. A single tap is usually sufficient for a medium base.

Liberated Brawler.description: Former Ghouls, these Forlorn have been displaced to First Ward like the rest of their kind. Despite being cured of their bloodlust, they retain a semblance of the strength and damage resistance of their more feral cousins.

Librarian Vortigur.description: Though Librarian Vortigur's powers are limited, his knowledge of magic and history are great. However, his tastes for earthly pleasures could get him into trouble.

Libri Vermis.description: Libri Vermis is the Circle of Thorns' foremost researcher and librarian. He has spent decades cataloging and reading the tomes within the vast libraries of the Circle of Thorns. He was the perfect choice to sequester the Malleus Mundi.

Lich.description: The lich is an undead entity that, when alive, possessed many dark powers of his own. Perhaps it was a dark wizard, or powerful arch villain. Perhaps it was even a Necromancer. Now it only hungers for the souls of the living, and is quite good at feeding itself.

Lichen.description: The power of the Devouring Earth seems to have no bound. These Lichens are not to be trifled with.

Lichen Colony.description: The power of the Devouring Earth seems to have no bound. This Lichen Colony seems to generating some sort of spores.

Lichen-Infested Extinction War Walker.description: Malaise has created a Nightmare, drawing from the experiences of those whom he battles. This Nightmare has the appearance of the Lichen Infested War Walker.

Lieutenant Automaton.description: Perhaps it's the careful precision of every movement, or the way they perform the same tasks over and over, but something about this seemingly normal citizen doesn't look quite right. In fact, they seem almost mechanical.

Lieutenant Blechley.description: Though the Vampyri of the Council are not undead, they are certainly monsters. Lt. Blechley is typical of them. His body has been modified by grotesque surgeries and chemical treatments into a super-human killing machine, and his mind has been altered to match. It's no wonder Old Man Marcone didn't allow them in Port Oakes.

Lieutenant Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Lieutenant Quantum Gunner.description: Although they prefer to be called Swordsmen, everyone refers to these Warriors as the Slashers. They're experts at swordplay, and can swing with both finesse and ferocity, making them very dangerous in close combat.

Lieutenant Tirailleur.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. This seemingly simple weapon is actually quite versatile. The Tirailleurs have modified their weapons to fire poison gas grenades.

Life Mage.description: Magical mastery over life can be a powerful tool for good, but in the hands of the Life Mages it is a deadly weapon. They can suck the very life force out of their foes, weakening and eventually killing them.

Lifegiving Essence.description: As a master of death, Diabolique is able to coalesce the energy of all those defeated, destroyed or otherwise absorbed by Mot into swirling masses of lifegiving energy. She uses these essences to restore herself within the shadow realm, but they can only give her their boon if they survive long enough for her to consume them.

Lifter.description: Lifters, as their name indicates, do a lot of the heavy lifting and construction. They are able to easily lift machinery and building materials that previously could only be lifted by powerful cranes. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units.

Liger.description: This mystical great cat has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Light Fairy Pet.description: This is a Faerie who has come from the Lost Lands to aid you.

Light Leo.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Light of the Well.description: The light of the well suffuses the area around it with a glow of power, granting Tyrant increased strength and sustenance.

Lightning Blade.description: Lightning Blade techniques concentrate on mastering the chaotic powers of electricity and matching it with fearsome sword skills. A disciple of the Lightning Blade school can channel the power of lightning into every attack.

Lightning Leopard.description: The Lightning Leopard style utilizes the Tsoo's internal energy to electrify their attacks. Lightning Leopard masters can shock enemies to drain their endurance.

Lightning Storm.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. This mass of electrical energy causes the air around it to visibly crackle, sending lightning flying to nearby grounding points at every possible juncture.

Lilitu.description: The She-Devil ruled some plane of Hell before being called forth by the Circle of Thorns. The sorcerers struck a deal with her, and Lilitu has come to Earth with her infernal hordes. It is said the price for her service is the death of 666 heroes - including her own son, Infernal.

Linda.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Line Oscillator.description: The airborne Clockwork Oscillators are a new and deadly threat to Paragon City's skies. Like their grounded counterparts, the Sprockets, these high-flying mechanical men attack using bolts of electricity. They are immune to any psychological attacks.

Link to Aurora's Mind.description: This portal allows you to reach Aurora Borealis' mind, buried under the dominating influence of Shalice Tilman.

Lion.description: This graceful and deadly lion has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Lioness.description: This graceful and deadly lioness has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Lisa.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Lisa Colbert.description: Lisa Colbert may have cracked Nemesis' latest cipher, but it won't mean much if you can't get her out of here alive.

Little League.description: Brayden Doggett was just an average middle-class working fellow, coaching baseball on behalf of his late brother-in-law Steve. He owed it to his sister to stand in as a father figure to his nephew, and took up the job of coach to fulfill that promise and be a good role model to Bobby. Fate had other plans, though, and on the drive home from dropping Bobby off, he fell asleep at the wheel and crashed into the back of a tanker truck outside of Steel Canyon. To this day nobody has been able to determine what was in the tanker truck, despite multiple investigations. The results are unmistakable, however - Brayden now has the reaction speed of a cat and the strength of a bear. He joined the Hero Corps to show Bobby that great power should not be hidden, and now fights crime to set a good example.

Livia, Priestess of Ravenna.description: Livia is a prominent matriarch that presides over the small Roman settlement of Ravenna, and has been slowly gathering influence and consolidating power as she organizes the town into an organized society within the Cimeroran Empire. Little is known of where she came from, other than she is the daughter of a Senator and rumored to have once been courted by Imperious as a potential wife and Empress. She now appears to be fully engaged in some other type of political intrigue, and nobody can say for sure what it is.

Living Armor.description: The Midnight Squad protects their treasures well.

Living Hellfire.description: Living Hellfire are demons attracted to the material plane by terrible violence. They can only exist on the material plane for a short time before returning to the Abyss.

Loco Yob.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Long Jack.description: Long Jack has worked the docks in Port Noble since he was a petty officer in the Second World War. He was training himself up to be a natural hero, but that wasn't in the cards. He lost his health â€” not to an accident or a disease, but to an unethical army doctor who used Jack's body for experimentation at the behest of the Council villain, Maestro. With the Council is tatters after the New Praetorians ran through them, Long Jack hasn't lost his purpose yet - he knows better than to let his guard down and has reason to believe fascism isn't done with Striga, yet.

Longbow Ballista.description: The Ballista are Longbow's heaviest hitters. These tankers are tough enough to withstand direct hits from rocket launchers, and can dish out enough damage to take out the toughest brute Arachnos can throw at them.

Longbow Blaster.description: This is a generic Electricity/Electricity Blaster.

Longbow Chaser.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Controller.description: This is a generic Gravity/Kinetics Controller.

Longbow Defender.description: This is a generic Electric/Storm Defender.

Longbow Eagle.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Flamethrower.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Guardian.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular. Guardians are wet-behind-the-ears do-gooders looking to prove themselves. Most don't last beyond their first encounter with the big bad bruisers of the Rogue Isles.

Longbow Mech.description: The Longbow Heavy Mech is a miniaturized version of the Heavy Mech's used by Longbow in dire circumstances.

Longbow Minigun.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Nullifier.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Officer.description: The Bravest of the brave, and those who have proven their ability to lead as well as fight, are promoted to officers. They are then given special bio-enhancers that make them far stronger than normal men, as well as energy-absorbing suits that offer great protection against most forms of damage.

Longbow Rifleman.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Scrapper.description: This is a generic Martial Arts/Super Reflexes Scrapper.

Longbow Sergeant.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Spec-Ops.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Longbow Tanker.description: This is a generic Energy/Invulnerability Tanker.

Longbow Technician.description: This technician works for Longbow, and knows the inner works of many of their technical systems.

Longbow Warden.description: Longbow is a hard-hitting division of Freedom Corps dedicated to stopping evil, and Arachnos in particular.

Lord.description: These elite soldiers are the personal guard and right hand of the Clockwork King. You can be sure that they will use all their psychic abilities to ensure his safety.

Lord Lorn.description: Lord Lorn is the Lord of the Eternal Prison and the first of the Black Knights. Under his watch none have ever escaped the Eternal Prison and he aims to keep it that way. He has arrived in Night Ward in pursuit of the Black Swan whose cruelty has earned her a place in Lorn's Eternal Prison, and he aims to collect her shortly.

Lord Recluse.description: The Master of Evil, the Count of Cruel, the Archvillain of Anarchy. Lord Recluse has been called many things. But the people of the Rogue Isles know him as their lord and ruler. Lord Recluse has a mysterious tie with Paragon City's own Statesman - some even claim they were once close companions. Their hatred for one another certainly belies a secret perhaps best left buried.

Lord Winter.description: Malaise has created a Nightmare, drawing from the experiences of those whom he battles. This Nightmare has the appearance of Lord Winter.

Lorenz Ansaldo.description:
Lorenz Ansaldo is an associate for the Family. He's a troubleshooter for their problems, outsourcing to freelance villains when necessary.

Some say Lorenz got where he did by taking care of certain unsavory tasks for the Family. Others say he'd be much more highly placed if it wasn't for his mouth getting him into trouble all the time. In any case, he gets the job with an easy smile, a nudge and a wink.

Lost Son.description: The powerful strikes of the Lost Son technique are used in conjunction with deadly knowledge of human pressure points. Masters of this technique can easily cripple and incapacitate their foes.

Lost Soul.description: These mournful ghosts were, until recently, the shopkeepers, farmers, and students of Salamanca. Their sudden departure from this Earth has thrown them into great turmoil, and most feel compelled to take out their rage on their former home.

Loyal Citizen.description: These are the normal men and women loyal to President Marchand. They are simply people who want to help him not get killed by Lord Recluse.

Lt. Harris.description: Lt. Harris was once a well decorated member of Longbow, but he has since fallen from grace since his decision to betray his country and his allies, all for revenge against Elena Page.

Lt. Page.description: Lt. Page is in charge of several operations that Longbow is launching in Mercy Island. Whether or not she'll live to see them is up to you and Lt. Harris!

Lt. Sefu Tendaji.description: When Sefu Tendaji returned to his native Kenya after the Rikti war, he saw cities under siege by Arachnos-sponsored warlords while humanitarian aid was stolen by flying mercenaries. He swore a vow to set things right, and joined Longbow to fight against chaos and injustice.

Lucan v0.65.description: A pillar of advanced genetic manipulation, Lucan v0.65 is actually quite lucid compared to other experiments. Able to communicate with other failed experiments though unknown methods, he is apparently capable of gathering together the furious ghouls and putting their fury to work: toppling the society that created them.

Lucent of Light.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Light are the order's lowest-ranking sorcerers.

Luddite Brawler.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luddite Crusader.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luddite Friar.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luddite Hacker.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luddite Slasher.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luddite Smasher.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luddite Torch Bearer.description: The Luddites believe technology is leading to the ruination of civilization. Most believe Dr. Aeon and his magnificent city are to be admired, but the Luddites crusade against it, and even make ludicrous claims that Aeon's advances are at the behest of demons and other dark forces.

Luminary.description: The current Luminary is an android built by Positron to replace the original Luminary, who retired in 1995. Far from being a cold machine, Luminary has developed a strong personality under the watchful gaze of the android Citadel of the Freedom Phalanx. Armed with powerful energy blasts, Luminary has become a shining symbol of heroism and progress for Paragon City.

Luminous Acolyte.description: The Luminous Acolytes serve as front line forces for the Carnival of Light. They can trace their origins back to the Legacy Chain, and retain some of their armor and accoutrements. Their mastery of the mystic arts is not as substantial as their superiors, but it far outstrips anything seen elsewhere in Praetoria.

Luminous Eidolon.description: In Dr. Vahzilok's mind, the Eidolons are mankind's next great evolutionary leap. Unlike the cadavers, they retain all of their memories and personality. The lucky few who can pay to become a Eidolon are augmented with the remains of heroes, so they often have super powers. The Luminous Eidolons toss blasts of radiation to weaken their foes; they are masters of long ranged attacks.

Lunatic Quantum.description: Most of the people affected by Malaise never recover. They certainly don't without help. No one has been able to detect a pattern in those he infects, but once they enter the world that exists in his mind they are never the same.

Lunatic Slugger.description: Most of the people affected by Malaise never recover. They certainly don't without help. No one has been able to detect a pattern in those he infects, but once they enter the world that exists in his mind they are never the same.

Lurker.description: Fungus run amok' is probably the best way to describe these loathsome creatures. Like their inanimate ancestors, mushroom men prefer dark, dank places. In combat they can release clouds of deadly spores that choke and disable nearby enemies.

Lusca.description: This giant octopus threatens the waters of Independence Port. No one is certain how the beast got so large, though some have placed the blame on the polluting tendencies of Crey Technologies.

Lynx.description: After an Alley Cat develops some skill he is moved to a leadership position. They have to be tough to attain this status but they must have compassion for their comrades as well. Bobcat will not tolerate cruelty among her group.

M3DUS4, The Hydra Whisperer.description: Deep within the Sewers, reconnaissance teams regularly go out and hunt for new resources for the army. Sometimes, parties previously written off as lost come back, with tales of survival and adaptability in the wild under-dark of the Abandoned Sewers. M3DU54 is one of those legends, having survived a Hydra ambush and then surviving for weeks while her excelsior slowly ran low. Did she beat them, or did she join them? Time will tell.

Machine.description: This strange machine looks highly advanced.

Macht Jaeger.description: This is not your typical Jaeger automaton. It's clear that Nemesis has somehow used the energy from Pandora's Box to power his creations. As if they weren't dangerous enough already.

Mad Freak Buckshot.description: Mad Freaks have earned their Excelsior Feeder, a device that pumps the drug directly into their bloodstream. That makes them stronger and tougher than humanly possible, as well as more than a little bit crazy.

Mad Freak Chopper.description: Mad Freaks have earned their Excelsior Feeder, a device that pumps the drug directly into their bloodstream. That makes them stronger and tougher than humanly possible, as well as more than a little bit crazy.

Mad Freak Gunner.description: Mad Freaks have earned their Excelsior Feeder, a device that pumps the drug directly into their bloodstream. That makes them stronger and tougher than humanly possible, as well as more than a little bit crazy.

Mad Freak Slammer.description: Mad Freaks have earned their Excelsior Feeder, a device that pumps the drug directly into their bloodstream. That makes them stronger and tougher than humanly possible, as well as more than a little bit crazy.

Mad Mike.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Madame Bellerose.description: Madame Bellerose is a villain whose exploits are infamous in Europe. She has the ability to utilize dark energies for her own use. It is believed that she recently ascended to become an Incarnate.

Madame maven.description: Born in France, Madame Maven came to Paragon City as a child. It was here that her powers developed and where she decided to use them to defend order and law.

Madame of Mystery.description: The Ring Mistresses are taken from the ranks of the Carnival. The strongest minds with the most capacity for evil are shaped and then hidden behind the most powerful masks that the Carnival has. No one is certain where these masks come from but they enhance the psychic abilities of the Ring Mistresses exponentially. They rule the troupes of the Carnival with a steel hand in a velvet glove.

Madeleine Casey.description: After facing her three times, you have learned that the Madame of Mystery is actually the psychic projection of Madeleine Casey's soul. Unless you can destroy the Madame completely, Madeleine's soul will continue to serve the Carnival forever.

Madness Mage.description: The Masters of Madness can control every aspect of the psyche. For their friends, they provide a constant aura of mental fortitude that helps them in all endeavors. In battle, their enemies suffer complete mental domination that leaves them incapable of any action at all.

Maelstrom.description: Eddie 'Maelstrom' Polstra received his nickname due to the device on his chest that keeps him alive. His background as a soldier has given Maelstrom a strong sense of loyalty, but only to those who are willing to trust him back. What exactly Maelstrom is after is a mystery to all but him, though his determination will surely see his goals become a reality one day.

Maemae van Whooters.description: Though initially cast for her physical assets in a number of 1960's 'rebellious teenager' movies, Maemae van Whooters soon cultivated a respectable career by alternating serious roles with B-movie fare to avoid typecasting. Her star fell in the late 1970s when changing standards of beauty in Hollywood made it harder for her to get major roles. Instead of giving up, she began to concentrate on serious parts in foreign films, earning high praise in Europe with several costume dramas through the 1980s. She quit acting in the mid 1990s to become a writer, though she will still appear on camera to promote children's charities and environmental organizations.

Maestro.description: As a child, Vincenzo Alferi dreamed of becoming a great composer, but those dreams were shattered when he lost his hearing due to a car accident. The 5th Column offered to perform a radical experiment that might restore his hearing, and Vincenzo agreed without hesitation. Unfortunately, things did not go as planned. An Arachnos attack on the facility resulted in a power surge at the worst possible moment. Instead of restoring him, the resulting explosion created a permanent resonance in Vincenzo's body. He agreed to join the 5th Column if they would give him the opportunity for vengeance against Arachnos.

Magic Axis.description: Protecting a base requires a way to know what is happening. This magic axis generates the control needed to bind all your defenses.

Magical Barrier.description: This magical barrier has been set up by a member of the Carnival of Light.

Magician Essence.description: This Vanguard Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Magma Thorn Caster.description: At the highest levels of elemental mastery, certain Casters are able to harness multiple techniques and combine them into more devastating powers. Magma Casters have mastered the arts of Fire and Earth casting, and can conjure blasts of volcanic stone to immolate and crush their foes.

Magmite.description: The heat of the Earth flows through the bodies of these minions of Igneous. Beneath a thin rock shell, their bodies are composed entirely of liquid magma. Their fiery breath can roast an unwary hero in no time flat, and if necessary they can expel gouts of magma to finish the job.

Magmite Lord.description: The heat of the Earth flows through the bodies of these minions of Igneous. Beneath a thin rock shell, their bodies are composed entirely of liquid magma. Their fiery breath can roast an unwary hero in no time flat, and if necessary they can expel gouts of magma to finish the job.

Magus Mu Drakhan.description: Magus Mu'Drakhan is a leading figure among the growing ranks of mystics working under the banner of Arachnos who trace their lineage to the ancient civilization known as Mu. Some whisper that he may be more loyal to his ancient bloodline than to Arachnos, but such whispers are often quietly silenced.

Mailbox.description: This is a typical mailbox used for the delivery of letters and parcels.

Mainframe.description: Managing all the systems in your base takes processing power. This mainframe computer has been programmed as a central control point for base security systems. It generates the control needed for base systems to operate.

Maintenance Drone.description: This sturdy Maintenance Drone serves as a health battery reserve for your machines. As your other drones are hurt, it will use its own health to heal other drones. Once all its health is used up, it will self destruct. Maintenance Drone does not regenerate health, and can't be healed.

Major Image of Aurora Borealis.description: Before the Rikti War, Aurora Scott was just a fledgling hero doing her best for the city she loved. Afterward, she was something else entirely. Aurora played host to Sister Psyche's mind after the Freedom Phalanx heroine was injured in the war. After gladly sacrificing her autonomy so that Sister Psyche could continue to serve, Aurora's just now returning to her own life. And she's got a few bones to pick with the villains who flourished in her absence. However, part of Aurora went with Sister Psyche and became trapped in the woman's mind. Now, this 'Aurora Psyche' is doing everything she can to escape - with help from Malaise!

Major Image of Malaise.description: Jean-Pierre Lourdin was not always a hero. He began his career as a villain in Europe, using the twisted images in his mind to commit robberies. With INTERPOL hot on his trail he landed in Paragon City, where his broken thoughts were detected by Sister Psyche. She confronted him and after an intense battle was able to subdue him. She spent months healing the damage to his mind and has taught him more productive uses of his abilities. Sister Psyche vouched for him with the authorities and he has been allowed to help with the current crisis in Paragon City. Many are keeping a watchful eye on Malaise, however, for signs of his madness returning.

Malady.description: Malady is a fiery Hygeian commander whose experiments on her immune system have made her entire body a fine-tuned machine.

Malaise.description: On Praetorian Earth the villain Malaise was never counseled by Sister Psyche, instead he was one of the 'patients' at one of Mother Mayhem's facilities. With the ability to control his madness and inflict it on others, he quickly rose to a position as her favorite.

Malice Monument.description: This monument seems to pulse with power.

Malignant Seedling.description: The Malignant Seedling is a specialized Seedling which is capable of surviving for a long period of time in an enormous range of conditions. They are often dispatched into areas where the Seed of Hamidon cannot be sent, where they wreak havoc on the environment before beginning the process of converting it to an infested wasteland.

Mamba Blade.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Mamba Fang.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Man O' War.description: The Men O' War are the strongest of the strange amoeba-like men that dwell within the sewers. Recently, scientists examined some DNA from a captured Man O' War. Strangely, it contained the genetic code of viruses and plants that are common on Earth.

Mangle.description: Mangle was an unwilling attraction for a traveling freak show, but the chains couldn't contain his fury forever. Once free he waited in the shadows to repay his captors' 'kindness' with blood.

Maniac Quantum.description: Some of those affected by Malaise's insidious powers attain some modicum of control again. They also see the world the way he sees it. These poor creatures become his most trusted servants. Some believe that if enough of them are created the world might turn into the topsy-turvy madhouse that Malaise sees everyday.

Maniac Slammer.description: Some of those affected by Malaise's insidious powers attain some modicum of control again. They also see the world the way he sees it. These poor creatures become his most trusted servants. Some believe that if enough of them are created the world might turn into the topsy-turvy madhouse that Malaise sees everyday.

Manslayer.description: Genetically altered to have a hyper developed medulla oblongata, Ghouls produce adrenaline at a prodigious rate, enhancing their strength, speed, and aggressiveness. Manslayers possess amazing strength and their presence causes other ghouls to fly into an uncontrollable murderous frenzy.

Manticore.description: Justin Sinclair was raised in a huge mansion in the outskirts of Paragon City by his English nanny, Virginia Bowman. The sole beneficiary of a huge trust fund, Manticore received training in all manner of mental and physical pursuits, but excelled in archery. When he turned 18, Miss Bowman revealed to him his true heritage. Manticore's father had once been a costumed vigilante in England, until he and his wife died at the hands of a German villain called Protean. Deeply affected by the story, Manticore took up his father's mantle and vowed to bring the 5th Column down.

Marauder.description: Praetor White, as he is known on Praetoria, heads up the Powers Division for Emperor Cole. These super-powered individuals act as the ultimate police force in keeping Praetoria the utopia it appears to be. All the while Praetor White feeds on the instability of the government and makes his own opportunities to look good.

Marcone.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Blackjack.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Buckshot.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Capo.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Consigliere.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Gunner.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Hitman.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Muscle.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcone Underboss.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Marcus Kirchmer.description: These Syndicate diehards were once initiates who rose through the ranks of their organization through dedication, skill and no small amount of craziness. Sword Masters can cut the very air causing blades of wind to slice at their foes from range.

Marcus Stribbling.description: Marcus is a young mutant with tremendous power over time. For several years, he has been imprisoned by his father, Dr. Chris Stribbling, after his powers first manifested and caused the death of his infant brother. Embittered by his treatment, he wishes now to escape to the Rogue Isles.

Marcus Valerius.description: Marcus Habitus Valerius is the former Captain of the Guard under the rule of Imperious within the kingdom of Cimerora.  When Imperious was traitorously ousted by a splinter group of his own men, Marcus Valerius fought alongside him.  He continues to work for the deposed ruler in a small fortress just outside the walls of his old kingdom.

Margaret.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Maria.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Marie.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Marigold Langston.description:
Marigold Langston is the sole heiress to the Langston Corporation dynasty, creators of machinery and the world-famous 'Gold Brick' chocolate bars.

After the media and publicity coverage subsided regarding the sudden passing of her father, Lawrence Langston, Marigold decided she would lead her company into a new era; One that would prioritize expanding their engineering and R&D divisions.

Utilizing her scientific genius for invention, and bankrolled by her company's chocolate fortune, Marigold has already led Langston Corp to massive success in the technology sector, seeing prestigious collaborations with organizations such as Vanguard and Portal Corp.

Mark.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Marker.description: This entity stays around until told to die.

Marshal Blitz.description:
Marshal Jason Blitz used to be the Arachnos Marshal for the isle of Warburg, one of the western-most Rogue Isles, and is today the de facto ruler of it. Marshal Blitz commands a contingent of Rogue Arachnos that took over Warburg and uses its rockets to threaten Paragon City.

Marshal Jason Blitz believed Lord Recluse wasn't acting fast enough in his bid to take over the world. He found it tragic that the Web had developed so many incredible weapons and none of them were being used on the hated heroes!

When Blitz learned he was dying of cancer, he decided to speed things up a bit so that he could live to see the defeat of Paragon City. He murdered Governor Melody Harkness and took over the city with a cadre of troops loyal to him. Soon after, he demolished the false faï¿½ade on the Warburg Rocket at the centre of his city and started firing warheads armed with various toxins at Paragon City.

Lord Recluse promised the UN he would rectify the situation, but his troops have so far been stalemated by their rivals. (or so Recluse claims.)

Martha.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Martial Gloom.description: Once a force to be reckoned within the Freedom Corps organization. Martial Gloom went insane after seeing innocent bystanders die in a fire fight and vowed to take the Freedom Corps down himself.

Martin Henri.description: Martin Henri is the leader of the ragtag group of anti-technology cultists known as the Luddites. His mad hatred for all things created by modern science is his only passion, and it is this devotion that has drawn followers to his cause. Whatever anyone says about Martin Henri and his Luddites, it is clear that he is a true believer in his own cause.

Mary.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Mary Macomber.description: Trust doesn't come easily to Mary Macomber, the leader of the Cabal. She's been in Croatoa too long. Still, your reputation precedes you, and she is willing to listen. If you can impress her in combat, that is.

Masamoto.description: Masamoto is one of the top Syndicate leaders. He has enjoyed great success in the Syndicate Corp Wars due to his own martial prowess.

Master At Arms.description: The Rikti Master At Arms is the head of ships Security. A powerful warrior and mentalist, he takes his responsibilties seriously.

Master Illusionist.description: After wearing their masks for long enough, Illusionists are trained to manifest their thoughts in the form of phantasms. At first the phantasms are insubstantial and ineffective, but after a training process the Master Illusionist can maintain them for longer periods of time and use them offensively.

Master Midnight.description: The Midnight Master himself, Master Midnight wrestled control over the Midnight Squad and their Midnight Mansion many moons ago. Those who he has defeated have become slaves to his power, serving him even beyond death as the undead Midnight Masters. Though despite all his power, Master Midnight lacks true knowledge of magic, a gap he is working feverishly to close in the hopes of obtaining the affections of Diabolique.

Master Midnight's Mail of Magical Master.description: Master Midnight's suit of armor was infused with numerous magical spells, giving him tremendous protection. That magic, however, appears to have gained an intellect of its own following Midnight's demise and has begun carrying out its own plans; sans Master Midnight's body.

Master Shadow.description: These servants of Black Swan are obviously different in both size and power from their smaller counterparts. They have achieved a mastery of Shadow energy that can only be surpassed by the dark lady herself.

Master of Agony.description: There is not greater distraction than pain and suffering. The Masters of Agony often help relieve their friends of such distractions in times of peace. But when it comes to battle, they are adept at harming their foes through powerful and disruptive enchantments.

Master of Death.description: The most powerful of all the Circle's mages, the Masters of Death are lords of the afterlife. They help to wrangle and control the Behemoths and other beasts the Circle summons, but their most fearsome power is the ability to create a pervasive zone of death that sucks the life out of any foes in the vicinity.

Master of Madness.description: The Masters of Madness can control every aspect of the psyche. For their friends, they provide a constant aura of mental fortitude that helps them in all endeavors. In battle, their enemies suffer complete mental domination that leaves them incapable of any action at all.

Master of Ruin.description: In ancient times, the Masters of Ruin could level whole cities with their powerful earthquake magic. Today these masters of mayhem are still deadly foes, capable of summoning localized tremors that cause great devastation in a short time.

Mastermind Hero.description: Dr. Advance uses his suit of space/time manipulating powered armor to help Longbow explore dangerous extremes of science!

Match.description: Outcast Initiates who show potential are valuable commodities amongst the Outcasts, and are quickly elevated up the ranks. An Outcast Match has started to demonstrate his fire starting abilities.

Matt.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Matthew.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Matthew Habashy.description: Matthew Habashy is an agent for the FBSA, who has recently beem promoted to work out in the field with heroes.

Maturing Seedling.description: Maturing Seedlings are the Seed's antibodies. Every Maturing Seedling alive provides the Seed with a fairly substantial amount of healing over time.

Maven of Ministry.description: It takes more than just hard work and dedication to become a Maven of Ministry. It takes a certain raw talent, and a sensitivity to the power wafting through every breeze in Croatoa. Some Mavens insist that they can hear the voices of their late husbands floating on those breezes. Whether true or not, this belief only strengthens their fury in battle.

Max.description: This mysterious man seems to be a prime target for both the Knives of Vengeance and the Banished Pantheon

Max Action.description: The leader of the amazing superteam called the Civic Squad, Max Action is a one-man war on crime. Though he's lead the Civic Squad for several years, Max Action's true history is a closely guarded secret. Rumors claim he may be a genetically engineered super-soldier, a movie action hero who escaped to the real world, or just a determined man who's pushed human ability to it's limit. One thing's beyond debate, though: his advanced martial arts abilities and finely honed reflexes place him among the most dangerous one-on-one combatants in the world.

Maximum Defense Turret.description: Armed with extensive multi-phasic sensor arrays and plasma weaponry capable of piercing through the toughest of armor, these turrets are an incredibly effective deterrent for keeping trespassers out of Lambda Sector, Keyes Island and other vital Praetorian military outposts.

Maxine.description: Maxine is one of the top Syndicate killers. Her psychic mastery over her own body turns her into a lethal killing machine.

Mayhem Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

Meat Doctor.description: Many of Dr. Vahzilok's talented but demented followers in Paragon City have been busted by the 'superhero phenomenon'. Some have found their way to Sharkhead Isle to ply their trade with the vast numbers of Freakshow sorting through the Crushes' junkyards. These sick surgeons are called the Meat Doctors.

Mechannie.description: The robotic 'daughter' of crimefighting inventor and gunslinger Sergio 'Sixtygun' Seiger, Mechannie Seiger carries on her father's crusade to bring justice to any outlaw who crosses her path. Her robotic body makes her nearly indestructible, but it's her fun-loving attitude and a heart the size of Texas that makes her truly unstoppable. When she's not fighting crime, Mechannie can often be seen at DJ Zero's Paragon Dance Party, dancing the night away.

Medic.description: Crey Industries believes firmly in hands on, frontline research, and they demand more from their scientists than most companies. Indeed, Crey Scientists often venture into the field, armed with Cryo weapons to help them collect samples - and do serious damage to anyone who get in their way.

Medical - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Medical - Male.description: This hapless citizen is in over his head.

Medical Apparatus.description: This has been recovered from Pathogen's lair and seems to be equipped with a powerful immune boosting medicinal delivery system.

Medium Cable.description: These strange living spires are somehow connected with Hamidon's ability to control the creatures of the Devouring Earth.

Mega Cog.description: The Clockwork King's improved psychic abilities apparently had a profound effect on his creations. These Clockwork are significantly stronger and more durable than their predecessors.

Mega Monitor.description: This massive monitor displays all base security information in a single glance. It increases control generated for the base.

Mek Man.description: Vandal, the genius behind the 5th Column's technology, created the first Mek Men during World War II. He's been improving on them ever since. The tough and deadly versions in operation today are 100 times more dangerous than their predecessors of 60 years ago. Modern Mek Men have tough, thick armor, redundant systems that resist damage, and a powerful onboard AI that makes them faster and smarter than most human soldiers.

Mek Man Gigantique.description: Vandal, the genius behind the 5th Column's technology, created the first Mek Men during World War II. He's been improving on them ever since. The tough and deadly versions in operation today are 100 times more dangerous than their predecessors of 60 years ago. Modern Mek Men have tough, thick armor, redundant systems that resist damage, and a powerful onboard AI that makes them faster and smarter than most human soldiers.

MekMan Pet.description: This is a solidified, animated hologram of a Mek Man.

Melissa.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Mender.description: Menders are often seen repairing broken structures and machines, including other Androids. Their top priority is to keep the other Androids in tip-top working condition.

Mender Essence.description: This Clockwork Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Mender Lazarus.description: Mender Lazarus is a time traveler who lost his sense of continuity some time ago. He is still a brilliant scientist and historian, he just occasionally puts the "effect" before the "cause."

Mender Ramiel.description: Not much is known regarding Mender Ramiel, only that he is one of the few menders who has intimate knowledge regarding Incarnates and their abilities.

Mender Silos.description: Ouroboros' ability to time travel is entirely the work of the brilliant futurist, Mender Silos. He was the one who founded the group, brought its members back in time and is attempting to save everything. He is a stoic leader who seems to have the ability to look right through people as if they weren't there. The other members of Ouroboros say that this is because when Mender Silos looks a you he sees every 'when' you ever were and will be. Silos speaks little of his own time, only to say it is a cold, dark place where all that is living is too quickly burning out.

Mending Mitochondria.description: These creatures seem to be the organelles of the giant single cell organism that is devouring the land around you. These Mitochondria seem to function as repair units for the cell.

Mental Cadaver.description: These reanimated corpses give off a powerful stench that's a mixture of chemicals and rotting flesh. The odor becomes a hundred times worse when they use their favorite attack - vomiting a stream of corrosive acid on their nearby opponents.

Mental Mike.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Mercedes Sheldon.description: While the Midnight Squad does not heavily practice the dark arts, there are a handful that see it as a useful way to defend themselves against those who would try and do their group harm.

Mercenary.description: A man with a mysterious past, Mercenary has just as much reason to confront Infinity and his army of robots as you do.

Mercenary Quantum.description: When the Knives of Artemis were first encountered, it was suspected that they were a small group of only 70, or perhaps 100 individuals. Obviously their ranks have expanded since the Rikti War as more broken or disillusioned women were adopted into their ranks and hardened. Nowadays, The Knives of Artemis are known to be one of the deadliest groups of mercenary combatants in the world. Masters of stealth and reconnaissance, they are highly skilled with all weapons, but the crossbow is their signature.

Meson.description: Anti-Matter's constructs are designed to work together but occasionally there will be a specific task that he wants accomplished. The Meson unit is almost always assigned to these duties. They carry more logic circuits and can more easily follow complex instructions.

Metal Crate.description: This large crate is used to transport various types of goods.

Metal Shift.description: Metal Shift is a Freakshow but is also a priest of the Cult of the Shaper on Sharkhead Isle. The cult espouses a philosophy involving transformation of self - this easily fits into the Freakshow paradigm of self-modification.

Metal Smasher.description: The Metal Freak's devotion to the cause is obvious - he's had both arms replaced with robotic contraptions that are good only for destruction. He must rely on other Freaks to feed him, but in combat he is a whirling nightmare.

Metal Swiper.description: The Metal Freak's devotion to the cause is obvious - he's had both arms replaced with robotic contraptions that are good only for destruction. He must rely on other Freaks to feed him, but in combat he is a whirling nightmare.

Meteor.description: This meteor was the first of potentially many more to come. Mender Silos seems to believe that this is an advance scout team, part of the 'coming storm' he speaks of.

Meteor Char.description: The meteors are numbered in Hindi after the Indian professor who first discovered Shiva. This is Meteor #4, which somehow managed to maneuver through the factory above. Sadly, those closest to the strike were consumed in a green wash of radioactive death.

Meteor Do.description: The meteors are numbered in Hindi after the Indian professor who first discovered Shiva. This is Meteor #2, which hit, ironically, in front of the Green Nugget Casino. Coincidence? You'll have to decide that for yourself, friend.

Meteor Ek.description: The meteors are numbered in Hindi after the Indian professor who first discovered Shiva. This is Meteor #1, the largest fragment, which smashed into the downtown area of Bloody Bay and created a 50-yard long trench.

Meteor Jay.description: The meteors are numbered in Hindi after the Indian professor who first discovered Shiva. This is Meteor #6. It was the last to land according to most sources.

Meteor Panch.description: The meteors are numbered in Hindi after the Indian professor who first discovered Shiva. This is Meteor #5, which slipped through the canopy and embedded in the earthy soil of these old woods.

Meteor Teen.description: The meteors are numbered in Hindi after the Indian professor who first discovered Shiva. This is Meteor #3, which slammed into the tourist-laden Boardwalk district. The sight of guys in Hawaiian shirts running for their lives with half yard margaritas in their hands made the front pages of all the major tabloids.

Metronome MK I.description: This monstrous construct is being pieced together from numerous stock and customized Clockwork parts. It appears to be quite a different machine than any Clockwork you've ever seen.

Metronome MK II.description: This monstrosity is a physical manifestation of the malignant Clockwork virus known as Metronome. It incorporates various parts from existing Clockwork, but hints of a brilliant design greater than the parts are clearly evident.

Metronome MK III.description: This monstrosity is a physical manifestation of the malignant Clockwork virus known as Metronome. It incorporates various parts from existing Clockwork, including powerful integral weaponry, but hints of a brilliant design greater than the parts are clearly evident.

Michael.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Michelle.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Midnight.description: The Midnight Order draws its fearsome might from the darkest places within the spirit, amplifying and focusing this darkness into a number of devastating attacks.

Midnight Squad Force Mage.description: While the Midnight Squad does not heavily practice the dark arts, there are a handful that see it as a useful way to defend themselves against those who would try and do their group harm.

Midnight Squad Hermetic Master.description: While the Midnight Squad does not heavily practice the dark arts, there are a handful that see it as a useful way to defend themselves against those who would try and do their group harm.

Midnight Squad Spirit Master.description: While the Midnight Squad does not heavily practice the dark arts, there are a handful that see it as a useful way to defend themselves against those who would try and do their group harm.

Midnighter Loremaster.description: This member of the Midnighter Club can provide training services for your Supergroup.

Midnighter Quartermaster.description: This member of the Midnighter Club can provide your supergroup with Enhancements.

Mike.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Mind Annihilation.description: Mother Mayhem will eventually take over and destroy your mind. Do not remain in the Seer Network for too long!

Mind Suppression Field.description: This entity creates the suppression field which allows Shalice Tilman to be controlled.

Mindcrasher.description: The Mindcrasher is a particularly violent psychic whose mind has remained intact despite the pain it has endured, allowing her to maintain control of her power where the Psychotic has failed. The enormous psychic power she wields has begun to rapidly alter her body, causing psionically driven organic armor to emerge from her body. This organic armor is capable of being expanded at will, allowing her to encase herself in an absorptive carapace or to reach out and infect distant targets. What energy is not being diverted to maintaining her armored body is instead being diverted toward her attacks, which consist mainly of psionic energy spikes which spontaneously emerge from her arms when threatened.

Mindshadow.description: Mindshadows are the closest thing the Seers have to elite field agents. They are combat trained and their psychic link to T.E.S.T. Rangers gives them the ability to summon deadly back up.

Mindspider.description: Mindspider was a government agent working for the DATA division of the FBSA. After a few too many 'disciplinary actions' she retired from the FBSA and went freelance. She can be found working for various hero groups, including Longbow, if the price is right.

Mindstorm.description: Once one of the more strong-willed and keenly focused of Mother Mayhem's test subjects, a Mindstorm is a barely contained maelstrom of psychic energy. So powerful was their resistance to Mother Mayhem's experiments that it manifested as an energetic storm consuming their body. Now, held together only by her force of will and concentration, the Mindstorm's body is wracked by a crackling, unceasing surge of energy. Unlike the Subjugator, most of the corruption has manifested across their body, as their minds are still largely intact. This enables the Mindstorm to control and even direct the tremendous psychic power at their disposal to achieve devastating results.

Mindwashed Resistance Commando.description: Resistance Commandos are surviving soldiers from the last wars before Cole's world order took over. They are well trained, disciplined, elite fighters armed with some of the best modified weapons the resistance can slap together.

Mindwashed Resistance Fighter.description: Resistance Fighters are experienced resistance recruits who have learned by doing rather than training. They are equipped with outdated military firearms that have been hastily upgraded with power packs and other accessories to give them a heavy enough punch to threaten the PPD.

Mindwashed Resistance Heavy Barrel.description: Resistance Heavy Barrels are walking mobile guns. Their exo-skeleton provides them with the strength to carry such high-powered weapons, and the addition of welded on steel plating enables them to withstand just about any return fire.

Mindwashed Resistance Heavy Hands.description: Resistance Heavy Hands are walking wrecking crews. Their exo-skeleton provides them with the strength to fight with their massive clockwork construction arms, and the addition of welded on steel plating enables them to withstand just about any fire on their way into melee, and any punishment their foes can dish out.

Mindwashed Resistance Officer.description: Officers are veteran soldiers who have years of command experience. They use their leadership skills to hone the resistance fighters under their command into a deadly fighting force whether they are raw recruits, or elite commandos. They also pack the best weapons they can get their hands on.

Mini Adamastor.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Adamastor.

Mini Arachnos Flyer.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Arachnos Flyer.

Mini Babbage.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Babbage.

Mini Caleb.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Caleb.

Mini Council War Walker.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Council War Walker.

Mini Deathsurge.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Deathsurge.

Mini Eochai.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Eochai.

Mini Hero 1.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Hero 1.

Mini Jack In Irons.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Jack In Irons.

Mini Jurassik.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Jurassik.

Mini Kraken.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Kraken.

Mini Kronos Titan.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Kronos Titan.

Mini Lord Recluse.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Lord Recluse.

Mini Lusca Tentacle.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Lusca Tentacle.

Mini Sally.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Sally.

Mini Seed of Hamidon.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Seed of Hamidon.

Mini Statesman.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Statesman.

Mini Tyrant.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature Tyrant.

Mini U'kon Gr'ai.description: This is a hard light hologram of a miniature U'kon Gr'ai.

Minor Image of Aurora Borealis.description: Before the Rikti War, Aurora Scott was just a fledgling hero doing her best for the city she loved. Afterward, she was something else entirely. Aurora played host to Sister Psyche's mind after the Freedom Phalanx heroine was injured in the war. After gladly sacrificing her autonomy so that Sister Psyche could continue to serve, Aurora's just now returning to her own life. And she's got a few bones to pick with the villains who flourished in her absence. However, part of Aurora went with Sister Psyche and became trapped in the woman's mind. Now, this 'Aurora Psyche' is doing everything she can to escape - with help from Malaise!

Minor Image of Malaise.description: Jean-Pierre Lourdin was not always a hero. He began his career as a villain in Europe, using the twisted images in his mind to commit robberies. With INTERPOL hot on his trail he landed in Paragon City, where his broken thoughts were detected by Sister Psyche. She confronted him and after an intense battle was able to subdue him. She spent months healing the damage to his mind and has taught him more productive uses of his abilities. Sister Psyche vouched for him with the authorities and he has been allowed to help with the current crisis in Paragon City. Many are keeping a watchful eye on Malaise, however, for signs of his madness returning.

Minor Shadow.description: These small shadowy beings serve Black Swan loyally. They seem to have no desires or motivations of their own. Some people say that after they encounter them they experience a chill for up to several weeks. They can channel dark energy into focused blasts.

Minotaur.description: The Minotaur is a beast of ancient times; born from the blood of a human and the passion of an Incarnate. Any man who dares challenge this beast will face a wrath of celestial force.

Mire Eidolon.description: In Dr. Vahzilok's mind, the Eidolons are mankind's next great evolutionary leap. Unlike the cadavers, they retain all of their memories and personality. The lucky few who can pay to become a Eidolon are augmented with the remains of heroes, so they often have super powers. Mire Eidolons have mastered the ability to control darkness itself. They tend to root their foes with tendrils of darkness and then launch into an attack.

Mirror Spirit.description: The woman known as The Mirror Spirit is the manifestation of a sacred mirror handed down from generation to generation from ancient times. The mirror came into possession of an evil ghost who used it to commit many crimes before being defeated by Foreshadow. The Mirror Spirit now serves Foreshadow faithfully.

Misadventure.description: Misadventure is just a girl with a lot of bad luck. She has accepted this as her fate and uses it to further her criminal career.

Misery.description: Orb Weavers created the Disruptor Arachnobots to capture their prey alive.

Misguided Citizen.description: This Misguided Citizen appears to be taking an interest in one of the magical cults that pervades First Ward.

Miss Francine.description: Miss Francine is a plucky young teacher from Paragon City who came to the Rogue Isles to teach the underpriveliged. Somehow her sweet demeanor and good intentions caught the attention of several members of the Freakshow, who were so astounded that they couldn't bully her, decided to try doing what she said. She has since started an underground school dedicated to teaching and rehabilitating members of the normally violent street gang.

Miss Liberty.description: Daughter to the well known Statesman, Miss Liberty grew up around some of the greatest heroes mankind has ever seen. It is no surprise that she grew up to be one herself. Inheriting the sacred girdle from her mother and the superhuman abilities of the gods from her father, Miss Liberty is a force for justice and equality across America.

Miss Thystle.description: This woman was just born into the wrong family. Her parents being her role model she decided that she wanted it all in life, without the hassle of working for it. Miss Thysle doesn't care how she gets what she wants, just as long as she gets it.

Mistress of Fury.description: There is no fury more intense than that of a woman scorned, and The Banner of Scorn has conjured manifestations of wronged women with a bone to pick. They seek eternal revenge for the horrible things that society, and life in general, has inflicted upon them.

Mistress of War.description: The Mistresses are extremely powerful sorceresses and mystics, able to twist magical energies into a diverse selection of abilities. With few exceptions, they are the most talented mystics in the Carnival of War, and form the core of its leadership. They represent some of the most loyal of Vanessa's original followers, and they would return to the fold if only she would see things as they do.

Mitochondria Antibodies.description: These creatures seem to be the organelles of the giant single cell organism that is devouring the land around you. These Mitochondria are definitely the cells main defense mechanism.

Mitochondria Electrolytes.description: These creatures seem to be the organelles of the giant single cell organism that is devouring the land around you. These Mitochondria are definitely the cells defense mechanism.

Mizbhaven.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Mk I Wolfpack Robot.description: The Mk I Wolfpack Robot has been favorably compared to a battle tank when it comes to both firepower and resilience. The big difference is that the Mk I is controlled by an ingenious artificial intelligence that can capably command troops in the field. It carries enough firepower to take out heavily armored targets, and its own armor stands up to anything less than an anti-tank weapon.

Mk I Zenith Warcry.description: The Mk I Warcry robot has been favorably compared to a battle tank when it comes to both firepower and resilience. The big difference is that the Mk I is controlled by an ingenious artificial intelligence that can capably command troops in the field. It carries enough firepower to take out heavily armored targets, and its own armor stands up to anything less than an anti-tank weapon.

Mk II Wolfpack Robot.description: The ultimate in automated fighting systems, the Mk II Wolfpack Robot is fearsome in combat, capable of taking on whole armored companies by itself. The robots' unerring aim and large caliber weaponry make them a threat to any hero they come across. Their enhanced AI allows them to coordinate with the 5th Column's human troops, making them the perfect battlefield commanders.

Mk II Zenith Warcry.description: The ultimate in automated fighting systems, the Mk II Warcry robot is fearsome in combat, capable of taking on whole armored companies by itself. The robots' unerring aim and large caliber weaponry make them a threat to any hero they come across. Their enhanced AI allows them to coordinate with the Council's human troops, making them the perfect battlefield commanders.

Mk-VI \"Victoria\".description: Mk-VI "Victoria" androids are a deadly assassin android model. Unlike the ACU, BCU and Warwalkers these cunning automatons prefer to employ stealth to engage in melee and deliver killing blows to their enemies.

Mk-VI 'Victoria' Essence.description: This Warworks Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Mob Specialist.description: Crey's Security Agents have become an almost ubiquitous sight in Paragon City, especially in any Crey owned facility. They're armed with standard law enforcement weapons, from riot batons to assault weapons.

Mobile Artillery.description: IDF Mobile Artillery is an enhanced soldier with the most advance heavy artillery equipment available. Combining short, medium, and long range arms, the Mobile Artillery is a almost a WarWorks Goliath's worth of hurt in a much more dexterous and mobile package.

Mobile Defense Turret.description: Armed with plasma weaponry capable of piercing through the toughest of armor, these turrets are an incredibly effective deterrent for keeping trespassers out of the Lambda sector and other vital Praetorian military outposts.

Mobile Guardian Turret.description: Guardian Turrets are mobile turrets that ensure the security of sensitive areas.

Mobile Sentry Turret.description: Sentry Turret are mobile turrets that ensure the security of sensitive areas.

Mold Wall.description: The power of the Devouring Earth seems to have no bound. The very mold that grows on the rock face itself has come alive to consume the Earth.

Monarch.description: The Monarch, leader of the Survivor Compound in First Ward, has been slowly losing his sanity, convinced that his daughter was stolen from him by the Carnival of Light.

Monitor Bank.description: Multiple monitors make it easier to observe activity throughout a base. The monitor bank increases control generated for the base.

Monitor Sphere.description: The Praetoria Police Department is charged with the unending duty of maintaining order on the streets of the City. The Monitor Sphere is an invaluable piece of equipment for the officers charged with this duty.

Monsoon Elemental Essence.description: This Elemental essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Monstrosity.description: Humanity's dark desire for mindless mayhem and destruction have been channeled by the Banner of Mayhem.  The results are these creatures that are fueled by the need to blindly destroy everything around them.

Montague Castanella.description: Freed from the magic that enslaved him to Master Midnight, Montague Castanella is once again the leader of the Midnight Squad.

Mook.description: When former Governor Manuel Marcone was nabbed by Interpol, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi decided to take over from his son, Emil. It seems Lord Recluse is content to see who wins this gang war, as he's issued no official proclamations as to who should succeed Manuel.

Mook Blackjack.description: When former Governor Manuel Marcone was nabbed by Interpol, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi decided to take over from his son, Emil. It seems Lord Recluse is content to see who wins this gang war, as he's issued no official proclamations as to who should succeed Manuel.

Mook Hitman.description: When former Governor Manuel Marcone was nabbed by Interpol, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi decided to take over from his son, Emil. It seems Lord Recluse is content to see who wins this gang war, as he's issued no official proclamations as to who should succeed Manuel.

Mook Muscle.description: When former Governor Manuel Marcone was nabbed by Interpol, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi decided to take over from his son, Emil. It seems Lord Recluse is content to see who wins this gang war, as he's issued no official proclamations as to who should succeed Manuel.

Moonfire.description: The young woman known as Aurelie Damiens used to be a humble French art student, visiting Paragon City as part of an international exchange program. She was bright and enthusiastic, but, in her eyes at least, nothing special. That all changed one day at the Paragon Museum of Art, when she felt the presence of a dying Kheldian touch her mind. Aurelie had a choice: she could allow the energy being to fade away entirely; or she could take it upon herself, merging with it, becoming far more than the sum of her parts. To this day, Aurelie has no regrets about her choice. As a member of the Peacebringer Army, she watches over Striga Isle and the dark forces that shadow it.

Morale Improvement.description: Morale has improved, so the beatings may now stop!

Morana.description: Little is known of the woman known as Morana except that she is revered by the Death Dolls within the Skulls and feared by their enemies. It is uncertain whether she has taken the name of a Slavic deity like the Petrovic Brothers, or if she truly is a manifestation of the Slavic goddess of death and nightmares. What is certain is that she is responsible for the deaths of hundreds.

Mortificator.description: The Reapers seem to be the only normal humans among the ranks of Dr. Vahzilok's reanimated legions. They are trained surgeons who collect body parts with the help of poison darts and industrial strength hacksaws.

Mortificator Quantum Gunner.description: The Reapers seem to be the only normal humans among the ranks of Dr. Vahzilok's reanimated legions. They are trained surgeons who collect body parts with the help of poison darts and industrial strength hacksaws.

Mot's Annihilation.description: Diabolique will use the latent death energy emanating from Mot to eventually take over your body and consume it from with in, killing you. Do not remain in her presence for long!

Mother Malaise.description: After he was defeated, Malaise's mind fractured, leaving him a shell of his former self. This fracturing weakened him enough to fall under Shalice Tilman's control. Now, after being expelled from Penelope Yin and Aurora Borealis, she has fully merged with Malaise in a desperate effort to remain connected to the Seer Network while she tries to regroup.

Mother Mayhem.description: Shalice Tilman, also known as Mother, is the Praetor of Health in Praetoria. She is the pioneer behind the revolutionary Seer Project, which ensures the safety and well being of all Praetorians by monitoring the people's thoughts through a network of psychics. Tilman herself is regarded as the most powerful psychic in the world after having joined her consciousness with that of Aurora Borealis. Both women now inhabit Aurora's body and have combined their powers to do far more for Praetoria together than they ever could apart.

Mother's Embrace.description: Fungus run amok' is probably the best way to describe these loathsome creatures. Like their inanimate ancestors, mushroom men prefer dark, dank places. In combat they can release clouds of deadly spores that choke and disable nearby enemies.

Mother's Lost Beauty.description: These Crystal captains command their sparkling soldiers in combat, chattering amongst one another with voices like breaking glass. In combat they rain down shards of razor sharp crystal and pummel their opponents mercilessly. Like their followers, these creatures fear smashing attacks.

Mouthpiece of the All-Mother.description: The ultimate eco-warriors, the Greater Devoured incorporate the biomass of fallen heroes into their monstrous forms. They rend foes with their slashing talons, spitting poison on those they can't reach. A Greater Devoured is a formidable foe, resistant to most kinds of attacks.

Mr. DuBois.description: Chief of Security for Tyrant's Palace, Ted Dubois has run the casino with brutal efficiency for years. With the help of his assistant, Sylvia Rexson, no one has managed to successfully pull off a job on the Casino on his watch. Ted Dubois is brutal and completely without sentiment and he maintains a hawk-eyed vigil over his casino, observing everything that occurs with an exacting attention to detail.

Mr. G.description: Mr. G, otherwise known as Doppelganger, was the assassin who trained Praetor Sinclair after killing his parents. Mr. G's abilities may have dulled over the years, but he is still a very dangerous man to try to fight, especially if he's been given time to prepare.

Mr. Rodney.description:
Mr. Rodney is a 'veteran' Goldbricker who has been promoted to role of a spokesperson for King Midas.

Whenever Midas wishes to bargain a deal with a villain or organization, he will send one of his spokespersons to do so for him.

He's been armed with an advanced version of the AU System combat gear, courtesy of customizations from Princess Zoe and using exotic materials they can't afford to incorporate into the standard-issue version. This, naturally, makes him far more powerful and dangerous as a result, and without any risk of the side-effects seen with the inferior unstable tech of his peers.

Ms. Liberty.description: Megan is the daughter of the original Miss Liberty from the Golden Age. She has taken up the mantle to fight for freedom, in this specific case to free Paragon City from its infestation of villains. She has heightened strength and endurance as well as the power of the Liberty Belt, which was passed on to her by her grandmother.

Ms. Shock.description: Ms. Shock is a mutant with the ability to store and discharge electrical energy. She uses her powers to counter super-powered threats.

Mu Adept.description: The most gifted Mu Strikers are given far more than promotions and new uniforms-they are given eldritch secrets to unlock their inner powers. As long as they continue to use them in Arachnos' service, of course.
