Peculiar Heavy Hands.description: There's definitely something wrong with this Resistance fighter. Just being near them causes your head to swim.

Peculiar Leader.description: There's definitely something wrong with this D.U.S.T. soldier. Just being near them causes your head to swim.

Peculiar Painted One.description: As if the Failed Experiments weren't bad enough already, this one seems to be different somehow. Just being near it makes your head swim.

Pendragon.description: Born of death, the knight known only as Pendragon is the single mightiest combatant within the legion of the Black Knights. No challenger has ever defeated him in single combat, and even the mighty Dread Templar whisper that some preternatural force guides Pendragon's every move. Is he destined only to be Lorn's most potent blunt instrument?  Or is his past grander and his future greater than any around him have predicted?

Penelope Mayhem.description: Formerly the Praetorian Penelope Yin, Penelope Mayhem is the collected consciousness of the Awakened. She is driven by all the negative emotions they felt and wants nothing more than to spread these feelings throughout the entire world. It is possible that once this is done, the regular Penelope Yin will be able to emerge. However, it's just as likely that that will not break the pure anger that is now Penelope Mayhem.

Penelope Yin.description: Penelope Yin is a normal girl who works at her father's store, enjoys talking to her friends, and happens to be the most powerful psychic on the planet. Penny already uses her powers naturally, but has only recently had any combat training. Penelope has recently gained the protection of the Clockwork King, who thinks of her as his 'Clockwork Princess'.

Penumbra Adjutant.description: The Penumbra Adjutants have completed their covert ops training and are on the verge of being promoted to Elite status. They have yet to benefit from a course of super soldier serum, but they have honed their stealth and physique to a near perfect level. Adjutants are often tasked with leading squads of Penumbra soldiers on raids to raise funds for the Council.

Penumbra Archon.description: A Penumbra Archon is responsible for overseeing squads of covert operatives. Since coverts ops need to be precise and perfectly executed, a Penumbra Archon is valued chiefly for his ability to follow orders precisely and make sure his troops do the same. In return for loyalty and good service, Archons receive their first taste of super soldier serum, making them stronger and quicker than any normal human could be.

Penumbra Assault.description: The Penumbra is the Council's special operations division, tasked with covert ops, assassinations, and espionage. Even the lowest level recruits receive some special training, particularly in stealth and evasion techniques. New recruits must have some military or law enforcement experience before being accepted into the Penumbra.

Penumbra Buckshot.description: The Penumbra is the Council's special operations division, tasked with covert ops, assassinations, and espionage. Even the lowest level recruits receive some special training, particularly in stealth and evasion techniques. New recruits must have some military or law enforcement experience before being accepted into the Penumbra.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Adjutant.description: Unlike their counterparts in the other branches of the Council's hierarchy, the Penumbra Cor Leonis Adjutants have considerable autonomy. The Council feels that the subversive activities that fall within the Penumbra's purview require a certain amount of independence. This makes the Penumbra Cor Leonis quite unpredictable at times - and thus, quite deadly.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Archon.description: The Penumbra Cor Leonis Archons author their own plans to sow terror and fear across Paragon City. Many are in command of small military cells, completely cut off from their compatriots - both for the sake of security, and to encourage independent thinking.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Fire.description: The Cor Leonis of the Penumbra have transcended mere special ops status. They are each unto themselves a powerful covert force, capable of taking on operations that would normally require an entire team of commandos. In addition to their enhanced physical and mental attributes, they receive training in security systems, computer infiltration, and surveillance equipment. In many ways, they are the perfect spies.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Force.description: The Cor Leonis of the Penumbra have transcended mere special ops status. They are each unto themselves a powerful covert force, capable of taking on operations that would normally require an entire team of commandos. In addition to their enhanced physical and mental attributes, they receive training in security systems, computer infiltration, and surveillance equipment. In many ways, they are the perfect spies.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Grenade.description: The Cor Leonis of the Penumbra have transcended mere special ops status. They are each unto themselves a powerful covert force, capable of taking on operations that would normally require an entire team of commandos. In addition to their enhanced physical and mental attributes, they receive training in security systems, computer infiltration, and surveillance equipment. In many ways, they are the perfect spies.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Marksman.description: The Cor Leonis of the Penumbra have transcended mere special ops status. They are each unto themselves a powerful covert force, capable of taking on operations that would normally require an entire team of commandos. In addition to their enhanced physical and mental attributes, they receive training in security systems, computer infiltration, and surveillance equipment. In many ways, they are the perfect spies.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Rocket.description: The Cor Leonis of the Penumbra have transcended mere special ops status. They are each unto themselves a powerful covert force, capable of taking on operations that would normally require an entire team of commandos. In addition to their enhanced physical and mental attributes, they receive training in security systems, computer infiltration, and surveillance equipment. In many ways, they are the perfect spies.

Penumbra Cor Leonis Sonic.description: The Cor Leonis of the Penumbra have transcended mere special ops status. They are each unto themselves a powerful covert force, capable of taking on operations that would normally require an entire team of commandos. In addition to their enhanced physical and mental attributes, they receive training in security systems, computer infiltration, and surveillance equipment. In many ways, they are the perfect spies.

Penumbra Elite Adjutant.description: A Penumbra Elite at the peak of his game may earn the rank of Adjutant, and with it a large upgrade in super soldier serum. He is on the verge of Cor Leonis status, and his mind has become focused with laser-like intensity. High ranking Elites are some of the best shots and most dedicated insurgents in the world. They can, and have, assassinated heads of state as well as world famous heroes.

Penumbra Elite Archon.description: While most Elites concentrate on learning the basic skills required for special ops, the Archons receive additional training in tactics. They're also trained in technological skills, such as wire tapping and circumventing security systems. Combined with their prodigious super soldier enhancements, these skills make Elite Archons well-prepared to plan and carry out small covert ops.

Penumbra Elite Assault.description: The Penumbra Elites are world-class special forces operatives, as well trained as any Navy SEAL. They're expert insurgents, capable of infiltrating a target swiftly and silently, then taking it down. Elites undergo a basic super soldier regimen designed to heighten their stealth, accuracy, and concentration. These enhancements make them incredibly dangerous, especially when encountered in force.

Penumbra Elite Fire.description: The Penumbra Elites are world-class special forces operatives, as well trained as any Navy SEAL. They're expert insurgents, capable of infiltrating a target swiftly and silently, then taking it down. Elites undergo a basic super soldier regimen designed to heighten their stealth, accuracy, and concentration. These enhancements make them incredibly dangerous, especially when encountered in force.

Penumbra Elite Force.description: The Reflections seem to echo the villains of other worlds, not just in appearance, but also in demeanor. These Reflections of Council agents are expert soldiers, as skilled and deadly as any Navy SEAL.

Penumbra Elite Grenade.description: The Reflections seem to echo the villains of other worlds, not just in appearance, but also in demeanor. These Reflections of Council agents are expert soldiers, as skilled and deadly as any Navy SEAL.

Penumbra Elite Marksman.description: The Penumbra Elites are world-class special forces operatives, as well trained as any Navy SEAL. They're expert insurgents, capable of infiltrating a target swiftly and silently, then taking it down. Elites undergo a basic super soldier regimen designed to heighten their stealth, accuracy, and concentration. These enhancements make them incredibly dangerous, especially when encountered in force.

Penumbra Elite Sharpshooter.description: Those gifted with incredible accuracy are quickly transferred into the Penumbra division, where they undergo lengthy treatments to refine their abilities. The Sharpshooters are natural loners and disdain associating with the rank and file. The only praise they seek is the satisfaction of a silent kill.

Penumbra Elite Sonic.description: The Reflections seem to echo the villains of other worlds, not just in appearance, but also in demeanor. These Reflections of Council agents are expert soldiers, as skilled and deadly as any Navy SEAL.

Penumbra Gunner.description: The Penumbra is the Council's special operations division, tasked with covert ops, assassinations, and espionage. Even the lowest level recruits receive some special training, particularly in stealth and evasion techniques. New recruits must have some military or law enforcement experience before being accepted into the Penumbra.

Penumbra Marksman.description: The Penumbra is the Council's special operations division, tasked with covert ops, assassinations, and espionage. Even the lowest level recruits receive some special training, particularly in stealth and evasion techniques. New recruits must have some military or law enforcement experience before being accepted into the Penumbra.

Percy Winkley.description: As one of the younger members of the Midnight Squad, Percy seems to get himself into a lot of trouble. Often acting before thinking through what he's doing or where he's going, he has a tendency to find himself strung up by one villain group or another. Thankfully, the Midnighters can spare a member or two for a rescue operation. Percy escapes the full wrath of the Midnight Club leaders because, while his risks seem rash, they often result in large windfalls of knowledge and lore for the Club.

Perfected Oscillator.description: The airborne Clockwork Oscillators are a new and deadly threat to Paragon City's skies. Like their grounded counterparts, the Sprockets, these high-flying mechanical men attack using bolts of electricity. They are immune to any psychological attacks.

Perioeci of Twilight.description: Like the Helots beneath them, these Perioeci are not full citizens of Ravenna; they are warriors proving their power and devotion to the cause, to eventually earn the right to be shown the true Path of the Dark as the Ravenna call it, to not merely sip from the power within but to fully embrace it.

Personal Storage Vault.description: An access point to your personal storage for Invention Salvage.

Pestilence.description: No Rikti warriors are more feared than those known as the 4 Riders. Said to have suffered some strange transformation during the crossing between worlds even their fellow Rikti are terrified of them. The Rider known as Pestilence infects his foes, weakening them and their allies.

Peter.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Petey.description: One of Frank McCain's dogs, Petey is a savage yet loyal companion to his gun-toting master. He's also McCain's favorite.

Phantom Essence.description: This Phantom essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Phil.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Photon Seeker.description: This Photon Seeker is a manifestation Kheldian Peacebringer power. It will seek out any enemy threat.

Piecemeal.description: Dr. Pierce has committed herself to the advancement of the Freaklok by personally testing nearly every bit of technology on herself before it goes out into the field. The result is this new cybernetic evolution of the woman who once ran a shop out of Skyway City.

Pillar of Ice and Flame.description: The Aspect of the Pillar allows access to the temporal network of Ouroboros' Pillar of Ice and Flame, allowing you to revisit the past and try your hand at missions you have outleveled.

Pincher.description: Pincher is a professional thief sometimes working out of Striga Isle. Her ability to shrink and enlarge items has allowed her to pull off a number of very impressive heists.

Pistol Adept.description: Only those that have achieved enlightenment through brutal combat, have proved themselves worthy members of the Syndicate and unlocked their true potential may call themselves Adepts.

Pistol Initiate.description: The Syndicate has survived by recruiting only those with at least some psychic potential. The initiates are the bottom rung of Syndicate ladder, they have yet to prove themselves and ascend to the ranks of Adept.

Pitbull.description: Pitbull is an enforcer for the Marcone Family in Port Oakes. You've agreed to help the Marcones with a few problems they've been having, and Pitbull has been sent along to assist you.

Pizzazz.description: Pizzazz is a Magic Origin hero who has come under Mage Killer's Zuhkara's purview. Destroy her!

Pledged of Steel.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. At the foundation of the Chain is the Legacy of the Sword. They are the strong arm of the group and protect the mystics of the other Legacies with their lives. They never retreat and willingly give their lives for their sacred cause.

Polar Shift.description: Polar Shift was orphaned when a tragic avalanche buried her parent's cabin. She barely survived by becoming one with the bone chilling ice, changing her life forever.

Polaris Essence.description: This Polar Light essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Police - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Police - Male.description: This hapless citizen is in over his head.

Police Drone.description: These non-lethal Police Drones have been dispatched by the Paragon City PD to help keep our streets safe. Unfortunately, the Portal Corporation is still developing the technology, so the Police Drones have limited their deployment to areas vital to the city. The Drones quickly dispatch any threats by teleporting them to one of Paragon City's jails, where the police take the situation over. Accidents have thus far been few and far between, but the authorities are still nervous about innocents being caught in the crossfire.

Poltergeist.description: Bound to the earth for so long and subjected to Diabolique's corrupt power, eventually each of her minions snap. When they do their powers increase proportionally. They no longer care if they can ever escape; they simply want to destroy the living.

Pop Up Anti-Personnel Gun.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a Pop-Up Anti-Personnel turret. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'Our hidden turrets can be a placed as nasty surprise for anyone who thinks they've bypassed your security.'

Port Noble Patroller.description: The members of the Port Noble Citizen's Brigade are armed citizens standing up for their right and freedoms after the collapse of the Council in Striga Isle. The Patrollers are the least trained, and so have been given some special armaments to shore up their lack of expertise.

Port Noble Shot-caller.description: The members of the Port Noble Citizen's Brigade are armed citizens standing up for their right and freedoms after the collapse of the Council in Striga Isle. The Shot-callers live up their names - they are the field generals that keep the citizens motivated and organized.

Portal.description: The Banished Pantheon is attempting to contact the spirit world through this portal. It must be destroyed!

Portal Killer.description: This dimensional vortex is allowing the Rikti to bring in re-enforcements. It must be destroyed!

Portal Scientist.description: This Portal Corp. scientist has been working with Longbow on their portal technology. Too bad for him.

Portal to Malaise.description: This portal has been opened by Desdemona into the Seer Network. It will take you to the network node where Malaise stands guard, preventing any direct assault on Mother Mayhem.

Portal to Mother Mayhem.description: This portal has been opened by Desdemona into the Seer Network. It will take you to the network node where Mother Mayhem can be found.

Portal to Penelope Yin.description: This portal has been opened by Desdemona into the Seer Network. It will take you to the network node where Mother Mayhem and Penelope Yin are in continual conflict over control of Penelope's mind.

Portal to the Beyond.description: This strange portal is bringing in entities for different worlds, times, and realities. A sufficiently strong attack my disrupt it's energies long enough to get what you need from it.

Portal to the Well.description: This portal has been opened by Desdemona into the Seer Network. It will take you to the network node where the now disembodied mind of Shalice Tilman has merged with Malaise.

Porter.description: Because they have a relatively small number of men, the Sky Raiders rely on speed and maneuverability to win battles. No one is faster than the Porters, special forces who can teleport directly into or out of battle, allowing them to strike where the enemy's weakest and retreat from dire situations.

Porter Bot Incinerator.description: In the name of dynamically changing tactics in a changing world, the Sky Raiders have equipped some surplus Jump Bots with surplus Porter packs. While the combination is unorthodox, it has achieved enough success to be put into the field.

Porter Engineer.description: Sky Raider Engineers can deploy a hovering force field generator to protect nearby troops. They are typically armed with submachine guns, flamethrowers, or other weapons suitable for fighting in confined spaces.

Positron.description: Dr. Raymond Keyes developed a high-tech battle suit that allowed him to channel bolts of anti-matter into fierce attacks. He used his powers to help defeat the Rikti, but at a terrible cost. Due to injuries he sustained at that time, he lost full control of his powers. Now, to protect others from himself, he remains imprisoned within his battle suit. He is constantly searching for a cure for his condition, but that does not stop him from contributing to the defense of Paragon City and contributing many other technological breakthroughs for the good of all.

Posse.description: These young hotheads are not the brightest bunch, but they are extremely loyal to the right leader. The Posse are not the toughest bunch, but there are a lot of them.

Possessed Duke Mordorgar.description: The Hellion known as Duke Mordragar has been possessed by the Circle of Thorns.

Possessed Manslayer.description: As if the Failed Experiments weren't bad enough already, this one seems to be different somehow. Just being near it makes your head swim.

Possessed Officer.description: There's definitely something wrong with this Resistance fighter. Just being near them causes your head to swim.

Possessed Provost.description: There's definitely something wrong with this D.U.S.T. soldier. Just being near them causes your head to swim.

Possessed Scientist.description: Fooling around with magic by using science can lead to unpredictable results. Being possessed by a hostile entity is just one of them.

Possession Junkie.description: This gentleman wants to be possessed by one of the Apparitions of First Ward, and is willing to pay handsomely for the privilege. Some people will do anything to feel alive.

Power Absorber.description: The Fail Safe device will destroy any follower of the Reichsman. This is a last resort device.

Power Blaster Clone.description: Crey has created cloned super-humans like this one using DNA harvested from fallen heroes and villains. This clone has the ability to fire powerful bolts of pure energy.

Power Crystal.description: These power crystals are a common tool of supernatural types. Each generates sufficient power to provide for the needs of a small base.

Power Disruptor.description: In ur zonz brakin ur stuffz

Power Drone Pet.description: Vanguard has awarded you with a prototype Power Drone.

Power Micro-Reactor.description:
These high-end microbial-electric reactors produce a network of on-demand power cleanly through the natural processes of bacteria native only to the Rikti dimension. The attached floor-lines carry the generator's current to their destinations.

Destroying this particular generator will deprive any connected devices of additional power to function.

Power Oscillator Pet.description: This Clockwork Oscillator has somehow adopted you as its owner.

Power Transfer Tower.description: These strange devices thrum with power, harvesting the meta-human energies gathered by the Web and channeling them into Lord Recluse.

Praefectus Castorum.description: Throughout the battlefield, you can hear the shouts and commands of the Praefectus. They alone can keep the bloodlust and battle frenzy that flows through the veins of every Cimeroran in check.

Praefectus Castorum Essence.description: This Cimeroran Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Praetor White.description: Praetor White is the head of the Powers Divsiion for all of Praetoria. He is Cole's right hand man and is determined to keep the peace within Praetoria.

Praetorian Battle Orb.description: This is a hard light hologram of a Praetorian Battle Orb.

Presence of Mother Mayhem.description: Luckily, this is not actually Mother Mayhem, but rather the lingering psychic impression of her presence within a Seer's mind.

President Marchand.description: President Marchand is the leader of the Rogue Isles. He is currently being hunted down by Lord Recluse and his minions. In an effort to further protect himself he has donned a power suit to keep him safe.

Priestess of the Path.description: Priestesses in the Ravenna Conclave are ones who have given their lives to the pursuit of advancing the overall prosperity of the society. They have earned the respect of the elders and the ruling class, and been inducted into the Path of the Dark fully.

Prima Capo.description: The Prima Capo is the 'Head Capo' and reports directly to the Don. In Paragon City, you don't rise to the top without a little super-powered help, and many Underbosses have heightened abilities or access to specialized gear that helps them stay on top in their cutthroat business. Some Prima Capos have become so strong that they carry around a huge chunk of concrete to show their opponents 'who is the real boss around here'. They're able to swing these huge weapons with ease and use them for intimidation, though usually it's used to bash in someone's head.

Prima Consigliere.description: In Paragon City, you don't become one of the Don's trusted advisors without a little super-powered expertise. Consiglieres have far more subtle powers than their Underboss counterparts, which match their more subtle responsibilities within the Family. The highest of the Consiglieres have modified their abilities to also heal their fellow mafioso around them. The Consiglieres are dangerous on their own, but they're even more powerful when they're around their goons.

Primal Wolf.description: These wolves, while fiercely loyal, will only fight by their summoner's side for a short time before they vanish back into the wild. Primal Wolves attack with bite attacks and howls.

Primate Psi-Protector.description:
This Rikti monkey serves as the anchor for the force field protecting K'ong...

Defeating it should make K'ong vulnerable to damage!

Princess Zoe.description: This is a cut scene actor and should never be fought by players.

Prisoner.description: This pitiful soul has been imprisoned for Cole-knows how long in the Behavioral Adjustment Facility.

Private Security Captain.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Private Security Guard.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Private Security Officer.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Professor Echo.description: Professor Echo is a scientific genius and master of time travel. What he's doing here, bothering you, remains a mystery.

Professor Lovelethe.description: This esteemed scientist was captured by the Devouring Earth. His partner, Dr. Theron, is still missing.

Projection of Sorceress Serene.description: This flickering image is merely a projection of the evil Sorceress Serene. It is but a shadow of her true power.

Prophet.description: Powerful mystics in their own rights, Prophets look forward into the future and try to guide their flock to safety and success in the violent land of First Ward.

Prophetess.description: The Prophetesses were once women who held a latent connection to the mystical elements. Rather than be twisted into a half-serpent monstrosity like their lesser kin, for whom elemental affinity was not natural, the Prophetesses retain much of their human form, with only their skin and feet showing the changes they have undergone as members of the Talons of Vengeance. They have a much greater control over the elements to which they are attuned and are capable of quickly overwhelming the unprepared with a flood of mystical energy in the form of fire, ice, shadow, lightning or earth.

Protean.description: Protean is a notorious shapeshifter, known for his murders of high profile heroes and their families. His earliest victims were the parents of Manticore. He also is responsible for the death of Dauntless, Galaxy Girl's sidekick. It was rumored that Manticore killed Protean in a fight some time ago but somehow Protean survived. He is now out to continue his reign of terror upon the people of Paragon and the Isles, while aiding the forces of Praetoria!

Protector Bot.description: Positron has dabbled in Robotics on occasion, though he has not had much success.

Protester.description: This Praetorian Citizen is angry. The Resistance has managed to twist their sense of right and wrong and now they are vehemently opposed to Emperor Cole and Praetorian Law.

Proton.description: A refugee from another dimension and time, Proton seeks a way back home to his true world. The clone of the son of his world's Manticore and Sister Psyche, Proton was raised by his 'uncle' Positron after their untimely death. Wearing Positron's final armor design, Proton faced down the combined might of the Arachnos Empire during the world's most desperate moment and lost. Ripped through time and space, Proton now seeks to defend Paragon City from Arachnos before it's too late for this world. And perhaps along the way, he'll be able to use his superior intellect from a future that never was to return to his home.

Prototype Oscillator.description: The airborne Clockwork Oscillators are a new and deadly threat to Paragon City's skies. Like their grounded counterparts, the Sprockets, these high-flying mechanical men attack using bolts of electricity. They are immune to any psychological attacks.

Prototype_Fake Nemesis.description: No one alive has ever seen Nemesis' true face. He hides within his finely wrought armor, safe behind personal force fields and a variety of armaments. He has many such suits of armor, each of which is a robot in its own right, capable of acting - and killing - independently.

Provost.description: Emperor Cole's army was divided after news of his bargain with Hamidon was spread by TPN. Many members of the IDF defected and joined the Resistance, realizing that Calvin Scott was right all along. These soldiers now believe in the cause of Calvin Scott, even if they do not believe directly in the man himself.

Proximity Bomb.description: It looks like this bomb is rigged to detonate when approached.

Psi-Scout Lk'Onik.description: Lk'Onik is a mystery even to his fellow Rikti. Though a life-long member of the Rikti Lineage of War, he left the military during the Restructurist/Traditionalist split for reasons of his own. He has been with the Traditionalists ever since, working towards peace.

PsiCurse.description: PsiCurse is a name that rings familiar to your ears. Be it from direct experience or from history, you at the least know his name is connected on Primal Earth with the disaster that destroyed much of Overbrook. You can't be sure of anyone's true nature is this somewhat familiar but distinctly bizarre universe, but he seems to be too weak and downtrodden to be much of a villain. One thing is for sure, though - you expected him to be a lot shorter...

Psimon Omega.description: Psimon Omega is an intimidating sort. He is a tall, strong man with a stare which looks right through you. It's said that he is a master psychic, capable of reading minds and seeing into the future. It's also said that he seeks to destroy any opposition to his psychic mastery.

Psionic Brass Conduit.description: The Clockwork King's improved psychic abilities apparently had a profound effect on his creations. These Clockwork are significantly stronger and more durable than their predecessors.

Psionic Crystal.description: This large crystal is part of Archus' psychic network. Destroy it!

Psionic Nexus.description: Penelope Mayhem has created an ally out of pure psionic energy. These allies unleash psionic storms as their primary means of attack. However, they will gradually build up psionic energy the longer they are alive. This will eventually reach a point where the Nexus is able to unleash a deadly explosion, which resets the buildup and allows it to begin again.

Psionic Typhoon.description: The battle for full control of Penelope Yin's mind has engulfed her network node in a gigantic psionic typhoon. Simply being here is a threat to your survival!

Psychic Defender Clone.description: Crey has created synthetic super-humans like this one using DNA harvested from fallen heroes and villains. This clone's brain has been modified into a living weapon, capable of firing deadly psionic attacks.

Psychotic.description: Psychotics are psychics who couldn't handle even the early stages of Mother Mayhem's 'training'. They've gone completely crazy and are utterly without fear. Though most of their psychic abilities have dissipated, what is left has mutated them into violent attackers who concentrate their last remaining energy into attacks which manifest physical pain in their targets.

Pumicite.description: The Pumicites may look ponderous and stupid, but get too close and you'll see why the police prefer to take on the Trolls. The creatures' porous stone bodies make them surprisingly quick and agile fighters, and their skin is hard and abrasive, like that of a shark. More than one hero has come to regret closing ranks with a Pumicite, and their ability to rip boulders from the ground and hurl them at enemies makes them deadly even at a distance.

Pumicite Lord.description: The Pumicites may look ponderous and stupid, but get too close and you'll see why the police prefer to take on the Trolls. The creatures' porous stone bodies make them surprisingly quick and agile fighters, and their skin is hard and abrasive, like that of a shark. More than one hero has come to regret closing ranks with a Pumicite, and their ability to rip boulders from the ground and hurl them at enemies makes them deadly even at a distance.

Pumpkin.description: It may not be a great pumpkin, but it's the best it can be.

Pumpkin Patch.description: The Pumpkin Kings fiery Pumpkin Bomb exploded and left this burning patch on the ground.

Punk.description: These young hotheads are not the brightest bunch, but they are extremely loyal to the right leader. This makes them a valuable asset to a Mastermind who is smart enough, and strong enough, to utilize their talents. His gang related activities have taught him well, and he is a pretty good shot with his pistols.

Pylon Nuke.description: These devices create an instability in the interdimensional field. When several are operating at once you can redirect an Item of Power to your base.

Pyra.description: Once a beauty queen pageant winner that lost her looks when the building a pageant she was in burnt down. She vowed to make everyone suffer the way that she did that fateful day of the fire.

Pyrelord.description: Pyrelord has always been obsessed with death and fire. Every chance he gets, he uses his powers to create chaos and mayhem, watching the flames of destruction with eery fascination.

Pyriss.description: This young and trusting heroine is the perfect victim for Peter Themari. The fool actually thinks you're helping her!

Pyrokineticist.description: The Syndicate encourages their Adepts to advance their psychic powers, so it isn't uncommon to see Pyrokineticists within their ranks. These fiery Adepts are capable of not only hurling bolts of fire, but also stealing power from their foes to build their own.

Pyrolicious.description: Theus Matchley was a small-time Hellion thug when his mutation manifested itself. Torn between the power and wealth he was sure to obtain from rising in the Hellion ranks and his conscience telling him he should be using his gifts to aid mankind, Theus danced between vigilante and villain, until one fateful day when he was confronted by the hero Alley Stalker, who gave him a lesson in civic responsibility resulting in a lengthy hospital stay. Alley visited Theus in the hospital every day, talking to him about how much suffering the Hellions had caused over the years, and upon his release, took on Theus as a sidekick. He even gave Theus his Superhero moniker when, after a particularly spectacular fireball, Alley shouted out "that was righteously Pyrolicious, man!"

Quad Howitzer Battery.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a Quad Howitzer Battery. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'The Quad Howitzer Battery provides top-notch firepower for defending your installation with its four heavy cannons and optional flamethrower.'

Quantum Agent.description: The stone-faced, suit clad Field Agents are Crey's main investigative branch. They can be found carrying out a variety of missions, from espionage to assassination ops. They carry the latest weapons and receive intense close combat training.

Quantum Alley Cat.description: The lowest rank of those who serve Bobcat is filled with strays. She searches the streets of the city for those who have nowhere else to go. She prefers those who have been injured in some way, mentally or physically and bear a grudge toward the ones that hurt them. Bobcat offers her Alley Cats something to fight for...and against.

Quantum Champion of Battle.description: To defeat the enemy in front of you and take the battle is the second lesson of the Champions of War Earth. They believe that if you cannot hold your place in the line then not only will you fall, but so will your comrades around you.

Quantum Champion of Mourning.description: The first thing that is taught to the Champions of War Earth is that you must always respect those who fall in battle. It does not matter if they are your comrades or your enemy, all those who give their lives to combat must be remembered.

Quantum Champion of War.description: The final lesson of the Champions of War Earth is that you must consider each action in terms of the larger picture. If you sacrifice too much to win one battle then you may lose the war. The highest rank of the Champions is always filled with master strategists.

Quantum Chiller.description: Outcast Initiates who show potential are valuable commodities amongst the Outcasts, and are quickly elevated up the ranks. Chillers have grown beyond the ability to keep a drink cool.

Quantum Eidolon.description: In Dr. Vahzilok's mind, the Eidolons are mankind's next great evolutionary leap. Unlike the cadavers, they retain all of their memories and personality. The lucky few who can pay to become a Eidolon are augmented with the remains of heroes, so they often have super powers. Quantum Eidolons have mastered the ability to control darkness itself. They tend to root their foes with tendrils of darkness and then launch into an attack.

Quantum Infantry.description: The Rikti have come to stand for everything humans hate and fear in the universe. Their unprovoked invasion of Earth has left much of the planet traumatized and angry. Even out of their battle armor, their high-tech weaponry makes Rikti dangerous opponents.

Quantum Jump Bot.description: The Jump Bots are a recent addition to the mercenary Sky Raiders' arsenal. Their effectiveness in combat has allowed the Raiders to greatly expand operations. Well armed and armored, the Jump Bots earned their name from their leaping ability, which allows them tremendous maneuverability.

Quantum Lynx.description: After an Alley Cat develops some skill he is moved to a leadership position. They have to be tough to attain this status but they must have compassion for their comrades as well. Bobcat will not tolerate cruelty among her group.

Quantum Mistress.description: The Ring Mistresses are taken from the ranks of the Carnival. The strongest minds with the most capacity for evil are shaped and then hidden behind the most powerful masks that the Carnival has. No one is certain where these masks come from but they enhance the psychic abilities of the Ring Mistresses exponentially. They rule the troupes of the Carnival with a steel hand in a velvet glove.

Quantum Ocelot.description: The most important quality that Bobcat looks for when moving one of her people to the rank of Ocelot is trustworthiness. If Bobcat cannot hold someone at their word, they will never succeed in her group. Woe to anyone who betrays her.

Quantum Paragon Protector.description: Crey denies the rumors that the Paragon Protectors are corporate pawns, but no one outside the company knows the truth for sure. The Claw Pattern hero is a master of melee combat, using both claws and enhanced physical attributes to make mincemeat of his or her opponents.

Quantum Red Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The red ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Red Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Quantum Servant.description: To be bound to Dominatrix is an honor that must be earned. Going without sleep and other trials of endurance are given to candidates to prove their worth. Passing means a term of servitude where complete obedience is expected.

Quantum Strongman.description: The Steel Strongmen are the pinnacle of the Carnival's muscle. Upon loyal service as an Iron Strongman for 5 years and a day, they are re-sealed into specially designed helms that provide the normal protections as well as the ability to harness their inner strength to weaken their opponent's attacks.

Quantum Trainer.description: Trainers are very important to Dominatrix's organization. They teach the new Servants to fight effectively and work as a unit. They also fill the position of tactical leader in combat quite often.

Quantum Volt.description: Outcast Initiates who show potential are valuable commodities amongst the Outcasts, and are quickly elevated up the ranks. Volts have shown promise in manipulating and controlling their Electrical powers.

QuantumLady.description: The Lady is the mistress of all she surveys. She is responsible for a number of Trainers and Servants. There is a strong bond of fealty that goes both ways in these relationships. With power comes responsibility.

Quarry.description: The greatest of Hamidon's rock beasts, Quarry roams Eden with a single purpose: to destroy any humans who stray inside. It may not be the smartest of Hamidon's followers, but it's certainly among the strongest. More than one hero has met his fate beneath Quarry's stony foot.

Quartz.description: The Devouring Earth grows these crystalline warriors in special caves deep beneath the Earth. Their blasts of shards can cut deeply into a target's flesh and bone, and energy attacks have a diminished effect against their crystalline forms. Luckily, they're susceptible to smashing attacks.

Quartz Shard.description: Even Shards from a fallen crystalline creature can prove deadly.

Quill.description: Venom runs through Quill's veins. His spines are toxic and deadly.

RAM Series I.description: This early prototype of the Robotic Attack Module was created very soon after Siege. It is fairly rudimentary and limited in its powers. It has none of Sieges intellect or creativity but can still pose a threat.

RAM Series I Quantum.description: This early prototype of the Robotic Attack Module was created very soon after Siege. It is fairly rudimentary and limited in its powers. It has none of Sieges intellect or creativity but can still pose a threat.

RAM Series II.description: The second series of Robotic Attack Modules was more successful than the first but still did not accomplish what Neuron had hoped. It became increasingly apparent that Siege was a once in a lifetime creation.

RAM Series II Quantum.description: The second series of Robotic Attack Modules was more successful than the first but still did not accomplish what Neuron had hoped. It became increasingly apparent that Siege was a once in a lifetime creation.

RAM Series III.description: The most recent Robotic Attack Module poses the greatest threat. Neuron abandoned his old plans and concentrated on making these units powerful and durable. With that focus the Series III easily became the most successful of the RAM units.

RAM Series III Quantum.description: The most recent Robotic Attack Module poses the greatest threat. Neuron abandoned his old plans and concentrated on making these units powerful and durable. With that focus the Series III easily became the most successful of the RAM units.

RIP.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

ROFLSTOMP.description: ROFLSTOMP is known amongst Freakshow for his signature attack style of rolling into a spikey ball and impaling those who challenge his leadership. Nobody outside the Freaks has ever seen this performed and lived to tell the tale.

Radiant Eremite.description: The Radiant Eremites are well-trained in the mystical arts and serve as commanders in the Carnival of Light. They can trace their origins back to the Legacy Chain, and retain some of their armor and accoutrements. It is under their tutelage that novitiates can gain strength and help the organization at large.

Radiant of Light.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Light are the order's lowest-ranking sorcerers.

Radiation Defender Clone.description: Crey has created synthetic super-humans like this one using DNA harvested from fallen heroes and villains. This clone is a natural nuclear reactor, bursting with atomic radiation.

Radiation Shield Generator.description: This machine can apply a temporary protective radiation shield.

Radiologist.description: Crey Industries believes firmly in hands on, frontline research, and they demand more from their scientists than most companies. Indeed, Crey Scientists often venture into the field, armed with Cryo weapons to help them collect samples - and do serious damage to anyone who get in their way.

Raging Ross.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Raider.description: Raiders are toughened survivalists who embody the phrase "Kill or be killed". These scavengers often take to robbing, killing, and enslaving the citizens of First Ward in order to sustain themselves.

Raider Engineer.description: Sky Raider Engineers can deploy a hovering force field generator to protect nearby troops. They are typically armed with submachine guns, flamethrowers, or other weapons suitable for fighting in confined spaces.

Raine Heartfall.description: Raine is a self taught student of the dark arts. Extensive study and practice has granted her the ability to control and manifest dark matter and energies from the netherworld. Through these means she has learned to replenish her own energy as well as that of those about her, and to weaken and slow her foes via physical manifestations.

Rampager.description: Marauder recruits only the most hungry and violent men into his ranks. He trains them hard enough to either turn them into rock or kill them. Those that graduate from this regimen are disciplined and deadly.

Rampager Quantum.description: Marauder recruits only the most hungry and violent men into his ranks. He trains them hard enough to either turn them into rock or kill them. Those that graduate from this regimen are disciplined and deadly.

Random Bug.description: One of many common issues, the 'bug' tends to annoy you and make your life difficult, but doesn't stop you in your tracks... unless there are a lot of them.

Ranged Hero.description: One of Paragon City's heroes thinks he can catch you unaware by ambushing you on your first task from Arachnos. He'd better think again!

Ranger.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Rangers are equipped with an upgraded Plasma Glove and Power Armor, making them resistant to all types of damage.

Raptor Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Raptor Agents are senior operatives who have achieved Wyvern's complete trust.

Rascal.description: These murderous creatures were feared by all in centuries past, but recently their existence has been dismissed as a myth. In fact, the Red Caps are quite real, and they enjoy nothing better than tormenting the various people they have trapped in Croatoa.

Raserei Elite Fire.description: Elite members of the Raserei have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the 5th Column remain secure.

Raserei Elite Fist.description: Elite members of the Raserei have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the 5th Column remain secure.

Raserei Elite Force.description: Elite members of the Raserei have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the 5th Column remain secure.

Raserei Elite Grenade.description: Elite members of the Raserei have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the 5th Column remain secure.

Raserei Elite Oberst.description: The Raserei Elite Obersts are among the few soldiers permitted to express their opinions to the 5th Column's leaders, though most wisely avoid doing so. They control almost all the internal operations of the 5th Column organization.

Raserei Elite Rifle.description: Elite members of the Raserei have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the 5th Column remain secure.

Raserei Elite Rocket.description: Elite members of the Raserei have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the 5th Column remain secure.

Raserei Elite Unteroffizier.description: The Elite Raserei Unteroffizier are those destined for positions of authority in the 5th Column hierarchy. Their authority supercedes nearly every other rank. These Unteroffizier reward the 5th Column with fanatical devotion to the cause. By the time someone has reached this lofty level, they have given up any semblance of a normal life. They belong to the Column, body and soul.

Raserei Fire.description: The Raserei are the pride and joy of the 5th Column's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the cause should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers; they're also perfect students of the fascist beliefs that form the core of the 5th Column's ideology. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Raserei.

Raserei Fist.description: The Raserei are the pride and joy of the 5th Column's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the cause should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers; they're also perfect students of the fascist beliefs that form the core of the 5th Column's ideology. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Raserei.

Raserei Force.description: The Raserei are the pride and joy of the 5th Column's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the cause should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers; they're also perfect students of the fascist beliefs that form the core of the 5th Column's ideology. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Raserei.

Raserei Grenade.description: The Raserei are the pride and joy of the 5th Column's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the cause should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers; they're also perfect students of the fascist beliefs that form the core of the 5th Column's ideology. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Raserei.

Raserei Oberst.description: The Raserei Obersts are the living essence of the 5th Column beliefs. While the Unteroffizier brim with enthusiasm, the Obersts radiate a palpable aura of danger. The Raserei carefully foster this mystique in order to keep order within the ranks of the 5th Column.

Raserei Rifle.description: The Raserei are the pride and joy of the 5th Column's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the cause should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers; they're also perfect students of the fascist beliefs that form the core of the 5th Column's ideology. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Raserei.

Raserei Rocket.description: The Raserei are the pride and joy of the 5th Column's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the cause should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers; they're also perfect students of the fascist beliefs that form the core of the 5th Column's ideology. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Raserei.

Raserei Ubermenschen Fire.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Raserei Ubermenschen Fist.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Raserei Ubermenschen Force.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Raserei Ubermenschen Grenade.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Raserei Ubermenschen Oberst.description: The Raserei Ubermenschen Obersts make up the inner circle that surrounds the 5th Column leadership. They are charged with the grand stratagems that further the ultimate goal of the 5th Column: the eventual domination of the world. The leaders of the Column foster a competitiveness between these high ranking officers in order to prevent any single one of them from acquiring too much power and becoming a threat.

Raserei Ubermenschen Rifle.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Raserei Ubermenschen Rocket.description: Every member of the 5th Column aspires to become one of the Raserei Ubermenschen, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the 5th Column - totally devoted to its beliefs and goals. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers and perfect models of behavior. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Raserei Ubermenschen Unteroffizier.description: Raserei Ubermenschen Unteroffiziere have the responsibility of leading large numbers of troops. They are concerned with training their men into peak fighting form - and recruiting new members to the cause. Until recently, none have ever been taken alive by the authorities.

Raserei Unteroffizier.description: Raserei Unteroffizier are zealots in every sense of the word. They believe in the 5th Column creed so fiercely that they have become experts at recruiting new members from the disaffected elements of society. Raserei Unteroffizier are in equal parts soldier and proselytizer.

Ravager.description: The Ravager is a twisted creature whose origins are not fully understood. Its appearance is remarkably similar to that of the much larger and more powerful Sentinel, but it also shares many features with the lesser creatures spawned by a god of the Pantheon. It seems that a Ravager represents a point of transition within the service of a god, where one has acquired many gifts and blessings from its master, but is not yet strong enough to be seen as one of a god's primary lieutenants.

Ravager Essence.description: This Banished Pantheon essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Ravenous Reanimated Corpse.description: The dead are restless and are walking the earth. They hunger for your flesh!

Ravenstorm.description: Joachim Matthias Reinhardt, an exchange student from Berlin, was obsessed with the dark matter that some Magic Origin heroes were able to channel into magnificent powers. Unwilling to tread down a mystical road himself, Joachim was determined to find a way to summon this dark matter through technology. Eventually, he created his "Nano-Noir" technology, which allowed small nannites within his body to store the dark matter and release it on demand. Of all Paragon City's heroes, Ravenstorm is the most solitary. Many find it surprising that he has formed such a close friendship with Moonfire, the Kheldian hero stationed on Striga Isle. But perhaps he considers her, like himself, alone in the world.

Raverobber.description: Raverobber is a Freakshow with more brains than most, although he tends to cast doubts on his perceived intelligence by regularly near-liquefying his brains with brain-rattling electronic music. Regardless of these attempts on his own potential, he has come into possession of some frighteningly advance notes on cybernetics and must be stopped before he can figure them out!

Raymond.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Razorvine.description: These horrid perversions of normal flora have become one of the most identifiable monsters in the Devouring Earth's maniacal menagerie. In addition to their astonishing mobility, they can fire swarms of thorns at their enemies, tearing flesh to shreds in an instant.

Reanimated Acolyte.description: This hollow shell of a Midnighter barely retains a hint of magical aptitude from its former life.

Reanimated Corpse.description: The dead are restless and are walking the earth. They hunger for your flesh!

Reaper.description: The Reapers seem to be the only normal humans among the ranks of Dr. Vahzilok's reanimated legions. They are trained surgeons who collect body parts with the help of poison darts and industrial strength hacksaws.

Reaper Quantum Gunner.description: The Reapers seem to be the only normal humans among the ranks of Dr. Vahzilok's reanimated legions. They are trained surgeons who collect body parts with the help of poison darts and industrial strength hacksaws.

Rebecca.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Rebecca J. Foss, Esq..description: Rebecca Foss leads Hero Corps, and is none-too-pleased to see the results of this investigation conclude in this manner.

Recall.description: A former Powers division operative. Recall has perfect recall of anything he sees.

Recruited Analyst.description: This civilian is in the wrong place at the wrong time, supporting or working with a cause that clashes with your values.

Red Hand.description: In 1717, these unfortunate French soldiers were slain by Captain Blackbeard and his bloodthirsty crew. They haunt the old fort now, slaying all those who approach their spectral domain and turning them into Night Haunts. The more powerful of their victims become Night Terrors.

Red Terror.description: In 1717, these unfortunate French soldiers were slain by Captain Blackbeard and his bloodthirsty crew. They haunt the old fort now, slaying all those who approach their spectral domain and turning them into Night Haunts. The more powerful of their victims become Night Terrors.

Red Widow.description:
In 1938 the previous ruler of Arachnos, The Weaver, plotted the death of Stefan Richter, the man who would later become known as Lord Recluse. This plot involved a young blind girl, Marlene Fortunata, who was to be used to lure the American mercenary into a trap. Marlene used her blindness to pretend not to be scared of Recluseâ€™s horrid appearance. It took months for the plan to work, but eventually Marlene was ready to strike.

But fate is a fickle thing, and during this time the would-be assassin had actually fallen in love with Recluse. She revealed The Weaver's treachery, and the two hatched a bloody scheme.

That night, Lia went to The Weaverâ€™s bed and gave him Recluseâ€™s bloody helm. He was dead, she claimed, as she ran her fingers through The Weaverâ€™s hair. Lia took the head of Arachnos to bed, and there used Recluseâ€™s own poison to murder her former master. From then on, she had become the 'Vedova Rossa'â€”the Red Widow.

Red Wisp Pet.description: This is a Faerie who has come from the Lost Lands to aid you.

Redcap Pet.description: This is a solidified, animated hologram of a Redcap Rascal.

Redd.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Reese.description: Cocky and self-centered, Reese has good reason to throw his weight around Powers Division. Of all of Marauder's Top Dogs none have risen higher or faster than him. No other Powers Division member can match Reese's strength, skill, and cunning, a point he makes abundantly clear with the broken bodies of those who would dare challenge him.

Regenerating Cadaver.description: These reanimated corpses give off a powerful stench that's a mixture of chemicals and rotting flesh. The odor becomes a hundred times worse when they use their favorite attack - vomiting a stream of corrosive acid on their nearby opponents.

Regenerative Lichen.description: This strange lichen appears to be emitting a regenerative aura now being picked up by the transformed War Walker.

Regent Korol.description: Regent Korol is one of the few Fortunatas chosen to devote themselves fully to Arachnos by becoming one of the powerful Tarantula Queens. Through the process she has gained immense psychic abilities that she uses to protect Arachnos from infiltration.

Rehabilitated Soldier.description: Rehabilitated Soldiers often lead other Forlorn into battle, drawing on their years of military training, tactical acumen, and advanced weaponry to protect their delicate and always-contested standing in First Ward.

Reichsman.description: This Marcus Cole, from an alternate dimension, was a rogue and a mercenary who was exposed to mustard gas during World War I. In search of a cure for the effects of the gas, Marcus discovered the Well of the Furies. He drank from the well and was granted incredible powers. Adopting the persona of Reichsman, Marcus used these powers in the service of the Axis powers on his world, leading them to victory over their foes. When he discovered the existence of another Earth, he traveled there and was defeated and imprisoned by the Freedom Phalanx. Now he's back, and ready for revenge.

Reinforced Door.description: This reinforced door stands between you and freedom!  The door seems to be vibrate and hum, as though it is coursing with energy.

Reinforcement Door.description: Through these doors will spawn endless waves of IDF super soldiers -- and these doors cannot be destroyed except with Molecular Acid!

Relentless Armor.description: Brought to life by magical incantations retained by the former Midnight Squad and nearly lost to history, these animated golems serve as powerful guardians and sentries for the Carnival of Vengeance, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes it would be better to join the Talons of Vengeance, rather than resist them. Constructed from scattered pieces of armor found around First Ward, the technologically advanced war machines make use of powerful tech swords which can fire bursts of energy at a target from range or rapidly cut them down in melee.

Renegade.description: Whether soldiers of fortune, former Destroyers, or ex-military, the Renegades are deadly combatants who are skilled with a large number of weapons they've acquired over the years. Their superior combat ability often lands them in leadership positions amongst groups of survivors in the wilderness.

Repair Bot.description: Menders are often seen repairing broken structures and machines, including other Androids. Their top priority is to keep the other Androids in tip-top working condition.

Repair Companion.description: Menders are often seen repairing broken structures and machines, including other Androids. Their top priority is to keep the other Androids in tip-top working condition.

Repair Field Generator.description: This generator is increasing the power level of the Council Goliath War Walker's repair field.

Repulsion Field.description: This is the emanation of the repulsion field that surrounds Mot.

Repulsive Spine.description: This is one of the many growths found around the area in which the creature Mot began to emerge from the ground. Diabolique has repurposed several of these growths to serve as foci for the magical rituals which have enveloped the area in a massive repulsion field.

Requiem.description: Ridolfo Uzzano has come a long way from his humble beginning as one of Mussolini's lapdogs. The primary cause of his success was his fusion with a Nictus, a being of utter darkness. The Nictus gave Ridolfo the ability to scorch his foes with an infernal fire. Though he is now over 100 years old, Requiem remains a fearsome foe in battle.

Research Assistant.description: Crey Industries believes firmly in hands on, frontline research, and they demand more from their scientists than most companies. Indeed, Crey Scientists often venture into the field, armed with Cryo weapons to help them collect samples - and do serious damage to anyone who get in their way.

Researcher.description: Crey Industries believes firmly in hands on, frontline research, and they demand more from their scientists than most companies. Indeed, Crey Scientists often venture into the field, armed with Cryo weapons to help them collect samples - and do serious damage to anyone who get in their way.

Resistance Commando.description: Resistance Commandos are surviving soldiers from the last wars before Cole's world order took over. They are well trained, disciplined, elite fighters armed with some of the best modified weapons the resistance can slap together.

Resistance Fighter.description: Resistance Fighters are experienced resistance recruits who have learned by doing rather than training. They are equipped with outdated military firearms that have been hastily upgraded with power packs and other accessories to give them a heavy enough punch to threaten the PPD.

Resistance Heavy Barrel.description: Resistance Heavy Barrels are walking mobile guns. Their exo-skeleton provides them with the strength to carry such high-powered weapons, and the addition of welded on steel plating enables them to withstand just about any return fire.

Resistance Heavy Barrel Elite.description: Resistance Heavy Barrels are walking mobile guns. Their exo-skeleton provides them with the strength to carry such high-powered weapons, and the addition of welded on steel plating enables them to withstand just about any return fire.

Resistance Heavy Hands.description: Resistance Heavy Hands are walking wrecking crews. Their exo-skeleton provides them with the strength to fight with their massive clockwork construction arms, and the addition of welded on steel plating enables them to withstand just about any fire on their way into melee, and any punishment their foes can dish out.

Resistance Heavy Hands Elite.description: Resistance Heavy Hands are walking wrecking crews. Their exo-skeleton provides them with the strength to fight with their massive clockwork construction arms, and the addition of welded on steel plating enables them to withstand just about any fire on their way into melee, and any punishment their foes can dish out.

Resistance Officer.description: Officers are veteran soldiers who have years of command experience. They use their leadership skills to hone the resistance fighters under their command into a deadly fighting force whether they are raw recruits, or elite commandos. They also pack the best weapons they can get their hands on.

Resistance Recruit.description: Resistance Recruits are largely untrained, fresh-faced recruits in the Resistance fighting force. They are equipped with outdated military firearms that have been hastily upgraded with power packs and other accessories to give them a heavy enough punch to threaten the PPD.

Resistance Reinforcement.description: Resistance Veterans are surviving soldiers from the last wars before Cole's world order took over. They are well trained, disciplined, elite fighters armed with some of the best modified weapons the resistance can slap together.

Resistance Runesoldier.description: Runesoldiers are high ranking members of the Resistance who have served under the tutelage of a master within the Carnival of Light. Through this training, they have adapted their high-tech weaponry to serve as a focus for mystic energies. However, their mastery of the knowledge they have received is less than ideal, causing their magical energy attacks to have a small element of randomness in the type of energy they produce.

Resistance Veteran.description: Resistance Veterans are surviving soldiers from the last wars before Cole's world order took over. They are well trained, disciplined, elite fighters armed with some of the best modified weapons the resistance can slap together.

Respiring Seedling.description: Respiring Seedlings allow the Seed of Hamidon to thicken the cloud of spores surrounding its body. For each Respiring Seedling alive, it becomes more difficult to hit the Seed and the range at which it can be attacked is lowered.

Resplendent Mistress.description: The Mistresses are extremely powerful sorceresses and mystics, able to twist magical energies into a diverse selection of abilities. They represent some of the most loyal of Vanessa's original followers and form the core leadership of all operations within the Praetorian Carnival. They bear the responsibility for integrating the remnants of the disparate magical groups in Praetoria into a cohesive unit. With few exceptions, they are the most talented mystics in the Carnival of Light.

Responder.description:
Blackwing Industries is a private military company which has been contracted by Paragon City to replace the police in Kallisti Wharf.

Patrollers that interact with the public are the 'face' of the company, but behind the scenes they operate to protect Blackwing's interests. When an incident is unfolding that requires action, a Patroller will equip BWI's patented kinetic dampening armor and become a Responder.

Resurrection Circle.description: The healing altar works similar to a hospital, teleporting defeated members to the altar and automatically healing them. Its healing is less efficient than a hospital's, but can be improved with auxiliary items.

Resurrection Watcher.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Reviler.description: One of the more dramatic transformations caused by an allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, the Reviler has lost almost all resemblance to her former human self. This woman has now become a humanoid bird with exceptional vision and the ability to fly. Because of her extremely keen senses and superior mobility, the Reviler makes an excellent scout and archer.

Revivication.description: This entity Revives Nightstar and Siege

Richard.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Ricochet.description:
From her broad smile and the splash of crazy in her eyes, to her dizzying speech pattern and signature pink PPD helmet, everything about Ricochet is memorable. She earned her name like most of the others do in the Crusaders: by how she got her first kill. In Ricochet's case, rumor has it, she let off a blind shot during her first engagement which ricocheted off of a PPD power field and ruptured a high pressure fuel tank. The resulting explosion took out the entire PPD squad, saving the lives of her comrades.

The other story is that the bullet ricocheted into her head.

Rikti Alteration Pod.description: This pod is Rikti technology at it's strangest. It seems to be some kind of full-body medical device, but it's actual purpose remains unknown.

Rikti Commander.description: These fiendish Rikti have cast off their disguises as game developers and are now leading the Second Invasion of Earth!

Rikti Crate.description: The contents of this crate must be destroyed!

Rikti Drone.description: This is a hard light hologram of a Rikti Drone.

Rikti Eidolified Mutant.description: These capable Rikti warriors are the result of experimentation in Dr. Vahzilok's lost laboratory!

Rikti Freak Gunner.description: Some Freakshow will try anything for a thrill, even using Rikti weapons. Some go even farther, and integrate alien Rikti technology into their cybernetic prostheses.

Rikti Freak Slash Tank.description: GLO_ST1CC is a one-man walking dance party that doubles as a night-time beacon for wayward Freaks to stumble their way home towards.

Rikti Freak Zapper.description: Some Freakshow will try anything for a thrill, even using Rikti weapons. Some go even farther, and integrate alien Rikti technology into their cybernetic prostheses.

Rikti Magus.description: These radical members of the Rikti's Restructurist faction have mastered magical arts stolen from the Circle of Thorns.

Rikti Monkey.description: These Rikti monkeys have been captured by Crey Industries for scientific experimentation. You must extract the little beasts before Crey figures out a way to bioengineer them.

Rikti Monkey Pet.description: This is a solidified, animated hologram of a Rikti Monkey.

Rikti Monkey Vulture.description: These ferocious Rikti Monkey Vulture mutants have been bred and engineered with added flight capabilities to compliment their ferocity and swarm coordination, making them particularly deadly in groups.

Rikti Portal Stabilizer.description: This machine is connected to the portal. Perhaps destroying it would cause the portal to close?

Rikti Pylon.description: A multi-purpose platform used by the rikti. These pylon casings can house a wide variety of equipment, ranging from construction gear, to force field generators.

Rikti Repairmen.description: The Rikti have come to stand for everything humans hate and fear in the universe. Their unprovoked invasion of Earth has left much of the planet traumatized and angry. Even out of their battle armor, their high-tech weaponry makes Rikti dangerous opponents.

Ring Mistress.description: The Ring Mistresses are taken from the ranks of the Carnival. The strongest minds with the most capacity for evil are shaped and then hidden behind the most powerful masks that the Carnival has. No one is certain where these masks come from but they enhance the psychic abilities of the Ring Mistresses exponentially. They rule the troupes of the Carnival with a steel hand in a velvet glove.

Riot Guard.description: Crey's Security Agents have become an almost ubiquitous sight in Paragon City, especially in any Crey owned facility. They're armed with standard law enforcement weapons, from riot batons to assault weapons.

Ripped Spectre.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. The Ripped Spectre is a much stronger Apparition than other types, and is capable of merging into an even stronger form.

Ripper.description: Working as a private security guard in a 'city of villains' must be a very tough job.

Ripplesurge.description:
This electro-temporal horror has sprung forth from Dr. Zeon's Phase Transmogrification System! Could this be a side-effect of tapping into Mount Diable?

Unfortunately for you, it appears that creatures of pure energy and ripple spaces are a dangerous combination. This monstrosity has evolved into something else entirely after absorbing so much unstable dimensional flux...

This unholy abomination born of unethical science only seeks to consume and grow larger.

Riptide.description: Riptide was once a well known member of the Powers Divison within Praetoria. He was known as one of the few 'Top Dogs' who was not out for fame, but instead out to uphold his honor and serve his people. Riptide was arrested by the authorities in Paragon for his role in the attacks on Talos Island. It was only through the intervention of Provost Marchand that Riptide was released under his care. Marchand vouched that Riptide, for all that he did, was a soldier, and an honorable one. All Riptide needed was a commander whose honor matched his. The authorities agreed to allow Riptide out while under the careful watch of Provost Marchand. However, they warned that should Riptide, much like Marauder, do anything wrong, they would not hesitate to put him back in the Zig.

Rising Vengeance.description: Rising Vengeance is one of the premier assassins within the Tsoo organization. Called on for only the most difficult of hits.
