River Dragon.description: The River Dragon style utilizes the Tsoo's internal energy to creating flowing chi bursts. River Dragon masters can punch holes in their targets using powerful chi attacks.

Robert.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Robert Alderman.description: Robert Alderman is a member of the city council, known for his firm stance on several unpopular issues. Many wonder if it's even possible for him to be re-elected in the next election.

Robert Flores.description: Robert Flores is a small-time journalist in Nova Praetoria. He's always been in the shadow of his older sister, Jessica Flores, but that doesn't stop him from trying to pick up leads to investigate. What does stop him is the hand of Emperor Cole coming down on his investigations when they get too 'in-depth'.

Roberta.description: Dr. Roberta Todd is Paragon City's preeminent scientist in the field of Kinetics. She's learned a trick or two in the lab that may come in handy here.

Rock Wall.description: The power of the Devouring Earth seems to have no bound. The very rock face itself has come alive to consume the Earth.

Rocket Girl.description: The majority of The Destroyers are made up of extraordinarily tough individuals who have survived The Gauntlet, an initiation ritual designed to weed out the weak. Once initiated they are expected to fight for the cause. Rocket Girls carry rocket launchers capable of firing high explosive rockets.

Rocketman.description: The Goldbrickers are high-tech thieves who operate in and around Cap au Diable. They're led by a notorious crime lord known only as King Midas.

Roderick Mueller.description: Mueller has been a 5th Column sleeper agent, in place for years. He's just been waiting for his chance to help restore his beloved 5th Column to its rightful place. Now, with the return of Reichsman, the time is just right!

Roger.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Rogue Crab Spider Longfang.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Rogue Crab Spider Slicer.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Rogue Crab Spider Webmaster.description: Crab Spiders function much like SWAT teams in other cities, and are dispatched to deal with high-level threats like super-types. They're equipped with full body armor, larger weapons, and a set of mechanical spider arms that turn them into death-dealing machines.

Rogue Dual Artillery Gun.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a Dual Artillery Gun. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'Our Dual Artillery Gun provides an excellent balance between the need for concentrated firepower and the desire to keep under budget. Ask about our options close-quarter flamethrower!'

Rogue Fire Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Rogue Fortunata.description: Fortunatas are Arachnos agents gifted with psychic powers. Those with aggressive abilities are tasked with taking down super-types-who often have little resistance to their deadly abilities.

Rogue Fortunata Mistress.description: The most powerful of the Fortunats are the Mistresses. These rare few have mastered numerous psychic abilities and risen to the top of Lord Recluse's beautiful Black Widows.

Rogue High-Explosive Missile Turret.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a High-Explosive Missile Turret. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'When you need maximum defense and cost is no concern, the Hi-Explosive Missile Turret is the premier choice. It's high-powered explosive rockets can ruin the day for nearly any attacker.'

Rogue Mu Adept.description: The most gifted Mu Strikers are given far more than promotions and new uniforms-they are given eldritch secrets to unlock their inner powers. As long as they continue to use them in Arachnos' service, of course.

Rogue Mu Guardian.description: Mu Guardians pulse with the blood of their slaughtered ancestors in their veins. They have read unholy tomes, visited other planes of existence, and performed dark sacrifices too terrible to mention to become masters of the mystic arts.

Rogue Mu Striker.description: Strikers are descendents of the long-lost Mu, drafted into Arachnos service to fight both mystic heroes and the troublesome Circle of Thorns.

Rogue PPD Ghost.description: These masked thugs seem to be wielding weaponry similar to the Paragon Police Department. They also appear to be well-trained. It's not too hard to figure out these must be members of the PPD, though what exactly they're up to is anyone's guess.

Rogue Quad Howitzer Battery.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a Quad Howitzer Battery. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'The Quad Howitzer Battery provides top-notch firepower for defending your installation with its four heavy cannons and optional flamethrower.'

Rogue SAM Battery.description: Turrets like these are rumored to be based on designs stolen (or bought) from Crey industries. This one matches the design for a High-Explosive Missile Turret. The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'When you need maximum defense and cost is no concern, the Hi-Explosive Missile Turret is the premier choice. It's high-powered explosive rockets can ruin the day for nearly any attacker.'

Rogue SWAT Equalizer.description: These masked thugs seem to be wielding weaponry similar to the Paragon Police Department. They also appear to be well-trained. It's not too hard to figure out these must be members of the PPD, though what exactly they're up to is anyone's guess.

Rogue SWAT Grenadier.description: These masked thugs seem to be wielding weaponry similar to the Paragon Police Department. They also appear to be well-trained. It's not too hard to figure out these must be members of the PPD, though what exactly they're up to is anyone's guess.

Rogue SWAT Officer.description: These masked thugs seem to be wielding weaponry similar to the Paragon Police Department. They also appear to be well-trained. It's not too hard to figure out these must be members of the PPD, though what exactly they're up to is anyone's guess.

Rogue SWAT Sergeant.description: These masked thugs seem to be wielding weaponry similar to the Paragon Police Department. They also appear to be well-trained. It's not too hard to figure out these must be members of the PPD, though what exactly they're up to is anyone's guess.

Rogue SWAT Suppressor.description: These masked thugs seem to be wielding weaponry similar to the Paragon Police Department. They also appear to be well-trained. It's not too hard to figure out these must be members of the PPD, though what exactly they're up to is anyone's guess.

Rogue Spiderling.description: These attack drones are used to soften up super-powered targets. Arachnos considers them very expendable, and as such uses them to record and monitor a threat's abilities before more expensive troops-such as Tarantulas or Fortunatas are deployed.

Rogue Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Rogue Tarantula Mistress.description: A rare few Fortunatas volunteer for the Tarantula program. Those who survive integration with the machine are truly terrors to behold. Their specially-designed suits greatly amplify their psychic abilities, allowing them to to not only communicate the next few seconds of time to their allies, but also to distort reality for their foes as well.

Rogue Tarantula Queen.description: What terrible process pushes a woman to become one of these unholy terrors is a subject of much speculation. What is known is that their suits are little different from Tarantula Mistresses. Instead, it seems the user somehow suffers the upgrade. Tarantula Queens are all incredibly powerful, but also quite mad.

Rogue Toxic Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Rolling Fog.description: This strange fog seems to roam Croatoa with little purpose or predictability. Wherever it passes, the ghosts of dead Salamancans spring up, ready to wreak horror on their former home.

Rollister.description: After performing the ritual for the Lance of Storms, Rollister's powers have increased ten fold! If he isn't stopped here, his power will become too much for anyone in Paragon to stop!

Romulus.description: Romulus is Warshade working with Longbow in the Rogue Isles. He has a reputation for taking down a number of villains, and is the arch-nemesis of the psychic villain known as Psimon Omega.

Romulus Augustus.description: Once the right hand man to Imperious, Romulus turned traitor and overthrew Imperious. Now, Romulus sides with the Nictus and other more questionable forces to secure his tyrannical rule over Cimerora.

Romulus Augustus Nictus.description: Once the right hand man to Imperious, Romulus turned traitor and overthrew Imperious. Now, Romulus sides with the Nictus and other more questionable forces to secure his tyrannical rule over Cimerora.

Ronald.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Rosethorn.description: Rosethorn was a brilliant botanist who was kidnapped by a villain working with the Devouring Earth. They were trying to develop human-plant hybrids, and ended up using her as a test subject! After she developed her powers she managed to escape and become the hero known as Rosethorn!

Rosewood.description: The strange plant-woman called Rosewood was found as a seedling in an abandoned greenhouse in the back woods of Oregon by a high school science club on a backpacking trip. She was raised by that class and succeeding classes, and eventually graduated from that very school with top honors and a scholarship to Paragon City University. She soon found herself hunted by the Circle of Thorns, and decided to take the fight back to them, and anyone who would endanger the helpess.

Rotting Chamber.description: Their hatred for humanity and utter disdain for life have left the Banished Pantheon with few allies. Thus they must make their own, by raising the dead to create armies of zombie-like servants totally devoted to their devilish agenda.

Rotting Husk.description: The Banished Pantheon's powers reach from the spirit world to raise the bodies of long dead soldiers armed with the weapons of our forefathers. These dried out Husks of men provide the backbone of the Pantheon's armies - a never ending supply of undead warriors.

Rotting Luminous Eidolon.description: The Luminous Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's ruined corpse army have become akin to minor walking meltdowns. Approach these with caution, as they can infect and leech from an unsuspecting hero.

Rotting Mire Eidolon.description: The Mire Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's rapidly decaying army have begun to leak miasma from every orifice, and this has not gone unnoticed. They are more dangerous and desperate than ever, capable of overwhelming a hero's senses.

Rotting Murk Eidolon.description: The Murk Eidolons from Dr. Vahzilok's festering former army have taken a more aggressive approach to their impending deaths. They have weaponized their rotting blood into a toxic snare to catch unprepared heroes.

Rubble.description: Large Rocks Beasts might fall, but from rubble smaller creatures arise to plague heroes!

Ruby Barrier Nova.description:
This Dark Nova Nictus is channeling a dark energy shield onto Romulus making him invulnerable to damage in exchange for him fueling it with his life force!

You'll have to destroy all the nearby Barrier Novas to get to Romulus! This crimson-hued Nictus appears to be more vulnerable to area attacks.

Ruin.description:
Ruin was infamously known back on Primal Earth as the arch-nemesis of Hero 1.

It was with some irony that he found himself later volunteering to join the Omega Team, which was headed by the man he'd fought so many times.

Like most Omega Team members, nothing had been heard of him since that fateful day years ago, but Ruin's fate appears to have been death by some cruel Rikti experiment.

Ruin Mage.description: In ancient times, the Masters of Ruin could level whole cities with their powerful earthquake magic. Today these masters of mayhem are still deadly foes, capable of summoning localized tremors that cause great devastation in a short time.

Ruladak the Strong.description: Malaise has created a Nightmare, drawing from the experiences of those whom he battles. This Nightmare has the appearance of Ruladak.

Rularuu the Ravager.description: Malaise has created a Nightmare, drawing from the experiences of those whom he battles. This Nightmare has the appearance of Rularuu.

Rularuu's Might.description: Those who have shown great physical prowress in the Rulu-Shin are sent the front lines in the battle for Rularuu's power. They are called the Might of Rularuu, for they enforce Rularuu's might where he cannot - for now.

Rularuu's Will.description: The greatest members of the Rulu-Shin become Rularuu's Will. It is said every act that they take is directed by Rularuu himself.

Rularuu's Word.description: Those who have shown great dedication in the Rulu-Shin are deemed Rularuu's Word. Their spoken word represents the voice of Rularuu in this world while he is unable to speak for himself.

Rumbles.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Rune.description: These runes connect Mot to the numerous souls that he has absorbed; destroying them means weakening Mot and freeing those who have been trapped within the beast!

Ruth.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Ryadovoi.description: The Spetsnaz are Russian special forces soldiers. They are experts in close-combat and conventional weapons, and have a reputation for ruthlessness.

Ryan.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Ryan McMean.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

SPECTRA Series I.description: Not to be out done by Neuron, Anti-matter created the SPECial Tactical Robot Army to serve Tyrant. The Series I was the prototype and is therefore the least efficient model.

SPECTRA Series I Quantum.description: Not to be out done by Neuron, Anti-matter created the SPECial Tactical Robot Army to serve Tyrant. The Series I was the prototype and is therefore the least efficient model.

SPECTRA Series II.description: When Neuron developed a new Robotic Attack Module series, Anti-matter did the same with the SPECTRA. Despite certain design differences the two models are comparable in practice.

SPECTRA Series II Quantum.description: When Neuron developed a new Robotic Attack Module series, Anti-matter did the same with the SPECTRA. Despite certain design differences the two models are comparable in practice.

SPECTRA Series III.description: The SPECTRA Series III is the most advanced design that Anti-matter has created to date. Some of his other creations are more powerful but none have the efficiency of the Series III.

SPECTRA Series III Quantum.description: The SPECTRA Series III is the most advanced design that Anti-matter has created to date. Some of his other creations are more powerful but none have the efficiency of the Series III.

SWAT Equalizer.description: Keeping the peace in Paragon City is not easy by any stretch of the imagination, and the PPD has to be clever and innovative to keep up with would be criminals. When things get dicey, PPD SWAT answers the call. These heavily armored officers have extensive training with the newest tactics and weaponry to combat their often super powered foes.

SWAT Grenadier.description: Keeping the peace in Paragon City is not easy by any stretch of the imagination, and the PPD has to be clever and innovative to keep up with would be criminals. When things get dicey, PPD SWAT answers the call. These heavily armored officers have extensive training with the newest tactics and weaponry to combat their often super powered foes.

SWAT Officer.description: Keeping the peace in Paragon City is not easy by any stretch of the imagination, and the PPD has to be clever and innovative to keep up with would be criminals. When things get dicey, PPD SWAT answers the call. These heavily armored officers have extensive training with the newest tactics and weaponry to combat their often super powered foes.

SWAT Sergeant.description: Keeping the peace in Paragon City is not easy by any stretch of the imagination, and the PPD has to be clever and innovative to keep up with would be criminals. When things get dicey, PPD SWAT answers the call. These heavily armored officers have extensive training with the newest tactics and weaponry to combat their often super powered foes.

Safe.description: This safe contains the most valuable items stored at the facility being robbed by Concrete Bill's thugs.

Safe Zone.description: No PvP combat may occur while in the Safe Zone.

Safety Valve.description: In case of emergency, please turn the Safety Valve to the 'Off' position.

Salamander.description: Salamander is one of the more notorious of Dr. Vahzilok's disciples, pushing the boundaries of regenerative therapies to their absolute breaking point. She's rumored to have personally maimed over seven dozen assistants in a gross dismissal of the Hippocratic Oath.

Sally.description: The Lake Salamanca monster, or Sally as she is sometimes called, is generally believed to be a myth. Though many insist that they have seen her, the world at large remains unconvinced.

Salvo.description: Salvo is another magic-based hero who has caught the attention of Mage-Killer Zuhkara. Destroy him!

Sandra.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Sapphire Barrier Nova.description:
This Dark Nova Nictus is channeling a dark energy shield onto Romulus making him invulnerable to damage in exchange for him fueling it with his life force!

You'll have to destroy all the nearby Barrier Novas to get to Romulus! This cobalt-hued Nictus appears to be more vulnerable ranged attacks.

Sarah.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Sardonic.description: Always a troublemaker, Sardonic often finds himself on the wrong side of the law. He is physically incapable of keeping his acerbic sarcasm to himself and tends to make bad situations worse.

Sardonyx.description: The Devouring Earth grows these crystalline warriors in special caves deep beneath the Earth. Their blasts of shards can cut deeply into a target's flesh and bone, and energy attacks have a diminished effect against their crystalline forms. Luckily, they're susceptible to smashing attacks.

Sardonyx Shard.description: Even Shards from a fallen crystalline creature can prove deadly.

Savage Siren.description: Savage Siren once looked up to Paragon City's heroes, until the day of the Rikti War, when one of the heroes hurled a Rikti Drone into her parent's apartment, killing them instantly. Siren has vowed to destroy the Freedom Phalanx, and is seeking to join Arachnos to help in their conquest.

Scarlet.description: Scarlet is a recent addition to the Black Knights and has proven herself a potent adversary through sheer determination and her fiery demeanor. Sir Agnan has taken her on as his squire in order to try and temper her aggressive disposition with a little wisdom and a lot of training.

Scars.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Scattered Spirit.description: Though little is known about the origins of the Apparitions, it is well-documented that they appear to be beings of energy which seem to be powered by pure hatred. They seem almost human at times, as a form can sometimes be discerned in the swirl of energy that makes up their bodies, but no one is quite sure whether this is an illusion or not. The Scattered Spirit is among the weaker varieties, though unlike a Fractured Spirit, this type can merge with other entities.

Schadenfreude.description: Schadenfreude has remained loyal to the 5th Column cause and has risen to a high rank within the resurgent organization.

Scientist.description: Crey Industries believes firmly in hands on, frontline research, and they demand more from their scientists than most companies. Indeed, Crey Scientists often venture into the field, armed with Cryo weapons to help them collect samples - and do serious damage to anyone who get in their way.

Scientist - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Scion of the All-Mother.description: The ultimate eco-warriors, the Greater Devoured incorporate the biomass of fallen heroes into their monstrous forms. They rend foes with their slashing talons, spitting poison on those they can't reach. A Greater Devoured is a formidable foe, resistant to most kinds of attacks.

Scirocco.description: Imad Malak was not always an evil man. Evil came to him from without. He was traveling in the deep desert near the Baka Valley deep in the Middle East. There he discovered an ancient tomb and stumbled inside. The tomb was that of a long-dead desert hero, and contained several objects of power including the bottle of the djinn Serafina. Also within was the hero's scimitar that granted the wielder incredible powers. Malak took the sword and donned the mantle of Scirocco. Unfortunately he fell under a curse and was driven to commit acts of great evil. He sold the other objects off to the highest bidder, the bottle ending up with the Circle of Thorns. Once a hero of the people, he is now a dark stain on their proud heritage. Imad wishes nothing more than to find some way to rid himself of the curse and find redemption.

Scorcher.description: Rivals to the title of the city's premiere arsonists, these Outcasts can conjure up a variety of flame-based attacks to scorch their enemies. Manipulating fire requires concentration and determination, two traits common in all Scorchers.

Scorned.description: There is no fury more intense than that of a woman scorned, and The Banner of Scorn has conjured manifestations of wronged women with a bone to pick. They seek eternal revenge for the horrible things that society, and life in general, has inflicted upon them.

Scorpinoid Deathstalker.description: Crey industries is always willing to use the latest technology to improve their own work. By adding elements of Dr. Quatrextin's Scorpion suit to their already formidable power armors, Crey hopes in increase the power of their battle armors.

Scorpinoid Stinger.description: Crey industries is always willing to use the latest technology to improve their own work. By adding elements of Dr. Quatrextin's Scorpion suit to their already formidable power armors, Crey hopes in increase the power of their battle armors.

Scorpinoid Trooper.description: Crey industries is always willing to use the latest technology to improve their own work. By adding elements of Dr. Quatrextin's Scorpion suit to their already formidable power armors, Crey hopes in increase the power of their battle armors.

Scott.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Scrapper.description: Few volunteer for the dangerous role as a 'spines scrapper.' Those who do are almost always the most reckless and dangerous of the bunch. Villains are warned to fight them with extreme caution.

Scrapper Hero.description: Dr. Advance uses his suit of space/time manipulating powered armor to help Longbow explore dangerous extremes of science!

Script Teleporter.description: In ur zonz brakin ur stuffz

Scrounger Brawler.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrounger Buckshot.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrounger Chopper.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrounger Gunner.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrounger Slammer.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrounger Slicer.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrounger Slugger.description: Despite their bedraggled appearance, Scroungers are actually very dangerous opponents. The Lost are organized much like a street gang or organized crime syndicate, though their weapons are often of surprisingly good quality.

Scrub Bot.description: Cleaners are designed for simple labor intensive tasks like cleaning, welding, and repairing other Clockwork. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves.

Scryer.description: Scyers are among the elite of Mother Mayhem's Seers. They make up the rank and file combatants among the elite. They specialize in tearing their foes minds apart with their mental assault while peering into the mind of their foes to find their weakness.

Scrying Paintings.description: Through these paintings you can observe events as they unfold, effectively increasing control available in the base.

Sea Witch.description: The Sea Witch is a hero from the Rogue Isles possessing elemental powers of the storm. She has been causing problems for the villains of the Rogue Isles for many years, including the destruction of many Family smuggling vessels including the Carpe Diem.

Sean.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Sebastian Frost.description: Sebastian Frost is the leader of the criminal organization called The Family. He took it over when his father, Harry Frost was accidentally killed during a Superadine drug raid by the Regulators in 1982.

Second Measure.description: As a hired assassin, few could match Second Measure's efficacy. He usually works for the highest bidder, which of late has been the Tsoo. Recent events have him reevaluating his links to the Tsoo, however, so he is working with the Hammers of Justice to use his position within the organization to bring down some of their more vicious elements.

Security Camera.description: This security camera is keeping a watchful eye on things. You should avoid being seen by it.

Security Chief Rodney.description:
As Chief of Security, Mr. Rodney is a man entirely devoted to his work: Protecting Marigold Langston, her company, and its employees.

Rodney serves his employer with zealous devotion, meticulously overseeing every detail regarding where, how, and with whom she conducts business, sometimes even going as far as to preemptively deal with 'potential trouble' behind the scenes utilizing the Gold Brickers.

Despite leaving their criminal roots behind, Langston Corp is still a new player in Paragon City with many potential enemies and rivals.

Seeker.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in her strength and toughness due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance and has abandoned her broadsword in favor of the more confrontational and visceral attacks of a brawler. The signs of her conversion into a member of the Talons are beginning to show. Though she has removed some of her body suit as her skin begins to provide more natural protection and replaced other pieces with true Talons armor, she still uses most of the standard Knives battle gear.

Seeker Drone.description: This is a Seeker Drone deployed by the Freedom Corps Cataphract.

Seeker Essence.description: This Seers Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Seeker Turret.description: Armed with extensive multi-phasic sensor arrays and plasma weaponry capable of piercing through the toughest of armor, these turrets are used to assist in anti-Resistance operations and search-and-destroy missions.

Seer 0001.description: Seer 0001 is the first Seer created to defend Praetoria city. She is also Katie Douglas' mother.

Seer Desk.description: From here orders can be sent and plans can be made. This desk increases the amount of control available for your base.

Seer Patient.description: This civilian is a powerful mentalist, ripe with potential for joining the ranks of the Seers.

Seer Patient Op.description: This civilian is a powerful mentalist, ripe with potential for joining the ranks of the Seers.

Seer/Clockwork?.description: You can hear the sound of Seer souls trapped within this mechanical body. It appears Metronome's process of transference isn't foolproof.

Selenops Main Cannon.description:
The main cannon on the L.R.S. Selenops is very clearly Praetorian technology in origin, a trophy claimed from the falling dimension when Lord Recluse's final gambit paid dividends.

This cannon has been improved in almost every functional capacity, including callibrations to calculate and fire accurate, long-distance barrages.
Rumors have it that this weapon is more than simply a ballistic firearm, and has some kind of secondary firing-mode that scientists are insisting will 'secure Arachnos domination'.

Self-Reparing Extinction War Walker.description: This Goliath has been modified with significantly improved nanobot repair capabilities - it appears to be able to heal from almost any damage instantaneously. Only the twisted energies of the Devouring Earth might be able to slow the regeneration process enough for the Goliath to be taken out.

Seneschal.description: The Seneschals of the Carnival are the efficient leaders of the rank and file. They most commonly rise from amidst the Attendants but occasionally a Harlequin will be moved over into this role. In addition to their access to the same arsenal as the attendants, the Seneschals use torches to create fire attacks.

Seneschal Essence.description: This Carnival essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Sentry.description: The leaders of the Rock Troops are tougher, smarter, and better equipped to take on whatever foes the Devouring Earth sets them against. In addition to the rock wielding skills of their subordinates, they have the ability to summon forth deadly Swarms of insects.

Sentry Turret.description: Sentry Turret are immobile turrets that ensure the security of sensitive areas. They never leave their post and their plasma gun can reach out and touch anyone even remotely threatening their position.

Serafina.description: Serafina is a Genie who assisted the last hero to take up the mantle of Scirocco, helping him until his death in the Rikti War. With his dying breath he asked Serafina to help the heroes of Paragon City, which she does to this day. But now that a villain has stolen the mantle of Scirocco from the true successor, Serafina is determined to see the powers of the wind return.

Sergeant Essence.description: This Vanguard Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Sergeant Major Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Sergeant Major Tirailleur.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. This seemingly simple weapon is actually quite versatile. The Tirailleurs have modified their weapons to fire poison gas grenades.

Serpent Blue Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The   blue ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Blue Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Serpent Drummer.description:
The enigmatic man called Serpent Drummer is the head of the Vanguard's Gauntlet division.

The Gauntlet was originally Vanguard's offensive division, but changing events have seen it shift those responsibilities to the Shield Division, while the Gauntlet concentrates on coordinating Vanguard's forces with the recent influx of super-powered volunteers.

Even in the middle of such great changes, Serpent Drummer remains serene.

Serpent Enforcer.description: The Pha, or Enforcers, are the foot soldiers of the Tsoo. They have yet to receive magical tattoos, and so must rely on their own strength and their weaponry. They train constantly and are especially deadly in close combat situations.

Serpent Red Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The red ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Red Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Serpent Yellow Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The yellow ink enhances a Tsoo's mental powers, giving him the ability to dominate and entrance his opponents. Yellow Ink Men can easily render their victims vulnerable to attack.

Servant.description: To be bound to Dominatrix is an honor that must be earned. Going without sleep and other trials of endurance are given to candidates to prove their worth. Passing means a term of servitude where complete obedience is expected.

Serzhant.description: The Spetsnaz are Russian special forces soldiers. They are experts in close-combat and conventional weapons, and have a reputation for ruthlessness.

Sgt. Major.description: Nemesis' officers are some of the best trained soldiers in the world, and they show amazing discipline and devotion to their master. They're armed with the Nemesis lance, a long rifle that can also operate effectively as a spear. Their skill with this weapon makes them deadly at any distance.

Sgt. Schorr.description: Sgt. Schorr leads up the Hammers of Justice, an experimental division of Wyvern.

Shade.description: These netherworld horrors hunger for the essence of the living. Once their victims have been chosen their assault will cease only once their appetites have been sated.

Shadow.description: Although there are no clear visible differences between these minions and the Minor Shadows, it is obvious that they can draw on a greater reserve of power. Something about their essence makes them stronger. It is uncertain where that energy comes from but the most popular theory is that they are created with a more direct connection to Shadow Earth.

Shadow Commando.description: Shadow Commando is an rarely-seen hero that toes the line between hero and vigilante. He's built his reputation on punishing those who escape from the justice system, causing a bit of a rumor mill to form around his methods and intentions.

Shadow Crystal.description: These unearthly crystals grow from a Shadow Seed, a hardened physical form created when one or more dying Nictus fuse and solidify themselves in the presence of rare earth minerals. Shadow Crystals project a field that allows Nictus to survive for extended periods without a host even on a planet's surface. The Crystals also act like wormholes, allowing Nictus to travel instantly from one crystal to another on a planet, and if allowed to swell in size to become a Cyst, can even cross interstellar distances. If allowed to grow in the right conditions, a Shadow Cyst can flood a world with Nictus.

Shadow Cyst.description: A Cyst Crystal is a worst-case-scenario in the nefarious Nictus' plots against humanity. They've already perfected light-speed travel at the cost of their mortal forms, but with the concept of a Cyst at their disposal, the process could link dozens, possibly hundreds of endpoints - only now at faster-than-light speeds.

Shadow Demon.description: As she has grown in power, Diabolique has also increased her command in the depths the shadow worlds beyond our own. Her personal forces have grown to include among them the ranks of the demons, including this Shadow Demon.

Shadow Freak.description: The Freakshow as a group display a twisted kind of Darwinism in action. Only the strong have any privileges, and all the weak try to get stronger. Most do this by abusing Excelsior and cybernetics, but some try other methods regardless of the danger. These Freaks have turned to Arakhn's new N-Fragment technology, granting them some small amount of Nictus power.

Shadow Hound.description: This shadowy hound has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Shadow Hunter.description: Infused with the fury of the Wild Hunt, Shadowhunter roams with his Pack, cutting down everything in his path. He loathes humanity for the most part and his alliance with Tyrant is an uneasy one at best. It is held together by the fact that Tyrant cares nothing for the wilderness and is happy to give it over to Shadowhunter. If Tyrant ever begins to strip the land for resources, things will quickly unravel.

Shadow Juicer.description: Most Juicers are already living on a constant power-fed edge, but some seek to push it farther still. By accepting Arakhn's new N-Fragment technology, they've pushed the limits even further, mixing their endless electricity fueled rush with the alien energy of the Nictus.

Shadow Lord.description: As she has grown in power, Diabolique has also increased her command in the depths the shadow worlds beyond our own. Her personal forces have grown to include among them the ranks of the demons, including this Shadow Lord.

Shadow Mistress.description: As she has grown in power, Diabolique has also increased her command in the depths the shadow worlds beyond our own. Her personal forces have grown to include among them the ranks of the demons, including this Shadow Mistress.

Shadow Realm Portal.description: As a master of death, Diabolique is able to coalesce the energy of all those defeated, destroyed or otherwise absorbed by Mot into swirling masses of lifegiving energy. She uses these essences to restore herself within the shadow realm, but they can only give her their boon if they survive long enough for her to consume them.

Shadow Rift.description: This tear in reality links Praetorian Earth to the raw nether power of Black Swan's home.

Shadow Shard Native - Female.description: How these people came to be in the shadow shard is a mystery, but contemplating it really isn't your job.

Shadow Shard Native - Male.description: How these people came to be in the shadow shard is a mystery, but contemplating it really isn't your job.

Shadow Spider.description: Shadow Spider began her career as a Knife of Artemis, specializing in infiltration and intelligence jobs that no one thought possible. Now working with Arachnos, Shadow Spider acts friendly and nice, and is usually very good to her people, but can turn cold as ice and hard as steel when she needs to be.

Shadow Tank Freak.description: For some Tank Freaks, turning their bodies into nightmarish steel-jacketed engines of destruction is enough, but for others it's only the beginning. They seek out any new technology they can find to make themselves more powerful and less human. The Shadow Tank Freak has turned to Arakhn's N-Fragment technology, adding Nictus abilities to their already formidable powers.

Shalice Tilman.description: The disembodied mind of Shalice Tilman has been chased out of the body she was inhabiting and is susceptible to death. Her will is the only thing keeping her alive at this point.

Shambler.description: Humanity's dark desire for mindless mayhem and destruction have been channeled by the Banner of Mayhem.  The results are these creatures that are fueled by the need to blindly destroy everything around them.

Shambling Archmage.description: Closer to a Lich than a Zombie, the Shambling Archmage packs a powerful punch with energy magic, and is able to sustain itself off of the life energies of nearby enemies.

Shambling Luminous Eidolon.description: The Freaklok are not a homogenous group, and these Eidolons have passed the minimum requirements for CMRj repair and improvement. As a result, these Eidolons can channel self-generated radioactive gas at unsuspecting supers.

Shambling Mire Eidolon.description: The Freaklok are not a homogenous group, and these Eidolons have passed the minimum requirements for CMRj repair and improvement. As a result, these Eidolons can weaponize their physiologies to periodically emit pheromones that stun unsuspecting supers.

Shambling Murk Eidolon.description: The Freaklok are not a homogenous group, and these Eidolons have passed the minimum requirements for CMRj repair and improvement. As a result, these Eidolons can dispense highly adhesive biofluids to snare and weaken unsuspecting supers.

Shannon.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Shaper.description: The Shapers are the ancient leaders of the Coralax, moved to lead their people after their goddess, Merulina, vanished. Many Coralax have split into separate societies based on the leadership of their Shapers.

Shard Native.description: How these people came to be in the shadow shard is a mystery, but contemplating it really isn't your job.

Shard Protector.description: Shard Protectors are super-powered guardians of Crey Industries interests who have undergone an experimentation process incorporate the mystic coral found on Sharkhead Island. This has given them some earth powers in addition to their normal capabilities.

Shared Suffering.description: This marker checks to see how many players are near you so that the damage from Shared Suffering can be split.

Sharon.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Shield Drone Essence.description: This Polar Light essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Shield Drone Pet.description: Vanguard has awarded you with a prototype Shield Drone.

Shield Oscillator Pet.description: This Clockwork Oscillator has somehow adopted you as its owner.

Shimmering Effusion.description:
These coalesced corporeal brume are born from condensed dimensional energy drawn from the environment around you.

If you don't do something about these, Ripplesurge will absorb their to regain strength!

Shining Attendant.description: The Shining Attendants serve as front line forces for the Carnival of Light. They are drawn directly from the followers of Vanessa DeVore and are trained in the use of the magical staves that channel a great deal of power. Their mastery of the mystic arts is not as substantial as their superiors, but it far outstrips anything seen elsewhere in Praetoria.

Shirley.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Shivan.description: These horrible things are an amalgamation of human corpses and some sort of weird sentient goo from beyond the stars. Some claim a mysterious interplanetary intelligence thought destroyed in the 1950s is the source of the Shivans, but if such a creature existed, 'Shiva', the Hindu name for the 'Destroyer of Worlds', was kept secret by the governments of earth.

Shivan Decimator.description: This Decimator seems to pulse with ectoplasmic destruction and hate. Its grotesque form and radiant energy makes your skin crawl.

Shivan Destroyer.description: The largest of the Shivans are the Destroyers. They seem little more than ectoplasmic jumbles of destruction and hate.

Shivan Obliterator.description: This Shivan monstrosity is among the largest you've ever seen. The cosmic radiation eminating from the creature is nothing short of oppressive.

Shivan Smasher.description: Smashers are larger versions of the Shivans seen all over Bloody Bay. How the beings formed from the bones of the dead is a complete mystery.

ShivanFakeTarget.description: This meteor was the first of potentially many more to come. Mender Silos seems to believe that this is an advance scout team, part of the 'coming storm' he speaks of.

Shiverstrike.description: Arfaana Jafri is a natural born leader, a talent she inherited from her father, a rogue hero that took up the moniker of 'Chumur Deki' (The iron-legged steed of Chitrali folklore) to deter and eventually dismantle the illegal drug trades of his province. Deki recruited a small team of loyal warriors and would stalk the trade routes at night, all the while raising a family on the move. The life was not without its dangers, and when Arfaana came of age she was sent with her mother to the United States to continue the work abroad. She'd spent enough time at her dad's side to learn the skills, and blessed with mutant powers of her own, she began working under the name Shiverstrike and conducting global operations with Hero Corps.

Shock Treatment.description: A demented doctor and one too many sessions of shock therapy left this unstable girl with a permanent charge. Now she walks free cackling in delight as she gives the world a taste of her torment!

Shock Trooper.description: Tyrant's Imperial Defense Force Troopers are the most advanced soldiers in his arsenal. The IDF Shock Troopers are terrifying foes to engage. Their weaponry is far more advanced than the PPD Shock Glove, and they are decked out in nearly impenetrable power armor.

Shocker.description: Masters of the air, the Shockers can fly and call forth blasts of lightning. They are without a doubt the flashiest of the Outcasts, and enjoy flamboyant displays of their power.

Shockstorm.description: Shockstorm is a hero working with Longbow in the Rogues Isles. He coordinates operations out of the Longbow base of Agincourt on the Nerva Archipelago.

Shopkeeper.description: This shopkeeper is likely the leader of a group of Freakshow who terrorize local businesses.

Shredder.description: Shredders are treated no different than their brothers and must survive The Gauntlet, an initiation ritual designed to weed out the weak. Once initiated they are expected to fight for the cause. Thanks to the incredible strength afforded them by Fixodine, a pair of fairly ordinary fighting claws in the hands of a Shredder will turn them into a human chainsaw.

Sibyl.description: Sibyls are specially trained Diviners with the ability to detect nearly anything around them, no matter how well hidden. They are mid-rank combatants among the elite. They specialize in crushing their foes in close range combat.

Sidewinder.description: Sidewinder is one of Operative Rutger's assets. She's been undercover in Longbow for some time, but her cover's been blown. You'll have to extract her.

Siege.description: The masterpiece of Neuron, Siege is the most advanced android ever created on Praetorian Earth. Neuron used Tyrant's DNA patterns to create him, making him virtually indestructible and extremely loyal.

Siege Watcher.description: This entity detects Siege around his start location for badge tracking.

Sigil.description: Sigil's soul is marked by a demon from the dark void. She signed a pact, her soul for her lover's life. Ever since, her and her husband, Kadabra Kill, have spent their adult lives seeking a loop hole in the bargain. So far, they have come up empty handed.

Silent Blade.description: Trained from birth to be the perfect killer, she has no name, no family and no compunctions about what she does.

Silver Mantis.description: Tamura Shirai is fascinated with the smooth, sleek feel of metal. Funding the augmentation of her body to pure metal was an expensive proposition, however, so she turned to crime. During one of her robberies she encountered Black Scorpion, on a job for Lord Recluse. Tamura realized an opportunity when she saw it, and rather than fighting with Arachnos over the ill-gotten loot, formed an alliance that has lasted to this day.

Silver Serpent.description: Silver Serpent has trained with Sun Xiong for as long as she can remember. Under her master's watchful eye, she has mastered the use of the Katana and wields it with deadly precision.

Simon.description: Simon is a renegade psychic who has evaded Mother Mayhem and her Seers for years. Additionally, all attempts to recruit Simon by either the Syndicate, or the Resistance, have ended violently.

Simulated Person.description: Generic boss is generic. Are you still reading these hoping for something different? -Neil

Sir Agnan.description: Sir Agnan is one of the oldest and wisest of the Black Knights. Some say he was an old man when Lord Lorn first became Lord of the Eternal Prison. Whatever the truth is, Agnan's wisdom is to be respected. He has taken on the young warrior Scarlet as his new squire, and aims to teach her to temper her fighting spirit.

Sir Bedwyr.description: Sir Bedwyr is an exiled Black Knight who is seeking to discover and foil a plot by the Talons of Vengeance to destroy the Eternal Order of the Black Knights.

Sir Emric.description: Of all the Black Knights, Sir Emric is the most beloved. Jovial and chivalric, Emric takes to battle with a mirth and flare that is often confused with madness.

Sir Lucane.description: Sir Lucane is an errant Black Knight who has sought out the Animus Arcana as potential allies against the Talons of Vengeance.

Siren.description: The Siren was once a woman whose voice was so alluring that she could enrapture anyone she met through the power of speech or song. In swearing her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, this woman found new power in her voice, as it was twisted into a voice of death and suffering.

Siren Essence.description: This Talons of Vengeance essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Siren's Call Phantom.description: The Soul Storm has drawn in the most vile spirits of the nether realms to haunt this island!

Sister Airlia.description: Although an outcast from the community of Sybils, Sister Airlia nevertheless shows an amazing prescience for tasks that will help drive Romulus from the Cimerora Peninsula -- and that will increase her own power. Despite arguments from other members of Cimerora, Imperious has allowed Airlia back in to act as an advisor.

Sister Psyche.description: Even in her childhood, it was obvious that Sister Psyche was blessed. The tremendous scope of her mental powers was far beyond that of any hero, past or present. When the Rikti War descended, Sister Psyche knew she had to make her gift count. She did, but at a price. She exhausted her powers so thoroughly that she fell into a coma. A young heroine named Aurora Borealis offered to play host to Sister Psyche's projected mental self. Of course, this situation could not last forever. Now back in her own body, Sister Psyche has dedicated herself to helping to shape the tremendous gifts of the young Aurora. It's a responsibility she takes seriously, as well as a consolation for the loss of her former protoge, Malaise. When the psychic link between the two women was first disrupted, Sister Psyche lost her mental control over Malaise's dual personalities. The evil Malaise reasserted himself, and quickly made his departure. His present whereabouts are as yet unknown.

Sister Solaris.description: Sister Solaris is the matriarch of the Seers. She has the strongest connection to the Oracle and therefore the greatest ability to glean the futures of mankind.

Sister Valeria.description: Sister Valeria is a follower of Bellona, the goddess of war. She has pledged to protect Cimerora from the dark forces that threaten its destruction.

Situational Control.description: This entity is counted when Maelstrom enters a state of situational control.

Skull Prisoner.description: The Zigursky Prison, or 'Zig' as it's known on the street, houses the most dangerous criminals in Paragon City. Despite the Zig's advanced security systems, a few hardened criminals occasionally escape. With nothing but time on their hands, these cons stop at nothing to win their freedom.

Sky Dragon.description: Sky Dragon is master of a mystical martial art known only to a few Eastern sorcerers. He has come to Paragon city to defeat villainy in all its forms.

Sky Fall.description: The Sky Fall technique requires incredible internal power to master. Those who have attained it become elemental forces empowered with the might of the storm.

Sky Skiff.description: The Sky Skiffs are light aircrafts whose small size belies their impact on the battlefield. Among the most advanced flying machines ever made, these vehicles are armed with banks of  powerful missiles that allow the Sky Raiders to maintain air superiority from a great distance.

Slag Golem.description: What strange forces gave life to these heaps of cast-off metal? There are those who say they are guardians of this island, born to stop the Cage Consortium's rampant destruction. Beware their incredible strength and near-indestructible hides.

Slag Heap.description: What strange forces gave life to these heaps of cast-off metal? There are those who say they are guardians of this island, born to stop the Cage Consortium's rampant destruction. Beware their incredible strength and near-indestructible hides.

Slag Pile.description: Metal Shift can summon Slag Golems to do his bidding.

Slasher.description: Although they prefer to be called Swordsmen, everyone refers to these Warriors as the Slashers. They're experts at swordplay, and can swing with both finesse and ferocity, making them very dangerous in close combat.

Slasher Elite.description: Some of the finest modern swordsmen on the streets, the Slasher Elite are experts at using their blades for both offense and defense. They're very tough and resilient fighters, resistant to smashing and lethal damage.

Slate.description: The leaders of the Rock Troops are tougher, smarter, and better equipped to take on whatever foes the Devouring Earth sets them against. In addition to the rock wielding skills of their subordinates, they have the ability to summon forth deadly Swarms of insects.

Slavering Reanimated Corpse.description: The dead are restless and are walking the earth. They hunger for your flesh!

Slick.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Slinger.description: Slinger is one of Malta's engineering geniuses, with excellent knowledge of advanced robotics and weapons. Some suspect he had a direct hand in the development of the infamous Titan robots.

Slow Field.description: This artifact calls on the deities of speed to curse all who enter it. Those in the area of effect have their speed and attack rate reduced.

Small Cable.description: These strange living spires are somehow connected with Hamidon's ability to control the creatures of the Devouring Earth.

Small Power Crystal.description: A small generator and laptop computer. Just enough power and control to get a small base up and running.

Smasher Elite.description: These Warriors have been around long enough that they can not only dish out pain, they can take it as well. On the streets of Paragon City, one doesn't survive long as a mace wielder without building up a resistance to smashing attacks.

Smelly Mel.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Smelter.description:
The Smelters have proven to be the catalyst that have transformed the Gold Brickers from simply a band of thieves with advanced equipment, to an organized and highly formidable group, capable of advanced operations and coordinated teamwork.

These new Gold Brickers were a concept born from the daughter of King Midas, as an application of her talent for tactics and critical thinking to the benefit of the her father's gang.

This resulted in a new generation of Langston Corp men who are not only armed with this new formidable technology, but also trained in leadership and tactics, capable of commanding their squads to accomplish the mission. The Smelting Arms technology gives its wearer deployable thermal shields for self-defense, the ability to cauterize wounds, and dangerous ranged fire attacks.

Snake Egg.description: These snake eggs are laid by the Gorgon Stheno, sister of Medusa. Destroy them, or they may hatch and destroy you!

Snaptooth.description: Snaptooth is a particularly nasty Red Cap that takes even more glee in torment and suffering than the rest of his kin. Clever and devious he has found a way to hop across dimensions using the faerie rings in Croatoa. Now he can bring his wicked games anywhere he pleases.

Sneaked In.description: This entity applies the Sneaked In buff.

Sneaky Champion.description: Sneaky Freaks have been outfitted with a cloaking device to make them nearly undetectable. Combined with their deadly cybernetic weapons, these Sneaky Freaks are enemies to be reckoned with!

Sneaky Swiper.description: Sneaky Freaks have been outfitted with a cloaking device to make them nearly undetectable. Combined with their deadly cybernetic weapons, these Sneaky Freaks are enemies to be reckoned with!

Sneaky Tank.description: Sneaky Freaks have been outfitted with a cloaking device to make them nearly undetectable. Combined with their deadly cybernetic weapons, these Sneaky Freaks are enemies to be reckoned with!

Snow Beast.description: Snow Beasts are the most powerful creatures in service to the Winter Lord. They desire nothing more than to freeze everything they come into contact with. This miniature version is thankfully less destructive!

Snow Maiden.description: A nature spirit joined with a young woman, Snow Maiden uses the icy power of winter to fight crime.

Socrates.description: Socrates is more than a member of Odysseus's eccentric cadre. He is also one of David Hill's closest friends and confidants. Though he comes off as somewhat self-important at times, Socrates constantly strives to better himself in all areas of life, and is fiercely loyal to those he deems worthy of respect.

Soldier.description: In times of old, the Fir Bolg battled the invading Tuatha de Dannan for control of Ireland, Here in Croatoa, history seems to be repeating itself. The two tribes, transported across an ocean and transformed into monstrous shapes, are waging an eternal war.

Soldier Automaton.description: Perhaps it's the careful precision of every movement, or the way they perform the same tasks over and over, but something about this seemingly normal citizen doesn't look quite right. In fact, they seem almost mechanical.

Sonic Bomb.description: This sonic device could deliver quite a blast if it detonates. You'll have to destroy it first.

Sonic Researcher.description: This researcher has been forced to do some sort of work for the Freakshow. It's hard to imagine how the Freaks got interested in sonic technology, but it's a solid bet that they plan on using it for destruction.

Soothsayer.description: Soothsayers are charismatic leaders of the Shepherds. Their unwavering belief in the group's purpose as guardians of First Ward spurs their followers to great success in the face of adversity.

Sorcerer.description: The Tsoo sorcerers are the most in touch with the Ancestor Spirits that provide the Tsoo their magic and power. They have a wide variety of powers that allow them to either attack whole groups of enemies or aid large numbers of friends, making them potent support players in any fight.

Sorcerer Essence.description: This Tsoo essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Sorceress.description: Women who have attained the status of Sorceress learn that they cannot leave the Coven without bringing down the brutal wrath of their former sisters. As a result, they stay, and become even more accustomed to the dark.

Sorceress Serene.description: Even when she was a young woman, Clarissa Moore was clearly a powerful mystic. Back then she was much more open and forgiving. She felt safe and hopeful for a bright future when she was taken in and taught the wonders of elemental magic by her coven. They became her family. When Diabolique slaughtered them all, Clarissa barely escaped the same fate. She was nursing her wounds when the Furies found her and gave her a new kind of hope... the hope for revenge. Since Diabolique is allied with Tyrant, Clarissa is a focused and uncompromising ally in the Furies war against Marcus Cole and all those who serve him.

Sorceress of the Winds.description: Most Cabal Sorceresses have become quite hardened over the years. Most are utterly implacable, fixed single-mindedly on their quest to exterminate the Red Caps. Still, some Salamancans have reported seeing a look of pity in the eyes of the Sorceresses. It could be that there is some spark of humanity left in them.

Soul Beast.description: The Soul Beasts are deadly beasts of the Netherworld who accompany the Drudges in their unending task of transitioning souls from one world to the next.

Soul Mage.description: The High Mages of the Soul delve into the deepest reaches of the human spirit. They are largely responsible for the gathering and training of specters and other spirits. When forced into combat, they petrify their foes in a wave of inescapable self-contemplation that leaves them incapable of any action.

Soul Portal.description: This portal is the gate preventing your soul from re-entering your body - destroy it to break free!

Soul of Percy Winkley.description: Following his sacrificial act which saved Diabolique from Sorceress Serene's ritual, young Percy Winkley's soul was sent to the Netherworld, but ended up trapped between worlds in the Night Ward. Now he is awaiting processing by the Drudges, but like the other souls here in Night Ward, he is trapped until whatever power is pulling worlds together is stopped.

Soulless Husk.description: The dead are restless and are walking the earth. They hunger for your flesh!

Soulshatter-Finale.description: Diabolique causes a Soulshatter at your location!

Soulshatter-Main.description: Diabolique causes a Soulshatter at your location!

Spacetime Rift.description: Anti-matter has opened this rift in spacetime, linking Keyes Island to his space station and enabling his amassed Warworks forces to join him in securing the reactor.

Spatial Annihilation Bomb.description:
When Mothership Î”-294 requested additional supplies from the Rikti homeworld the shipping manifest suffered damage, and the scrambled request for more bombs was received as an order for more Heavy Assault Suit power cores.

Due to the delay in communications with the homeworld, U'kon Gr'ai ordered engineering to repurpose the excess power cores into make-shift explosives by overloading the core's psychic interface matrix to create localized psionic nullification zones, spaces that are mentally devastating to anything that isn't a Rikti.

Spawn.description: These formless creatures appear to be controlled by some other entity. Studies of their remains have revealed that they lack any sort of brain. Nevertheless, their actions demonstrate a fearsome cunning and a total hatred of mankind.

Spawning Chamber.description: This large cyst seems to call up Devouring Earth creatures from the ground. You'll have to destroy it if you want to stem the tide of monsters.

Spec Ops.description: These Special Forces are trained in covert ops and special tactics. They can deploy various munitions to gain every tactical advantage.

Special Agent Infiltrator.description: The Special Agents are the best of Crey's field operatives. They have superb training, the best weapons, and a seemingly preternatural focus on the task at hand. They often carry heavy weapons, since Crey trusts them enough to use them discreetly and appropriately.

Special Agent Jenni Adair.description: Special Agent Jenni Adair, special agent for the Department of Superpowered Activities Monitoring, has been kidnapped by your evil double!

Special Agent Sharpshooter.description: The Special Agents are the best of Crey's field operatives. They have superb training, the best weapons, and a seemingly preternatural focus on the task at hand. They often carry heavy weapons, since Crey trusts them enough to use them discreetly and appropriately.

Special Agent Vigilant.description: The Special Agents are the best of Crey's field operatives. They have superb training, the best weapons, and a seemingly preternatural focus on the task at hand. They often carry heavy weapons, since Crey trusts them enough to use them discreetly and appropriately.

Special Assault Suit.description: These assault suits have been developed by the Rikti specifically to deal with super powered enemies. They provide excellent protection and firepower and provide excellent flight capabilities.

Specialist.description: The members of the Resistance in the Unified People's Army make up those who were loyal to Calvin Scott's vision. They were unphased when it was revealed that he had a mental disorder causing him to believe that Aurora Pena was his wife; what mattered was the goal of fighting for the freedom of a new tomorrow. They fight now in the Unified People's Army with the belief that they stand for the freedom of mankind, even if mankind doesn't realize it.

Specter.description: Specters slowly fade away over 90 seconds. They cannot be healed, regenerate, upgraded, or commanded.

Spectral Daemon.description: The Circle's sunken city of Oranbega is rumored to be filled with the ancient ghosts of its original inhabitants. Some of these spirits become malevolent Specters, angry and incorporeal beings immune to physical attacks but capable of causing tremendous damage to living beings.

Spectral Daemon Lord.description: The Circle's sunken city is rumored to be filled with the ancient ghosts of its original inhabitants. Some of these spirits become malevolent Specters, angry and incorporeal beings immune to physical attacks but capable of causing tremendous damage to living beings.

Spectral Follower.description: The Circle's sunken city of Oranbega is rumored to be filled with the ancient ghosts of its original inhabitants. Some of these spirits become malevolent Specters, angry and incorporeal beings immune to physical attacks but capable of causing tremendous damage to living beings.

Spectral Knight.description: The Circle's sunken city of Oranbega is rumored to be filled with the ancient ghosts of its original inhabitants. Some of these spirits become malevolent Specters, angry and incorporeal beings immune to physical attacks but capable of causing tremendous damage to living beings.

Spectral Lord.description: Summoned and controlled by the Midnight Squad, these Specters are the souls of Midnighters who have chosen to give not just their life to the service of the Midnighter Squad, but their soul as well.

Spectral Oranbegan.description: The Circle's sunken city of Oranbega is rumored to be filled with the ancient ghosts of its original inhabitants. Some of these spirits become malevolent Specters, angry and incorporeal beings immune to physical attacks but capable of causing tremendous damage to living beings.

Spectral Sensor.description: This strange machine looks highly advanced.

Spectral Werewolf.description: When a creature of the night gives itself wholly to eternal darkness, their soul becomes linked to the very shadows itself. Spectral Werewolves have sacrificed both their body and their souls to serve the night, and have become wily and dangerous spectres, capable of rending their targets very essence apart with unholy claws. Despite having lost their physical form, these monsters crave the blood just as much as when they drew breath.

Spectre.description: These phantasms are actually manifestations of humanity's fears come to life. At the Banner of Transparent Terrors, they seek to inflict unimaginable terror upon their victims and as long as the Banner of Terror persists, these parasites will feed off of the fear of others.

Spectre Essence.description: This Phantom essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Spider Pet.description: This creepy spider pet has taken a liking to you and will keep you company. However, it won't engage in combat and cannot be attacked.

Spiderling.description: These attack drones are used to soften up super-powered targets. Arachnos considers them very expendable, and as such uses them to record and monitor a threat's abilities before more expensive troops-such as Tarantulas or Fortunatas are deployed.

Spiderling Pet.description: This Spiderling is damaged. It won't engage in combat and cannot be attacked.

Spine Carver.description: Reapers and Mortificators from the Vahzilok often find themselves without work in this post-Doctor world they live in. Many of them, hearing whispers of a new initiative being run through Cortex, Pierce, and Buzzsaw, have gladly offered their services in exchange for asylum from Paragon City. Spine carvers are on the forefront of neuroelectrical and skeletal modifications.

Spine Scrapper Clone.description: Crey has created synthetic super-humans like this one using DNA harvested from fallen heroes and villains. This clone is able to instantly grow deadly spines for combat.

Spinnerette.description: Spinnerette is a lieutenant of the Scrapyarder hero known as Iron Widow. She is a champion of the Scrapyarder cause in Sharkhead.

Spirit.description: These mournful ghosts were, until recently, the shopkeepers, farmers, and students of Salamanca. Their sudden departure from this Earth has thrown them into great turmoil, and most feel compelled to take out their rage on their former home.

Spirit Essence.description: This Phantom essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Spirit Guide.description: This creature's grisly appearance is not unlike a hundred different descriptions of the grim reaper or the ferryman. Indeed, a spirit guide's existence is devoted to the ushering of souls from one world to the next. They do so with mechanical efficiency and enthusiasm, as their reward for a job well done is a payment in wax, which keeps their spirit candle burning, if only long enough to find another soul in need of guidance to the next world.

Spirit Ink Archer.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The spirit ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to bring the strength and power of an Ancestral Spirit into their bodies, merging the two. However, this member has only begin to prepare the rituals for such a merger, and so is not adorned in the glow which graces those who have completed the task. She relies on a bow as her primary weapon.

Spirit Ink Warrior.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The spirit ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to bring the strength and power of an Ancestral Spirit into their bodies, merging the two. However, this member has only begin to prepare the rituals for such a merger, and so is not adorned in the glow which graces those who have completed the task. She relies on a katana as her primary weapon.

Spirit Panther.description: This spirit panther has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Spirit Signal.description: The Rune Spire channels healing energies, improving an altar's healing effectiveness by {FunctionPercent}%.  Rent: 100 Prestige

Spirit Ward.description: This spirit ward protects the Chapel of Enduring Light from the approach of the Apparitions and those they have possessed. If they are destroyed then the chapel will be overrun, the Carnival scattered, and Sorceress Serene will be victorious here in First Ward.

Spirit of Death.description: One of the four types of Corrupt Spirits, the Spirits of Death take joy in anyone's demise, be they friend or foe. Once they've become focused on a victim, they become single-minded in their attacks and cannot be distracted. They will even destroy themselves if it means defeating their opponent of choice.

Spirit of Desire.description: One of the four types of Corrupt Spirits, the Spirits of Desire feed upon greed, avarice, and the loss of control that comes with overwhelming need. They like to flood an area with telepathic imagery, confusing and even damaging opponents with visions of their greatest desires.

Spirit of Pain.description: One of the four types of Corrupt Spirits, the Spirits of Pain delight in agony and misery. They particularly delight in the pain that they dish out by projecting blasts of pure destruction at their enemies.

Spirit of Sorrow.description: One of the four types of corrupt spirits, a Spirit of Sorrow thrives on sadness and depression. These spirits project blasts of pure sorrow that explode in life-sapping bursts, seeping the will and life force from anyone caught in the explosion.

Spiritualist.description: Having long ago sworn fealty to the Talons of Vengeance, the Spiritualist has been twisted into a half-human, half-serpent monstrosities. In the process of transformation, however, they gain significant aptitude with the mystical elements, allowing them to call forth a variety of elementally attuned powers. In addition, they become more resistant to the element with which they have an affinity.

Splice.description:
A reclusive technophile, Splice's skill with a soldering iron has saved more lives than almost anyone else in the Resistance. She invented 'blueboxes', cheap home-made devices that allow the Resistance to send and receive messages over Praetoria City's power lines, known lovingly as 'The Static'. She's also pioneered a technique to allow cellular phones to function off the grid, a feat she boasts to have figured out in only five minutes flat.

Currently she's working on reprogramming captured clockwork androids. Of course, since the things pack dangerous weaponry the specimens her allies bring in for her are usually less than functional.

Sprite.description: The true nature of the Sprites is a matter of some controversy among paranormal experts. Many believe that they are the byproducts of the Cabal's magic. They seem to be intelligent, and will aid any person they perceive as worthy of their assistance.

Sprocket.description: These pint-sized junkyard contraptions have become a real plague on the streets of certain neighborhoods. Their exact workings are mysterious, but there's no mystery about the deadly bolts of electricity they hurl at anyone who gets in their way.

Squall Elemental.description: From a distance, the Storm Elementals are a beautiful sight. At close range, however, they're a serious threat. Their Endurance-draining attacks can cripple their enemies.

Stalker.description: This is a generic Claws/Super Reflexes Stalker.

Stalker Hero.description: Dr. Advance uses his suit of space/time manipulating powered armor to help Longbow explore dangerous extremes of science!

Stalwart.description: Stalwart started off as a champion prize fighter. It took him only a short while to discover that his power and abilities never stopped growing by leaps and bounds. After a very brief but undefeated career Stalwart decided he was destined for greater things. Now he fights the evil of the world one left hook at a time.

Stardusk.description: With a tainted soul as dark and twisted as a dying star, this villain warps and weakens any who stand in her way.

Stasis Tube.description: This is a high-tech stasis tube used to hold human-sized medical subjects.

Statesman.description: Marcus Cole, who would eventually become Statesman, was a rogue and a mercenary throughout the early part of the 20th century. During WWI, he became ill after being exposed to mustard gas. While traveling with his childhood friend Stefan Richter, Marcus discovered the Well of the Furies. Both men drank from the well and were granted incredible powers. Marcus went on to become Statesman and Stefan, Lord Recluse.

Statue of Bast.description: This is a massive statue of Bast, the ancient Egyptian cat-goddess.

Steamer Chest.description: The contents of this chest seem to be regenerating the health of the villains around you.

Steel Serpent.description: The Steel Serpent style utilizes the Tsoo's internal energy to reinforce their weapon's hardness. Steel Serpent masters can use their unbreakable blades to cut any target.

Steel Strongman.description: The Steel Strongmen are the pinnacle of the Carnival's muscle. Upon loyal service as an Iron Strongman for 5 years and a day, they are re-sealed into specially designed helms that provide the normal protections as well as the ability to harness their inner strength to weaken their opponent's attacks.

Steel Valkyrie.description: The Steel Valkyrie class Hoverbot is one of the 5th Column's more ingenious inventions. Rumor has it that Vandal was inspired by the Rikti attack drones, but there have been versions of the Valkyrie in service since WWII.
