Mounted with omni-directional jets and banks of armor piercing rockets, the Steel Valkyries are quite maneuverable and pack a deadly punch. They can make the skies a very dangerous place.

Stephanie.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Stephanie Peebles.description: Stephanie Peebles, the last witch of Striga Isle, has come out of hiding to deal with the threat posed by The Unnamed and the servants of the Banished Pantheon. This is your chance to strike a blow against the heroes who want to keep law and order on Striga, when you would prefer chaos and lawlessness.

Stephen.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Stern.description: Stern has been replacing his body with cybernetics his entire life. Born a quadriplegic, Stern's only dream was to be a hero and to help others. He was given that chance when a mysterious benefactor offered to give him the body of a true hero. He has since gained recognition amongst the Powers Division and earned a place in the Top Dogs. His steady detachment from humanity, however, has given him a reputation as a ruthless and uncaring adversary.

Steve.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Steve \"Mute\" Mutombo.description: Known as 'Mute' to the members of the Family here in St. Martial, Steve Mutombo has done more time in the Zig than any other member of the Family. He routinely takes the fall for others, never flipping on his comrades.

Steven.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Stevie Greene.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Stheno.description: Stheno is the mother of the Snakes on Mercy Island. Her goal is to drive away all beings from Mercy Island and claim it for herself!

Sting Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Sting Agents have achieved Wyvern's complete trust and are given access to specialized armor piercing arrows.

Stone Henge.description: This henge is a focal point of the Red Caps' power.

Storm Elemental Essence.description: This Elemental essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Storm Maven.description: It takes more than just hard work and dedication to become a Storm Maven. It takes a certain raw talent, and a sensitivity to the power wafting through every breeze in Croatoa. Some Mavens insist that they can hear the voices of their late husbands floating on those breezes. Whether true or not, this belief only strengthens their fury in battle.

Storm Shaman.description: The Storm Shaman has mastered the power of the tempest, calling upon lightning and thunder as their weapons of choice. They are particularly adept at exhausting their foes with continual shocks of lightning, though they are also capable of hindering the ability of a foe to attack.

Storm Shamaness.description: The Storm Shamaness has mastered the power of the tempest, calling upon lightning and thunder as their weapons of choice. They are particularly adept at exhausting their foes with continual shocks of lightning, though they are also capable of hindering the ability of a foe to attack.

Storm Void.description: The swirling energies of the storm which has engulfed Penelope Yin's network node have created voids within the flow of energy. These voids have taken shape and can be moved around. When brought close to a Vortex, the two will combine to create an Eye of the Storm. This Eye of the Storm will suppress the storm's effects on those who stand in it and will allow Metronome's voice to reach Penelope, calming her and ending her untouchable state.

Streng.description: The Tuatha De Danann and the Fir Bolg were tribes who fought for control of legendary Ireland, the Fir Bolg were the original inhabitants and refused to share the land with the Tuatha De Danann.

Stricken Brawler.description: It doesn't take long for the cesspool water to have an effect. These petty thugs have been drinking from it for only a few days, but already the change in their appearance is apparent.

Stricken Scavenger.description: It doesn't take long for the cesspool water to have an effect. These petty thugs have been drinking from it for only a few days, but already the change in their appearance is apparent.

Striker.description: When the Syndicate needs muscle they call in their Strikers. Whether it's to put the hurt on someone who has crossed the Syndicate or to rally Initiates and Adepts under them; the Strikers command respect within the Syndicate ranks.

Strongheart.description: This young hero's incredible might and impenetrable skin make him a formidable foe.

Strongman Essence.description: This Carnival essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Stropharia.description: Catch it unawares, and you may find this giant mushroom blissfully content, drinking in the atmosphere of Hamidon's strange Eden. If it sees you, though, watch out! Stropharia seems intent on exacting revenge for all its cousins that met their fate in a buttery saucepan.

Stunner Chief.description: It takes some skill to control death dealing levels of electricity as they course through your nervous system, and Stunner leaders have that control. They can use their implants to fire bolts of electricity and even create fields of crackling lightning around their foes.

Stunner Freak.description: Stunners undergo a very specific and unusual cybernetic enhancement, one that sets them apart from all other Freaks and does strange things to their brains. A network of electrical wiring and emitters allows the Stunners to immobilize even the strongest heroes for a short period of time.

Subaltern.description: Nemesis' officers are some of the best trained soldiers in the world, and they show amazing discipline and devotion to their master. They're armed with the Nemesis lance, a long rifle that can also operate effectively as a spear. Their skill with this weapon makes them deadly at any distance.

Subaltern Comet.description: At first glance, the Nemesis lance looks much like the spear from which it takes its name. Though it can be used as a spear, it's also a very powerful, accurate rifle. The Nemesis lance fires explosive rounds over long distances and requires great skill to use effectively.

Subaltern Tirailleur.description: The Nemesis army's main support weapon is the storm rifle, a long barreled weapon with a bayonet affixed to the end. This seemingly simple weapon is actually quite versatile. The Tirailleurs have modified their weapons to fire poison gas grenades.

Subjugated Citizen.description: This citizen has fallen prey to one of the Awakened and is no longer an individual with any survival instinct. It serves its Awakened controllers without question.

Subjugated Scryer.description: This Scryer has fallen victim to the powerful mind control exerted by an Awakened.

Subjugated Seer.description: This Seeker has fallen victim to the powerful mind control exerted by an Awakened.

Subjugator.description: The Subjugator was once a Seer of immense power, used to suppress and control the minds of others. Even within the Seer program, the Subjugator could impose her will on other Seers. However, in some, this power caused tumors to take root in their brain. The more a Subjugator used her powers, the worse these tumors became, eventually growing to consume the Seer's head. Now, even though this Subjugator has become a grotesque monster, her power has grown even greater than it was when she was still human.

Subterranean Honeybee Swarm.description: These highly aggressive subterranean honeybees are one of Dr. Vahzilok's many side projects, cultivated for their antibiotic honey. Though adorable, their bite is vicious.

Succubus.description: Not every horror that emerges from the Inferno is hideous-at least on the outside. The Succubi appear as voluptuous women to lure foolish mortals to a long and painful doom.

Succubus Essence.description: This demonic essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Suit.description: Suits are there to keep the Syndicate Initiates and Adepts in line and to make sure they don't fall prey to Mother Mayhem's Seers. They act as a sort of psychic shield for their men. The Suits are cold and calculating, one part business man, one part heartless killer.

Summoned Demon.description: Summoned from the hellish pits of some other dimension, the Behemoths are fiery demons that inspire nightmares in all who see them. They can summon flaming swords to strike down their enemies, or breath fire from their mouths to incinerate all who stand before them.

Summoned Natterling.description: Natterlings travel in large packs, hopping about the floating islands and mystic causeways of the Shadow Shard looking for intruders. They're very good scavengers, and any piece of technology or any living thing they find they'll scoop up and bring back to their masters.

Sun Xiong.description: Sun Xiong is the son of Pha Xiong, the ancient martial arts master who taught Tub Ci his technique of applying mystical tattoos. Sun Xiong is also a powerful martial artist, and retains a loyal following within the Tsoo.

Sunstorm.description: S.T.A.R.T. Representatives are experts at identifying threats and carry advanced assault weaponry to protect the interests of their parent company.

Supa Troll.description: This is the Supa Trolls' moment of glory, for they have become what every Troll wants to be: pure incarnations of bestial fury. They have taken so much Superadine, their strength is simply amazing.

Super Arachnoid.description: Lord Recluse guards the secrets of the Arachnoids closely, but what is known is that they were created in Project Fury. Some speculate this experimental program was designed to create soldiers in Lord Recluse's image, but if this is true, the results so far are hideously flawed.

Super Charger.description: Unwavering in his belief that evil must be eradicated, Super Charger zealously pursues criminals.

Super Devoured Pyriss.description: Pyriss was once an impressionable young would-be heroine, until Peter Themari and a truly depraved villain tricked her into turning against her allies and becoming a villain herself. It seems that her villainous life left her at the mercy of the devouring Earth, who consumed her and transformed her into what she is now. The scientist Vernon von Grun has experimented on Pyriss, trying to discover the secret behind the Devouring Earth. As a result, von Grun has triggered parts of Pyriss's old personality to resurface, while also empowering her beyond her normal proportions.

Super Freak.description: The Superfreak was created by Doc Buzzsaw by implanting magically-imbued prosthetics into a Tank Freak. Now the Superfreak possesses necromantic abilities in addition to his formidable fighting powers.

Super Stunner.description: Super Stunners undergo a very specific and unusual cybernetic enhancement, one that sets them apart from all other Freaks and does strange things to their brains. Even Juicers and Stunners are amazed at the amount of hardware stuffed into a Super Stunner. A network of electrical wiring and emitters allows the Super Stunners to shoot forth great gouts of electrical energy that allows them to dominate their foes.

Super Zenith Mech Man.description: This monstrosity of a Mech Man was made using the same technology that powers Citadel. It is no fit legacy for the heroic android, and must be destroyed.

Superadine Lab.description: In the prescence of this lab, you can't help inhaling a whiff or two of Superadine. The substance will buff your Endurance until the lab is destroyed.

Supercomputer.description: Large bases have serious processing needs The Benedict 87 supercomputer has the ability to simultaneously process the multiple control programs needed to maintain base security.

Supplies.description: This is a pile of construction supplies including building materials such as boards, braces, and nails and various tools such as hammers, saws, and shovels.

Support Automaton.description: Perhaps it's the careful precision of every movement, or the way they perform the same tasks over and over, but something about this seemingly normal citizen doesn't look quite right. In fact, they seem almost mechanical.

Susan.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Susan Beck.description: Susan Beck is a robotics specialist working for Omnitek.

Suspicious Citizen.description: There's something subtly wrong with this citizen. You can't quite put your finger on it, but this person is clearly more than they seem to be.

Suspicious Ranger.description: There's definitely something wrong with this D.U.S.T. soldier. Just being near them causes your head to swim.

Swan.description: Lena Elliot was touched by magic from the moment she was born on the Vernal Equinox. Both her parents were powerful mystics, and performed a ceremony to bless Lena's birth. Shortly after her 21st birthday Lena's parents were caught in the middle of a battle between the Circle of Thorns and the 5th Column. The groups were seeking a pair of rings that had been in the Elliot family for generations. Lena's powers manifested and she instinctively protected herself and her parents. Manticore had been following the 5th Column group and came to the Elliot's aid. The battle was going poorly when Lena lashed out with her psychic abilities, stunning many of the villains. Manticore mopped up the rest, but not before the 5th Column managed to escape with Lena's parents. Manticore offered Lena the chance to fight at his side and she jumped at the opportunity. As Swan, she aids him in his relentless war against the 5th Column, in the hopes that one day she will find her parents alive.

Sweeper.description: Sweepers are often seen patrolling the street cleaning up litter and debris to make Praetoria a more beautiful place to live. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves.

Swift Cut.description: Swift Cut is the woman who has hired you to help her get out of the Whispering Hand. Keeping her alive will lead to a fairly large pay day.

Swift Steel.description: The Swift Steel school emphasizes speed of body and of blade. Masters of the school's techniques can extend their inner power to alter the speed and rhythms of combat, slowing and limiting the power of their foes.

Sword Adept.description: Only those that have achieved enlightenment through brutal combat, have proved themselves worthy members of the Syndicate and unlocked their true potential may call themselves Adepts.

Sword Initiate.description: The Syndicate has survived by recruiting only those with at least some psychic potential. The initiates are the bottom rung of Syndicate ladder, they have yet to prove themselves and ascend to the ranks of Adept.

Sword Master.description: These Syndicate diehards were once initiates who rose through the ranks of their organization through dedication, skill and no small amount of craziness. Sword Masters can cut the very air causing blades of wind to slice at their foes from range.

Sybil.description: This Sybil seems steeped in some kind of treachery!

Sybil Bramlett.description: Fortunata Bramlett has come to Cimerora and disguised herself as a Sybil to aid Sister Airlia's plans.

Sylvia Rexson.description: Confidant, assistant, attache and paramour to Ted Dubois, Sylvia Rexson handles many of the day-to-day operations of the Tyrant's Palace Casino. However, you get the feeling that she is capable of far deadlier pursuits.

Syn Overload.description: Do you have the proper security clearance to be lookin' at me?

Synapse.description: Steven Berry was just an average man, until Crey Industries got hold of him. The Crey scientists were testing a number of radical procedures for inducing super powers. Steven was blasted with high doses of electricity for days. It amplified the electrical energy in his body, giving him the ability to harness it into super speed and electrical blasts. Synapse escaped Crey's clutches by shorting out the lab where he was kept prisoner. To this day, Crey executives deny any knowledge of the project in which Synapse was an unwilling participant.

Syndicate Takedown Kill Watcher.description: This entity sits in a kill volume around the Syndicate Takedown building and kills any non-boss entity unfortunate enough to be pushed off the building.

Syndicate Takedown Teleport Watcher.description: This entity sits in a teleport volume around the Syndicate Takedown building and teleports any entity unfortunate enough to be pushed off the building.

T.E.S.T. Leader.description: Tactical Engagement Strike Team Leaders are always selected from within the ranks. They are trained to take down lawbreakers hard and fast with no concern for secondary objectives like avoiding collateral damage.

T.E.S.T. Provost.description: Anything that pulls a PPD Provost out of their Monitor Sphere information nexus has to be considered a severe threat. In order to insure their safety, Provosts don the state of the art in PPD protective gear to restore order in the most extreme cases of lawbreaking.

T.E.S.T. Ranger.description: The final physical challenge that a member of the PPD goes through in order to be admitted into the Tactical Engagement Strike Team is speculated about in hushed whispers all over Praetoria. Those who succeed won't speak of it and those who fail don't survive the experience.

TPN Camera.description: These Monitor Spheres have been 'acquired' by H.D. They are used for his own personal interests, and are permanently linked to the TPN Campus broadcasting center, allowing H.D. to bring the news of the day live and uncensored directly into the living rooms of Praetoria's citizenry.

TPN Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

TPN Technician Watcher.description: This entity is counted by the TPN Technician to determine how effectively it suppresses propaganda.

Tac Ops Commander.description: The Tac Ops Commanders are the only members of their cell to have any contact with the upper echelons of the Malta group. Secrecy and maintaining their cover identity is the primary directive for these agents.

Tac Ops Commanders Quantum.description: The Tac Ops Commanders are the only members of their cell to have any contact with the upper echelons of the Malta group. Secrecy and maintaining their cover identity is the primary directive for these agents.

Tactical Operative.description: These are the backbone of the military presence of the Malta Group. The Tac Ops cells are trained to operate independently and are almost never aware of each others activity. Machine guns, grenades of varying kinds and other modern weaponry are their stock in trade.

Tactical Operative Quantum.description: These are the backbone of the military presence of the Malta Group. The Tac Ops cells are trained to operate independently and are almost never aware of each others activity. Machine guns, grenades of varying kinds and other modern weaponry are their stock in trade.

Talon Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Talon agents are young operatives who have yet to prove themselves in the field. They are given the simplest assignments until they prove their worth, but are extensively trained in close combat knife fighting, as well as archery.

Talon's Claw.description: Time and space seem to flow differently around this Tsoo martial artist.

Tank.description: This mainframe computer must be destroyed.

Tank Smasher.description: The fully armored, incredibly tough Tank Freaks are a rare breed indeed. As their name suggests, they're almost unstoppable in combat. The one ray of hope when confronting a Tank Freak is that their electronics are not always top of the line, leaving them vulnerable to energy attacks.

Tank Swiper.description: The fully armored, incredibly tough Tank Freaks are a rare breed indeed. As their name suggests, they're almost unstoppable in combat. The one ray of hope when confronting a Tank Freak is that their electronics are not always top of the line, leaving them vulnerable to energy attacks.

Tanker Hero.description: This young hero's incredible might and impenetrable skin make him a formidable foe.

Tanya.description: Tanya isn't known so much for her fiery temper as much as she's known for turning people who hurt her friends into charcoal.

Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Tarantula Essence.description: This Arachnos Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Tarantula Mistress.description: A rare few Fortunatas volunteer for the Tarantula program. Those who survive integration with the machine are truly terrors to behold. Their specially-designed suits greatly amplify their psychic abilities, allowing them to to not only communicate the next few seconds of time to their allies, but also to distort reality for their foes as well.

Tarantula Queen.description: What terrible process pushes a woman to become one of these unholy terrors is a subject of much speculation. What is known is that their suits are little different from Tarantula Mistresses. Instead, it seems the user somehow suffers the upgrade. Tarantula Queens are all incredibly powerful, but also quite mad.

Target Dummy.description: This reinforced door stands between you and freedom!  The door seems to be vibrate and hum, as though it is coursing with energy.

Taskmaster.description: Taskmasters are the bureaucratic masterminds of the Drudges. They have, for time immemorial,  been in charge of the flow of souls from each world to the next, and they have made a great deal of profit off of their services. The Taskmasters deal in wax, which is used to keep the candles of the Drudges burning - but in order to meet the demands of their Taskmasters the Drudges must burn their candles at both ends, creating an eternal cycle of dependence.

Tattoo Artist.description: The dedicated tattoo artists of the Tsoo have little combat ability on their own, but their mastery of the Tsoo's tattoo magic allows them to imbue others in that organization with phenominal powers.

Tear Gas Grenade.description: In the fight to keep the city safe there are times when it is too dangerous for a human officer to lead the way. For these high risk situations the PPD has designed three robotic automatons to keep them in the game. Each model is designed to take whatever punishment can be thrown at it and keep the pressure on with an impressive arsenal of its own.

Tech Lab Generator.description: This is a high-tech generator used as a dedicated power source for equipment in this are

Tech Portal.description: By using Portal Corp. technology, Longbow can move troops instantly across great distances. Destroying this portal would cut them off further re-enforcements.

Tech Specialist?.description: It looks like Kelly Uqua's captured technicians are a little more exotic than you expected. Still, a job's a job.

Technician.description: This technician has been dispatched to suppress and control the transmissions being sent from the TPN Campus. The longer the technician remains on scene, the more effective his suppression and the less effective your efforts to convince the populace of Tyrant's corruption.

Technician Naylor.description: You're suprised to see Technician Naylor as a hostage of the Nemesis Army, since he's the one who just sent you here!

Telekineticist.description: The Syndicate encourages their Adepts to advance their psychic powers, so it isn't uncommon to see Telekineticists within their ranks. These Adepts are capable of manipulating kinetic energy to crush their foes, but also to steal power from their foes to build their own.

Telepathist.description: Telepathists are unique amongst the Seers, in that they have focused all of their psychic power in being able to influence the minds of Praetorian citizens. They have no ability to defend themselves except by changing otherwise peaceful citizens into fierce combatants in defense of Praetoria.

Teleportation Field.description: This is the entity that disables travel powers and kill-self powers in the neutral tutorila.

Tellurian Seedling.description: Tellurian Seedlings function as the Seed's antibodies, used against Cole's forces and superpowered beings who dare venture near the massive beast. Every Tellurian Seedling spreads a particularly virulent strand of the Plague, capable of melting the victim's mind in mere seconds.

Tellus of Earth.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Earth commands the forces of nature.

Telsa Tower.description: These strange devices thrum with power, harvesting the meta-human energies gathered by the Web and channeling them into Lord Recluse.

Temp Disabler.description: This entity disables all powers marked with "kDisable_Temp" mode disallowed.

Temp Disabler Fast.description: This entity disables all powers marked with "kDisable_Temp" mode disallowed.

Tempest.description: This mercenary sister has been completely converted into a member of the Talons. Her skin is now replaced with the more protective scales of her brethren and large wings have sprouted from her back. The only remnants present from her previous life are her utility belts and her combat headset. She wields dual blades in place of her broadsword.

Tempest Elemental.description: From a distance, the Storm Elementals are a beautiful sight. At close range, however, they're a serious threat. Their Endurance-draining attacks can cripple their foes, and their ion strikes can disorient heroes, leaving them defenseless.

Tempest Elemental Essence.description: This Elemental essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Tempest Essence.description: This Knives of Vengeance essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Tempest Gyre.description: The swirling energies of the storm which has engulfed Penelope Yin's network node have created vortices within the flow of energy. These vortices have taken shape and can be moved around. These vortices are dangerous and should be eliminated as soon as possible.

Temporal Portal.description: These 5th Column portals have allowed the villains to hide themselves throughout time.

Tentacle.description: These wild tentacles protect the giant octopus' head from attack.

Tera Prince.description: The Clockwork King's improved psychic abilities apparently had a profound effect on his creations. These Clockwork are significantly stronger and more durable than their predecessors.

Terminal.description: This terminal monitors many of the functions of base security and increases the control generated by the base computer system.

Terra.description: Transformed by a Devouring Earth drug, this raging beast was once the woman Tanya Tyler. Now capable of breeding Devouring Earth creatures, Terra is the monsters' greatest offensive weapon in their war against humanity.

Terra, the All-Mother.description: This birthing orb appears to be all that remains of Tanya Tyler in this universe. Every once in a while you swear you hear the low hum of a lullaby coming from it.

Terran of Earth.description: The Legacy Chain works to ensure the mystic arts are used only for good. The Legacy of Earth commands the forces of nature.

Terror.description: These phantasms are actually manifestations of humanity's fears come to life. At the Banner of Transparent Terrors, they seek to inflict unimaginable terror upon their victims and as long as the Banner of Terror persists, these parasites will feed off of the fear of others.

Tesla Bishop.description:
The Clockwork Bishops are the most effective psionic conduits of the Clockwork King's power, allowing them to channel electricity into a protective and healing energy to bolster the ranks of the kingdom's soldiers.

While less sturdy than other ranks of the mechanical army, a Bishop left to their own devices can quickly turn the tide of a battlefield by channeling their King's tactical smarts, a strategic advantage that is leveraged to great effect.

Tesla Cage.description: This device is charged with an entrapment spell that will automatically trigger when an enemy comes near. If successful, the victim is immobilized in a tesla field for a short time.

Tesla Duke.description: Like any monarch, the Clockwork King has his own court, although in his case it's composed of mechanical nobles called Dukes. The Tesla Dukes are dangerous foes, possessing the ability to imprison foes in crackling electrical cages.

Tesla Knight.description: The Knights make up the bulk of the leadership class within the twisted court of the Clockwork King. The Tesla Knights are especially dangerous because they enclose foes in deadly electrical cages.

Tesla Prince.description: The heirs apparent to the Clockwork King's throne, the Princes represent the pinnacle of the mad genius' creations. Although Tesla Princes sometimes seem almost human because of their advanced robotic brains, they possess the decidedly inhuman ability to imprison their foes in cages of electricity.

The Abomination.description: This mass of flesh and machine is Dr. Kane's greatest creation.

The Almighty Donut of Death.description: Donuts are not good for you in large quantities, much like everything else.

The American Diplomat.description: This American ambassador wasn't looking for trouble when he went to meet Ambassador Alwani of West Libertalia. If you can't get him out of here, he'll probably be killed to cover up the assassination of Alwani.

The Burninator.description: The Burninator is a rather eccentric arsonist who joined the Gold Brickers after he learned the group was using the type of weaponry he loves. While his comrades are occasionally a little nervous around him when he's laughing like a maniac, none can deny that he's good at what he does.

The Center.description: The Center has been the master of the Council for nearly 70 years. His mutant ability to convince people and his own devious intelligence have helped him keep his power and turn the Council into one of the most dangerous organizations in the world.

The Crusader.description: The Crusader is a mysterious Resistance Runesoldier. His Runesoldier Rifle overpowers his opposition with its magically infused ammunition.

The Dragon.description: The Dragon is a decorated Rikti general, a hero for them from the first Rikti war. He was caught on the homeworld side of the dimensional barrier when Hero 1 and the rest of Omega Team sealed the pathway between our world and theirs.

The Dragon's Tail.description: The Dragon's Tail is desperately seeking the antidote to a plague in Paragon City. Of course, you're being paid to pick up the same antidote. So someone's gotta lose.

The Dreaded Mapserver!.description:
The Mapserver has been central to so many hero and villain defeats over time, that it's hard to believe it's escaped capture for so long.

It is the Alpha and Omega of supers world-wide... it's been there since the beginning, and will be there at the end. Some say it was already at the end, and is trying to accelerate to the end to save humanity the misery.

The Facemaker.description: The woman called the Facemaker was once a disciple of Dr. Vahzilok in Paragon City. She still admires the mad doctor's work, but decided to strike out on her own to pursue her own amoral vision of life and beauty.

The Fortune Teller.description: If allowed to remain in the hands of the Circle, it's very likely this fortune teller could be forced to give up information that would bring Paragon City to ruin. She has a reputation for extremely accurate predictions.

The God Champion.description: A hero from the lost-age of Myth, the God-Champion constructed the Coliseum in time immemorial. Brooding like a spider in its web, the God-Champion has feasted on the sweet nectar of violence ever since. For generations, the God-Champion has waited for a challenger worthy of his power and has grown overwhelmingly more powerful with each combatant defeated on the brutal sands. Now that a group of challengers have proven themselves worthy, he takes up sword and shield once more as the souls of the vanquished flock to his side for a chance to bathe once more in the glory of the Coliseum.

The Goddess Hequat.description: The Goddess of the Mu, Hequat guided her people in the war against the people of ancient Oranbega. Hequat does not abide the insolence of mortals who do not pay due worship to the gods.

The Grub.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

The Invincible Axios.description: Seeking to make his mark as one of the great heroes of Paragon City, Axios dons his costume in an effort to generate as much press as possible.

The Lawyer.description: A relic of the Cold War, the Soviet soldier who goes by the name of Comrade is a Killer-For-Hire. If you need someone to disappear forever, Comrade will do the deed, for the right price.

The Major.description: Known only as 'The Major' this man acts as the handler for Void Sanction. He gives out cryptic clues for the locations of dead drops where you can pick up a new target for Void Sanction's special services.

The Mapserver?.description: The Mapserver has been central to so many hero and villain defeats over time, that it's hard to believe it's escaped capture for so long!

The Prophet.description: The leaders of the Anathema have fully mutated minds that allow them to project their indomitable will onto others. They can use these powers to immobilize, hypnotize, or even dominate lesser wills. The Eremites are the preachers of the Lost. Their psychic abilities allow them to entrance crowds of possible converts.

The Quest.description: Young orphan Jimmy Blankenship grew up in the Rogue Isles, surving by his street smarts and the kind help of Westin Phipps' Haven House. He might have even found a life in the isles, until the day Arachnos troops took the woman he loved away for forcible induction into Fortunatas. He nearly died trying to save her, but still failed. On the run from Arachons, he escaped the Isles and found his way to Paragon City. There he trained under combat masters and found his personal desire for revenge transformed into a larger quest for justice.

The Radio.description: This looks like a perfectly normal radio. Every now and then you can hear snatches of dialog from a radio show called 'Radio Free Opportunity' break through the radio chatter.

The Ranger.description: The Ranger thinks she can stop you from rescuing Olivia Darque. She's wrong.

The Seed of Hamidon.description: The Seed of Hamidon can be seen from miles away, spreading the Hamidon infestation throughout the Sunken City. The Seed surrounds itself with a thick cloud of spores and uses its Seedlings to manipulate their properties, giving it massive powers of control over everything in its vicinity.

The Sentinel of Mot.description: After the defeat of Mot and the purging of Maximus from the Sentinel, the creature was left a soulless husk, perfect for Diabolique to claim for her own ends. Where once the Sentinel served Mot with strength and intelligence, this mindless creature is little more than a brutish monster whose only objective is to sow death and destruction while his new master completes her apotheosis.

The Swarm.description: These nettlesome swarms are crawling over the Seed of Hamidon and infest the Seedlings when they are produced. These swarms are potentially very dangerous, as they will become extremely furious if pressed and can erupt in a cloud of noxious chemicals.

The Unnamed One.description: The Totems are avatars of the ancient gods of the Banished Pantheon. They are powerful, deadly foes who relish tearing heroes apart with their bare hands. They enjoy it so much that they ignore any attempts to disorient, dissuade, or divert their focus.

The Well of the Furies.description: This entity will debilitate players by randomly shutting off a single player's powers every 30s.

Theadora Marcone.description: A Family cousin, the love of Johnny's life, and a closet superheroine: Theadora Marcone leads a busy life. A shame you'll have to take her out.

Thomas.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Thorn.description: No one knows exactly how Hamidon breathed life into this colossal tree. What is certain is that the tree is grateful. Thorn defends Hamidon's Eden with a fearsome vigor, and seems to have no sympathy for anything that walks on two legs.

Thorn Tree.description: A demon-tree of the netherworld, the Circle of Thorns use the Thorn Tree to siphon energy from an ancient fortress of the Mu. Unlike a normal plant, the Thorn Tree has its own defenses, and cannot even be damaged until the vines defending it have been cleared away.

Thorn Tree Vine.description: The vines of the Thorn tree can move and strike, cutting down those who would hurt its body. What's more, the main body of the tree cannot be attacked until all of the vines have been destroyed.

Thorn Wielder.description: The mighty Thorn Wielders are the elite guardians of the Circle of Thorns. They wield the sacred Thorn Blades, enchanted weapons that leave a taint of foul magic on anyone they strike.

Thunder Leopard.description: Thunder Leopard is the youngest of Sun Xiong's favored disciples, and struggles to earn the respect of his seniors. He has trains in the ancient art of Nrig Xub Tua, allowing him to sheathe his own fists with powerful electric energy.

Thunder Maven.description: It takes more than just hard work and dedication to become a Thunder Maven. It takes a certain raw talent, and a sensitivity to the power wafting through every breeze in Croatoa. Some Mavens insist that they can hear the voices of their late husbands floating on those breezes. Whether true or not, this belief only strengthens their fury in battle.

Thurisaz Rune.description: These strange runes glow ominously with unstable mystic energy.

Tia.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Tielekku.description:
Ancient myths say that the goddess Tielekku was the first being to harness the power of magic. She then taught her magic to other gods and mortals and used her abilities to defeat an evil pantheon of gods, banishing them to the spirit world.

Tielekku is a powerful entity, though it is rumored that her power has faded over the centuries due to the distribution of magic.

Tiger Blue Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The   blue ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Blue Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Tiger Enforcer.description: The Pha, or Enforcers, are the foot soldiers of the Tsoo. They have yet to receive magical tattoos, and so must rely on their own strength and their weaponry. They train constantly and are especially deadly in close combat situations.

Tiger Red Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The red ink empowers the Tsoo with the ability to drain the strength and energy from a victim and add it to his own. Red Ink Men are masters of using an opponent's strengths against him.

Tiger Yellow Ink Man.description: The enchanted inks used in Tsoo tattoos grant these soldiers special powers. The yellow ink enhances a Tsoo's mental powers, giving him the ability to dominate and entrance his opponents. Yellow Ink Men can easily render their victims vulnerable to attack.

Time Capsule.description: This time capsule contains mementos of Hero 1 and his teammates on Omega Team. Protect it from the invaders!"

Time Stop.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. This powerful spell was meant to stop all of time for its master, but quickly grew bored and wandered off on its own into the Night Ward.

Timothy.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Tinder.description: The hellfire burns bright inside the leaders of the Hellions. So bright, in fact, that they can call it forth to incinerate their enemies. This inner fire keeps them safe from fire damage, but leaves them quite susceptible to cold.

Tobias Hansen.description: Tobias Hansen has been around Striga Island for quite some time, but you wouldn't know it to look at him. According to local legend, 'Old Toby' was already the vicar when the Family started setting up shop here in the 1920s. No one can explain the strange youth of Tobias and his twin brother, Lars. With the Council disbanded, the rumors of their preternatural youth are still without answer, and their continued dedication to Striga Isle is without pause.

Todd.description: Dr. Roberta Todd is Paragon City's preeminent scientist in the field of Kinetics. She's learned a trick or two in the lab that may come in handy here.

Tommy.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Tommy Fontana.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Tommy One-Eye.description: 'Tommy One-Eye' lost his eye in a Superadine deal raided by the Warriors. It's said that the Warrior who snatched it from his skull is still about, telling the tale. Before that, he was locally known as the Tomcat for his vicious, feral attitude towards keeping his crew in line during crises.

Tony.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Topaz Barrier Nova.description:
This Dark Nova Nictus is channeling a dark energy shield onto Romulus making him invulnerable to damage in exchange for him fueling it with his life force!

You'll have to destroy all the nearby Barrier Novas to get to Romulus! This amber-hued Nictus appears to be more vulnerable to melee attacks.

Torment Monument.description: This monument seems to pulse with power.

Tortured Soul.description: As a warrior he lost his life in battle. As a Grave Knight, his own lust for vengeance was manipulated and exploited. Now this Tortured Soul knows only hatred and will do anything to be free and finally rest.

Totem.description: The Totems are avatars of the ancient gods of the Banished Pantheon. They are powerful, deadly foes who relish tearing heroes apart with their bare hands. They enjoy it so much that they ignore any attempts to disorient, dissuade, or divert their focus.

Towering Inferno.description: A colossus of modern technology, the Towering Inferno sets all who oppose him ablaze!

Toxic Gas Missile Turret.description: The Crey security catalog entry reads: 'Sometimes even the strongest conventional defense isn't enough to dissuade some of the stranger threats your installation may face. Crey Industries is ready to provide you with the perfect solution when you need maximum levels of non-conventional force. Our Toxic Gas Missile Turrets can suppress even the most unconventional of foes with their deadly vapors.'

Toxic Tarantula.description: The Tarantula Exoskeleton Armor was developed by an Orb Weaver cell named Weaver One. It grants the user incredible strength and wires him directly to his weapons systems. Rumor is that the pilot must undergo a terrible treatment of some sort to properly graft with the suit.

Toxic Waste.description: This barrel contains a powerful drug that will weaken the immune system of Paragon City's people. You must destroy it before it's introduced to the water supply.

Tracker.description: Trackers are adept at picking out particular thoughts among the sea of confusion generated by the minds of Praetoria. They can be given a subject or word to listen for, pluck it out of the air, and lead PPD forces right to the person whose thoughts they are hunting.

Traditionalist Negotiator.description: The negotiators of the Rikti Traditionalists have dedicated themselves to finding a lasting peace between their own people and the peoples of Earth.

Trainer.description: Trainers are very important to Dominatrix's organization. They teach the new Servants to fight effectively and work as a unit. They also fill the position of tactical leader in combat quite often.

Training Dummy.description: A training dummy. It allows trainess and pros alike to get used to hand to hand combat against the Rikti foes.

Transformation Capsule.description: The vampyri are the very pinnacle of the Council's super soldier program. The final stages of the process are carried out within these crypt-like chambers, where a complex cocktail of hormones and mutagens are fed to the prospective vampyri intravenously. Though some fatalities inevitably occur, the resulting super soldiers are more than enough to make up for the loss.

Transformed Rikti.description: The Rikti Conscripts were once regular people who were horribly mutated by the effects of experimentation.

Trapdoor.description: Since Trapdoor's escape from Arachnos, he has made an alliance with the Council to find ways to improve his nacent Incarnate abilities. One new trick he's picked up is the ability to teleport himself to multiple places at once, bifurcating his body to recuperate from enemy attacks.

Trapdoor Bifurcation.description: Trapdoor has used the power of teleportation and correspondence to appear to be in multiple places at once. While he is not fully concentrating in those areas, he is able to use the respite to regenerate himeself.

Trash.description: In some jailbreaks, the toughest of the prisoners manage to overpower the Zig's security guards and grab their weapons.

Trebuchet Drop Ship.description:
A Rikti Transport ship. It also serves effectively as a Bomber.

This ship is a Trebuchet Class, which allows it accurate long-range ballistic firing capabilities.

Tree of Life.description: These tiny trees don't do much to heroes, but their aura boosts the healing rate of all Devouring Earth creatures nearby.

Tree of Wonders.description: The Tree of Wonders produces Inspirations that can be used by Super Group members, for a cost. You can also feed it with unneeded Inspirations to get Influence.  Rent: 100 Prestige

Triage Beacon.description: The Beacon is immobile, but it emits a powerful healing aura that increases the Regeneration Rate of the Mastermind's nearby allies.

Troll Bodyguard.description: This massive Troll works as a bodyguard. A very effective bodyguard.

Trollkin.description: There's something... odd about these Trolls. Not only do they have a strange glow about them, but they appear to have gained an immense amount of power. You've never known Trolls to have strength that could threaten a member of the Freedom Phalanx.

Trollkin Brawler.description: The Trolls have abused their bodies with a particularly dangerous drug called Superadine. It has begun to literally turn them into monsters. These low ranking gang members aren't showing many signs of changing, but that doesn't stop them from acting like beasts.

Trollkin Bruiser.description: The Trolls have abused their bodies with a particularly dangerous drug called Superadine. It has begun to literally turn them into monsters. These low ranking gang members aren't showing many signs of changing, but that doesn't stop them from acting like beasts.

Trollkin Buckshot.description: These Trolls have managed to hit upon a stash of uncut Superadine. It's got them raging out of control and bent on destruction.

Trollkin Gunner.description: The Trolls have abused their bodies with a particularly dangerous drug called Superadine. It has begun to literally turn them into monsters. These low ranking gang members are already showing signs of changing, but they still sometimes rely on conventional weapons.

Trollkin Quantum Gunner.description: The Trolls have abused their bodies with a particularly dangerous drug called Superadine. It has begun to literally turn them into monsters. These low ranking gang members are already showing signs of changing, but they still sometimes rely on conventional weapons.

Trollkin Slammer.description: The Trolls have abused their bodies with a particularly dangerous drug called Superadine. It has begun to literally turn them into monsters. These low ranking gang members aren't showing many signs of changing, but that doesn't stop them from acting like beasts.

Trollkin Slugger.description: The Trolls have abused their bodies with a particularly dangerous drug called Superadine. It has begun to literally turn them into monsters. These low ranking gang members aren't showing many signs of changing, but that doesn't stop them from acting like beasts.

Truck.description: This truck looks like it's of sturdy construction.

Tub Ci.description: Bladestorm is a psychic blade-wielding hitman for the syndicate.

Tundra.description: Tundra contols Arctic Snow and Ice.

Tunnel Rat.description:
Tunnel Rat has been given the task of helping get people out of Praetoria City. She spent most of her life living in the tunnels, giving her heightened vision in the dark and an incredible sense of smell.

Unfortunately, she must permanently wear a re-breather, due to all of the toxic fumes she has inhaled over the years.

Her time in the tunnels has made her an invaluable asset to the Resistance. Though she is one of the more... paranoid members, having seen many of her friends torn apart by ghouls.

Turbine Generator.description: Portacio Industry's LS-3100 dual-shaft gas turbine can be configured for gas or gas/water operation.  Backed by Portacio's warranty and service network, the LS-3100 is the easy-to-maintain solution to base power needs.

Twinshot.description: Twinshot wandered around the nation for several years after being discharged from the military, acting as a hired gun to whoever would hire her. After some time, she got over her disillusionment and remembered why she joined the military to begin with. She began fighting for 'what was right.' Working with Proton, they fought together to bring justice to Paragon City. Recently she's added Dillo and Flambeaux to the mix. Twinshot is always on the lookout for a fresh face who wants to make a difference.

Type 22.description: These genetically altered humans are given the cold numeric moniker Type 22, suggesting that they were part of an earlier batch of experiments. Genetic meddling has given them immense strength and speed, at the cost of extremely rapid cellular decay.

Type 53.description: More advanced genetic creations than their Type 22 counterparts, the Type 53 was created as a command and control unit, as well as a test bed for advanced genetic manipulation. The Type 53 has a targeting computer surgically installed in its head, enabling it to designate a target to its comrades. Genetic meddling has given them immense strength and speed, but once again at the cost of extremely rapid cellular decay.

Type 90.description: Advanced genetic abominations; the Type 90 appears to be intended as a mass-produced replacement for Power's Division members. They are stronger, faster, and tougher than their compatriots, leading them from the front and inspiring them to fight harder and longer than humanly possible. Genetic meddling has given them immense strength and speed, but once again at the cost of extremely rapid cellular decay.

Tyrant.description: Marcus Cole came from the streets of Shroud City with nothing to his name, and ascended to the ultimate throne of power. He pulled the planet back from nuclear annihilation, ended the Hamidon Wars with his own indomitable will, and created a perfect utopian society for all those who follow him. Cole has had many titles in his long life, Soldier, Hero, President, Consul, and for the last 25 years, Emperor of Earth.

Tyrant's Palace Bouncer.description: These hired thugs work security in the Tyrant's Palace Casino and have orders to fight first, ask questions later. Those who run afoul of them better be prepared for a fight.

Tyrant's Palace Enforcer.description: These hired thugs work security in the Tyrant's Palace Casino and have orders to fight first, ask questions later. Those who run afoul of them better be prepared for a fight.

Tyrka.description: Tyrka is a former Circle of Thorns mage. There aren't many members of the Circle of Thorns who willingly abandon thousands of years of tradition, but Tyrka seems to have been swayed enough by someone to leave the Circle of Thorns. It's assumed from the body that Tyrka's spirit is a female, though Tyrka has never confirmed that suggestion.

Umbra Beast.description: The Umbral Beast is among the most horrific predators of the Netherworld. They tear their foes with their vicious claws and can manipulate the shadows of their victims to bind them in place.

Unai Kemen.description: Unai Kemen was given his name by a set of young Basque twin girls that he was hired to bodyguard. In their language it means 'Strong Shepherd'. Tragically, the girls were killed by a super powered villain and Unai retired. It was years before he was contacted by Portal Corporation to coordinate their security. He refused at first, but relented when the Freedom Phalanx sent Statesman to encourage him. Unai still has no idea why he was asked to assume so much responsibility, but he is determined not to fail again.

Unbound Nictus.description: These free-floating Nictus have been drawn to Earth from somewhere else on planet, bridging the distance through a Shadow Crystal. They have not yet joined with or possessed a host, and normally could not survive on a planet's surface for long. However, the dark energies of the Shadow Crystal sustain them, allowing them to hunt for hosts on their own.

Undead Acolyte of Repulsion.description: This undead acolyte has one task, and one task only: To maintain an appropriate amount of social distance.

Undead Acolyte of Sweet Nothings.description: This undead acolyte has one task, and one task only: To make you feel as comfortable as possible in your new life as an apparition.

Underboss.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Underboss Prizefighter.description: The Family loyalists work for Emil Marcone, de facto governor of Port Oakes. They're being challenged by the Marcone's former chief consigliore, Guido 'the Mooch' Verandi.

Underboss Quantum Gunner.description: The Underbosses report directly to the Don, and each has control over a number of Capos. In Paragon City, you don't rise to the top without a little super-powered help, and many Underbosses have heightened abilities or access to specialized gear that helps them stay on top in their cutthroat business.

Underground Completion.description: This entity checks to see if all players in a trial have earned the completion badge.

Underground Watcher.description: This entity sits in a volume and defeats itself if it detects Desdemona enter the volume.

Unkempt - Female.description: This hapless citizen is in over her head.

Unkempt - Male.description: This hapless citizen is in over his head.

Unseelie.description: It's unclear how long these eerie ghosts have floated along the desolate streets of Paragon City, or what force has held them to this world. One thing alone is clear: they seem to be angry with you.

Unspecified Error.description: Sometimes, errors will show up, and nobody knows how it was missed for this long.

Unstable Script.description: This unstable script is liable to explode at a moment's notice. But if it doesn't, it will surely make the intern that wrote it seem smarter than he is!

Upstart.description: Upstart is the master of Anarchy in the Freakshow. His complete indifference to law, order, safety, and consideration has made him a legend to the Freaks in the ranks. Unfortunately, he was the first to be incarcerated, and his followers devolved into chaotic memesters under the other leaders' banners..

Uruz Rune.description: These strange runes glow ominously with unstable mystic energy.

Uuralur the Mirror.description: Uuralur presides over the Garden of Memories. The beings that reside there are reflections of the worlds that Rularuu has consumed, though it is unclear whether he created them out of remorse or amusement. Uuralur has organized many of these reflections into a guard force that patrols the area and keeps the remaining reflections in check.

Vacuum Bot.description: Sweepers are often seen patrolling the street cleaning up litter and debris to make Praetoria a more beautiful place to live. They have an innocuous appearance, however if threatened they are more than capable of defending themselves.

Vagabond.description: Vagabond is a man who has stared into the face of death and laughed at it. He is regarded highly in the Resistance and is willing to do whatever it takes to bring down Cole and his regime.

Valkyrie.description: Valerie Kellum was an archeologist who discovered what she first took for an ancient spear. A more careful examination led to the realization that the spear had a technological component. She traveled around Europe looking for ideas about its origin and ended up in a local Crey facility. When a Crey security team tried to take the weapon from her it activated and injected Valerie with advanced nanites that transformed her into Valkyrie, a extraordinary warrior with a completely different personality. She broke free and traveled to Paragon City where Positron is helping her come to terms with her new identity.

Vampire.description: Impervious to pain and to most forms of death, vampires know only one discomfort: thirst. It gnaws at them from the moment human blood first touches their lips. Although they spend their immortal lives trying to slake this thirst, it is only in rare moments that any vampire feels truly sated.

Vampire Lord.description: By nature vampires resent authority, but they do recognize the need for a little organization. Vampire Lords have distinguished themselves by their daring, their bloodlust, and their imaginative ways of killing. But they must always keep a sharp eye on their followers, for loyalty is a concept alien to the vampire mind.

Vampyr Adjutant.description: The Vampyri Adjutants are soldiers who have been promoted from the Ubermenschen ranks and given the singular honor of becoming a Vampyr. This honor is one the masters of the 5th Column are loathe to give, since it means a year of inactive duty for the Ubermensch. The result, however, is a Vampyr who has both the power and the experience to lead his monstrous soldiers into battle.

Vampyr Commandant.description: The Vampyri Commandants are the assistants to Nosferatu, the man responsible for the 5th Column's super soldier program. Commandants are scientists as well as super soldiers, and have a hand in the creation of other Vampyri. They often personalize their own transformation process, giving themselves special abilities and powers that lesser beings can only dream of.

Vampyr Mesmerist.description: The Vampyri are not true vampires at all. They are instead the ultimate result of the 5th Column's super soldier program. It takes a full year of chemical treatments and surgical enhancements to create a single Vampyr, but the result is one of the most deadly killing machines in the world. All Vampyri have incredible strength, speed, and resilience. The Vampyr Mesmerist has potent hypnotic abilities that entrance enemies and render them helpless.

Vampyr Parasite.description: The Vampyri are not true vampires at all. They are instead the ultimate result of the 5th Column's super soldier program. It takes a full year of chemical treatments and surgical enhancements to create a single Vampyr, but the result is one of the most deadly killing machines in the world. All Vampyri have incredible strength, speed, and resilience. The Vampyr Parasite has the ability to drain life from its targets, while strengthening itself.

Vandal.description: The fiend known as Vandal was once a humble tinkerer named Othman Doul. In the late 1930's, the villain Requiem recognized Doul's usefulness and recruited him to the nascent 5th Column. Othman was happy to oblige, since it meant he could indulge his scientific curiosity without restraint. Over the years, Vandal has mechanically augmented himself to prolong his lifespan. Now, he seeks to advance his own position within the 5th Column and perhaps even challenge Requiem for supremacy.

Vanessa DeVore.description: Vanessa DeVore is the mother of the resistance. It was her warning of what was to come in Cole's new world order that unified a small group of important military leaders into what would one day become the Resistance. Without DeVore's immense psychic power the Resistance would have been tracked down by Mother Mayhem's Seers, and smashed by the PPD.

Vanguard Adept.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Colonel.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Commander.description:
These walking tanks are the pinnacle of everything that is Vanguard's training, weapons, and a symbol of their power.

These men and women are at the head of Vanguard's endeavors to keep Earth safe and won't hesitate to make the difficult calls on what must be sacrificed to ensure every threat is eliminated before it can harm our world.

Vanguard Drill Instructor.description: Vanguard has allowed this Trainer to provide services for your Supergroup.

Vanguard Eliminator.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Emergency HVAS.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard HVAS.description: Vanguard has rewarded you with the use of one of their Heavy Assault Suits.

Vanguard IDC.description:
The Vanguard have engineered these Immobile Dummy Combatants as a means to gather combat data on their offensive capabilities against the Rikti.

It's also a great way to relieve stress!

They've been made to incrementally increase in sturdiness so that operatives can test the differences from combat level.

Thanks to cutting-edge technology, when this dummy is destroyed it will report how long the defeat took from full HP.

Vanguard MDC.description:
The Vanguard have engineered this Immobile Dummy Combatant as a means to gather combat data on their offensive capabilities against the Rikti.

It's also a great way to relieve stress!

Thanks to cutting-edge technology, when this dummy is destroyed it will report how long the defeat took from full HP.

Vanguard MVAS.description: Vanguard has rewarded you with a miniature replica of one of their Heavy Assault Suits.

Vanguard Magician.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Quartermaster.description: Vanguard has sent a Quartermaster to provide Enhancements to your Supergroup.

Vanguard Ranger.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Sergeant.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Soldier.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Sorcerer.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanguard Training Pylon.description:
The Vanguard have prepared this facsimile as a tool for operatives to gauge their offense capabilities against the Rikti. While these dummy pylons are not armed with any offensive capabilities, they match the looks of the genuine-article perfectly.

Thanks to cutting-edge technology, when this dummy is destroyed it will report how long the defeat took from full HP.

Vanguard Warhead.description: Inside this Vanguard Crate appears to be a warhead of some type.

Vanguard Wizard.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Vanquisher.description: This mercenary sister has experienced a profound boost in her agility and sight due to her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance. Clad in the latest high-tech body suit and still using standard Knives battle gear, she has abandoned her wrist mounted crossbow in favor of more graceful and deadly dual pistols, chambered with ammunition containing toxins created by the Talons.

Vault Door.description: This Vault Door is a massive hunk of reinforced tempered steel. No normal person would be able to put a dent in it. But you're no normal person, and right now it stands between you and your prize. Blow it away!

Veles.description: Viktor Petrovic is the eldest of the Petrovics. As one of the Lords of Death he is a leader of the Skulls street gang in Paragon City. Together, with his siblings, he formed a pact with dark powers to learn the black arts. He took the name of Veles, an ancient Slavic deity of the underworld, magic, and trickery. Unlike his siblings, Veles leads the Skulls through guile and cunning rather than death and fear. Whether he commands respect from his siblings due to familial love or even greater strength remains unknown.

Vengeful Attendant.description: The Vengeful Attendants serve as front line forces for the Carnival of Vengeance, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes it would be better to join the Talons of Vengeance, rather than resist them. They were once followers of Vanessa DeVore.

Vent Smoke.description: The vents are spitting out hot flames.

Vermillion.description: Cerulean's blood lust has gotten the best of him and now he has let his thirst for vengeance completely overtake him. The blue wizard may yet exist somewhere behind those burning red eyes, but reasonable conversation with him seems an impossibility at this point. He's become an agent of vengeance.

Very Large Cable.description: These strange living spires are somehow connected with Hamidon's ability to control the creatures of the Devouring Earth.

Vic Johansson.description: By all accounts, Vic Johansson is one of the good guys. A beat cop who has worked The Gish for years, Vic has become especially concerned with the growing numbers of The Lost, as well as the rising crime rate thanks to the Skulls and their Superadine drug ring.

Vicious Rikti Monkey.description: These Rikti monkeys have been captured by Crey Industries for scientific experimentation. You must extract the little beasts before Crey figures out a way to bioengineer them.

Viewer.description: After a Scanner has been under Mother Mayhem's mind for a time one of three things happens. Most of them burn out. A smaller percentage shows no indication of greater ability and remains where they are in the ranks. Finally the smallest fraction demonstrates the ability to penetrate more deeply into a subjects mind and is advanced to Viewer status.

Viewing Portal.description: Through this gateway thoughts fly quicker than wind. The portal generates additional control for your base.

Vigilant.description: The stone-faced, suit clad Field Agents are Crey's main investigative branch. They can be found carrying out a variety of missions, from espionage to assassination ops. They carry the latest weapons and receive intense close combat training.

Vince Dubrowski.description: If there's one thing Cage Consortium believes in, it's profit. That's why Vince Dubrowski's here. Vince is in charge of keeping down the rabble-rousing Scrapyarders who are throwing a wrench into the well-oiled machine of the Consortium's bauxite mining. Vince never questions his orders to bust up Scrapyarder safehouses, put down picket lines with militant force, or even have a few of the more troublesome louts arrested on false charges. Because if there's one thing Vince Dubrowski believes in, it's loyalty. He gave his soul to the Consortium long ago, and he's never looked back.

Vindictive Mistress.description: The Mistresses are extremely powerful sorceresses and mystics, able to twist magical energies into a diverse selection of abilities. With few exceptions, they are the most talented mystics in the Carnival of Vengeance, and form the core of its leadership. Their newfound loyalty to the Talons has granted them some of their unique morphology. These Mistresses represent some of the most loyal of Vanessa's original followers, and their departure from the Carnival of Light has strained that organization significantly.

Viper Blade.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Viper Claw.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Viper Fang.description: Rumor has it that that Snakes are what's left of the long-vanished Children of Enos, the Mu cult that originally discovered the Rogue Isles. Or perhaps they were here before the Children fled the French authorities, and gobbled up the unfortunate refugees who tried to hide here on Mercy Island.

Virginia.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Viridian Fear.description: The Viridian Fear techniques are based around amplifying and controlling the power of fear itself. A Viridian Fear master can use shadow techniques to manifest the very fears of his enemies.

Visionary.description: Visionaries are extremely powerful and quite rare among the seers. They are usually stationary and are very seldom called into field duty. If you see one it's far too late to run.

Vito.description: Even prisoners have their hierarchies. Some convicts rise to leadership positions because of their ruthlessness and ferocity.

Void Harbinger.description:
It is an ill omen for any world that finds themselves host to a Void Harbinger, as they are the eldest and most powerful of all the Void Hunters mercenaries. Armed with technology unlike any you've ever seen, they've annihilated an uncountable number of the Kheldian race.

These are the most loyal agents of an unseen darkness. Working tirelessly to seed the universe with Nictus, having laid waste to thousands of unsuspecting planets in the name of their masters.

Void Ripper.description: Void Ripper is a villain with a reputation for viciousness. He's been tossed in the Zigursky prison on assault charges numerous times.

Void Seeker.description: Void Seekers are the lowest rank among the deadly Void Hunter mercenaries, serving mostly as scouts to detect possibly Kheldian activity. They carry a powerful Quantum Array gun specially designed to damage and disrupt Kheldian energy signatures, and have special Nictus fragment implants that protect them from energy attacks.

Void Slayer.description: Void Slayers are the deadliest operatives the Void Hunter mercenaries have at their disposal. They carry the most powerful Quantum Array weapons available and have dozens of Nictus fragment implants, allowing them to destroy a Kheldian with little risk to themselves.

Void Stalker.description: Void Stalkers are drawn from the ranks of Void Seekers who have proven their cunning and viciousness in battle. Extra training, more powerful Quantum Array weaponry, and additional Nictus fragment implants transform them into something dangerous to most heroes and deadly to Kheldians.

Volatile Portal.description:
The Rikti's portal Scientists can open somewhat volatile portals to bring experimental Hydra bio-weapons to Earth.

An opened portal can only be closed by being Held, Stunned, Slept, or Feared at a magnitude of 10 or higher!

Volt.description: Outcast Initiates who show potential are valuable commodities amongst the Outcasts, and are quickly elevated up the ranks. Volts have shown promise in manipulating and controlling their Electrical powers.

Vorpal Sword.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Legendary artifacts only known in rumors and legends, Vorpal Swords are few and far between even in the Midnight Squad's prestigious membership, capable of dealing severe damage to any being wandering between dimensions.

Vortex Adjutant.description: Vortex Adjutants are zealots in every sense of the word. They believe in the Council's superiority so fiercely that they have become experts at recruiting new members from the disaffected elements of society. Vortex Adjutants are in equal parts soldier and proselytizer.

Vortex Archon.description: The Vortex Archons are the living essence of the Council's beliefs. While the Adjutants brim with enthusiasm, the Archons radiate a palpable aura of danger. The Vortex carefully foster this mystique in order to keep order within the ranks of the Council.

Vortex Assault.description: The Vortex are the pride and joy of the Council's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the Council should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers, but their faith in the Council's supremacy is complete. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Vortex.

Vortex Cor Leonis Adjutant.description: Vortex Cor Leonis Adjutants have the responsibility of leading large numbers of troops. They are concerned with training their men into peak fighting form - and recruiting new members to the Council. Until recently, none have ever been taken alive by the authorities.

Vortex Cor Leonis Archon.description: The Vortex Cor Leonis Archons make up the inner circle that surrounds the Council leadership. They are charged with the grand stratagems that further the ultimate goal of the Council: the eventual domination of the world. The leaders of the Council foster a competitiveness between these high ranking officers in order to prevent any single one of them from acquiring too much power and becoming a threat.

Vortex Cor Leonis Fire.description: Every member of the Council aspires to become one of the Vortex Cor Leonis, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the Council - totally devoted to its goal of world domination. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Vortex Cor Leonis Force.description: Every member of the Council aspires to become one of the Vortex Cor Leonis, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the Council - totally devoted to its goal of world domination. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Vortex Cor Leonis Grenade.description: Every member of the Council aspires to become one of the Vortex Cor Leonis, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the Council - totally devoted to its goal of world domination. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Vortex Cor Leonis Marksman.description: Every member of the Council aspires to become one of the Vortex Cor Leonis, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the Council - totally devoted to its goal of world domination. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.
