They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the Council - totally devoted to its goal of world domination. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Vortex Cor Leonis Sonic.description: Every member of the Council aspires to become one of the Vortex Cor Leonis, but few of them achieve this lofty goal. They are the spiritual and philosophical leaders of the Council - totally devoted to its goal of world domination. Like any good soldier, they lead by example. Their intense training and physical enhancements make them perfect soldiers. In battle, they serve as an inspiration to all who fight at their side.

Vortex Elite Adjutant.description: The Elite Vortex Adjutants are those destined for positions of authority in the Council hierarchy. Their authority supercedes nearly every other rank. These Adjutants reward the Council with the utmost devotion. By the time someone has reached this lofty level, he has given up any semblance of a normal life. He belongs to the Council, body and soul.

Vortex Elite Archon.description: The Vortex Elite Archons are among the few soldiers permitted to express their opinions to the Council's leaders, though most wisely avoid doing so. They control almost all the internal operations of the Council organization.

Vortex Elite Fire.description: Elite members of the Vortex have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the Council remain secure.

Vortex Elite Force.description: Elite members of the Vortex have not only proven their loyalty to the cause, they've also shown themselves capable of bringing new members into the fold. Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the Council remain secure.

Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the Council remain secure.

Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the Council remain secure.

Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the Council remain secure.

Only those who have achieved Elite status are allowed to interact directly with potential recruits. Their fanatical devotion ensures that they'll either convert the potential member, or kill him. Either way, the secrets of the Council remain secure.

Vortex Fire.description: The Vortex are the pride and joy of the Council's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the Council should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers, but their faith in the Council's supremacy is complete. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Vortex.

Vortex Intern.description: This Vortex Adjutant made a bet with his commanding officer that if he could take out heroes with a sidearm and raw physicality, he'd get the promotion to the rank of Elite. Let's see how well that turns out for him.

Vortex Marksman.description: The Vortex are the pride and joy of the Council's army. They represent the ideal to which all other followers of the Council should aspire. Not only are they disciplined, well-trained soldiers, but their faith in the Council's supremacy is complete. Only those who have proven both their ability and loyalty are permitted to join the ranks of the Vortex.

Vulcannon.description: Vanessa Shaw has one rule, and one rule only when it comes to working with her - when she fires, get out of the way. Her power is great, her friendly-fire rating is not. Hero Corps has been working with her for years to study her powers and help focus them, but currently she comes with a disclaimer that you should not 'stand directly in front of the Vulcannon.'

Wailer.description: St. Martial is infested with these horrid demons. A rumor on a Johnnie 'The Pipes' Sonata fan-site a few weeks back 'joked' that the singer must have sold his soul for his golden voice and the demons are here to collect. Maybe there's some truth to it.

Wailer King.description: St. Martial is infested with these horrid demons. A rumor on a Johnnie 'The Pipes' Sonata fan-site a few weeks back 'joked' that the singer must have sold his soul for his golden voice and the demons are here to collect. Maybe there's some truth to it.

Wailer Lord.description: The Wailer Lord is the biggest and strongest of the demons that infest St. Martial. It's assumed that the wailers fight for the power and the knowledge that comes with the title in terrible howling brawls that shake walls blocks away.

Wailer Queen.description: St. Martial is infested with these horrid demons. A rumor on a Johnnie 'The Pipes' Sonata fan-site a few weeks back 'joked' that the singer must have sold his soul for his golden voice and the demons are here to collect. Maybe there's some truth to it.

Walter.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

Walter Daschle.description: Walter Daschle isn't the world's most powerful mystic, but he does have an uncanny knack for summoning creatures and binding them to his cause.

War.description: No Rikti warriors are more feared than those known as the 4 Riders. Said to have suffered some strange transformation during the crossing between worlds even their fellow Rikti are terrified of them. The Rider known as War specializes in pure destruction, aiding his allies as he annihilates his foes.

War Hulk Essence.description: This Nemesis Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

War Priest.description: Though the Rikti are not known to be religious, they do have a number of individuals that fill a role similar to a priest within their society. These cultural officials also investigate instances of aberrant thought, and seek to correct them. Few had ever been seen before on Earth, until recently.

War Walker.description: War Walkers are meant to serve one purpose, to instill terror into its foes as it obliterates them with its deadly particle cannons. The mechanical behemoths represent the pinnacle of Praetorian technology.

War Witch.description: Though War Witch has passed away, her spirit remains rooted to the world for which she gave her life. The ghost of War Witch has made her home in Croatoa over the last several months, sitting silently by the lake--but now she has sprung into action. It seems that War Witch's ghost retains the powers granted to her by her mystical coven, and will continue to use them in service of Paragon City.

Ward.description: The Animus Arcana are magical spells or items brought to life by the very nature of Night Ward's tenuous dimensional connections. Ward is the sentient Overspell that is in charge of managing all of the magical defenses of the Midnight Mansion in Night Ward. He is the Spellfather of the Animus Arcana.

Warden Essence.description: This Longbow Essence has been conjured out of the mists of the Well of the Furies, a study of an enemy made substance and brought to heel.

Wardog.description: Wardog's name strikes fear into the hearts of even the most brave Loyalist. His thirst for vengeance against Cole rivals that of Calvin Scott. Some say that he spends every waking moment thinking about the day when he'll get a chance to personally put an end to Cole.

Warehouse Worker.description: From their dress, these men would appear to be simple warehouse workers, spending their time carrying and organizing crates of merchandise. Their clothes are plain, and they are unarmed. And yet, they show no signs of fear in the presence of heavily-armed Arachnos soldiers, and infamous Villains of the Rogue Isles... which is hardly expected behavior, for a simple warehouse worker.

Warhulk.description: The War Hulk is the largest and most powerful killing machine built by the Prussian Prince of Automatons. It's a veritable walking tank, armed with flamethrowers, storm cannons, and an impressively brutal power claw.

Warrant.description: Determined and dependable, Warrant rose from the ranks of the PPD and into the Powers Division. His custom armor is not only symbolic of his dedication to Praetoria, but it also packs quite a bit more punch than the gear issued to the police.

Warrant Officer Welks.description: One of the few female officers on the force, Sheila Welks does a job that few women in Praetoria would want to. It's hard work, but Welks is proud to be doing it. She was recently promoted to Warrant Officer after rescuing a fellow officer from Destroyers and still managing to bring them into custody, albeit with a few broken bones.

Warrior.description: The Warriors are the frontline troops of the Tuatha de Dannan. They are relentless in their efforts to keep down their ancient enemies, the Fir Bolg.

Warrior Bruiser.description: A little education can be a dangerous thing. The members of the gang known as the Warriors take their inspiration from ancient Greek heroes and soldiers. They seem to favor the old school weapons over democracy, literature, and art.

Warrior Chopper.description: A little education can be a dangerous thing. The members of the gang known as the Warriors take their inspiration from ancient Greek heroes and soldiers. They seem to favor the old school weapons over democracy, literature, and art.

Warrior Quantum Gunner.description: A little education can be a dangerous thing. The members of the gang known as the Warriors take their inspiration from ancient Greek heroes and soldiers. They seem to favor the old school weapons over democracy, literature, and art.

Warrior Slammer.description: A little education can be a dangerous thing. The members of the gang known as the Warriors take their inspiration from ancient Greek heroes and soldiers. They seem to favor the old school weapons over democracy, literature, and art.

Warrior Slicer.description: A little education can be a dangerous thing. The members of the gang known as the Warriors take their inspiration from ancient Greek heroes and soldiers. They seem to favor the old school weapons over democracy, literature, and art.

Warrior Veteran.description: This Warrior bears the scars of many battles. They're all testaments to his tenacity for winning fights.

Warwolf.description: The Warwolf has lost all of his humanity to whatever force transformed him into a monstrous killing machine. Unlike the more sedate Nightwolf warriors, the Warwolves are in a wild state and can barely be controlled. They are berserkers, unwilling to obey any orders when their enemy is in sight. They are, however, nearly impossible to kill, which makes up for their disobedient nature.

Wastelander.description: Wastelanders are veteran First Ward survivors. They are extremely tough after years of exposure to the elements and dangers of the area. They tend to shoot first and ask questions later.

Watcher.description: The Watchers oversee squads of Patrolmen and are assigned by Drudge Taskmasters to act as cudgels when something needs to be done quickly and efficiently. They are feared not only because of their lash, but because they can call upon the very shadows of Night Ward to hunt down those who obstruct the directives of the Taskmaster's Office.

Wavelength.description: Wavelength is one of Paragon City's most storied living heroes, having served with the Freedom Phalanx in the 1970s.

Waylan McCrane.description: Adventurer and self-proclaimed hero Waylon McCrane was hired by the village of Salamanca to stop the strange goings on in the woods. He's gotten himself in a bit over his head, but he's still an impressive shot with a bow.

Weakened Hamidon.description: Hamidon is the nucleus of a giant single celled organism, spawned from some twisted primordial soup. It has but one instinct, to devour the Earth and all that infests it.

Weapon Cache.description: Weapon Caches contains some experimental weapons that might prove to be useful on your siege of Praetoria.

Webbed Passage.description: These are massive spider webs which block this passage.

Webs.description: These are massive spider webs which stretch floor to ceiling, and look quite sticky. Whatever made them must be huge!

Well Watcher.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Werewolf.description: The victims of werewolf bites quickly forget their human lives, as their entire being becomes wrapped up in the thrill of the hunt. Werewolves fight only on feral instinct; as a result, clever heroes are often able to outsmart them.

Werewolf Champion.description: These monstrous werewolves live their lives completely in shadow. The sun never seems to rise on their bleak, ruined world.

Werewolf Lord.description: These monstrous werewolves live their lives completely in shadow. The sun never seems to rise on their bleak, ruined world.

Werfer Jaeger.description: Jaegers take their name from the German word for 'hunter'. They're some of the strangest and most advanced combat robots to ever stalk the streets of Paragon City. Nemesis seems to have a limitless supply of these steam-powered killers, each armed with powerful ranged or melee weaponry.

Whispering Coyote.description: Whispering Coyote is a spirit animal who is very knowledgeable about the spirit world.

White Dwarf.description: Every Kheldian energy being retains the patterns of its past hosts, and can use these patterns to transform itself and its current host into an energy-based duplicate of that creature, gaining new abilities in the process. The White Dwarf form is patterned off of a race called the Kurukt that lived on the surface of a neutron star. The White Dwarf form retains the incredible physical resilience of the Kurukt, as well as the ability to channel energy into powerful melee attacks.

White Lightning.description: White Lightning was a fool to think he could defect to Longbow without bringing down the wrath of Arachnos. Take him out, and you'll be moving up in the world.

Widdershins.description: Widdershins is a leader of the Arachnoids inhabiting the Gutter area of Grandville. He is strong and vicious!

Wight.description: These incorporeal spirits have been caught before they could travel across the veil by Diabolique's dark magic. In binding them to this world she also forces them to do her bidding. They are tormented and distraught but are forced to serve the twisted mystic.

Wild Rikti Monkey.description: These Rikti monkeys have been captured by Crey Industries for scientific experimentation. You must extract the little beasts before Crey figures out a way to bioengineer them.

Will o' the Wisp.description: The true nature of the Will o' the Wisps is a matter of some controversy among paranormal experts. Many believe that they are the byproducts of the Red Caps magic. They seem to be both intelligent and malevolent, and they will harm any person who comes near.

Willforge.description: The Willforge is a sort of quasi-sentient factory that turns raw reality into physical or even living objects. If Rularuu wills it, so shall it be! Destroy the Willforge's spawns and the obelisk they protect is vulnerable.

William.description: This civilian has been invited to hang out in your Supergroup Base.

William Spiers.description: William Spiers is one of a group of four mystics who were investigating Croatoa's strange transformation of Salamanca. They may be the only thing standing between Salamanca and the spirit world.

Willie Pete.description: Vanguard is a group backed by the United Nations, and headed up by Lady Grey. Their soldiers are specifically outfitted in Impervium armor and with high-tech as well as magical weaponry to fight the Rikti. Everything they do is centered around containing the Rikti menace on our world.

Wing Fang Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Wing Agents act as air support for their companions.

Wing Quantum Raider.description: The iconic soldiers of this mercenary outfit, the Wing Raiders wear advanced flight packs that allow them to soar through the air with the speed and grace of a fighter plane. They're armed with advanced infantry weapons and know how to use them with a professional soldier's effectiveness.

Wing Raider.description: The iconic soldiers of this mercenary outfit, the Wing Raiders wear advanced flight packs that allow them to soar through the air with the speed and grace of a fighter plane. They're armed with advanced infantry weapons and know how to use them with a professional soldier's effectiveness.

Wing Raider Officer.description: The Sky Raiders officer corps consists of combat veterans who fought both before and during the Rikti War. They've become disenchanted with the government and its current reliance on super-powered heroes, but they haven't lost any of their military ability or discipline.

Wing Raider Quantum Officer.description: The Sky Raiders officer corps consists of combat veterans who fought both before and during the Rikti War. They've become disenchanted with the government and its current reliance on super-powered heroes, but they haven't lost any of their military ability or discipline.

Wing Raptor Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Wing Agents act as air support for their companions.

Wing Smasher.description: The Enforcers are what everyone thinks of when they hear the word Freakshow: dangerous punks with over-sized mechanical arms ending in nasty looking weapons. They are the true heart of the Freakshow, deadly in combat but not yet totally insane.

Wing Sting Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Wing Agents act as air support for their companions.

Wing Swiper.description: A combination of revolutionary fervor and massive doses of Excelsior allows the leaders of the Enforcers to completely ignore the effects of pain. This trait lets them keep on fighting when by all rights they should have dropped dead.

Wing Talon Agent.description: Wyvern is a private agency dedicated to eliminating problems Freedom Corps hasn't or won't deal with. Wing Agents act as air support for their companions.

Winter Guardian.description: This manifestation of Lord Winter exists to protect his master from taking any damage. While he stands, Lord Winter is immune to all form of damage. In this way, he aids Lord Winter's cause of bring endless night on our world.

Winter Lord.description: This is a manifestation of the Winter Lord. He is a creature of ancient power that wishes to bring eternal winter to the land. If he is ever allowed a permanent foothold in our world, endless night will fall.

Winter Wolf.description: This legendary beast has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Wisp.description: Wisps are intelligent and capable leaders within the army of the Rularuu. Despite their frail appearance, they're quite tough and resilient to physical attacks, although they hate to feel the touch of another living being upon their flesh.

Wisp Oppressor.description: The Wisps are always in flight, floating about from one place to another with surprising speed. When seen from a distance, they are really quite beautiful, but at close range their psychic attacks can rend even the most disciplined mind to shreds.

Wisp Overlord.description: The most powerful Wisps have expanded the powers of their mind so greatly that they can, in small ways, affect space itself. They can seal off their enemies in small pockets of space, rendering them unable to attack or aid allies. They can also bend space around themselves, creating a powerful Dispersion Bubble that protects all those within it.

Witch.description: New converts to the Coven are just beginning to learn the spells that will make them deadly mistresses of darkness. Each Witch must strive hard to earn the respect of her coven sisters, and with it access to new, more potent magical texts. They are therefore quite reckless in battle, often willing to throw away their lives on a chance for glory.

Witness.description: This Praetorian Citizen has come to witness the current attack on the TPN Campus. They are confused and frightened, making them highly susceptible to influence by the Telepathists deployed by the IDF.

Wodan.description: This colossal shadowy hound has taken a liking to you and will follow you around, although it won't aid you in combat.

Woke Eidolon.description: The Woke Eidolon is the closest Dr. Pierce has gotten, to date, to making a reassembled corpse into a completely functional new being. The biggest source of the arguments between them has been over how to name them - by whoever self-identifies within the donated brain, or by percentage of the person who was donated to the body? They still haven't decided.

Wolf.description: This wolf has taken a liking to you and will keep you company. However, it won't engage in combat and cannot be attacked.

Wolf Companion.description: This wolf has taken a liking to you and will keep you company. However, it won't engage in combat and cannot be attacked.

Wolf Spider.description: Wolf Spiders are little more than legalized thugs. Lord Recluse recruits legions of desperate souls to fill their ranks, then puts them through a rigorous training program that emphasizes loyalty, brutality, and discipline, in that order.

Wolf Spider Assault.description: Wolf Spider Assault troops are armed with submachine guns to hose down pesky super-types who stick their nose in Lord Recluse's business.

Wolf Spider Commander.description: The most brutal and effective members of the Wolf Spiders are eventually promoted to Huntsmen. They're armed and armored for many situations, so tread lightly when they're around.

Wolf Spider Enforcer.description: Wolf Spiders are little more than legalized thugs. Lord Recluse recruits legions of desperate souls to fill their ranks, then puts them through a rigorous training program that emphasizes loyalty, brutality, and discipline, in that order.

Wolf Spider Ghost.description: These Wolf Spiders have discovered a method to become living ghosts. Though they're not completely used to it, they've already begun to master their new ghostly powers.

Wolf Spider Huntsman.description: The most brutal and effective members of the Wolf Spiders are eventually promoted to Huntsmen. They're armed and armored for many situations, so tread lightly when they're around.

Wolf Spider Phantom.description: These Wolf Spiders have discovered a method to become living ghosts. Though they're not completely used to it, they've already begun to master their new ghostly powers.

Wolf Spider Shade.description: These Wolf Spiders have discovered a method to become living ghosts. Though they're not completely used to it, they've already begun to master their new ghostly powers.

Wolf Spider TacOps.description: Tactical Operators are Wolf Spiders who have shown keen tactical sense and lead small detachments of Wolf Spiders.

Woodsman.description: The Woodsman was once a renowned hero who helped keep the world of mankind in balance with the forces of nature, fighting against those who would destroy or corrupt nature for their own ends. He came to a tragic end when he was captured by the Devouring Earth, who used his link with the earth to destroy Woodvale and carve out their own territories. Though the Woodsman's physical body perished at the hands of the Devouring Earth, his spirit was freed through the actions of the city's heroes. Now he lives on as a spirit of nature, at one with the wild places of the Earth, helping heroes carry on the fight for the safety of the world.

Working as Intended.description: You can't be fooled that easily. How could a single Monkey operate a complex Freakshow suit like that?

World of Anguish.description: This entity runs the World of Anguish power used by Malaise in the first battle.

World of Anguish - Hyper.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

World of Anguish - Large.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

World of Anguish - Master.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

World of Anguish - Medium.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

World of Anguish - Small.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

World of Anguish - Super.description: This entity destroys itself as soon as it is spawned. A Script tracks how many are defeated.

Worldweary Citizen.description: This citizen has managed to find a way to survive in First Ward despite the numerous threats to survival one may encounter in this lost part of Praetoria.

Wormy.description: Wormy is one of the Family's thugs, and is often called upon to do the worst jobs for them!

Wraith.description: After being in Diabolique's service for some time, Wraiths are imbued with some of her potent mystical energy. Combined with their tortured existence this makes her Wraiths fearsome foes indeed.

Wrath.description: Taken from the ranks of the Wolf Spiders, Bane Spider Commandos are given specialized assault training. They are vicious masters of combat that relish engaging the enemies of Arachnos.

Wrathful Acolyte.description: The Wrathful Acolytes serve as front line forces for the Carnival of Vengeance, a faction of the Carnival of Light which believes it would be better to join the Talons of Vengeance, rather than resist them. They can trace their origins back to the Legacy Chain, and retain some of their armor and accoutrements.

Wrecker.description: Marauder is extremely adept at spotting leadership potential and tactical aptitude. When he sees these qualities in one of his men he gives them the chance to lead small groups and operations as a test. There is only one price for failure.

Wrecker Bot.description: Dismantlers are occasionally called in when their plasma torches can be put to use to tear apart crumbling or collapsed buildings. These behemoth Androids are the heavy lifters, movers and builders of the Android labor units.

Wrecker Quantum.description: Marauder is extremely adept at spotting leadership potential and tactical aptitude. When he sees these qualities in one of his men he gives them the chance to lead small groups and operations as a test. There is only one price for failure.

Wretch.description: A twisted wreck of a human being, Wretch was horribly mutated in the same incident that slew Ghost Widow. He remains her loyal guardian and protector, using his immense strength and savage fury to protect her from all harm.

Wu Yin.description: Mega Corp titan and CEO of Yin Corp, Mr. Yin is a household name. In the wake of the Hamidon Wars, Mr. Yin's hard work ethic galvanized his workers, forming the world spanning Yin Corp in a matter of a few short years. Invaluable in the reconstruction efforts, Mr. Yin enjoys a privileged life along with his daughter and heiress to the corporate throne, Penelope Yin.

Wyvern Research Files.description: These files are full of Wyvern's research on upcoming villains.

Wyvern Spy.description: This captured Wyvern agent was up to something, and that could spell trouble for Westin Phipps.

X-Type Heavy Trooper.description: Former members of the highly decorated TRB (Threat Response Battalion), these genetically reengineered super soldiers are armed with the best weapons and equipment available. Heavy Troopers are equipped with a sonic cannon.

X-Type Ranger.description: Former members of the highly decorated TRB (Threat Response Battalion), these genetically reengineered super soldiers are armed with the best weapons and equipment available. Rangers are equipped with force gauntlets.

X-Type Shock Trooper.description: Former members of the highly decorated TRB (Threat Response Battalion), these genetically reengineered super soldiers are armed with the best weapons and equipment available. Shock Troopers are equipped with beam swords and power shields.

Yanamari the Enchantress.description: This MAGi mystic has been kidnapped by the Hellions. It will be most interesting to learn what they wanted from her.

Zane.description: Zane and Reese have had a rivalry since they both joined Powers Division. Constantly chasing Reese for the top spot, Zane has remained adamant that he can and will defeat Reese, a claim he has yet to prove. Despite this, Zane is tougher than any other Top Dog, and has earned the respect of Powers Division as a strong and honorable ally.

Zapping Jessie.description: The Zig is home to all kinds of prisoners. Many of them have their own super powers that are normally kept subdued. This prisoner is now out on the loose and able to use all of his abilities!

Zealot.description: This young woman has sworn her allegiance to the Talons of Vengeance, a powerful force of fanatical warriors who seek to punish those who have committed particulary egregious offenses of oathbreaking, betrayal and deceit. The Zealot remains mostly human, and is a swift, vicious opponent who favors moving in for deadly strikes with her imbued claws.

Zenflower.description: Blessed with the powers of nature, the young heroine Zenflower fights those who would hurt or misuse nature for their own evil ends.

Zenith Hoverbot.description: The Zenith Hoverbot is one of Vandal's more ingenious inventions. Rumor has it that he was inspired by the Rikti attack drones, but there have been versions of the machines in service since the 1940's. Mounted with omni-directional jets and banks of armor piercing rockets, the Zenith Hoverbots are quite maneuverable and pack a deadly punch. They can make the skies a very dangerous place.

Zenith Mech Man.description: Vandal, the genius behind the Council's technology, created his first robots during the 1940's. He's been improving on them ever since. Now known as the Zenith Mech Men, these tough and deadly machines are 100 times more dangerous than their predecessors of 60 years ago. Modern Mech Men have tough, thick armor, redundant systems that resist damage, and a powerful onboard AI that makes them faster and smarter than most human soldiers.

Zephyr.description: Zephyr has been around for quite a while, zipping around the skies for generations. Having become rather bored due to the advent of increased navigation technology and sturdier construction material used in buildings, Zephyr has taken a corporeal form recently. Spending time among Paragon City, he would soon move onto the Rogue Isles where he found people were far more willing to destroy things for no good reason. And for Zephyr, that's one heck of a lot of fun.

Zeus Class Titan.description: The middle class of Titans utilized by the Malta Group are even more deadly than their younger brothers. This stands to reason since they are two Hercules class units combined into one deadly enemy. They are equipped with the standard fragmentation, incendiary and gas missiles. In addition the Zeus units combined plasma generators are extremely potent, firing multiple blasts simultaneously.

Zombie.description: The dead are restless and are walking the earth. They hunger for your flesh!

\u00ce\u00a9 K'ong.description:
One of the greatest mysteries surrounding the Rikti is what the interior of their motherships look like, and the alien invaders are fiercely protective of these secrets.

To that end, Mothership Î”-294 was often praised as the standard in defensive security, utilizing an engineered bio-weapon known simply as K'ong.

This large beast can psionically command massive hordes of Rikti Monkey Vultures while also being cybernetically integrated with the Rikti's neural network, allowing it to leverage an unexpected amount of tactics and cunning.

'Monkey see: Monkey kill.'

\u00ce\u201d K'ong.description:
One of the greatest mysteries surrounding the Rikti is what the interior of their motherships look like, and the alien invaders are fiercely protective of these secrets.

To that end, Mothership Î”-294 was often praised as the standard in defensive security, utilizing an engineered bio-weapon known simply as K'ong.

This large beast can psionically command massive hordes of Rikti Monkey Vultures while also being cybernetically integrated with the Rikti's neural network, allowing it to leverage an unexpected amount of tactics and cunning.

'Monkey see: Monkey kill.'
